name: Scott Wilezol
text: I enjoyed my experience here today. It’s a beautiful day and BS had great outdoor seating. The staff was friendly. The bartenders mixed some very good cocktails... they also have an unusually large amaro collection, if you’re into that (i am). I recommend for a date or just a few drinks out with friends. Was pleasantly surprised!

name: Mimi Hsu
text: What a cozy place to get cocktails. They have a unique cocktail menu that has not disappointed me yet. Very mellow vibe inside. Also outdoor dining. The first floor of Optimist Hall

name: Raquel S
text:
This bar has a lot of potential.

I ordered the SPF 100. It had so much ice I could barely move the straw around. Flavor was just ok.

We sat outside and sadly were pretty much forgotten about after we got our drinks. We wanted to order food and another round of drinks but the server never came back to check on us. When he finally did come we decided to just pay out and grab a beer next door.

name: Tameka Michelle
text:
It was my husband's birthday  so we decided to go out for drinks close to home. Optimist Hall was the perfect area. He chose Billy Sunday due to the nice relaxed environment. I ordered a Nice Pear it was a very tasty yet strong drink that was enjoyable for a light drinker like myself. My husband asked the bartender for recommendations based on the things he liked and ordered a Buffalo Trace Bourbon. He stated he enjoyed it and ended up ordering another before we left.

I really liked the cute relaxed setup of this little bar and enjoyed our time there. They had a great variety of music playing. The decor was nice as well they had  pictures of people on the wall from previous generations which I thought was cute & unique.

When it was time to leave the bill was a bit of a surprise for our three drinks it was $48 . I check for prices before I order my husband not so much lol.

If you are looking for a nice bar to visit near optimist hall I recommend you check this spot out

name: Dipesh Patel (Peshy)
text: Went her twice on same day, it is that good!  Perfect place to get drinks while it rains and sit under covered patio on comfy furniture.  Their old fashion and penicillin drinks are amazing.  On the food side, the devil eggs with tiny hint of bacon is perfect snack with their drink menu.  The spinach artichoke dip was amazing as well.  Will def return to try out rest of the drinks.  Side note the patio are is dog friendly, two thumbs up!

name: Kristin Horak
text: Visited on a Sunday afternoon and I was surprised to see how slow they were considering the nice weather. My party of 3 sat inside and there was one other couple at the bar. Other than that everyone  was seated outside.  The server attending to the outdoor tables was hustling and seemed to be checking on his tables. The indoor bartender (Grey hair, tattoos) could not be bothered to pay us any attention.  After out first drink we waited 20 min hoping to be acknowledged.  It was almost  like he was purposely avoiding helping us. He certainly had time  to check his phone though cause we watched him do that. This was the worst service I've  had in years. I  will definitely  not be returing and I advise anyone looking for cocktails to go elsewhere.

name: Cory Davis
text: Rather pricey, but really great drinks and a relaxing atmosphere. Not really the place to go if you don’t want to pay $15+ for your drink. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable as well. It's small so it seems like it might get a little crazy if it's busy.

name: Dominic Birckbichler
text: This place has a fantastic selection of cocktails and a killer list of amaros.

name: Ability 101
text: When a buddy ask for a drink thats different. However, the bartender says he's run out of ideas. That to me sounds rude. I've brought a number of friends here for the experience but tonight simply means I won't be returning.

resp.text: I am so sorry you had that experience, we would love to correct that and have you back for a delicious cocktail! Please send me an email at Stephanie@billy-sunday so I can make it right! Cheers

name: breta collins
text: Fun spot with great music and a lovely Saturday afternoon crowd. Interesting cocktails!

name: James Knicely
text:
Excellent cocktails with very creative presentation and delicious flavor.

Perfect ambiance for a date or drinks with friends.

Definitely will be back again soon.

name: Ashley Welch
text: Was so excited for this place to finally open and I was able to try it out March 12. Fabulous decor, great atmosphere, top notch customer service...and of course a killer cocktail menu. I got the 'stay off the grass' (I love vegetal cocktails!), but can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu!

name: Seth Wyatt
text: Quality of service and hospitality.

name: kaledev
text: Great cocktails.

name: Victoria Horton
text: Gas station! Gas is super high right now.

name: Amanda Vasquez
text: Worst experience ever today Bought a coffee for Teacher week at the school grabbed 4 creamers and 3 sugar packs so the teacher can make to her liking, and was told I had pay extra .50 for the cream even though I was buying coffee by the manger on duty. I come to this store all the time you guys have lost a customer. The sad part is that I even explained it the other cashier tried to explain it the manger and he didn’t even care. This not the first bad experience with gentlemen either

resp.text: Hi Amanda, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience. We have passed on your message to our local management team.

name: DIY with Dean
text: Why is it that the African American girls behind the counter are always staring at their phones not paying attention,  then when they see you standing there they act like you're interrupting their day and get attitudes as they ring you up? They don't say hi,  bye,  nothing.  Just get right back on their phones.

resp.text: Hi there, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience. We have passed on your message to our local management team.

name: Khanh Nguyen
text: Either false advertising, noti opened 24 hours...either that, or, you need to fire the night clerk!

resp.text: Hi Khanh, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience. We have passed on your message to our local management team.

name: SGT.
text:
Check the prices on the screen and when you pick them from the shelf.

Every time I go to this location, the prices are higher when they ring you up.

I’ve told the manager twice and came back a third time, but nothing has changed.

Plus the skinny black female with the same wig ever time I see her has an extremely rude attitude.

resp.text: Hi there, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience. We have passed on your message to our local management team.

name: Dre Davis
text: Old candy , ice has mold, the owner doesn’t care

resp.text: Hi Dearndrea, we are sorry to hear this. We would appreciate if you can contact us at (704) 583-5700 or via email https://www.circlek.com/contact-form and share details on how we can improve. Thanks.

name: Dan Witzke
text: This place is crewed and managed by complete idiots.

name: Aaron Raye
text: I agree with Dan and all ladies have attitudes especially the fat African that used to be pregnant

resp.text: Hi Aaron, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience. We have passed on your message to our local management team. Feel free to contact us at (704) 583-5700 or via email https://www.circlek.com/contact-form.

name: Betty Brannon
text: Very nice place

resp.text: Hi Betty, thank you for your feedback and for choosing Circle K!

name: Michael R. Sim
text: Average circle k

name: Kay
text:
Please do something about the multiple vagrant people who hang outside asking for money. In 1 visit alone I got asked by 3 different men & it scared me to see them tracking me.

Other gas stations have security to help customers feel safe or not harassed especially as a woman.

name: Serena CP
text: Homeless people harassing everyone who’s coming in/out. Cashiers are always talking on the cellphone not acknowledging customers. People blocking the pumps and entrance instead of the parking lots to go shop inside for over 5 minutes. My wife is afraid to go to this gas station even with me. Switching over to the nice new QT down the street.

resp.text: Hi Serena, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience. We have passed on your message to our local management team.

name: Heather Channel
text: This gas station has the biggest rats running around this building and around the dumpsters. It’s disgusting. They are HUGE RATS.

name: Nick Akers
text: I'm giving it 5 stars because when I went to it, it was a nice clean facility. However, as of 2/26/2016 it is closed for I don't know how long due to a fire. I feel it's important to alert folks because it was the only gas station in Uptown and I would hate to have people run out of gas or walk a few blocks to discover it shuttered.

name: Brett Balding
text: Why is this place closed at 2:39am? Its Saturday morning and to employees laughing inside like they don't care about their customers. The customers pay the bills and as soon as Circle K loses their customers they will go out of business.

resp.text: Hi Brett, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience.  We will pass on your message about the opening hours to our local management team.

name: Jesse F
text: I’ve never been here when all 4 gas pumps were actually in working order

resp.text: Hi Jesse, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience. We have passed on your message to our local management team.

name: Jon Wertz
text: Just rude and playing around too much. They just don't care about the customers.

name: Dustin F
text: Just another homeless infested Charlotte gas station.

name: Alana Olmeda
text: Very clean restroom!

resp.text: Hi Alana, thank you for your feedback and for choosing Circle K!
Hi there, thank you for your rating and for choosing Circle K!

Hi Ryan, thank you for taking the time to rate our store. We would appreciate if you can share some feedback on how we can improve. Please feel free to contact us at (704) 583-5700 or via email https://www.circlek.com/contact-form.

name: T C
text: Not sure if under new management or what, but we used to love this place.  Used to have knowledgeable staff to help with marinades and recommendations.  Know not so much. The variety of fish not so good anymore.  Still the best place to get fresh fish, but definitely a change from what it used to be.

name: M. C.
text: A random stop, first time visiting Clean Catch. Crab cakes were delicious, the sauce that Clean Catch pairs with compliments well. I will definitely return. The prices are a bit high compared to what you will pay at your local grocery store. However, the quality is much better than your local grocers seafood.

name: Kathleen Flora
text: Clean Catch is the go-to place for seafood!  Crab cakes and salmon are amazing and chunk lobster meat makes the best lobster salad.  Their dumplings and seaweed salad are delicious too. Well worth the price!!

name: Filmon Isak
text: loved it.  great staff excellent food.  oysters were incredible.  sushi was excellent.

name: Dekun
text: I bought some bluefin tuna here and it was exquisite. The meat was firm and not fishy at all. I used it to make sashimi and I can’t wait to get more.

name: George Hobel
text: I grew up fishing on Long Island Sound.  My dad was a commercial lobster fisherman and we always had fresh fish to eat.  The guys at Clean Cut Fish Market were able and willing to procure some fresh blue fish for me from the coast.  Its my favorite fish, but oddly not too popular, and other local markets would not even try.  Got a call from Scott this morning... My fish will be here tomorrow.  Can you say...."lifetime customer" ?

name: Lori Wilson
text: In response to recommendations on Nextdoor, I visited Clean Catch Fish Market for the first time and I was not disappointed!  I sought a Charlotte fresh fish supplier for home cooks and I believe I’ve found it here.  The shop is clean and attractive, staff members are friendly and helpful, the fish looks fresh, and the three items I purchased were outstanding!  I will definitely return and I look forward to trying their fresh-made sushi too!

name: Chris Slay
text:
I tend to shop locally, love to know where my food is from and that it's sustainably harvested. I know I may pay more for this assurance.

So I got this bug in my head to try out Clean Catch in Myers Park since I wanted fish tonight and was in the vicinity.  Here's how my experience went: the location is spotless and the seafood on display is beautiful. The available catches are displayed on a large menu but WITHOUT PRICES, although there's an area to display them. That should have been my clue, but I can be clueless.

I ordered 1.22 lbs of halibut and a half pound of ceviche featuring octopus. My bill was $95!!! That's 58.99 per pound for the halibut and $39.88 per pound for the ceviche. All had been cut and packaged so I couldn't back out.

While I'm sure this will be the best and most conscionable choice, I had a really hard time explaining the expense to my better half. I could have taken us both to McCormick & Schmick's for a comparable price.

My STRONG suggestion is for Clean Catch to DISPLAY PRICES or a sign that says "if you have to ask, you can't afford it."

name: Scott Wilezol
text: Top quality, fresh fish. Yes, you pay for it. Personally, I feel it is worth it. I especially enjoy the sashimi grade fish and scallops-- just slice up and eat at home; doesn't get any better than that. It is a privilege to have a fish market of such high quality in Charlotte!

name: Lewis Merit
text: Most impressive fish market named after a urine sample I've ever encountered. Five stars!

name: Tileshia Alford
text: The most spotless and odorless seafood/fish market I have ever visited!  The establishment is well maintained.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable !!!!

name: Glenda Steel
text: We love everything about Clean Catch except their prices. High quality and great service with accompanying high prices.

name: Bravo Machismo
text: Ashley was amazing and so helpful. Cant wait for my sushi dinner tonight. I picked up fresh sushi grade Ora King Salmon and yellow fin tuna. Thanks ashley. Thanks clean catch!

name: Malik Williams
text: Chef Reed made the entire visit amazing

name: Christopher Reiter
text: Amazing place - pricey but the guys know their stuff and can tell you all about the fish and how to prepare it.

name: Anastasia D
text: $42 and $53 for 1lbs of scallops. Insane. I misread their advertisement sign and thought crab cakes were $9/lbs, well, it turned out to be each. They were yummy, that's why 2 stars. But God, it's expensive

name: Mark Price
text: Great selection of frrsh fish and shellfish.

name: Indira Smith
text: Staff are knowledgeable, but very expensive!

name: Betty Walsh
text: The best

name: Orkinguy t
text: Excellent

name: Griselda Diaz
text: I recently started coming to this location for a few months now and never really had any bad experiences. Every time  i walk in, i am always taken care of. Rude is understatement everyone has a job to do and everyone takes care of the customers first. Yes there maybe a crazy line but who doesn’t have a line. It is, what it is. Carry on. Very quick service never really had to wait too long...Great Job..UPS. Keep up the good Work..

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind remarks,we appreciate your business and understanding the unusual and trying times we are going through.We try to work quickly and efficiently to serve our customers and take pride in our jobs.

name: sr little
text: When I go to FedEx to print off ONE page in black and white on regular paper, it costs $0.12...here it was $2.27. To print ONE PAGE! Seriously?! A $2 dollar email service charge because I emailed the document I needed to print...from MY phone?!?! Why was this charge not shown on the card with the email address, an - oh and by the way if you choose this method option it's an additional $2. Yeah, it's only $2 but I definitely feel overcharged. I feel like the price was inflated in the moment and purposefully not given till after printing. I  will never go back here.

name: Lazaro Gutierrez
text: Krystopher was rude and condescending for no apparent reason. When I called and asked to have a # written on my package after I had left the store he responded with “I don’t have time for that, we have a line at the store.” I explained that I live far from this location and couldn’t come back. I’m not even sure that he even did what was requested. Rude and disrespectful, awful customer service and lazy.

name: Ronni T
text: Great customer service.  Very helpful with printing, notary and shipping.  Social distancing might increase outside wait times.

resp.text: Thank you for your comments about our store.I certainly appreciate your business and definitely try to the best we can to serve customers as quickly and efficiently without compromising their needs.Thank you for your patience during these trying times.

name: jacob
text: I had a bit of a complication and they took care of me. Made the process super simple and easy even with my weird online return.

name: Jillian Dooley
text: They have horrible customer service. Wanted to charge me $5 to tape a tiny box before shipping it. She literally had tape sitting next to her, but she wouldn’t let me use a piece.

name: Chris Cc
text: Quoted me $90 to ship something to florida with UPS ground.  The acyual cost of the label was $23 on the UPS website.  Don't get ripped off.  They are not really UPS. They pay to license the name and mark up prices.

resp.text:
Hi Chris C,I am so sorry you had a misleading quote for a UPS package going to Florida.I fail to understand  why there would be such a drastic price difference!I can assure you that we do NOT hike our prices.Just to mention few factors that play a part in getting rates :Destination Zipcode,Weight Dimensions,declared value and service level.I would certainly like to speak to you to clarify this ,please.Could you call me please,704-583-2100?
Thank You
Deepak

name: Jarita Campbell
text: Customer service was awesome. They helped me get the right packaging for items to be shipped.

resp.text:
Thank You! We definitely strive to please our customers and offer the best solutions for any of your Shipping,Packing Printing and much more.......
I appreciate your business,Ms Campbell

name: Tiana Peterson
text: Poor/slow service. They then posted confidential information onto Google (Like my package destination) when I left a prior review. This UPS store has no respect for its customers private info, I will not use it again and suggest everyone does the same if you want your business kept private.

resp.text:
Good Morning Tiana
I appreciate your business and the compliment about the service you received from my associate.I apologize that your package will not get ti it's destination until the following Monday,however the service level you picked was Ground UPS and the Zip code you sent to was Washington  which is a 5 business day zone.and since you came in late Saturday afternoon your package did not not get picked up until today Monday July 23rd.I once again apologize for your concern about time in transit.
We do certainly appreciate your business.

name: Mark Fomin
text: Doesn't return stamps???? $60 for 100 stamps at UPS or $50 at Publix. Tried returning stamps at UPS and they would not accept the return even though it was within 15 minutes of purchasing with proof of purchase. They would not accept the return because it is a money commodity? What kind of BS excuse is that? Went to Publix to return stamps since UPS scammed me out of the transaction and Publix GLADLY returned my money back. Thank you Publix for being a better postal service than UPS!

name: Vimal V
text: While I was staying at home waiting for my package there was no knock on the door.. Only a sticker that said, 'Sorry we missed you and you can pickup at UPS access point". What a humiliation after I took a day off waiting for my package to arrive -and specifically paid extra for 2 day shipping.  Thanks to UPS, now that I got my package after 5 days. Never trust UPS again

name: DeAndra Timmons
text:
I'm only giving one star because it was located close to me. This is the most horrible ups store I've ever been to. The owner or agent was rude and overcharged me for what I know should've been less. I definitely
recommend going to another one.

name: Keatina Blakeney
text: Always professional and courteous, I used them for faxes, copies, and shipping. No issue whatsoever

name: Jeffrey Hatch
text: Went in asking for the cheapest method to ship my item.  Got charged $20 to ship a 1.5lb item (came with box and 1 small sheet of bubble wrap).  Gentlemen was rude and I felt very rushed through the process.  Told me this was the cheapest way they had.  I asked if it would be cheaper to ship via USPS since I have never paid that much to ship such a small item.  He "looked it up" and told me it would have been more expensive.  I went home and found a flat rate box to ship my item for $12.35!  I will go elsewhere in the future.  Avoid this place!

name: Aaron H
text: Solid UPS Store. I was helped out immediately with a shipment I brought in. Fast and easy service.

name: B R
text: Friendly staff.

name: Theodore Karabet
text: Hands down, the best Chinese food I've eaten in Charlotte. The crew is super nice and the food is delicious. Definitely will be eating here again.

resp.text: Thank you for your affirmation,

name: Phylli Cheeze
text: I'm so sad!! it was really hard for me to give 3 stars, but i had to be fair because the restaurant isn't TERRIBLE. but i've been going here for 3 years, and up until a month or 2 ago, there was this wonderful older woman who worked the counter and, from what i was told by another regular, a popular local chef who worked in the kitchen. and his food was absolute marvelous; the lunch specials that i would get came with fried rice and an eggroll, and you could tell the eggroll was homemade as soon as you bit into it. the flavors were like nothing i had ever had in other Chinese restaurants around Charlotte, and the fried rice was perfectly fried. now, unfortunately, the quality of the food has gone down; not sure if the older woman sold the restaurant or passed it down to her kids, and, don't get me wrong, the staff is fine, but now it just tastes like every other generic Chinese restaurant. the eggrolls no longer have that homemade quality, nor are they as big as they used to be. the portion sizes in general are a lot smaller and the rice just tastes generic. don't think i'll be going here anymore since i can literally taste the change; if you're looking for something special, i can't recommend this place anymore, but if you're looking for a place with decent prices and decent food, then this isn't a bad spot.

resp.text: Thank you for your suggestion. We will improve it

name: Yu-Hsien Ho
text: Very delicious Chinese food. Theyve got a separate authentic chinese dish menu as well. The roast duck was quite good. Skin was crisp and the meat tender and fresh. Sauce was flavorful. Great chinese food.

name: Justin R.
text: Just ordered this and it taste like the food old and they tried to cover it up with salt. We threw our food away.

name: Tavita Mageo
text: Food is great ! And such a nice and friendly place ! Def will be my regular restaurant!

name: louis does things
text: Ordered curry chicken for lunch. You can see what it is. Not bad, just ok.

name: April Raybon
text: One of my favorite places in town. Food is always fresh. And the owner at the register is always sweet. They also have an authentic Chinese menu upon request. Decor is like the very average Chinese restaurant which makes me feel at home. Hopefully you will love this place as much as I do

name: Peter A
text: Great Chinese take out place. Inexpensive and the food is great as well. It’s a good place to get a fix for your Chinese craving.

name: Lewis Royer
text: Nice little Mom and Pop Chinese takeout spot. Lady behind the counter is always very sweet and answers any questions with enthusiasm. Definitely must try if looking for affordable Chinese takeout.

name: David Childress
text:
Great, fast basic Chinese food and consistent in quality and generous portions.
I've always done take out from the same lady and husband? and they always give great and friendly service.

name: Judy Y
text: Bed now fun, Singapore noodles, pan fried dumplings, all good!

name: R Strope
text: Great basic Asian food. A sweet couple. The general chicken is great.

name: tonya bolton
text: No flavor. NO Crab in the crab rangoons! Really!?

name: j watts
text: support the locals, good food for a descent price!!!

name: RED Mcdowell
text: Just didn't like it ....

name: Simon James Truman
text: Great people and delicious always fresh seafood!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We appreciate your business!

name: Lakeisha Hill (Kitty)
text: Fresh seafood!

name: Habiba M.
text: This place is DEFINITELY NOT what I expected walking in but they DEFINITELY had EVERYTHING you need in there including what I was looking for fresh seafood at good prices. They did not have any blue crab when I went which is what I really wanted but they told me they would have them when they thought the season was right so I got a piece of fried catfish filet which was very healthy in size but lacked on flavor and the batter fell completely off when I tried to break a piece off but it was well done and very greasy.

name: Tracey Parker-Broady
text:
Omg!!!! Just order 3 fish sandwiches, had I known you only get ONE piece of fish with it, I wouldn't order from you. I went there because; PILE EM BOB'S had a line.
Ms Nana!!! I piece of fish for $4. Is insane!!! If; you're that cheap then give ONE piece of bread.

name: Ms. Smith

name: Lee Bremer
text:
A Charlotte hidden gem. Once others experience how great dinner is, it will likely become a hot spot

The drinks are excellent.  The craft that goes into the cocktails you can see smell and taste.

The food is made from scratch and delicious.  Wife had the scallops and raves about them.  I had the rigatoni and it was the best pasta I’ve had in Charlotte

The pizzas are cooked so well they have that nice crunch on the bottom with fresh ingredients on top

Great restaurant!  All covid protocols are in place and they have outdoor heated seating too.

text: Loved the vibe and ambiance.. hidden gem for sure

name: Manda Michelle
text: I’m obsessed with finding the best cocktails and let me tell you these are some of the tastiest, most aesthetically pleasing drinks I’ve had in Charlotte. The flavors in  it just the drinks but the food is also just astounding.  This is a Charlotte Must go.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback. We value your business.

name: Rob Smith
text:
So this is going to be a COVID grading scale.

We ate breakfast here for two days. The service needs some serious improvements for sure. There were not that many tables, but they had two waitresses, and most of the time they were hard to get service out of. The food is different, more yuppy type of breakfast.

On the first day, we ordered our food, which was good, but it does take forever. When we ordered, I ordered OJ and my son took two sips of it and stated he did not want it anymore because it tasted bad. Again, not the end of the world.

On day two, we ordered our food, the pancakes were definitely not as fresh and yummy as the first day.

Was it bad, nah not at all. Was the concept nice, sure was. Do you want to eat here if you are in a rush, not in the least. Would I eat here again, maybe if it was part of my package. What I can say is that if this was not COVID times, the score would be different for sure.

name: Corey
text: Just ok for lunch. Short rib sandwich only has three ingredients and it was missing one. Pickled Onions. Honestly I think that would’ve helped it taste better. Slight taste of cinnamon in the meat. Wasn’t a fan. I don’t think that’s the right bread; it should probably be on a softer hoagie type bun. All In all not bad ,but for $13 I could probably find better in the area.

name: Nicole Angtuaco
text: I want to give this place a 5 but can't, at least not yet.  The ambiance is superb, the breakfast food is decent (awesome waffles), and the service is good enough (could be a little faster).  My biggest complaint is that brunch doesn't start until 11, and you can't even get a mimosa before then.  Brunch should definitely start at 10, as is the case pretty much anywhere else in Charlotte.  Very disappointed we didn't get to try what appears to be a wonderful brunch/cocktail menu.

name: Mike Trevino
text:
Had a great Valentine’s Day brunch here. The food is excellent and the menu is balanced, with both traditional brunch options and some more exciting options (like a fried PB&J, sweet potato pancakes, and beef short rib with grits).

I will say—the vibe in here is kinda weird. To no fault of the restaurant, F&F takes up half of the ground floor lobby of the Canopy Hotel. It feels a little weird watching people walk through the lobby with luggage while you’re eating. Building mgmt should invest in a larger physical barrier between the two spaces.

name: Sam Hart
text:
Chef Daniel Wheeler can throw down. Want to experience food that it’s an absolute shock it rests inside of a hotel, go!
Incredibly impressed.

name: Aaron Bevacqua
text:
A gem hidden away in South Park - an area dominated by a crowd-pleasing old guard of 131 Main, BrickTops, Firebirds and the like. The cocktails are varied and push the boundaries of the area; the food is a nice mix of the familiar with a twist. The smoked buttermilk dressing in the Bibb salad was so good we asked to buy some to take home, the house-made rigatoni dish with sausage exceeded all my expectations. My wife's golden tile fish with a squash puree was cooked to absolute perfection. And then to top it all off, the rum apple cake (that they drop on the grill for a quick char) was an amazing cherry on top!

The menu changes in a week, we can't wait to come check it out!

name: Adam K
text: It was easy to obtain a Last minute patio Saturday night dinner reservation. Food was very good. Sliders were our fav. Service was excellent.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We hope to see you soon.

text: This is my first time here, very welcoming and laid back atmosphere for a Sunday brunch. The inside venue is spacious and comforting. I would certainly like to come back for the night life. Food service could be quicker, and I would recommend parking at the top of the commons. Overall great food and experience! Great job!!

text: Food is excellent and the crowd is awesome. Mature and sexy

name: Alicia Goldsby
text:
I read the reviews....I did...and I still went....and the reviews were right. The decor was great and the place was packed due to the NBA Finals. I was able to find a great spot on the patio and the weather was great. We got our drinks fairly quickly so I thought things were going well. We ordered several apps in the 1st quarter, by the 3rd quarter we still had no food. We ordered some bottles thinking surely if they see how much money we plan to drop then they'll make sure we get great service. It took 1.5hrs to get the appetizers and we were told the server dropped the tray so the whole order was re-fired. The server was apologetic and said they'll adjust the bill in light of the wait.
The food was ok, the sliders were decent, the lettuce wraps were wilted and the wings were lukewarm.
When I got the bill at the end of the night the manager took off $1.74 .... Bottom line - good atmosphere, good music, cute staff, but don't go hungry or thirsty.

name: KARENETTA MCCORMICK
text: The champagne and strawberries are good. The food was okay. The comedy show only had one the funny person in it. But overall I had a good night there.

name: CLTCL3 H
text: Has the potential to be a good time. Unfortunately we purchased $20 advance tickets to get into the day party on a Sunday. When we arrived we just walked in. Nobody asked for tickets or anything. When we left the staff near the door was just on their phones... no thanks for coming or anything. Music was ok. Kitchen was closed. Radio station folks were there and didn't appear to be having a good time. Drinks were good. We were able to get a table. We left early and went to Sports One. I wouldn't suggest anyone pay money to get in.

name: Vergiekitten Weatherspoon
text: Had crab stuff w/shrimp...it was really good. Not enough staff..need to hire more waitress and bartenders...too way too long to get food and drink...20 minutes wait b/t our waitress visits to check on us. Nice place hope they staff up quickly.

The 4th order never arrived or remembered that it was placed. Drinks were expensive at $13 a pop. Air conditioning condensation dropping on our heads and we were in a small awkward space which was reserved. Configuration of the entire place is strange. Will not ever return!

text: Decor is nice but the DJ/music is HORRIBLE. Went on a night where there were 3 different parties going on: high school reunion, reggae (so reggae music), and the third I cannot recall. There were two DJ's who alternated between reggae and hip hop. It was a mess. The music selections from the DJ's were horrible. The DJ is supposed to orchestrate the energy of the club. Smh. Will NOT be going back. I am a music lover. When I go out I expect a great time... Music, staff, atmosphere etc... It's a nice place though. *Kanye shrug*

text: IMHO, this is one of the best subways in Charlotte. The service is fantastic! Every time I've eaten here I notice that they have several regulars that seem to be treated like family. I will bypass other subways just to eat here.

name: Alexander Forester
text: The manager was very kind which is why I woul dnt give this the worse review. First time at my neighborhood Subway. I ordered two 6 inch samdwhichs because of a coupon and I had to get a drink with that. Well the first sandwich was toasted and forgotten and ended up burning to a crisp. Had to make a third sandwich for me. I explained that I had my own cup and that I rather not use there's just to be disposed... I was told for sanitation reasons I couldn't use my own cup st the fountain drink... honestly I didn't even want a drink but i was gonna be charged for it to use my coupon anyways.  Wasting money or wasting a cup... I'm in no position to waste money and I'm too environmentally conscious to think that a sanitation reasoning is why I couldn't push my own cup to receive my own drink. I hope subway reconsidered this policy because before subways allowed me to use my own cup or deny the ridiculous amount of napkins given.  I dream for a future of consciously mitigating waste and that companies support and even reward such behavior

text: Literally the absolute worst service. The girl with the red dreadlocks must’ve been having a terrible year because she had a horrible attitude. She was moving a snail’s.... no, sloth’s pace to check out customers. She was, in fact, so slow, that a line formed well in the snack area of about 9 people. Please keep in mind, we all were buying no more than 2-3 items (eg. drinks, chips, etc.). Her team mate thought this long line of patiently waiting customers was the signal to leave the checkout  booth and grab trash bags. This certainly was NOT the optimal time to change the small trash can behind the counter. I thought it odd that her first thoughts weren’t, “Maybe I should ring people out to help move the line.” This could be a great gas station if management hired people who actually planned to work once they clocked in.

text: I've been coming to this gas station almost 5 days a week for the past 8 or so years, I work near by. Over the years the customer service and cleanliness of the establishment had progressively gotten worse. It always feels as though they are under staffed and the employees are always on their phone and either don't have a mask on it it's around their chin not coming their mouth and nose. There has been gross sticky soda in their refrigerated cases for MONTHS.

The store is always clean, shelves are always filled, and the associates are always pleasant and respectful.  They handle the long lines during rush hours efficiently.  Prices are always right and rewards program is worth pursuing. Thank you for regularly exceeding my expectations.

We didn't eat here, so I can't speak to the food quality, but drinks were great. They have a good selection to choose from & some decent specials.
This drink was the Fizzy Lifting Drink. Very good! Our bartender was awesome. It got busy, but he was still attentive to everyone. Great little place! They have outdoor seating, as well.

name: Chloe W
text: Always delicious food. The traditional frisee salad was amazing. They had big chunks of crispy bacon and the fried goat cheese is so good!

text: Love this place! Everything we have tried has been amazing, and keeps us coming back for more. The wedge salad, steak sandwich, and mussels are our favorites. It also has bigger portions and more options than most tapas places. It's the only tapas place my boyfriend will agree to without fuss. Usually 2 menu items, 3 tops, is plenty for the two of us.

name: Amber Goff
text: Interesting drink options!  The fritters were more like fried balls of creamy cheese than what I would consider a fritter.  They were not spicy.  The  hummus was yummy, but not super amazing.  Good atmosphere.

text: This place has great drinks and beer selection.  The wedge salad rocks. I am not a big fan of tapas, so yea. Ahhh, and weekend brunch is very good.

text: This place is OK. Nothing here wows me at all. There were a few innovative cocktails on the menu but overall most were kind of blah. The food was about the same. Nothing I ate really captured my attention or made me desire to return. I had the lamb lollipops and the Moroccan pork skewers with the Whiskey cocktail of the day.

text: The Col. Hans Landa cocktail was delicious, just the right amount of spice to it. Trout and sprouts was amazing, especially with the Benton's bacon. Braised oxtail was very good, a little heavy for a tapas dish. Great draft beer selection.

I SO wanted to like this place after reading the reviews, but the food was TERRIBLE!  The best Sesame Chicken in town?  I don't think so.  Instead, I got under cooked mystery meat bathed in a super sweet almost barbecue like sauce. Even the spring roll was bad!  Soggy and salty.  I couldn't even finish it.  I have yet to find decent Chinese food since moving to this side of town which is disappointing since there seems to be a large Asian population in the area.

On a good note, I agree with the other reviewers that the customer service was great.  The owner seemed really nice.  Sadly, when I pay for food, I would like it to be edible.  I won't return.

text: The restaurant is very nice, the servers have excellent behavior and the owner is as humble as it gets. The cook is amazing.

name: El Guapo
text:
Our family has been looking for an Indian restaurant similar in quality to Blue Taj in Ballantyne since we north moved to Huntersville. We've finally found it. CLOVE was an outstanding experience: spacious, beautifully decorated dining room, wonderfully gracious staff, perfectly presented delicious food, large portions and extremely reasonable prices. Don't forget to try their homemade ice cream.
It's a place that's easy to overlook in its upstairs location, but it's 100% worth the elevator trip for a visit.
Highly recommended. We'll be back.

text: Food was good but need to work upon the management. I'd give another try after few months

text: I had the chicken tiki Masala and mango lasse. No complaints on the food, best I ever had. I think this place is new. Go for the food, you won’t regret it. The atmosphere was a tad chaotic. That is the only reason why I give it 4 stars. The service was  mediocre at best, the servers weren’t rude, just seemed like they didn’t have a system worked out yet. The decor was a little odd, but nothing offending. I’d totally go back here, try it you’ll like it!

text: I ordered 4 At Home Kits for an event that I was hosting. Upon arrival, I walked in the get my bag and I was given the wrong bag. Luckily, I checked before I left. That wasn’t the issue because that was an easy fix. The issue was that I ordered I See You in the Christmas version and was given the regular version. I held a holiday themed event so that was a little disappointing. I also did not receive instructions like my guests did. I enjoyed my event regardless and tweaked the picture to my liking. I would still probably order in the future because it was very enjoyable for my guests. I was just a little disappointed.

name: Krystle Rambert
text: My favorite place to relax, create, and have fun. I love taking Tan's classes, the music and vibe is always on point. Everyone is friendly. Bring your own sips n snacks if you'd like too. Guaranteed to be a good time whether you come by yourself or with your people.

text: I thoroughly enjoyed my tea at Paint with a Twist! Tam is a talented and fun-loving facilitator and artist. She made our party feel very comfortable, even when our paintings were less desirable, lol. Even during this pandemic we enjoyed our time and we're socially distant and STILL had an enjoyable time. I attempted to get extra creative with my painting to match my "boudoir" and.she was accommodating. I would be definitely recommend you go to Painting with a Twist!

I had the opportunity to paint with Tanzania for a 2nd time. She is an amazing instructor. She is helpful, personable, in the room and is the best paint I structor in Charlotte.
As I travel to studios from state to state, I notice the different atmosphere  and not all instructors are helpful, patience, or even in the room and she is the best all around.
Also, I love how she took the time to help others, bring their painting back to life.
Thank you for being an awesome instructor.
Hint: She's usually in the Hu tersville area, but my last painting was at the Charlotte location. Make sure to look her up because she really is the best and worth the time and money.

name: Sharon Beauzier
text:
I came in to this restaurant during lunch time on Friday afternoon  . They followed social distancing guide lines !!!
First time eating here and was highly disappointed . The restaurant has good reviews and I am not sure why because for my first time eating here there was a lot to be desired ! The waitress kind and helpful  offered me the special which was breaded chicken (Milanesa, pollo empanisado) side of yellow rice and beans , warm tortillas .
(No salad ) asked for some avocados which were really good . The Chicken was super bland ( No Sabor) the beans had no salt which is fine but there was no seasoning at all , rice was ok maybe the best on that plate . Let the waitress know I was not happy , mentioned the chicken had no flavor she said that how bread chicken is😱🤔 which by the way if you have had pollo Empanisado correction no it is not meant to taste bland , all it was is coated in bread crumbs no spices at all .
I have had mexican food before smh this was not it !!! I could not even continue to eat my meal , my food had no flavor, changed my plate to a $14 plate at that Carne asada (Steak) with sauteed onions (caldoito)=broth beans and yellow rice this time they forgot my avocado :(
The steak was cut in pieces and so tough not tender at all , the steak must of been small because it was a fee pieces , the meat was  in a broth had pieces of tomatoes seasoned well with salt . Nothing worse then leaving unsatisfied and hungry , Idk if Id return . I expected more and I think they could do better ! Someone else came and offered the special just when I took a bite of my breaded chicken , I desperately wanted to tell him no son this ain't it .

name: Dana Santiago
text: Great Tacos. I had the asada, chorizo, and al pastor tacos. all the meats were tender, juicy, and full of flavor. The tortillas were delicious and both red and green sauce exallent. it's a little hole in the wall, but the food is awesome and the service is warm and inviting. I uber in Charlotte and will be her often.

name: Justice Futrell
text: Walked in and my boyfriend handed a lady $40 in 20s. The cashier proceeded to tell him she was not allowed to take the money as she “guesses” it was fake but DIDNT use a counterfeit pen because she “didn’t have one”. A few moments later I walked in with the same bills to figure out what the problem was and after I announced the name it was under I was instantly told “if it’s the same bills then I can’t take them”. We both work hard for our money. But to assume automatically it was fake was an issue for me. We originally chose seafood but wanted to try the wings here instead. Must of been a sign.. I won’t be back.

text:
(Translated by Google) Nottttt bad!

Nottttt bad!

name: Justin Fields
text: Do not what do ever go there to get your business cards done. I could have had my little sister do them and have a better quality. Maybe they do better in another *ing department.

name: Scott Somerville
text: Line out the door, finally got inside and there were 3 employees inside only one helping a customer. Ended up leaving the package on the counter and walked out, with 6 people waiting outside. Worst location I've experienced in the city had customer service issues in the past as well.

name: jeslyn sampaio
text: Luis is awesome. Very helpful and friendly.

name: Harry Higgins
text: Why don't you post holiday hours online? It's frustrating to get to a location with 3 boxes on my lunch break and it's not open.

name: Raquel Johnson
text:
$5 for printing two Black and White pages? No thank you.

While I appreciate the response, $5 for two pages is still price gouging, posted or not. The UPS location near me charges 20 cents or so. $5 more and I could have a really nice birth certificate or marriage license printed on high quality security paper. Yeah, still a NO for me.

resp.text:
Raquel, Thank you for your review. First, we have our costs posted publicly and our staff is transparent about charges before anyone sends us an email for our full-service printing service. We have a self-service station that allows patrons to access their own files for a discounted cost.

Please contact our management at store1027@theupsstore.com in order to take corrective action and further discuss this situation. When you contact us, please leave a phone number.

Thank you,

Management Team

name: Katie Nichols
text: This is the only UPS store I go to. They’re fast, friendly, knowledgeable, and adhering to guidelines for dealing with COVID-19. Thanks, y’all!

resp.text: Thank you Katie! Glad your experience is always great and that you recognize the measures we are taking to keep our team, customers, and respective families/friends safe. See you soon!

name: HairMetal Chris
text: Very unfriendly staff. No help at all. Definitely stay away! Don't take my work for it just read most of the comments. I wish I did before goinging in.

resp.text: Thank you for your thoughts. It is unfortunate that you had an unfriendly experience during your visit. We hope the next time we can exceed your expectations.

name: SOPHIE LALA
text: Great service, not only when you are shipping with cost but they accommodate very nicely even with prepaid labels! I think they changed ownerships and previous patrons were very nice but I think new owners are even nicer. Glad to see!

resp.text: Thanks Sophie! Glad we're able to make your experience great! The owners of this location has been here for a few years now, so glad to see we're able to improve on your experience at our location. See you soon!

name: T K
text: Difficult to find on a busy corner. There's no drop-off area you have to literally go park around the corner. Very inconvenient when it's raining and you have large packages.  Their front door is extremely heavy and I saw two employees watch me struggle to open that heavy door with my boxes in the rain no one helped me. When I seemed a little aggravated covered in water and wet packages one of the employees rolled her eyes. This location should definitely hire more professional staff

resp.text:
Louise, Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Management was unaware of this situation. Our team is expected to provide world-class customer service.

Please contact our management at 704.342.1950 to discuss this further so that we can do proper due diligence so that your next experience at our location is tremendous.

Thank you.

name: Kelly Breeney
text: This place was super fast when I walked in and helped right away. Plus the employee who I believe does deliveries was there and he was very friendly!

resp.text: Thanks Kelly! At our location, we pride ourselves on our world-class customer service, and we are so glad to hear it is recognized by the folks we work with. See you soon!

name: Stephen Gregory
text: Very Friendly and always willing to help! Great overall Service.

resp.text: Thanks Stephen! Always glad to provide the best service we can. See you soon!

name: Matt Hill
text: I could drive my package halfway across the country and deliver it in the time it takes to get through the slow lines here

resp.text: Thank you Matt for your thoughts. Due to the global health pandemic, essential businesses such as this location have taken measures to help protect our staff, patrons, and our community from the spread of the disease. If you do not want to wait in the line, we encourage you to visit us during slower times of the day.

name: Natalie Mcpherson
text: Wonderful fast experience.  They are better than other locations I have visited and the staff is friendly

resp.text: Thanks Natalie! Glad we're able to make your experience great when you visit us. See you soon!

name: Nick Tipton
text:
Nickel and dime you. I had a return in a small box that I needed a strip of packaging. I was charged 1$ for a single strip of tape. .

Edit: Improving rating because you did perform the shipping service which was the goal (I assume), but I was charged for a extra services which were not made clear (bad). I will improve your overall rating, but I am stilling dinging for the lack of transparency and an unwillingness to compromise in a situation and remain friendly, but rather chose to argue and talk to me in a patronizing tone.

resp.text: We apologize for any inconvenience. There is a cost associated with the box used to secure your item, the materials associated with securing the item inside each box, and the service provided.

name: R H
text: Started coming here after repeated negative experiences at Dilworth Packing on East Blvd.  These guys are everything that they’re not; friendly, helpful and professional.   I’d give 6 stars if this UPS store had parking.

resp.text: Thanks RH! Always glad to make your experience great at our location. Now if Google reviews had 6 star capability, I would let you know the little secret of the loading zone spots along Camden Road close to the corner of West Blvd (enough spaces for five cars); but until that time, thanks for the great review! See you soon!

name: Anatol Schweizer
text: Very friendly staff,  great deal and fast speedy delivery.

resp.text: Thanks Anatol! Glad we're able to make your experience great when you visit us. See you soon!

name: David Merrill
text:
Awful. Charged me $3.22 to print a shipping label without telling me. Pricing for 2 boxes was excessive. Unpleasant reminder of why I don't use UPS for shipping needs and to request Amazon sellers to allow me to send returns via FedEx instead. Also, Parking sucks.

My Response to your reply:
There is a cost to having lights on in your and water in your toilet but I was not charged for those things. They are considered a cost of doing business. I did not use your computer therefore no disclaimer was displayed to me. Your staff used your computer to print a label for a package that I was shipping with you. That minor $3.22 to print a shipping label was as cost you should have absorbed as a cost of sending my pacakege. FedEx does not charge me for labels, boxes, envelops, zipties, etc. That is why I usually go with them. Additionally, I was shopping back an item that was sent to me over a year ago for factory repairs. That is a tad bit long to keep an Amazon box. There were no parking spaced availible for your store when I was there, and had there been, 30 minutes certainly would not have been enough time as I was there for almost a hour. Based on you poor service and chargin me $36 for something that FedEx would have done for $10, I can only assume you would have towed my vehicle and told me that there was disclaimer on the roof of the building that can only be seen with a black light during the solar eclipse on the Ides of March.

resp.text:
David, we apologize that you had an unpleasant experience at our store.

First, there is a cost associated with usage of the rental computer. There are disclaimers on the initial screen, on the pop-up screen upon providing a form of payment, and a sign on the monitor so that each of our customers are aware.

Next, we recommend online shoppers to retain the shipping boxes, if they are in good shape, in case the buyer would like to return their item.

Finally, if you chose to visit our store again, there is parking along Camden Road, including two 30-minute loading zone spaces and metered spaces. Our property has a parking lot in the back of the building which our customers may utilize by parking in a non-numbered parking space, if available, during business hours.

name: Taylor L
text: This location is smaller, and reminds me of a post office you’d see in a small town in a movie. The employees were very friendly and helpful, and I was able to get in and out of the store in less than 2 minutes. I’m definitely using this as my go-to location from now on.

name: Stuart Smith
text: Good location with parking in the back. Staff was good. Met my expectations.

name: Kyle Miller
text: This UPS Store has the best customer service around.  I use him for all of my shipping and printing needs.

resp.text: Thanks Kyle! Glad we're able to make your experience great at this location. See you soon!

name: Gerald S
text: Slow response time

resp.text: Gerald, thank you for your thoughts. In order to protect our customers, staff, and their families, we have precautions in place which in turns slows down the process for transactions. Once we resume business as usual, we welcome you to come back to visit when we operate at a much faster pace.

name: Michael Giudice
text: Very friendly staff that helped me pack and ship items right before Christmas. Items got to Florida on time even though the staff expected them to be delivered after the holiday

resp.text: Thank you. As always, we appreciate your continued support and patronage.

resp.text:
We apologize for any inconvenience. There is a cost associated with the both shipping  and shipping materials (included boxes and filler materials). We do our best to minimize for the customer for shipping materials as shipping charges are based on schedules set forth by UPS Corporate.

Should you change your mind and revisit our location, we hope to make your experience with our team terrific.

resp.text: Thank you for your thoughts. If you could please elaborate by sending us an email at store1027@theupsstore.com, we would greatly appreciate it as we look to improve our services.

Please contact us at store1027@theupsstore.com or (704) 342-1950 for any further concerns or questions.

text: Great little store for the health conscious. For such a small place they have a good selection of supplements, essential oil and supplies, and food options. The best gem of this little spot is the abundance of knowledgeable staff ready to help you whether you are a seasoned health nut or a newbee trying to learn your way around. Would give 5 stars if they were bigger and had more choices and the bldg seems about 100 years old with a bit of a funky smell, but still a neat place.

name: Jeremiah Napier
text:
They automatically add a tip to online orders and you can't edit it. I'm more than happy to tip of the service is good but don't force me to.

The tip is also calculated AFTER taxes and fees. a tip should only be calculated for the food/service.

EDIT: Response to owner: it says "tip" when ordering service, in addition to the fee. There is no separate place to add/edit a tip.

resp.text: We do not add a tip. It is at the customers discretion.  The charges are from the online services you are ordering from.

Tried it out with a few coworkers and was pretty disappointed. Was understaffed, they forgot half the default toppings on my burger, and one of my co-workers had worringly rare lamb (which was NOT what he had asked for). The food I did manage to try was alright: better than a fast food joint but definitely not as good as anything similar to Five Guys, Bad Daddy's, etc.

As of now, I'd say give them a few weeks to get things going before you give it a shot. I'm hoping it's simply a rough opening week and will update after a later lunch outing.

name: Diamond Camp
text: Came in to eat here with my family and it was our first time. After we ordered our food we went to get drinks and unfortunately they were out of all juice in the coke machine” due to something being wrong with it and getting fixed”. So my husband asked for tea instead bc the tea was out. Lanesha C an employee behind the counter screamed” I’m not making no tea we close in a hour and I’m not making no tea” .while we waited for the order to be done, she is screaming and yelling still stating she was not making the tea? We went to chipotle which was next-door to get juice instead. On my way back in I was greeted by another employee and ask him what was wrong with her and why was she being so rude. He stated that she’s usually nice, & that her boyfriend works here as well. As soon as we walked in her and her boyfriend who works there just fought about something, so she was angry about that.????? Literally on our way out her boyfriend whom works in the back as a cook comes up to the front, words were exchanged between him and my husband and it was literally almost a fight! Thank god two police officers were next door at chipotle and came over because at that point everyone from their kitchen was in the front trying to escalate a brawl! In front of my 9 year old! Like I felt as tho we were in the middle of the hood or in the projects! All this because we wanted tea to drink with our meal! Save your time and money unless ghetto festivities are your thing!!!!

resp.text: Hi - we received copy of the complaint from the police officers involved- if you would like to discuss this issue further please contact us at burgerimtyv1@gmail.com...thank you- management

text: Went here to try the lunch specials, and my expectations are throughly exceeded. The place Is quiet and cozy at the end of the shopping strip with very well planned out and aesthetically pleasing front of house design. The head chef Parichat is extremely skilled at her culinary prowess. She began with serving a perfectly balanced chicken and rice soup,  which was amazing! I ordered the Pad See Eew (chicken - medium spice) and I was blown away, the flavors were perfectly balanced, the chicken was not overcooked, and the pad see eew noodles were freshly made in house that day. I highly highly recommend this place to everyone,  as it is easily the best Thai food restaurant in the University.

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
I've sampled some of Chef Alyssa's food before, so when I heard they were doing brunch, I was so excited to try it.

We went on Saturday just after 9am and we were the only ones there (everyone else is probably still sleeping at that time). You order at the counter, take a number, find a seat, and they bring your food out to you.

We got the Pancake Tacos, the Modern Southern Bowl, and the Stuffed French Toast. Everything was amazing, but the Stuffed French Toast was probably our favorite. The over easy egg and fresh berries easily made it the best French toast I've ever had.

I loved the pancake tacos. The flavor was great in the pancakes and scrambled eggs and the thick cut bacon put it over the top. I'm not even a big pancake person, but these were great.

The Modern Summer bowl eat light and refreshing. It definitely felt like a good healthy option compared to the other things we got. We added some of the homemade hot sauce which really complemented the flavors.

We got our food quickly and the everyone was so friendly and helpful. This is one of my favorite (possibly my favorite) brunch in Charlotte. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you so much Jacqueline! We're so glad you enjoyed your meal and hope to see you again soon!

name: Justine V
text: Went here for Saturday morning brunch and it did not disappoint! Ordered the pancake tacos, breakfast burrito and the Latin TBD with mimosas. Will definitely be coming back..worth the wait.

name: Andrew Donatelli
text: Wife and I came for Saturday Brunch. Entrees averaged about $12-$14 dollars, but the quality of food was fantastic. I got a breakfast bowl with short ribs on a bed of grits topped with a poached egg, my wife got the stuffed French toast. Both were fantastic, there was plenty of seating and service was very friendly and helpful. I plan to go back to try more of their menu options! Highly recommend for a casual Saturday brunch experience.

resp.text: Thank you so much for brunching with us and the recommendation! We love the opportunity to share our food and space!

name: Morgan Ferone
text:
Chef Alyssa’s Kitchen has a lovely, welcoming and bright atmosphere! We tried the stuffed French toast, the Latin TBD, and the pancake tacos — all three were delicious. Perfect brunch for the whole family!

Unexpected bonus: great music!!

resp.text: Thank you for stopping in today Morgan! And extra happy you enjoyed the food in our brand new location!

name: Matthew Chappell
text: We had an amazing time in a cooking class.  We learned to use the Big Green Egg and ate some amazing food.  Alyssa and her staff were amazing.  The facility is really fantastic.  Highly recommened.

name: Ashley Scott
text: The first thing you'll notice taking a class with Chef Alyssa is that she is the real deal. She's an expert cook, genuinely kind and incredibly talented at sharing her skills with you. No matter how many students in the class, Alyssa makes you feel comfortable working with the recipes and will have you leaving the class with a full stomach and legit cooking chops. Go for the classes, stay for the incredible team of Alyssa and Andrew that make them so fun.

name: Blessed One
text:
I went to Brunch on my birthday with family members, who have attended the classes there. They had rave reviews.

The brunch was very poorly managed and planned for. The wait was horrible. The customer service was terrible and the food was absolutely not worth the wait.

Please stick to what you do best.
Stick to cooking classes and leave the resturant side of the business alone.

A very disapointing Birthday Brunch!

resp.text: Nora, we are so sorry to know that you did not have a great experience on Saturday! Our goal, of course, is provide a positive experience for everyone. You had caught us on a day when were unexpectedly extremely busy. This is not always typical and we hope you'll consider giving us another try in the future!

name: Cris Taylor
text: Absolutely AMAZING food, service and atmosphere! After following Chef Alyssa on IG, I had to visit for Saturday morning brunch. The Pancake Tacos (filled with scrambled eggs and thick cut bacon) were delicious. They had classic mimosas and a Raspberry Sorbet mimosa. Both were very tasty. Shrimp & Grits have been added to my wishlist for my next visit. Brunch is available on Saturdays from 9AM - 2PM. The kitchen offers adult and kids cooking class and features family style table seating, smaller tables and outdoor seating. A must try!

resp.text: Thank you so much! We're so happy you brunched with us and enjoyed the food! Our hope is to keep it casual and delicious with a variety of appealing choices every Saturday. Hope to see you again!

name: Elizabeth Gravley
text: Decided to take a class with Chef Alyssa during a birthday trip to Charlotte. We had the Mediterranean meal with stuffed grape leaves, sea bass, and rose water pavlova with berries. I'm normally a very picky person, so I came in with worries that I would not enjoy the food as much as the experience. I was seriously wrong. The class was so much fun! I cleared my plate and had one of the best desserts I have ever tasted. I will absolutely take another class if I stay a weekend in Charlotte again. I highly recommend this!

name: Rite Lite Signs
text: A wonderful chef and manager couple team duo curating some wonderful cooking classes as well as creating and distributing their own local products. Started here in Southend and have growth with the development boom! Friendly. Exciting. Well worth every penny. SUPPORT LOCAL!

resp.text: We love what we do!

name: Jason Normoyle
text: I've eaten at restaurants where Alyssa was the chef, and the food was always fantastic. I am so glad she decided to start teaching cooking classes, and will definitely be taking my fiance on a few date nights here. Their location is super convenient in South End and she is a great teacher. Highly recommend that you check them out!!

name: Alex Mason
text: Alyssa and Andrew, you guys are a PHENOMENAL team!!  Thank you, Alyssa, for sharing your WONDERFUL and BEAUTIFUL art of cooking! There was NO WAY we would have created such a dish without your great instruction!  Andrew your OUTSTANDING Marketing and Customer Service skills have definitely won us over and we look forward to cooking with you all again! Bravo to Chef Alyssa's!!! VERY Tasteful! You guys are truly THEEEE BEST in CHARLOTTE!

Very affordable too! We’re doing the 20 meal plan. That’s lunch and dinner for two for $160. That’s $8/meal. Can’t beat it.

We’re spending about the same amount of money as we did at the grocery store and now have gotten back an hour of our evenings. Now we have time to go to the gym!

text: It may be the location or the timing on opening but people haven't figured out how great this place is yet. I've been to over 20 coffee shops in Charlotte and this is in my top three. The food and drink have been made with a thoughtfulness and quality that really can't be compared to anywhere else in town. They even having evening food, alcohol and a gorgeous collection of bottles of wine, many of which are natural wines. Don't let the small size of the shop and menu scare you- everything is delicious. The savory rice porridge bowl may be my new favorite breakfast item in the city.

name: iNSIDE EUROPE
text:
Congrats to Hex and Good Bottle Company to join forces for Stable Hand: same great coffee prepared and offered by their kind team — with hopefully more tasty food + drink options to follow soon.

Excited that one of our favorite CLT hangouts is open again and liking the new look. We won’t be strangers.

name: Lauren Bilski
text: Savory porridge was delicious. My 8oz coffee and milk was amazing. Made for a perfect Sunday morning.

name: Dominic Birckbichler
text: What a beautiful and well put together place. The have an incredible wine selection and beer to match. I love coming here for some coffee and any of their breakfast options. The staff is always super friendly and knowledgeable. Try to stop by if they do a pop up dinner. Those have been unforgettable!

name: Amit Patel
text: Rice porridge unique and tasty. Dirty chai was not too sweet and had a good balance of chai and espresso, which was great. Service was quick and friendly.

name: Yonatan Daniyel
text: Thanks for the wonderful cup of coffee and I appreciate the nice ambiance of this place.  I visited this coffee shop years ago and its nice to see its still around. Hex Coffee probably is the best roaster in Charlotte and I was impressed with the bag I bought at the shop and brought home.  Indeed, this place has great coffee, good beer selection and very interesting food menu.  I enjoyed sitting at a coffeeshop again after 3 months or so of not visiting one.  Hope Stable Hand (and Hex Coffee) will flourish and would encourage people to give this place a try and support this business.

name: James Bullard
text: My barista was a slender blonde with ink up her arms.  She had a passion for coffee and made just enough connection to make me feel welcome while still being time-efficient.  The coffee was brewed perfectly and the serving size was delightful.  I'm a "hot, black, and bitter" kinda guy, so I don't love a lot of liquid with my go-power.  Great vibe in the room, VERY busy, so that was a great sign, and the price point was A-OK.  All in all?  An excellent experience.  I look forward to getting my afternoon pick-me-up when I'm back in the neighborhood from Stable Hand.

name: Dellarisa Patterson
text:
Wonderful Vibe... Good food!
More avenues for me to come back explore.. Natural wines to endeavor in. Looking forward to sharing with my close friends and family.

name: Pavi MJ
text:
We went here on a date night. The service and food is amazing. The staff were very friendly. The black eyed peas they give as complimentary was just too good (I prefer soft bread though). The waiter was very accommodating and helped with customizing to our tastes. Roasted chicken was juicy and tender.
We will visit again....

text: Delicious meal in a lovely ambiance. Nice staff who delivered a very well crafted meal (kids lived it too) . Definitely will come back.

name: Filmon Isak
text: Amazing service and food!

name: JJ Souther
text:
Went for Queens Feast. Our server, Bret, was spot on with his service. Impeccable timing and never felt rushed to finish. Great job by management to maintain the ambience.  Overall, the food was excellent and very well prepared. We ordered the crab cake, fritto misto, penne seafood and tagliata steak.  The crab cake was crispy but not greasy.  The fritto misto, also fried, was tasty and loved the fried zucchini mixed it as well.  The penne seafood was flavorful, the penne was al dente. Would definitely order any of these again.  The steak was prepared properly but the entire plate was probably the less flavorful of all the items we ordered. I would not order the steak again.  I'm lactose intolerant, so for my dessert, I received the fresh fruit dish which is usually my only dessert choice. Really?! I have gotten to the point I usually turn down fresh fruit. But I was served the fruit anyway and these were the best strawberries I've had in years! Not sure where these were purchased, but they were picked ripe! These were not picked green then left to ripen during transit like so much of our fruits and vegetables today. The bread and white beans served as we waited for our meal was good, however, I have a pet peeve about burned bread.  And ours was on one edge. The bread was good, crusty outside, soft inside but I never understand why restaurants serve burnt bread! We ordered a bottle of wine with dinner. The wine prices are on average $40/bottle. If you bring your own bottle, corkage is $20.
They were very helpful with my lactose intolerance and even made recommendations on what I could order (almost everything). NOTE: The tables on the porch were extremely close, you had to turn sideways to get to your table.  No elevator so if you can't climb stairs,  you can't eat here. I like the quiet background music, we were able to have a conversation but were so close to the other diners that we never had much of one. Maybe one row of tables rather than cramming two on the porch?

name: Nancy Galimi
text: We came here during restaurant week and even though it was very busy our waitress was very friendly and pleasant. The lamb shank was phenomenal and the crab cake was delicious. We would definitely go back.

name: Steph R
text: I went for restaurant week and got the potato leek soup, the lamb shank and the cheesecake. The leek soup had plenty of delicious crab meat in it. Otherwise I think I would've been happier w the beef carpaccio  the server recommendation. The lamb shank took forever but was well worth the wait. It was bigger than a turkey leg and came on a bed of cheesy parmesan risotto. The lamb was delicious the red wine reduction was so delicious I couldn't get enough of it. The risotto was amazing! Totally hit the spot and paired perfectly w the lamb and the juices. The cheesecake wasn't over the top but definitely didn't disappoint. Everyone was very nice and the atmosphere was very cozy.

name: Brian Capron
text: Wonderful business dinner with colleagues. Charlotte Restaurant Week menu was spot on. Ambiance is very conducive to conversation. Highly recommend!

name: Joe Alpha
text:
Here's my review with 2 pros and 2 cons:

Pros:
1. The food is great - had the following: Scallops Wrapped in Smoked Salmon, Burrata, Beef Wellington. Cost for 2 people $250+
2. The decor is top notch: it's up-scale with white linen and beautiful paintings on the walls.

Cons:
1. Noise Level: very loud atmosphere. During the evening the wait staff dropped silverware on the ground 3 different times. Shuffling of silverware can be heard from the kitchen. The noise creates a chaotic feeling.
2. The hosts and wait-staff did not seem to care: the greeting upon entry was insincere and lacked interaction. The server could have been more attentive and timely, given how few of people were in his section.

text: I came for restaurant week. Our server, Mia, was amazing. The fritto misto and lamb shank were delicious and generous portions. I can’t give it a 5 star because my risotto was not true risotto. It was made with just regular rice as opposed to arborio rice. My tiramisu was delicious, too... I would have preferred it without the extra chocolate sauce on top.

name: Nathaniel Anderson
text: Some mixed feelings on this review, the interior of the restaurant is very nice but seems to be set up more as a bar than an actual nice sit-down restaurant. Unless you've had a couple drinks you'll probably be annoyed by the noise level ( bar area is raised and noise travels out into surrounding dining area). The cost for the food is kind of expensive but the presentation is nice ( unfortunately did not get any pictures). I should not have ordered the ribeye steak... I've never had a steak that tough before, ever! It was cooked medium rare and must have just been a very low quality ribeye. The ribeye steaks I purchased from Walmart and cook myself are a hundred times better. Staff was super friendly and did a good job with keeping up with all the orders, were dressed pretty sharp too. I think I would enjoy this place better at the bar drinking with some appetizers.

We did the two person dining experience because it allowed us to taste a bunch of different food while still getting a deal on the cost. My favorite dish was the Butternut Squash Ravioli. Everything else was amazing as well. Highly recommend anything on the menu and need to go back to taste the other things.
The cocktails were also very good. End the night with the tiramisu. You will thank me later.

We would still like the opportunity to make it up to you. Would you please email us at info@osterialuca.com. Thank you!

name: Jacob Packett
text:
The environment here is absolutely fantastic. Probably one of the best looking restaurants in the charlotte area. Dim light but not dark next to bright whites and a glowing decor. My wife and I absolutely loved it.

The service left some to be desired. The hostess let us know that pizza bar and bar seats are first come first served but didn’t check for us if there were pizza bar seats. We may not have gotten seated unless a woman (likely the owner) hadn’t seated us. Food service was courteous but very slow. Our waitress was in the weeds the whole visit.

The Pizzas were delicious; very well made, hot, with a flavorful crust. There’s not anything but good things to say about the pizza.

All in all, I’m sure at some point the novelty will die down and service will improve. It’s hard to justify coming here for pizza when Inizio can get you there without sit down service and Stagioni is up the road with PHENOMENAL pizza for just $2-3 more. Lots of Italian competition in the Charlotte area.

resp.text: Jacob - Thank you for your honest review! We are disappointed to hear that we fell short on service; our team is still fairly new and we are continuing to work out the kinks. We really do appreciate your feedback and hope you will give us another shot soon!

text: I think this restaurant definitely has potential to be great. Only being open just under two weeks there is still a lot of learning to be done. She did however admit she wasn’t sure about some of our questions and did ask other staff members to get us the answers. The burrata had very little flavor and overall was a disappointment. The brussel sprouts however were amazing, make sure to order those. We also had the wild mushrooms & caramelized white pizza. I thought the pizza itself was average but the crust was pretty good. Hopefully once this place gets up and running it will be worth a visit back.

name: Hannah Khederian
text:
I found out about this place because a paint night event hosted by The Createry was taking place here. I love sushi and shortly after finding out they offer a half-price sushi menu on Sundays (the day I would be there for the event) I knew I had to give it a try.

Of the five rolls my bf and I deduced the specialty rolls were significantly better. The 'Enter the Dragon' roll was easily my favorite, and I highly suggest it to anyone who enjoys imagine/eel. As for the more basic rolls, spicy tuna and salmon avocado, I didn't think they were anything special and I've had way better before. But for half-price I really couldn't complain.

Our server was fantastic, very friendly, timely, and never let my water glass get below halfway gone. Especially impressive because they were a bit busy after the event.

All in all, I would go back here on a Sunday in a heartbeat. Also, an added bonus was that Piedmont Row (where it's located) was all decorated for the holidays, so it was very pretty to walk around outside as well.

name: Ashton Garr (Ashbringer874)
