text: Great atmosphere!! Music on point!!! Nice place to hang and the artist slang some ink...

name: Chrissy Nave’
text: Service is so bad! The waitresses have the worst attitude doing their job, slow & rude. It was our 2nd time and we thought it would be better from the first time. It wasn’t. Even got a table again & the same results. Everyone in our party agreed we will never go back. Food was dry & cold. Drinks were ok though. The tattoo parts didn’t have on mask & their spaces were cluttered and dirty. Didn’t seem sanitary.

name: Chloe McNealy
text: The owner isn't friendly at all. Rude. His wife is super sweet. Staff isn't very well trained on the menu nor on customer service skills. The food is ok, with the Brussel sprouts being my favorite with the chicken Flatbread.

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback! I'll address your concerns with the General Manager who is not my husband, LOL! We have a lot of new staff that we are trying to get up to speed. We take service serious and appreciate you patronizing us. I hope you will return and give us another chance to make things right in the near future.

text: Visited this place 2 days in a row. Saturday night and Sunday evening. Drinks were ok, Dj was good Saturday night. However the female bartender was ignorant,  she watered down our drinks, but when my guy friend ordered the same drink it was better and stronger. Philly cheesesteak egg rolls were deep fried more than once (used old egg rolls) and deep fried them again in overly old grease which made them appear very dark in color , overly greasy and tough. The atmosphere was great but will never eat there ahain.

text: Tattoo guy and bartender downstairs was great... but they only have hookah on the weekend and the menu is very limited

text: I visited w my16 yr old daughter & because my last name ID's(same address)does not match her last name as I choose to not carry es-husband's last name they will not attend to her? NC laws are jot even clear on this & they decided that my ID w same address, tax return is not proof...what the heck do the want as proof...who knows..they JAVE NO COMPANY POLICY ..UNPROFESSIONAL & IDIOTIC

resp.text: It’s against the law to tattoo or pierce a minor! If the proper proof is not provided we do reserve the right to decline any service.

text: BEST in Charlotte. My food was cook to order. Man this is my 3rd time eating there and i wanted to makes sure it was good lime the 1st time an boy was my entire family pleased. All our food was fantastic! The dipping sausees i believe are homemade and they're great. I even had the pleasure of meeting the owner everytime i visit and didnt realize it was the owner til yesterday an complimented her on her establishment. I cant eat everyone's cat fish my niece odered some an i tried it mannn i put my flounder down to order some more catfish lol that damn good. Captain Steve's has nothing on this spot. WoW i will be back an will make sure i tell others about this hidden gem!!! Really good!!!

text: It's a hole in the wall for sure. And it's out dated. But the customer service was excellent and the food was fresh and soooo delish!  The prices were very good for the large portion of food you get. 3 dinners with two sides and 3 very large drinks $33.33. We will eat here more often.

text: Need to season the food. Cook fish a few seconds longer! Not good!!!!

Having apparently loaned their sole umbrella, he got soaked in the process. I don't think my mother would have gone so far. Customer. For. Life.

name: Bill Powers
text:
Refreshing restaurant experience in Charlotte.  Creative menu, locally sourced, and friendly service.

If you're looking for Chicken con Crema, refried beans and rice, well, this isn't your place.

On the other hand, if you like the sound of grilled octopus, mole, and aggressively spiced fare, Comida is for you.

Bill

name: larry ramsey
text:
Almost one year ago to the day, my friends and I met for our annual holiday dinner.  I had chosen Comida, which was then located in the old Penguin location off of Central Ave. as we were looking for an upscale Mexican meal.  The experience and the meal were the stuff of legend.  The menu was focused on Spanish and Mexican dishes that were done to perfection.  We learned that they would be closing at the end of that month and moving to their current location on Selwyn.  When it came time to get a reservation for this year's meal, Comida was a unanimous choice.

Upon arriving, the look/feel of the restaurant was appealing, very similar to the previous space, but that is where the similarities ended.  We mentioned why were there, and our previous visit and were told that the menu was "completely different".  Our first clue.  Looking at this new menu, I was disappointed how many of the items were indeed gone from before.

To jump to the meal, we had the fresh pork skins which were seasoned with a spicy dusting which was very good.  A solid 4 out of 5.  We also had the Chicharron de Queso, which on our previous visit was made with a different cheese and was much lighter and more delicate.  This one had to be manhandled to break apart. The dip was good.  A 3 out of five.   I had the sauted shishito peppers in cream sauce, a solid 4 out of 5.  Two of our party had the street corn, which they both liked a 4 out of 5 again.  Two of us had the pork shank, which I expected to be pull apart tender, but required serious knife and fork skills to take a part.  Very tough and dry, a 2 out of 5. A fourth had the duck, which he said was good - 4 out of 5.

Service was spotty, despite the fact there were few other patrons there that night.  We did not feel "attended to".  This was once again in comparison to our previous visit, where we had been treated to a conversation with the chef and even exchanged some contact information and recipes.  I would give the ambiance and service a 2 out of five.

So a note to self for us that we will be searching for a new place in the coming year.  And, I'll be toning down my recommendation to those who ask (friends, family, etc.).  I see many effusive and positive reviews posted, and I do not doubt that those folks had great meals and experiences.  I can only conclude that they never tried the other location.

name: Daniela D
text: I was really excited to try this restaurant, so I invited a friend to come with me tonight. First of all, the hostess was very unfriendly and it seemed like she was just making excuses not to gives us a seat. After standing for a couple of minutes she said she had a couple at the bar leaving in about 15 min. We agreed, and she mentioned we could wait around and she would text us whenever the table available. We called back to the restaurant to check before going , to what the hostess reply,  "the kitchen is packed, the restaurant is packed" which u understand I've been in the industry before , but she could've explain herself better. About after the hour at a different restaurant we decided to go, we received the msg letting us know that the table was "available"  way to greet your not anymore customers 👎

name: Joel Bonasera
text: A lot of people will say this place is overpriced and that the proportions are way too small. I would tend to agree, but I would add that if they can just get that figured out it has potential. The flavors weren't bad and some were quite good. I actually found one of my orders to be way too BIG in proportion: the porkbelly was HUGE and didn't seem cooked correctly. Not that it was dangerous, but it was a little cold and wasn't very crispy.

name: Elizabeth Torres
text: Food was greasy and overpriced. Restaurant facility is nice, but there’s not one dish that boasts authentic, flavorful Latin food. Just Very disappointed and dissatisfied with the food and would not recommend.

text: Good drinks.  Food was fresh, but not great.  Bathrooms are annoying, specifically it shouldn't be a challenge to turn the water on.

name: Jimmy B
text: The food is good and interesting; however, for the price you are better off going elsewhere. We went home and fixed sandwiches after leaving.  For example, Zambra Tapas in Asheville NC has figured this, small plate, concept out and has balanced prices and quality. Wine also appears to be marked up at 4 x wholesale cost, when it should be 2.5 to 3 x cost. Central Avenue is full of Latin restaurants like El Pulgarcito De America that are better options for the price. Comida is better suited for people that want to sit in a restaurant on the "cool" side of town rather than get a satisfactory meal at a good value.

text:
It may cost a tad more, but it's always well worth it.  The summit room makes great cocktails and food.

I adore the mussels and shrimp bahn mi sliders.  The Summit room consistently delivers some of the best food I've had in Charlotte.

name: Daniel Boyce
text:
The food is of amazing quality and everything is made in North Carolina...Even the liquor they serve is brewed in NC (and surprisingly stood up against some of the higher quality drinks I've had in high end cocktail bars).

The only reason I gave it lower than a 5 star was it took longer than preferred to get our food. Though I understand it takes longer based on the quality and the fact we had over 10 people, but some of our party weren't able to enjoy dessert since we didn't anticipate such a long wait.

It's pricey, but well worth it due to the quality ingredients, the amazing culinary work, and the unique atmosphere.

text: Uhh, whoa. This place was significantly better than I thought it would be. The menu looks boring, the execution is anything but. We shared a bunch of small plates and all of them were fantastic, particularly the Surf and Turf flatbread and BBQ shrimp - two things I thought were going to suck and definitely didn’t. I’ll be back. There are so many other underwhelmingly described but undoubtedly delicious things left to try.

name: Yu-Hsien Ho
text: Excellent cocktails and tapas. Can get very busy during dinner time. Reservations are recommended.  Had some unique cocktails on classic that were very good. Had the lavender mule and their old fashioned while we waited for a table. Luckily, a table had canceles their reservation and we got seated. 6 of us ordered a bunch of plates to share. The barbeque shrimp over grits were good, but a little on the sweet side. The fried okra was delicious, especially the dipping sauce. The chicken sliders were almost as good as chick fil As fried chicken.  Corn fritters were solid as were the crab cake popsicles. Very good service, water was constantly being refilled. Waiter stopped by often to check on us  top notch establishment. Would highly recommend.

name: Chris DeCamp
text: Some of the best service in Charlotte!!! Awesome food.

name: Melissa Summitt
text:
5 star food and bar service with a 0 star host and greeting.

Walked in around 6:30-6:40 with 2 people.  Restaurant was pretty much empty inside with a few patrons at tables and some at the tables outside.

The "host" welcomed us and asked if we had reservations, we said no and he explained that the tables were for reservations only but we could sit at the bar or outside.

While puzzled that we apparently arrived right before a swarm of people, we chose the bar.

The good news - Angela was behind the bar and she was fabulous!  She helped us with wine choices, talked about her favorite menu items and made suggestions.  Her counterpart, Dustin, was also fabulous.

Fave foods from our experience:
Maple glazed brussels sprouts - excellent even without the bacon (we were with someone who doesn't eat meat)
The Summit burger - I had without the brioche bun and it was phenomenal.  I even took one home for hubby.
The Mixed Greens salad - I had this in place of the fries.  Blueberries, walnuts, fresh peach slices and some diced sweet potato - fabulous!

At the time we finished our meal and were just chatting with one another (about 90 minutes later), there were still plenty of open tables inside the restaurant, with at least 4 tables visible that had never been seated during our meal.  They did fill up the bar area, including the host asking me to move my bag which I'd placed next to me in order to pay the bill.

My 2 star ding for this review is solely due to the host at the door and his demeanor when we arrived and when we left.  His parting words "Thanks for showing up and eating and drinking"  What?!?!  He needs some training on how to schedule tables for reservations so they can also take walk-ins as well how to talk to human beings.

Anyways, thanks to Angela anf Dustin for excellent service.  A return visit will be completely due to you and the others who helped take care of us.

Let's be clear - I am not saying to avoid this restaurant but diner beware - if you don't have a reservation, you're on  your own for a seat at the bar or outside.   Even if you do have a reservation, they may seat you at a long table where they eventually also seat other people who aren't with your party (we witnessed that happening too while we were there).

text: This was the first and last time I get food from this location. I showed up at least 10 minutes after my order was supposed to be ready. She also had no idea that I had 2 items in my order and had to go search around for the other item. The pizza had to be remade because it was not what I ordered. There were 2 other people that came in for their orders which were also wrong. Its not worth coming here. Most likely your order will be wrong. If not you'll have to wait extra time for them to prepare it. Good luck.

name: Kevin Pleasants (KPsquared)
text: We we’re so excited to know there’s was a Pizza Hut coming to our area that would over delivery to our neighborhood. While the food is good (didn’t start off that way but they’ve gotten much better), the service needs help. We’ve only ever received one delivery order. The rest we ended up having to go get ourselves. This most recent order quoted over 2 hours before delivery. I immediately called, switching over to carry out. I got there and called a few times to have it bought out to my car for contactless delivery. I sat and watched as no one in the building answered the call. There were no customers inside or anything. I ended up going inside to get my order. I’m sure their doing their best with what they have, but this is a terrible reflection of Pizza Hut, and shows a lack of leadership and customer service that the Huntersville location has. There’s been a couple of times that we actually decided to go there instead although is twice the distance away for us. If only they delivered from out there!

text: Food here is on point.  Not super expensive either.  Service was great and I really liked the atmosphere.  Will be back for sure!

text:
Wow, the Bolognese sauce on Linguine was fantastic!  Best Bolognese sauce I have ever had!  I felt the amount of food given was fair for the price, maybe a tad high, but not bad considering the location in Uptown Charlotte.  We took my Daughter there for her 23rd B'Day.  Four adults ate an appetizer that we shared, and four meals for  about $75 including tax.
The service was fantastic.

name: Vicki Sloan
text: Visited Tavalo for a Where Magazine event. The venue space is beautiful. They have a traditional dining area on the first floor with bar and then  lounge-like area with a wine and cocktail bar on the 2nd floor-perfect for network mixers and happy hour. We sampled 2 pizzas , penne with meatballs ( the sauce was so yummy and a perfect consistency) and my absolutely favorite, arancini. I'd described them as mozzarella huspuppies ( it's OK to laugh) definitely a must-try. The manager Anthony was very nice and welcoming as was the rest of the staff. He even offered his card when I mentioned having my birthday celebration here. Added bonus during the week they have an Express lunch that is on average $10 with fries ( no drink because we'll have beer/wine later )  If you are staying in 1st ward Uptown Charlotte or near the Holiday Inn Express Uptown Charlotte, definitely stop by and enjoy some well-mad Italian food.

Also, do you see that white stuff on top? Thats chicken. yeah ew

resp.text: Hi Liz, this is Jeff and I am the owner of the  Grabbagreen locations in Charlotte.  Sorry to disappoint.  From the picture, it looks liked you ordered a Mediterranean Sea and we simply did now give you enough.  I am at the Epicentre location today if you want a meal on us.

name: Kathleen D
text: I'm a clean eater always looking for good places to eat. However, this was not it. I got the Tokyo bay and it tasted like they put a ton of vinegar all over my food. Concept is great, but the food was not good at all. Will likely come back for juice but that's it. Kitchen also looks dirty.

name: Jennie Karelin
text: Grabbagreen is one of my favorite lunch places in uptown. I eat there one to two times a week. All the ingredients are fresh and clean.  They can even accommodate special diets like paleo and Whole30!  The owner goes out of his way to make sure you're satisfied!

name: Raphael Law
text:
People will complain about the portion sizes and about what they see for trainees.
I think everything here is perfect. I currently work here, and this is what they do for trainees.
You watch. You get to watch how everything is done instead of being thrown in without a clue and completely slowing down everything. That's why when new people are trained, they're seen as "standing on the side" or "taking a lunch break." We learn by watching and seeing where everything is and how it's done, first day, then we start doing things on our own. It encourages competency and builds confidence because you don't have to be deathly afraid of screwing things up as soon as you walk in. It's a radically different approach, but one that's so much more efficient.
They really do care about the health of their customers, and all the ingredients are fresh or made in the house (with the exception of the bottled drinks sold on the side, such as coconut water and expresso cold brewed coffee.) I'm impressed - the other health food place I have worked at had prepackaged and frozen materials, but this place has raw ingredients, and organized everything so as little cross contamination as possible can occur (for example, the almond milk is set aside from all the other juices/milks used in case someone has almond allergies.)
And it's pristine. Working in the food industry, there's a high chance of finding places that have the mentality to just clean up the workspace, and not necessarily everywhere else. Here, EVERYTHING will get cleaned. Daily. It's wonderful to work for a place where the proper guidelines are followed and they care about the quality of the food, as well as the proper training of their workers.

name: Kathleen D
text: I'm a clean eater always looking for good places to eat. However, this was not it. I got the Tokyo bay and it tasted like they put a ton of vinegar all over my food. Concept is great, but the food was not good at all. Will likely come back for juice but that's it. Kitchen also looks dirty.

name: Erica Blair
text:
IMG_7137.PNG

It was good until l found a piece of metal in my wrap.  It just made me think did my contents fall on the floor and they put it back in the wrap?  Did something fall near or on the food and they thought they moved it all and wrapped up my food anyway?   Or the actual  first thought to come to my mind... was someone intentionally trying to hurt another human being?  I won’t be back, sad because l thought l found a good option for some real food but l didn't like the surprises.  Thank God l chew my food well before swallowing.  Hope this doesn’t happen to anyone else.

resp.text:
Erica

Sorry about my late response.  We had issues with our google account and I could not reply.
Please leave me your contact information on grabbagreen@jnzr-llc.com as I would like to understand better what happened.

Thanks / Jeff

name: Jennifer OConnor
text: They have a very diverse choice of teas. They give you the choice of cold or hot for almost all options. Their egg tart was delicious as well. It's a nice spot to hang out inside or outside. There are two tables inside and two outside. If you're looking to try a new tea spot, this one is worth looking at.

name: gem grant
text: delicious tea, especially the winter melon fruit tea. it’s very low-key but definitely don’t overlook it. one of my favourite bubble tea places in charlotte

name: Dean Liu
text: Lowkey spot with good boba and fast service. Diverse food options as well. Would recommend!

name: jalesa young
text:
Absolutely amazing here....the mega mango with rainbow 🌈 jelly's is brilliant it has little pieces of apples 🍎 and other fruits in it as well. And menu item #2 which is a sandwich is Devine. And the cute tea cake 🎂 is 🔥
1. Its a cozy little spot.
2.staff super friendly
3. Price's are like $9 and lower!!
4.support small business
Will return ...have return ....will continue to return!!

name: Jonathan Dinh
text: Great mangonada and delicious Banh mi!

name: Octavia Killingsworth
text: I just moved to the area 2 weeks ago and really like this place. I’ve already visited 3 times for tea

name: Rachel Levi
text: This place is the best! I always recommend Central Tea House for their delicious food, amazing drinks and wonderful people working there.

name: Donovan Waite
text: The food is delicious. The wide variety of teas are amazing. They have more than 20 different teas.

name: Janna Venti
text: The pudding is very good, not too sweet or too eggy. Haven’t tried all the tea yet but the Fruity ones we got were good.

name: Just another viewer
text: I used to go almost EVERY DAY when I worked close to here! The staff and owners are so wholesome, welcoming, and friendly here. The service is quick and the food is not only exceptionally priced but super delicious! My go to is the number 7 with a added egg and a raspberry lemon black tea with lychee popping pearls. It is a small shop which I love cause it's so cute! They also have really yummy deserts that they make there and little board games too! This place deserves more recognition for sure! 10/10 would recommend!!!

name: Kristi C.
text: Service is quick. Tons of options for snacking. They even have games for you to play with friends. Definitely a great place for a quick hangout. The taro smoothie is pretty good. 👌 the shaved ice from San Fran has made my expectations too high so i didnt really care for the shaved ice here. Definitely will return to try out now things on the menu.

name: David Kern
text:
Cute little place with just a few small tables. It is a tea house, not a sit down restaurant. There must be 50 different types of tea! We tried three different ones and really enjoyed them. Be warned however, they can be VERY sweet. They have different levels of sweetness. Be sure to pick the one that matches your taste buds.

Food was great too. It was the best part. We had several sandwiches that were unusual and delicious. Great, distinct flavors. Unusually good bread.

name: Anthony Tran
text: This place was AMAZING. My wife and I are pretty picky with our bubble tea. We normally drive like an hour for some good bubble tea until we found this place. The flavor is delicious and creamy. They have a lot of options as well. We were definitely satisfied with our experience.

name: Phung Nguyen
text: I stumbled on this cafe by chance and I’m glad I did. Their prices are quite affordable and they have a wide range of drink selections as well as snacks and pastries. Such as a variety of tea and bánh mì. Their boba is soft and chewy which is really good. My favorite is their oolong milk tea with 50% sugar.

name: Alec Stowe
text: The taro smoothie is great, all the pastries are awesome, and the BULGOGI sandwich is A1! The guy at the counter was super friendly, helpful, and incredibly polite. Will absolutely be coming back.

name: Tyler Shoffner
text: Amazing place for Bubble Tea, food, and dessert. The staff is always friendly and willing to assist any customer with their order. It is a great place to relax and grab a bite and play games with friends. My girlfriend and I love going here!

name: Karl Is-Karl
text: I really like the vibe here. Good tea and sandwiches.

name: Serge TheUkrainian
text: Very friendly staff, good to have a small chat with. Tea was on top level. We've been to every bubble tea place in Charlotte, I definitely recommend this place. A+👌

name: kris
text: Best tea in town!

name: Nicole
text: Had the tres leaches & passion tea~ very nice service & great tea plus the tres leaches was aromatic & delicate!

name: Brandy Taylor
text: Huge menu. Friendly service. Adorable set up.

name: Iya VH
text: Very nice cozy clean dining area. Quality drinks and food. Must see!

name: Sonnyson
text: Pretty good tea joint, one of the only on the Central Blvd area. Small lounge area, but nicely decorated. Only thing I can say that I dislike is that toppings are at an added cost, whereas generally places like these toppings are generally free for one or 2, and then anymore is an extra cost.

name: Rampage 5678
text: U need to get there day dreamer special fruit tea its sooo good won't regret it and there sandwiches are the bomb as well really nice staff as well

resp.text: Thank you for your business and the positive review.

name: Thomas Shinn
text:
I would highly recommend you give it a try. Really good experience with owner, food, Boba tea, price, and setting. I will definitely be returning. I hope they out grow their present location, which is a small storefront shop.

We wanted a quick bite before a game, and decided on Vietnamese. We were going to stop at a Pho place, then we saw this next door. So glad we did! We ordered taro boba teas, a traditional banh mi pork sandwich, lemongrass chicken sandwich, and a traditional pork and egg steamed bun. Everything was delicious! My only remark is to ask for the bang mi buns to be less toasted (my preference).

The owner is super sweet and staff seem to enjoy their jobs, which makes for a great experience. They also offer pastries like: Napoleans, Tres Leches, Macaroons, cake slices, and cookies. Their milk tea, smoothie, and drink selection is vast, which I look to explore later.

name: Alma Julian
text: Best bubble tea on this side of town!

name: Michael Nguyen
text:
The place is nice.  Bright and welcoming!
Counter service with a smile (or 2).  It's in a good location as it's in the same plaza as the best Pho in Charlotte. I would save some room for an after pho smoothie or tea.  They have a lot of options so they will have what you want.  I had the original banh mi and it ranks up there with one of the best in Charlotte.  Definately stop by!

name: Steve H.
text: Good variety of offerings both in bahn mi and tea

name: Joel Ferris
text: love that they have bahn mis!

name: Nina Fergusson
text: Yummy bahn mi!

name: Jessie B
text: Disappointed. Over priced, long wait.. and no the place wasn’t even busy. Not sure why there are so many positive reviews on here. Maybe I’ll visit again and try out the food.... maybe.

resp.text: Hi Jessie. Thanks for your comment. We apologize for your negative experience. We were inexperienced than and since have learned from our mistakes. Hope you give us a second chance to gain your business and your appetite.

name: Megan Amberly
text: Food and boba is on point!

name: Lucifer Morningstar
text:
I’ve been here a couple times but I haven’t gotten the chance too review it but today I have some time. First I’d like too say the place is quite small but the atmosphere just screams peaceful, there are also plants on every table so it makes it nicer. They maintain the COVID guidelines which is 6 feet apart.
I had their strawberry smoothie boba and it was very refreshing, they have music playing in the background so it lightens the mood for anyone who might be in a terrible mood.
I’ve also just found out they have board games that you can play while drinking boba so that’s something else. They have sandwiches on their menu as well but those I haven’t tried yet so I can’t review those yet but other then that I recommend this place highly too anyone who wants too bring their date here.

name: Jay Goodman
text: First time at Cheddars. The decor is warm and inviting. Brick and wood. The food is very good. The croissant was so lite and flaky it could have floated away. I had the cajun pasta with descent amounts of sausage, shrimp and chicken. Will return.

name: Nick Rosenfeld
text: Wait times were pretty long, a little over an hour for two people on a Tuesday night. Servers/bartender seemed stretched thin, service was also pretty slow. Food was great however, I'd definitely return! I hope they are able to fix their staffing challenges.

name: Salem Rotaru
text: They've still got a limited menu (as many restaurants still have from the pandemic), and were a little short staffed for lunch (only 2 servers, poor babies), but all of the staff worked really hard and very well together, and there wasn't much of a wait time at all. The food was as good as I remember (it's been a few years since I've visited a Cheddar's) and the flaky, honey butter croissants are still to die for.

name: Raven Christian
text: They are following social distancing and the staff is great! I waiters was Jae I think he was the best. Drinks were perfectly poured, the dip hit the spot and most of all it’s not too loud in here. We went for lunch and was full. Wasn’t a big fan of the pasta but that could be because I was so full from everything else. Definitely will go back. Almost forgot those butter rolls were soooo yummy.

name: joseph marine
text: The short staff and lack of planning makes this place difficult.  If you happen to get in and get a seat you will not be disappointed in the food.  The wait time can be extremely long outside of rush hour or peak times.  At best it is unpredictable.  The service is about average but the chefs have impressed me on numerous occasions.  It is an impressive menu but the New Orleans pasta is truly a comfort dish.  It is always served hot.  It always has plenty of seasonings.  It has never disappointed me.    The price point is reasonable.  It's s delicious well prepared dish that won't break your budget.  Try it at first opportunity.

name: Tonia Ann Branch
text: I took James for the honey croissants. I had Lemon Chicken and he doesn’t remember what he had! Smh

name: PRECIOUZ ROBINSON
text: OM GOODNESS...WE HAD A BLAST. WHEN I TELL YA DRE IS THE BEST WAITER HANDZ DOWN..... THAT'S A UNDERSTATEMENT!!!! HE WAS VERY ATTENTIVE FUNNII OUTSPOKEN AND JUST SOOOOO VERY DOWN TO EARTH... HE MADE SURE WE ENJOYED OURSELVES AND MADE SURE EVERYTHING CONSISTING OF OUR MEALS WERE ON POINT... WE'RE DEF COMING BACK AND WE DEF COMING TO SEE DREW. OUR NEW FAV AT CHEDDAR'S INDEED 💯😍

name: Scottie Hundley
text: Very good! Lots of variety burgers, steaks,  chicken and seafood

name: Lady Angelia
text: Today's lunch was phenomenal!!! Bourbon Salmon with Rice and Broccoli Casserole ×2! And our server was 5-Star! #SatisfiedCustomer

name: Tonia Ann Branch
text: I took James for the honey croissants. I had Lemon Chicken and he doesn’t remember what he had! Smh

name: Danius Gladden
text: Food was awesome, much better than the Gastonia location. Our server Courtney was outstanding!

name: Lawanda Goodman
text: The wait was not bad. I ordered the fried chicken with gravy, broccoli casserole and fries. My chicken was NOT done. The broccoli casserole looked old.  The plate did NOT have a nice presentation.  The waiter tried to take just the chicken back.  I asked him to take the entire plate. An I ordered something different.  I ordered chicken strips. The service was just ok good. My food was half cooked.  It was not a good experience.

name: Robi Guerrant
text: First we waited 53 minutes after being quoted 30 minutes for a wait.  Once we got our table, we ordered our kids food and appetizer through the kiosk.  We got our appetizer fairly quickly, but we're still waiting on the rest of our food.  48 minutes later, our food came out, along with our kids food, but it was.wrong.  Then someone from the kitchen immediately swapped out the kids plates.   Then I proceed to look at my sandwich which had a still moving mosquito on the tomatoe.  I called over the manager and she said she informed the kitchen manager of the situation.   As we were walking out I watch as a kitchen employee dropped a box of numerous togo bags as he was walking out to a bus.  He proceeded to pick them up and keep on going.  This was a very poorly run, untrained staff, with no management presence.   I don't know what you can do to make this right,  but I lost my appetite from this visit.

name: Tabetha Goforth
text: It was my son's grandmother's birthday dinner and it was phenomenal. We had a wonderful time Chit Chat and in this being together even during these times. Courtney was wonderful she was a little busy so I made her a little slow but overall she was great I love her attitude and would love to have her as our waitress again when we do return good food good people good time

name: Dustin Heiland
text: Service was great at the bar. Kitchen was a little slow but not bad. Really enjoyed my Blackened Salmon Salad, and that baked potato. Yum.

name: Laura Fritzky
text: I was greeted and escorted to my table and the waitress  Alicia was very polite.  She checked on our table often, and made sure that we were well taken care of.

name: Gerald Johnson
text: I had a great experience at the location in Dallas, Texas but haven't at the Charlotte, NC location just yet. I was there on a service call to do repair work. Looks nice. Always seems to be a crowd there.

name: Gabriel Lopez
text: Food was very good. Service was not up to par, waited at our table for about 10 minute before the waitress came over to take a drink order.....

name: Maria Ross
text: Great food,  clean restroom, good prices.  kind and helpful assistants .

name: Greg Pridgen
text: I LOVE Cheddar's Scratch Kitchen. My favorite dish is the Bourbon Glazed salmon. But hands DOWN, those honey butter croissants are THE BEST thing ever made. Nothing in this world like them. I always say THOSE are blessed and anointed lol.

name: Scottie Hundley
text: Very good! Lots of variety burgers, steaks,  chicken and seafood

name: K B
text: My wife & I decided to drive down to Charlotte for a family outing, we decided to stop at Cheddars for lunch and let's just say a decision WELL MADE, this place has such home welcoming feeling and the food is a true definition of comfort food. The prices are very reasonable too. Let's just say, will I come back to Charlotte just to eat here again ?, absolutely even though there's one 30 minutes away.

name: William Bortins
text:
It took them 20 minutes to seat us because the hostess couldn’t walk out side to seat the two families in front of my group. Instead she went to go find a working iPad that could send a text message instead of walking outside. Then we waited 5 minutes at the table before not being served. IT TOOK 25 minutes to not be served.

Go eat next door at Godavari. It was fast, efficient, and delicious.

name: Daryl Williams
text: One of my favorite places for family dining. Good food at good a price

name: Franisha Munn-Simpson
text: The spinach dip was phenomenal... The chicken of the chicken alfredo was delicious... The sauce and noodles were not... Also, my cheesecake was freezer burnt and frozen solid... Good atmosphere... Long wait to be seated... Friendly staff...

name: Danius Gladden
text: Food was awesome, much better than the Gastonia location. Our server Courtney was outstanding!

name: Gary W
text: Food was decent but took such a long time after placing the order to actually get. We ordered for pickup was initially told 35-40 minutes. We arrived a few mins early and waited another 45 mins.

name: Ted Adams
text: Food wass good could have been a little more hot . It was not cool . I was a little disappointed and the chicken it was country style chicken I thought I was going to get a whole piece of chicken you know leg and fire breath and Wing maybe or something like that no two chicken breasts and they wasn't full breasts they'll fillets

name: A C
text: Curbside pick-up was quick and efficient.  Our food was delicious and warm.

name: Tanisha Gauff
text: Food was great. Seasoned to perfection. And our waitress was the best.

name: Prissy Krissy
text: It's a real gamble now...its either hit or completely, utterly, majorly miss.....if you feeling lucky..try it😒

name: Carol Lowery
text: The food was lousey, lukewarm and over cooked.  The Chedders in Pigeon Forge was great. But the one in Charlotte, NC was short staffed and the meal was not like Pigeon Forge .

name: Andrea
text: I enjoyed the food here.  The service was okay,  I was brought out somebody else's food twice.  We didn't wait to ling to be seated.  Our waiter was nice. Price point was good.

name: Aaliyah & CoCo
text: Cheddar’s is a wonderful restaurant overall, but this location was just average. The food was average, the service was average. Not like the other locations I have visited. The one thing that’s most important to me when writing a review is being fair all around. Not a bad place I just didn’t particularly care for this location.

name: Carol Lowery
text: The food was lousey, lukewarm and over cooked.  The Chedders in Pigeon Forge was great. But the one in Charlotte, NC was short staffed and the meal was not like Pigeon Forge .

name: A C
text: Curbside pick-up was quick and efficient.  Our food was delicious and warm.

name: Tanisha Gauff
text: Food was great. Seasoned to perfection. And our waitress was the best.

name: Macie Myers
text: This is my 2nd time eating at this location and both times have been great. Very friendly wait staff and the food is fantastic. I had lemon chicken and penne pasta salad. Huge bowl! With a croissant with butter and honey.

name: Aaliyah & CoCo
text: Cheddar’s is a wonderful restaurant overall, but this location was just average. The food was average, the service was average. Not like the other locations I have visited. The one thing that’s most important to me when writing a review is being fair all around. Not a bad place I just didn’t particularly care for this location.

name: Dani T
text: Everything was really good. There was a little bit of a wait to whereas we were put on a list and there was an hr wait but that was to be expected. Customer service was great as well, will definitely recommend and will be back as this have been my favorite restaurant. My mother and little brother enjoyed as well as they were in town and that was there first time at Cheddars 😊

name: K B
text: My wife & I decided to drive down to Charlotte for a family outing, we decided to stop at Cheddars for lunch and let's just say a decision WELL MADE, this place has such home welcoming feeling and the food is a true definition of comfort food. The prices are very reasonable too. Let's just say, will I come back to Charlotte just to eat here again ?, absolutely even though there's one 30 minutes away.

name: Mia's Ministry
text: Food was great. Cameron my waiter was wonderdul and thats alot of.food for the price i paid. Enjoyed my time there

resp.text:
That's wonderful to hear, Mia, and has certainly made our day! We will be sure to let Cameron and the team know how much you enjoyed your recent visit. Hope to see you in again soon (whether dining in or using our convenient Curbside Pick Up for a To Go order)!

-Gabi

name: Omar Sharif
text: Meh ... you can do better. Not the best Cheddars location. I gave 3 stars bcz they didn't do anything wrong.

name: Jonathan McManus
text: first time and i lt was hot fresh and very good prices.

name: Dani T
text: Everything was really good. There was a little bit of a wait to whereas we were put on a list and there was an hr wait but that was to be expected. Customer service was great as well, will definitely recommend and will be back as this have been my favorite restaurant. My mother and little brother enjoyed as well as they were in town and that was there first time at Cheddars 😊

name: John Daly
text:
“Fall off the bone baby back ribs” had to be eaten with a knife and fork... they weren’t tender at all. Not much flavor, either, sadly. Bread and sides were good, but for an almost $20 entree you expect a bit more; Applebee’s has better ribs.

We had a gift card someone had given us, so we weren’t paying (we also got the food to go), but had I been eating in I would’ve sent them back and gotten something else. Idk there’s a lot of competition right in this location, and I don’t ever see myself driving past Applebee’s or Chili’s to get to Cheddar’s.

name: Gary Hinson
text: Food was awesome! Service was great!  I have missed this place!  Definitely go back!

name: Aaliyah Simpson
text: I was invited back with a gift card from the GM. This time the food was really delicious! The wait time for our food was really long but overall a better experience than before. We were able to sit near the bar in a corner that was subcluded from a lot of traffic which was perfect.

name: Wiletta Jones
text: One of my favorite  places to eat.  Food is good and prices are reasonable.

name: artofvoice
text: It took a while to get our food but they did the best they could while being understaffed. They gave us two free honey butter croissants which we instantly inhaled. Delicious! My salmon was cooked perfectly and was so moist. My boyfriend's stake was a perfect medium rare, which seems to be hard for some restaurants to do. The frozen strawberry margarita was really good too. The cocktails are very reasonably priced. I appreciate everything they are doing to make sure everyone is social distancing while dining. If you go out, be patient and make it rain on your server.

name: Letitia Porter
text: Great cozy spot. You get a nice size portion for your money. The customer service was great!

name: James Jones
text:
First time at a cheddars and it was very good.
Had the ribeye and it was tender and perfectly cooked.
The highly touted croissants were decent but the best thing was the actual butter that’s on them. The bread itself was sooo flaky. Our waiter was amazing as well. Very good establishment.

name: Kandice V
text:
My family and I love cheddars but I personally don't recommend this location.

We were quoted a 30 minute wait ended up waiting a hour because the hostess wrote out number wrong and the only reason we got seated is because I went in and asked how much longer. Server was new and she did a pretty good job but for the price and the food I could of went somewhere else and had a better time and meal.

name: JAMES WILLIAMS
text: Food was good, server was good, wait was never again.

name: Trena Green
text: Man the good was great. Service was friendly and I'm going back.

name: Brandon Stoff
text:
Just ate here tonight 9.27.2020, and this was my first ever visit to a Cheddars, and I was very excited about trying it.

There was a 45 min wait - which was fine, Saturday evening, no big deal.

We got to our table at 7pm.

I got my check at 8:45.

No drinks
We just went there to eat...

I got a free chips and queso for signing up with their rewards program and it took that 15 minutes to come to our table after we ordered.

Then, the food took another 15 minutes.

Our waitress was good. I think they were very low on staffing and cooks maybe.

And why on earth don’t you have any outdoor seating available during a pandemic????

Ridiculous.

Do your self a favor and eat somewhere else.

Total disaster.

name: Jasmine Epps
text: Staff was welcoming. Best dish (in my opinion) is the salmon. Totally recommend it. The croissants are delicious, my son loves them the most.

name: SHALAWAM EPHRAIM
text: I would recommend the HONEY BUTTER CROISSANTS😋 They are warm and soft when they bring them to you. Very delicious!

name: Alex Gradishki
text: Perfectly cooked ribs, the half slab was more than enough and come with two sides of course

name: Alia Ward
text: Staff were rude. Said it would be 23-35 minute wait. We stood around waiting then they told us after 15 minutes we had to go to our cars and they would call us. Almost no tables were open to sit out they almost all had "social distancing signs". I understand social distancing, do not understand being rude to folks or not letting people sit to eat. After 10 minutes of waiting a gentleman came in the hostess told him it would be 25+ minutes then another hostess immediately led him to a table while we waited the whole time. Preference treatment, rude attitudes, bad for Cheddar's name.

name: Macie Myers
text: This is my 2nd time eating at this location and both times have been great. Very friendly wait staff and the food is fantastic. I had lemon chicken and penne pasta salad. Huge bowl! With a croissant with butter and honey.

name: Eli F
text: So I've been going to cheddar for years and I'd usually had good experiences, but my most recent one was unsatisfactory. The waitress never brought out water. We had to ask a manager who did quickly rectify the situation. Then the waitress had a bit of an attitude. As a restaurant worker, I can understand the feeling, but its imperative to never let your emotions suffuse your work. While the food was good, especially the croissants, it's mostly about the experience for me. Itll be a while before I go back if o decide to do so.

name: Erica Alexander
text: New menu items and the new orleans pasta was really good. Service was good.

name: Faith Joy
text: I will say that the drinks have always been good here, but the food is always mediocre. In about 90% of my visits I've had to wait an astronomical amount of time to be seated. Also, they stopped serving mac and cheese. I only still came here because my son loves the fish, but I'm not coming back anymore.

name: Valarie Jennings
text: First time eating at Cheddars. Delicious sums it up.  Service was great.

name: Michael Douthat
text: I’m rather disappointed in this Charlotte Cheddars. Extremely long wait time to be seated! Sometimes take more than an hour! They are short staffed. Food wasn’t very good. Some of the appetizer chips were stale tasting. Spinach dip didn’t taste like I remember from other Cheddars. My bacon burger was not cooked medium well as I requested. It was cooked well done. They gave me the burger free. Fries were overcooked. I liked the waitress, Zeeondrea! She seemed to care but there wasn’t much she could do. Not her fault the food wasn’t very good. This Cheddars needs improvement!

resp.text:
Hi Michael, we are concerned to hear your meal was a let down, especially after waiting so long to be seated.  I'd love to connect further with you when you have a moment.  Please email me at guestrelations@cheddars.com so we resolve your concerns.

All my best,
Bridget

name: David Evans
text: First time ever going. Food was decent. Better than I expected. I ordered the cajun pasta and was pleasantly suprised. It was a good portion of everything.

name: Monique Hernandez
text: The drinks were amazing but the food unfortunately was just okay. I was really hoping to have a Monty Cristo sandwich but ran out (we were there for lunch around 12pm)

name: Julie Dickey
text: The service was AWESOME food arrived hot and fresh. And their safety measures were great 👍

name: Linda Gail
text: 1st time visit pretty impressive.

name: Angelia Flemming
text: Excellent customer service.  Food was delicious.

name: Chuck Price
text: I like this Cheddars a lot. The service was very good. Food was hot and delicious. Great value for the money here. Great location as well.

name: Dave Higgins
text: The service was great and our waitress was quick the entire time, but the food had zero taste. I got the veggie plate with soup. The potato’s were great, but the rest had zero taste and like it came directly from a can.  My wife had the white fish and rice and she got sick from it before we left. Doubt we’ll be back.

name: Lea Robinson
text: Service was good, drinks were very good, food.... Err it was ok.

name: Iris
text: Service. Usually this makes a huge difference for me. They are understaffed but made the effort to ensure we did not have a wait time. Our server paid attention and took good care of us. The food was pretty good. The green beans were surprisingly great. I had the salmon which also pretty good. My daughter had the chicken fingers which were not so good. The croissants remain a winner.

name: Steve Pope
text: Food was great, service was awesome.

name: Michael Pearce
text: The food here is really good and came out fairly quick. The waitress we had was also super amazing. If you ever go there Wednesday-Sunday afternoon/evening, ask for the old white lady (that's what she referred herself as) you won't be disappointed.

name: Vee Marie
text:
Food was decent...could of been better.
Will try again another day.

name: Betsy Hollis-Leggett
text:
Server was great.  Food overall was good except for my friends steak was to be MW
And came  out more MR.  She sent it back and then came out burnt. That we were all disappointed in.

name: Millicent Roseboro
text: I always enjoy my food. You always get more than you can eat. Delicious 😋

name: Joanne Potter
text: Great service and great food!

name: Shirley Garner
text: I like cheddars always have but the curbside is a little slow but the food is still on point

name: Lorrie Young
text: It was just a bad night may have been a diff cook on that shift..Plus we waited hour to get in it was very busy..The manger and waitress was nice and they took care of our problem this was my 1st time I saw this in Waldorf's MD just didnt go in..Don't worry I will try again

name: Gibran Naughton
text: I had to wait atleast 10 mins or more before my server came to the talk. I place my order of steak and ribs. I was told by my server that they were waiting on my steak to finish being cooked. It was two mins left. I was part of a part of 5. Everyone else in my part was given their food and I was not. I was told by the server that he wasn't sure what happened but the kitchen was now making my entree, I was left waiting and had to watch the rest of my part enjoy their dinner. I wouldn't recommend coming to this particular cheddar. Service is terrible.

name: tdstroman68
text: I've been to Cheddar's in GA but this was my 1st time visiting in Charlotte. The service was mediocre and the food was terrible. I ordered the lunch portion meatloaf with mashed potatoes and my daughter had the ribs with steak. The mashed potatoes were EXTREMELY salty and the ribs were hard on the outside. I sent my food back and they gave me rice instead. Unfortunately my replacement meatloaf was burned on the bottom and salty. Once again I sent that back. I WILL not be visiting here again because after all that my bill was still $36.....WTH I'm paying $36 for 2 non alcoholic drinks, kids meal, side of corn and a salad.... RIDICULOUS!

resp.text:
This is disappointing to hear, and certainly not the type of experience we'd want for you. When you have a moment, please feel free to email me at GuestRelations@Cheddars.com with your name/Google Handle, phone number, and receipt (if you still have it).

I look forward to hearing from you!

-Gabi

name: Lynn Jones
text: Love love love it!hot fresh and delish.

name: tamika lair
text: Great food at reasonable prices w/large proportions!! 🖤🖤 Great place for large families! Oh and the complimentary croissants are to die for!!

name: mirris_mgs11
text: Excellent service and as always excellent food!!! Thank you!!

name: Mrs. Karen
text: Curbside pickup should be more than one person. the staff was friendly both on the phone and bringing out the order.

name: Jamila Reynolds
text: The food, atmosphere, and our waitress was great!!!

name: wisdom mayer
text: Great place to bring a group of friends and families. Good food great menu

name: Almighty KI York
text: Great bartender, nice atmosphere, good food

name: Redd Bears
text: OMG, Phenomenal food and service. I ordered a 12 oz top sirloin dinner and was expecting average like I get from other restaurants. However when I got home with my food it was one of the best steaks that I have ever had the homemade sides I got the mashed potatoes and french fries with the gravy and it was absolutely Beyond phenomenal. Their prices are great and even if they charge more I would still gladly eat there and I am going to be highly recommending them to people I know. I am a new customer and I'm now going to be a regular. Thank you guys for doing such a great job especially during the quarantine. You are appreciated as well as your food and your service

name: Charline Gantt
text: Terrible service waited 1hr no service wasn't informed then worst-case was they didn't care l will be reporting this.

name: A. Emy Diop
text:
2 stars. Quality has decreased drastically and the staff poll together with management makes this place undesirable! Pack your patience

----
4 stars. Great value! Food is delicious here and never had a complaint. You may run into inadequate, unprofessional staff from time to time but haven't been here over 3 dozen times, this happens less frequently..

name: Cody Millard
text: I am so disappointed that the Cheddars quality I knew when I worked there is now gone. This is the worst experience I have ever had at a Cheddars and I've dined at Cheddars in 6 different states because it used to be my favorite. This experience was a TOTAL mess from the get go. We walked in the front door and there were two other guests ahead of us at the host station. No employees present at all. After probably 5 min or so the host finally shows up. The guests in front of us told her they had been looking for her. The response they got was repulsive, the girl just giggled at them like it was a joke. After we got seated we had waited ten minutes and we had not even seen a server in our section. So I called the restaurant by phone and told whoever answered that we had not been greeted or had a drink order taken. It must have been the same hostess that seated the first guests mentioned before because she laughed me when I told her that! Then someone brings us croissants which were very delicious. BUT, bread without a drink is no fun and we still had not been greeted by our server or had drink orders taken. It took 15 minutes before we even found out who our server was. She had to apologize for the kitchen multiple times. The hot honey sauce was not correct and she had to ask my partner how he liked his broccoli because it had been cooked wrong all day. Then, when my food came (chicken tend platter w/fries and ched broc cass) my casserole wasn't there! I do not believe for a second any of this was our servers fault. I feel like there is poor and weak leadership of this location. Oh, and the hostess double sat our server with a big top right after we got sat. The restaurant was empty not busy. Just everything that could be wrong at this particular Cheddars was wrong. This should embarrass whoever owns and operates this location.

name: Kenyon Strother
text: Food was great, service was fair. Thankfully the culinary manager was awesome!

name: Alex Voronov
text:
Nice place, looks like every other Cheddar's, I love interior. It becomes really busy on weekends, not so during the week. Food is very good, prepared from scratch they say, it tastes so I must say, really nice. Best chicken tenders ever.
It felt a bit slow in servicing even with not a lot of people, don't know why, though server was good enough, checked on us a lot.

name: Ox
text: The Southern Fried Chicken is EVERYTHING!

name: Debra stevenson
text: Food cold and over cooked. First time and last time

name: Mark Andrews
text: Love coming here when I'm in the area Love the peach tea the steaks are delicious and all the great sides they have to go with it I will definitely be back

name: Giovanni Kyler
text:
I had the monte cristo and it was delicious. Also you get free crossaints so thats a plus.
Fantastic all around.

name: tammy norman
text: It was okay but  the chicken tenders had too much batter Bread on it.☹

name: Thomoya Casimir
text: Dre our server was awesome. Only problem we had was there was a piece of plastic still  on my rib. Other than that service and food was awesome.

name: Hayes
text: Usually enjoy it here but recently had a bad bout of food poisoning from the shrimp, had me reeling all night. Hopefully that was a one-off thing, not ordering that again.

name: Erica Cunningham
text: My food was good but my mom ribs where old.and rough, she was very disappointed 😧😧

name: Adrian Long
text: One of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte

name: Sharon Cooke-Smith
text: Their rating was in the 80%  wiuld not eat there they need improve alot.

name: S White
text: Always good food.

name: Ox
text: The Southern Fried Chicken is EVERYTHING!

name: Mark Andrews
text: Love coming here when I'm in the area Love the peach tea the steaks are delicious and all the great sides they have to go with it I will definitely be back

text: Food cold and over cooked. First time and last time

text: Always good food.

I had the monte cristo and it was delicious. Also you get free crossaints so thats a plus.
Fantastic all around.

name: Sharon Cooke-Smith
text: Their rating was in the 80%  wiuld not eat there they need improve alot.

name: Adrian Long
text: One of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte

name: Adrian Long
text: One of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte

name: Erica Cunningham
text: My food was good but my mom ribs where old.and rough, she was very disappointed 😧😧

name: Kemp
text: I don't think I have had food this fresh from a  restaurant ever!

name: Jean Gonzalez
text: Love coconut shrimp

name: Coltin Marsh
text: Great staff and great food.

name: Frank Kapelar
text: Average, small portion of Salmon on the Blackened Salmon salad. Service was very good , thank you Stephanie. If the protein serving was 2 oz larger then I would rate 4 stars.  I spent $21 including $4 tip. The food was very tasty.

resp.text:
Hi Frank! We're happy to hear Stephanie took great care of you recently. I'll be sure to share your feedback with our culinary team, and we hope to be able to welcome you back in again soon!

-Gabi

name: Shonda W
text: Food was really good, service was fantastic. The alcoholic drinks were on the weak side. They had lots of interesting choices, but one person in my party felt like they were drinking Kool-Aid. I would definitely go back as the food quality & portion size was worth the money. This is a very busy place, but fortunately we only had to wait about 15 min to be seated.

name: Barb Cooley
text:
Cheddar's is one of my favorite restaurants. The servers are friendly, the atmosphere ideal, to relax
and enjoy "delicious" food.
The portions are wonderful. The service is (absolutely) outstanding. I go "every" chance I get, I bring friends to share this experience.

resp.text:
Thank you for being a fan of ours, Barb! I'll be sure to let the team know how much you enjoy visiting, and hope to see you again very soon!

-Gabi

name: Kevin Bahrami
text: We had the most amazing maple bourbon glazed chicken sandwich and mac n cheese! Can't wait to come back!

name: Kenya Thompson
text: Delicious food for a cheap price!

name: Jackson Poulnott
text: I really enjoy Cheddar's. Their service is above average. They are a good place to go for getting your moneys worth. Their portions are good sized. I always have food to take home and leave very satisfied. Their appitizers are big enough for a meal.

resp.text:
Thank you for being a fan of ours, Jackson! We're looking forward to seeing you again soon!

-Gabi

name: Jonathan Berrier
text: Eating a late lunch, we had to wait 3-4 minutes,  if that to get a table.  Our waitress was great,  us being first time customers.  We both enjoyed buffalo chicken tenders, amazingly good green beans and mac & cheese. Complimentary buttery, flaky croissants completed this wonderful meal. Well done Cheddars Scratch Kitchen!

resp.text:
All wonderful things to hear, Jonathan! Hope to see you and your party in again very soon!

-Gabi

name: Latisha Young
text: Food was great. Wonderful atmosphere. Friendly and courteous staff

name: LaToya Holloway
text: Food was good. Restaurant was clean and I forgot our server's name but he was great!

name: Luna Vistara
text: Always come here with the boyfriend for lunch. We usually get the lunch portions because the regular portions are enough for 2 people. I ordered the pot roast special and it was so big it lasted us for 2 days. If you're hungry and like big hungry man portions come here. You'll always take your food home with you. Also the chicken parmesan was amazing! It still tasted great the next day when i had it for lunch.

resp.text:
Getting a lot, for not a lot - that's the motto we live by! We appreciate you and your boyfriend being fans of ours, Luna, and we hope to continue welcoming you both in! Don't forget to check out our new and convenient Curbside Pick Up for any future To Go orders!

Hope to see you in soon!

-Gabi

name: Natalia
text: Usually a really good place to eat (fairly quickly) and prepared meals, though it doesn't always taste as if it's made from scratch. We enjoy the salmon salad and definitely the croissants! Was disappointed at the Mac and cheese as it was extremely bitter and my child couldn't eat it. All in all, I will probably keep coming but keep in mind 'trying new meals' may not be the best idea here. Stick with what you enjoyed the first time.

resp.text:
Hi Natalie - I'm disappointed to hear you and your family couldn't enjoy your recent visit. Please feel free to email me at GuestRelations@Cheddars.com with your name/Google Handle, phone number, receipt, and any other details from this recent visit.

I look forward to hearing from you!

-Gabi

name: Brittany Harris
text: Unlike my previous visits I was truly disappointed with cheddars. I understand there is a pandemic going on causing short staff, but the sercice was not of quality. we waited over an hour for our food. The waiter never came to check on us. The manager was nonchalant with no apology after we asked about our food.

name: Life With Iggy A
text: Great service by the manager manny Minaya, i strongly recommend his service,

name: Edric Salone
text: To start off the food was good. It was prepared to order and everything came as intended but my service could have been better. I am a stickler for timing, accuracy, and presence when it comes to eating out and this location needs to raise the bar. Although I was greeted promptly I was escorted to a section where the server was not present or possibly on break. After 5 minutes of staring at a menu with no help, the hostess finally returned and asked if she could get me a drink while I waited. I attempted to order a beer but was quickly told that only the server could do that. So after getting a water I sat and waited another 5-10 minutes before the server appeared. I gave her my order where upon I ordered a beer. I know she heard it because she asked what kind it was twice. After receiving my meal, I received no beer and it was never mentioned again. Upon leaving I was halted so the glass doors could be wiped down before I exited. Great potential....but I was not impressed.

name: Jai S
text: Yummy, affordable,  fast w quality food. Nice casual atmosphere.

name: teresa Taylor
text: Food was awesome..especially the cressent rolls.service was good also. A little high but worth it

name: Seth Goodman
text: I was seated a given two menus that were weirdly moist and fused together with creepy restaurant rag juice. I peeled them apart and decided what I wanted. I waited. It dawned on me that no one was going to acknowledge me, so I left with my head down, hands in my pocket and kicking a rock. The hostess was sweet though. Cheddar do bedder

resp.text:
This is definitely disappointing to hear and not the type of visit we'd want for you, Seth. When you have a moment, please feel free to email us at GuestRelations@Cheddars.com with your name/Google Handle and phone number.

We look forward to hearing from you!

-Gabi

name: Roberto Gallardo
text: Great food great service and prices..the best place to gather

name: Diane Mills
text: Delicious food, great prices

name: RAFA
text: Drinks where and food was ok. I hand the Montecristo sandwich but it was a bit to toasted for my taste

name: Christopher T
text: The food is really good, but the service was some of the worst I’ve ever experienced.

name: Christina Burns
text: Had the steak broccoli cheese casserole and salad. Very good beautiful atmosphere.

name: Kenny Chester
text: Cheddar's Charlotte could be Best Hidden Secret. I had Salmon on a bed of rice with brocolli and mashed potatoes as an additional side. The Food is incredibly tasteful and done to a high caliber of standards. You may not find a better restaurant in Charlotte University area. The things that makes it even better? The service! THANK YOU TAMMY!

name: Roy W Schoolfield
text: Great food. Fast service  and friendly people

name: Rachel Robinson
text: We had 2 wait for like between 20 to 30 min but we just changed our mind maybe next time don't have 2 wait long

name: Victoria C
text: My first time visiting. Although they don't have a happy hour, the drinks are well priced for the size. That totally made up for it. I got there around 4:30pm on Labor day. Not crowded and the bar was empty. I sat at the bar. I had already looked at the menu online so I had an idea of what I wanted. I still looked over it, just in case. I chose the 6oz top sirloin with the sauteed mushrooms, Idaho mashed potatoes, and broccoli cheese casserole. I noticed that the meal didn't come with any type of bread product so I also ordered the croissants. I was starving (hadn't eaten since the previous afternoon) but everything was Delicious! I truly appreciated my steak being made well done the first time. A lot of places, nowadays, don't get it right. The sides looked small in portion but found out the bowls are deep! The croissants were super flaky and moderately sweet with the whipped honey butter. I ordered the Maui margarita and boy!; big and tasty! "Cactus juice" was sweeter than I expected. The overall atmosphere wasn't any different from most restaurants. The bartender was excellent as they had her making drinks, doing to go orders, and taking meal orders at the bar. She never neglected me as a customer. Although I have to drive out of state to get Cheddar's, it was worth it. Maybe they'll come to Columbia, SC.

name: Hector Ramirez Jr
text: Waitress was rude, chicken tenders under cooked, chips from the spinach dip stale af, and to top it all off they don't honor military or law enforcement. If I could give this restaurant negative stars I certainly would have. I've eaten better food from cheaper restaurants. Our dining experience was disappointing. We'll never patronize this establishment again!!!

name: Jordana Chadwick
text: Food was awesome! Waiter not s I much!

name: Tiffany Miller
text: Really enjoyed. Long wait.

name: Angela Hunter
text: Food was awesome

name: korrine donaldson
text: The staff and service was great! Our main course was delicious along with the cheese fries!!! My bf sides of mac and cheese and broccoli cheese cass was very bland. Definitely going back

name: angel pena morales
text:
Our wait staff was the BOMB.  We are a work group of ladies from DSS. We came in today at noon and were given the royal treatment. My check was 83.00 and some change .....just so you can ID the female wait staff and give her a hand.

Great

Mary Pena

name: Mrs. Oluyede
text: Always a good time and a little wait.

resp.text:
That's what we love to hear, Mrs. King! Don't forget to check out our new and convenient Curbside Pick Up for any future To Go orders!

Hope to see you soon!

-Gabi

text: Waitress was rude, chicken tenders under cooked, chips from the spinach dip stale af, and to top it all off they don't honor military or law enforcement. We'll never patronize this establishment again!!!

name: Yvette Conatser
text: The food was delicious. Try the dijon chicken.

name: Angela Hunter
text: Food was awesome

name: MusicMan Reviewer
text:
Food was amazing.

Came with my family on a Saturday night around 6 thinking it would be busy, it was busy, but no wait. Service was good. I had the Keywest Shrimp and Chicken.  Loved it!!  Everyone enjoyed their food.

name: Mary Ann Lear
text: Menu has changed. Food ok, not as good as it used to be.

name: Jason Leake
text: We were not greeted by our waitress for over 10 minutes and had to go back to the hostess to request someone to wait on us! The food is great and if it were not for the consistently poor service we would eat here much more frequently. The service is always slow but it's never because the restaurant is overly busy.

resp.text:
That's upsetting to hear, Jason - you should be able to count on us when it comes to speedy service. When you have a moment, please feel free to email me at GuestRelations@Cheddars.com with your name/Google Handle, phone number, and receipt (if you still have it).

I look forward to hearing from you!

-Gabi

name: Josh Giampaolo
text: Very friendly staff and the service was quick!

name: Shawn H
text: Great service food was awesome

resp.text:
That's what we love to hear, Shawn! Hope to see you in again soon!

-Gabi

name: E. S.
text: Monte Cisco and broccoli casserole are awesome

name: B W
text: Pick up order was for 750. Called the number posted on the wall she said your food just came out. That was 756. By 810 I'm inside. I asked to get my food. Hostess  came back and said FIVE more minutes. I said she said it was done 15 minutes ago. I got my food like 815. Its not hot. Its warm. Like what were yall doing with the food oh my bad picking up 4 for 4s out the  parking lot. Im good on cheddars again.

name: Traies Butler
text: The worst fast food experience ever..how do you bring hot appetizers and cold entree's..I asked for two to go boxes and tipped the waiter and quickly exited

name: Michael Strahl
text: Only place in Charlotte that makes a homemade Monte Cristo , excellent. Great service also. We will be back, saw other items on the menu that looked equally as good. Highly recommend.

resp.text:
Delicious choice, Michael! Hope to see you in again very soon!

-Gabi

name: B. Simpson
text: Very elegant in its appearance. The evening was a bit slow when we arrived, around 6, but traffic began to pick up significantly about 45 minutes later. The staff seemed very friendly and informed on the menu. I like that the bar area appears very "mingle" friendly, but the other area keeps its quaint vibe for couples.... FYI, the giant fish tank looks amazing!

name: Jewel Jenkins
text: Good food and service, not crowded today, Sunday 5:30 PM

name: Kevin Lane
text: Outdoor eating available....

name: Amy Newsome
text: The service was very slow it took 15 minutes to even get our drinks.  The food did not have any flavor.

name: Shady Shane
text:
Was told by a co-worker about Chedders.  So we ended up in the area and decided to check them out.
The place was clean and we were greeted by a very friendly and smiling staff.  We were seated and we started looking at the menu.  I am a fish person so I decided to give it a go.  It can with broccoli and rice. I was able to exchange the cook carrots for a bowl of macaroni and cheese.  The food arrived within 10 minutes which really surprised me and it was. Bit into the fish and found it to be very tasty with a good amount of seasoning. I was pleasantly surprised.
The waitress checked on us enough without being overbearing. And always with a small on her face. The thing that makes me give it five stars is I ended up leaving my credit card. And had driven more than an hour and a half away before I realized my mistake. I was able to call the the establishment and spoke to a manager and was pleased to find that the waitress had turned the card over to her immediately. Everything was taken care of and I could not be any happier. The honesty and the great service definitely puts this place at five stars in my book. The food was an added plus with the great taste.
Unfortunately we do not have a Cheddars in the Raleigh Durham area so I will not be able to experience this restaurant on a regular basis. But if you're in the Concord area or any place that has this establishment give it a try. It's basic food with a very good taste.

resp.text:
How awesome to hear, Shane! We take pride in providing delicious meals and top notch service, and it sounds like the Charlotte team took great care of you recently. I'll be sure to let them know how much you enjoyed your visit, and we hope to be able to welcome you back in again soon!

-Gabi
