name: Betsy
text: We really enjoyed sampling the wines at the Auto Pour!!  Very ample outdoor seating, wonderful hosts! 10/10, will return, would recommend.

resp.text: Thanks for coming in!  We have 64 wines here and are grateful you liked pouring small amounts to see which wines are your favorites!  Come back soon!

name: Lee B.
text: I love Jenny and Jon Lucas!! They are amazing!! They are such beautiful people and their winery is just as good!! They've got a regular customer here!!

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Lee!  We love meeting all our customers!

name: Michael Pearse
text: Amazing place! Definitely give it a try....great wine selection, and a bunch of local beers. Will be frequenting!!

resp.text: We have a chalk wall in the back for customers to add recommendations of wine and beers they'd like us to have in stock.  We take that seriously and have enjoyed getting in many local beers, ciders and seltzers--all because that's what our customers have asked for!  Thanks Michael!

name: Jenny Goodale
text: 100% Recommend this place!! It recently opened in our neighborhood. We were so excited to be able to walk there! The selection of wines that they have is impressive! But not as impressive as the service of the staff. They are friendly and knowledgable. We go back every chance we get!

resp.text: Thank you so much Jenny! We appreciate your amazing review and your business. Come on back and visit any time!

name: JJ Souther
text: Very easy to use. Safe and sanitized seating. Friendly, helpful staff. Good and varied wine selections.  Definitely a great place to try wines! You can even buy a bottle if you want.

resp.text: Thanks JJ! Come back and visit us any time 😊

name: William Hodges
text: Very knowledgeable staff who were very helpful and friendly with a wine novice in me. The wine is reasonably priced but isn’t cheap wine. A very welcome addition to the neighborhood. Look forward to returning!

resp.text: Thanks William! We’re glad you came to visit and really appreciate your business. Come on back any time 😊

name: Ricardo Castro
text: Beautiful decor and very friendly staff. Tuesday trivia night is a blast. Selections on draft and wine tasting are varied. Will definitely return. Try the porter.

resp.text: Thanks Ricardo! We loved having you and really appreciate your feedback! See you soon 😊
Yay! Thanks Bree!
Thanks Chris!

name: Stephen Lawler
text:
Crisp can best be described culinary chaos.

Went in for a salad (the daily special).   Which one would think would be a slam dunk.

The kitchen was disorganized.  Orders were not processed in the order taken.  Staff tended to make excuses rather than offer solutions.

I could have grown the salad faster than it was prepared.

Good concept - poor execution.

name: Nicholas Becker
text:
The salads are really good, really fresh- always has been.  I've gone here for a few years now.  Lately, the staff has an attitude problem.  Came in last night for a salad- there were five other people in the restaurant- it was 8:40.

The woman behind the counter did not acknowledge us standing there for at least five minutes, probably longer while she did her side work.  Then told us she was out of things that we knew she had, because they were on the other line right next to her.  Then she yells to her co worker to "come get these salads!" because she can't do both things.  I have worked in restaurants for years, and she does not need to be in the front of an open concept kitchen- move her to the back of the house.  Then when she sends our salads to the back for the protein, she whispers something in the grill cooks ear- probably told him to spit in our food.

I am calling the management today- absolutely unbelievable.  I am paying ten dollars for a take-out salad, and I should not be made to feel like I have done something wrong for walking in the door.

There are no hours posted anywhere- on the door, on the website, nowhere.  If they close at 9:00, then I will not walk in 20 minutes before close, but 8:40 on a Thursday night is not unreasonable- especially in this neighborhood- and if the kitchen is closing, then say so.  I will happily go elsewhere, as I have worked in places where people walk in with 2 minutes left for the night and made us reopen the line, but pans hadn't been changed out, nor the station wiped down yet.  Absolutely unbelievable.

Update:  I tried calling the restaurant twice with no answer, and then tried their email address from their website, and the e-mail was returned because the mailbox is full.Unfortunate, because I feel that the manager/ owner needs to know.

name: Josh Richard
text: Great salads quick! Plenty of proteins to choose from, too, so you won't go hungry.

name: Traci Loudin
text: This review is for the new Latta Arcade Crisp, which doesn't show up on Google Maps. Expensive food at low quality. I don't know why I keep letting people convince me to try stuff from here. Their salads are soggy and so are their wraps. Today I tried their new BLT wrap and it had so much mayo that the wrap couldn't contain it. The bacon was so crispy and crumbled it felt like Bac'n Bits and I could barely taste it through all the liquid in the sandwich. I took a bite from each half and then gave up and threw it in the trash.

name: Derek McEley
text: I love all of their salad options and their daily specials are always fantastic

name: jaqwonna brooks
text: I got the grilled salmon salad last week and it was sooooo good. Then today I got the crisp cobb salad and substituted blue cheese for feta cheese...OMG AMAZING! I will surely be back to try more things on their menu. Service was fast and good ... Check out my pictures above in the photo gallery to see what the salads look like!

text: Pretty good place for a nice salad.

The food was delicious..I can’t tell you what I like better about my meal but it was all excellent...That piece of chicken right there had my name all over it. If I were you next chance you want to try a decent Caribbean place head to Anntony’s. Tell him I sent you!!

name: Shiphrahjudah Israel
text: I purchased Plantan (not good) I had rice and peas!! No flavor!! I had Calalu green!!! Tasted Less!! I had Beef Patty!!! Dry as Straw the beef looked like Paste!!! The Food was Awful!!! Never again!!!😡😡😡

name: Anthony Scott
text: I don't understand why all the negative reviews. Yes, it isn't traditional Jamaican food, even though they sell some traditional Jamaican meals, like jerk chicken and peas and rice. However, the food was very tasty. The peas and rice was very moist and had great seasoning. The owner was very pleasant.

text: Very small on 7th street but they do deliver. Food is fresh and great. Awesome customer service I will keep going back

name: Molly Murchison
text: I came here on a Friday night and had the jerk chicken with corn, candied yams, and Johnny bread made by Chef Webstar. Everything I had was amazing! Great food and friendly atmosphere, and real slow-cooked recipes.

name: Denise David
text: Great food and great service 👍

name: Tiffany Pegues
text: Curry chicken very good , lots of flavor

name: Sam M
text:
Small no frills establishment with about three tables, a drink cooler and counter with register. We got the largest table to seat 5 and was a bit cramped.

Mac and cheese was good
Boneless chicken was okay (it's the normal rotisserie they just pulled out the bone and took off skin, then Poured sauce on it.
Corn bread was good, a bit dry for me.
Curry chicken was great.
Rice and peas were good.
Rasta pasta was simple and light but good.
Yams were canned so we didn't order that.
Sweet tea was not traditional sweet tea.

Overall the food was good. We did hear and see items being put in the microwave, so that was a bit disappointing. Portion sizes were small/average (about an ice cream scoop size). Service was lacking a bit, the server seemed annoyed by my questions about the food and would ask us if we needed anything while sitting at her seat behind the counter.

name: Mary Claire
text: One of the best Jamaican food

name: Andrea
text: Curry goat was not the best... good Mac and cheese. Ox tails was not the best

name: Tammy Melvin
text: Husband loves their oxtail and I usually get either the wing dinner or special of 2 piece dark. Gotta watch tho, sometimes they only give you seven wings instead of eight! Also I've learned my lesson, don't order the extra sauce at 50 cents a tiny 1-2 ounce serving because they put more sauce on them when you DON'T ask for it!! Black beans are wonderful, greens were way too salty but we got last serving out of the pot. Swank tea usually good but we've had it a couple times and had to send it back cause it wasn't any good. Still one of our favorite "little hole in the walls".

name: Sweets Alexander
text: This was the worst food ever.  Chicken dried up and the sauce horrible. My mother myself and son had the so called jerk chicken.  Lots of vinegar in the sauce.  Greens taste like canned greens. Potato salad  a mess.  Mac n cheese dry. I’m so disappointed. Now my my sister curry chicken was ok.  Never again

name: Nick McDougal
text: Best damn spot in Charlotte bet that the vegan spot in there is to die 4

name: Carrie Vaughns
text:
The first times we went here like a year ago, the food and the customer service was great!!

We went last night and will never go again!! The chicken was freaked dry, barely any sauce, and smaller helpings on the sides. And the sanitation grade went down to a 90!

Oh my gosh- the waitress who helped us was so rude and disrespectful(has short curly hair with nose ring)- didn't greet us, we had to ask for straws, we asked about a food on the menu she just said I don't know, didn't check on us at all or ask how the food was, snatched the food and drinks away, didn't say bye at all, and ugh was just so rude !! Looked like she was pissed at the world!

name: Sandy Weaver
text: We ordered take out for the Super Bowl. It has been years since I had Anntony's chicken and tried the ribs for the first time. YUM!!!! It was delicious.  We are ordering wings for my birthday party.

name: Special Lady
text:
DO NOT EAT HERE!!!
There is absolutely NO seasoning on my chicken!! Have you ever had unseasoned curry chicken? It's disgusting!! I have never been so disappointed.
There is nothing Caribbean about this food. I just spent $15 and I'm still hungry b/c this mess isn't edible. It's bland and really bad.
On top of that, my co-worker who ordered w/ me called them to see if we had any options, maybe a customer dissatisfaction comp of some sort...all she got was non-chalance. You could practically hear the lady shrugging her shoulders. NEVER AGAIN!!
WASTE OF MONEY!!!

name: Sharon Hall
text:
No food and No AC....just close your doors for good!
Two weeks in the row I tried to dine in to eat, first time they were out of food by 7pm??? This time the air conditioning was not working and they had a very limited menu.
Don't worry we won't be back for a third try.

name: Alex Pyun
text: Previous review is incorrect, the jerk chicken wrap was under $9 and a large size, comes with a side dish too. She is right about the customer service though. It's a bit odd. The jerk chicken wrap itself and rice side dish were both bland and severely under seasoned. Also, not sure why there was balsamic vinaigrette on the wrap. Strange combination with jerk chicken. The chicken was not seasoned at all though.

name: Christopher Strout
text: Get the Callaloo greens, the Swank, the macaroni, and the 1/4 dark...and if at all possible, eat in. The music and the food warms your soul. Highly recommend for a cheap, healthy lunch when the weather gets cold. The greens are amazing. And if you've never had Swank before, ask for a taste to see if it's for you, can be quite strong for some.

name: Spencer Jackson
text: Why such negative reviews?  I used to get the goat and/or curry and it was good. .unless it's changed recently.  I'll have to make another stop in, soon.

name: De'Borah Hosea
text: I love the food here. Prices are fair ans reasonable..

name: alberto cabrera
text:
I have gone to Anntony's for the longest time. Since 1994. In 2000, I moved to another state and unfortunately the owner sold the restaurant as a franchise and moved to Sugarcreek. Since then, I would come back to Charlotte once a year to see family and visited the 7th street location. Unfortunately, I had noticed the quality of the food declining over the years. First it was they stop basting and marinating the chicken in Anntony's Sauce. Which is the whole point about Anntony's. Then they stop seasoning the chicken. But they still roasted the chicken and used the sauce, so I was still good.

It's 2016, and this place is now a disappointment. The only thing that is Anntony's is the sauce. The quality of the chicken has gone down. I have never been so disappointed when I saw my food. Anntony's was famous for its Anntony's All-Purpose Sauce and Chicken. The original staff would start slow roasting his chicken with a bucket of sauce and basing it at every turn. Creating chicken wings of sticky and saucy goodness.

This time, I ordered for takeout blindly expecting the same chicken I have eaten for years. Nope, this time, it seems there's either a new owner or manager. They closed off the bar area and now instead of slow-roasting the chicken, they deep fried it and let it sit in a hot bin till someone places an order. What a disappoint. The chicken doesn't even have a good color. It looks over fried and old. The chicken meat is dry and bland. No better than fried buffalo wings from an old bar.

Please do not go here and head to the Sugarcreek location instead. At least they still make the chicken by Anntony's standards. I haven't been there yet on this current trip to Charlotte. But I may just go tomorrow so that I can have a good experience with Anntony's wings before I leave.

text: Have had different jerk chicken with better flavor

name: Mr. Bull J in Jacksonville NC
Key West Steve
text: It may be a little pricey but it's a great little grocery store and a really nice place place to stop for lunch.

name: Maria Moraru
text: Almost every time I go into either of the Reid’s locations I either accidentally buy or make it to the counter and then have to turn around with an expired product. The place is way too overpriced and the food is bland. The check-out staff is sometimes aloof or rude. Not worth the trip.

name: Malely Cardona
text:
Excellent as usual, is a pleasure to shop, always clean and products fresh and organized, customer service A+.
My favorite store

name: Chris Hitch
text: Always love visiting Tommy to select the best cuts of beef. If you catch it right their bread is sold hot!! Great for salads and deli sides.

name: Michael Keim
text: They say fine foods in their title and by George they are right! From the killer wraps to the craft beer selection you won't be disappointed walking in their doors. Can't wait to try all their prepared foods, they all look so delicious.

name: Brooklyn Constance
text: Food was great. Staff and service on the other hand was far from exceptional. Beware: this is not a kid friendly restaurant (if you even classify it as that). I brought my daughter with me and I could tell from the start she was not welcomed. The female employee at the hostess stand gave me a unfriendly attitude when I walked up and asked for a high chair.. come to find out, this was actually one the managers. This should have been my first clue. It was LUNCH TIME for goodness sake. My daughter literally said three words while we were dining. The service was extremely slow and the wait time for our food was ridiculous to be honest. It was not busy at this time. We found ourselves asking each other several times where our waitress was. Overall, it was a really bad experience and I unfortunately will not be back.

name: Jessica B
text: Reid's is great however it is always so hard to maneuver through the store. One employee or manager nearly ran into my stroller. The young woman who works in the wine section is amazing and so is Regina in cold cuts. Regina helped me compile a lovely and delicious charcuterie and spent about 15 min or more doing so. I'll be back to see Regina and the woman in wine again.

name: Chris Ratchford
text:
I shop here more than I do at Teeter.  The staff seems genuinely interested in their customers.  They know me by name and are welcoming.

It's pricey, but you get what you pay for.

name: Isaac Stone
text:
After seeing a couple of liberals all upset because Reid's doesn't welcome employees voicing their "first amendment rights"... I had to give this establishment 5 stars and I will DEFINITELY try them out.
What these liberals fail to understand (and yes, they are liberals because they claimed as such), is that the first amendment protects you from persecution from the government. However, it does NOT give you the right to say what you want when you want without consequences. If you are at work, you are representing your employer. Even outside of work, to an extent, you are representing your employer.
I look forward to this weekend so that I can make the drive to try out this place. I am excited.

name: C Danzer
text:
Our dining experience at Reid's was so disappointing...tiny menu and everything we tried was too
Expensive for the ridiculously small portion sizes served. the lobster mac and cheese and shrimp and grits were horribly salty...beet salad was ridiculously tiny not even an appetizer size and good but nothing to write home about..  My glass of Wine, my husbands beer, our waiter and the other dining/ bar staff were the highlights of our experience, but we sadly won't ever return and we can't recommend it to others. Our bill was over 80 including the tip - way too much to leave hungry and not enjoy the food... we felt sick when we left but not because we were full....

name: David Day
text: Had a great dinner experience with my wife and friends last Saturday.  Joe does a great job on the grill and the wait staff has always been top notch.  Will be back soon!

name: Gary West
text: Always have great food and wine.

name: miguel m
text: Awesome burgers and service is even better

name: Benjamin Watson
text: Excellent fresh and gourmet foods, friendly staff.

name: frank secan
text: Prime rib sandwich on Thursday outstanding

name: Beth Gosey
text: It's really pricey. They think a lot of themselves.

name: doug mcclure
text: Great place with great food

name: Malely Cardona
text: Excellent customer service!!!

name: Lisa Harvey
text: The steakburgers are amazing!!!

name: Europa Jupiter
text:
Glad to find this new place.  The beef noodle is extremely good.  The chucky beef shank is very tender and well seasoned.  Most of the beef buried under noodles and the portions is good enough.  The broth is the stock used to cook shank.  This well extended the envelope of good Chinese cusine in Charlotte.

The soup dumpling is probably among the highest quality you can find in the US. Although I would not say I personally is very satisfied as I grown up eating XiaoLongBao. But I have never ever eat any soup dumpling in the US that met my personal criteria.

name: Judy Y
text: Chow fun with beef and Singapore noodles with shrimp, and egg rolls are all good.  Portions are on the small side, so make sure you order enough!

name: Ryan Daly
text: This place is 100% worth checking out! I’ve been searching a very long time for a place in Charlotte with soup dumplings and I’ve finally found it. We had a bunch of different apps and a few main dishes. Everything was incredible. The staff was super friendly and helpful as well. We’ll definitely be regulars here!

name: Wajeha Barakat
text: Every noodle dish you can imagine and it's all delicious. My husband and I tried a few different dishes and they were all fantastic, especially the soup noodles. The head chef has been working and developing recipes for over 30 years and it shows. So much depth and flavor in each bowl. You need to eat here and experience the warm hospitality and the richness of every noodle.

name: Taylor McDonald
text: The pork buns and scallion pancake were great. The Thai Mei Fun soup was so under seasoned it tasted like nothing even with some soy sauce. The chicken chow fun also under seasoned.  We will be back for the pork buns & scallion pancake. Will probably frequent our other Asian restaurant for the staples.

name: Timothy Kolesnikov
text: Best noodles ever. Staff was extremely friendly and kind.

name: Lindsay Bierwert
text: Ordered online and was able to pick up within 15min. Their ramen was delicious and packed with flavor, can't wait to try more of the menu!

name: Lindsay Bierwert
text: Ordered online and was able to pick up within 15min. Their ramen was delicious and packed with flavor, can't wait to try more of the menu!

text: Delicious food and possibly the best boba tea we have had in CLT.

name: Jen Shoemaker
text: Loved the bubble tea options!

name: Chris Brafford
text: All of the staff was super friendly during my visits while in my continuing education classes.

name: Jonathan Brown-King
text: Bagel specials are always prime here. The coffee has a good flavor and the bagels have a premium taste.

name: Sage Duffey
text: I like bagels, this place has bagels. I miss their vegan cream cheese

name: Morris Owens
text: Excellent early morning noshing place.

name: Tanya Day
text: Come here every morning great staff

resp.text: Thank you for being a loyal customer, Tanya! We appreciate you!

name: David Maillie
text: Bagels are good, but the lines in the morning can be quite long.

name: Jigar
text: It's an express counter , not many variety but they do have coffee and bagels

name: Eric Harrison
text: Good

resp.text: Thank you for your rating! We appreciate you being our customer!
Thank you for being our customer, Gary! Have a great day!

name: Ron Onedertwin
text: I enjoyed the Caribbean vibe that this place had to offer. You can sit on the patio with lively music or inside with more of a low-key island vibe. The service is great and the food is tasty. One of my favorites were the jerk wings and the empanadas. A piece of heaven in NODA. Very nice to see a black owned business in this area. By the way the drinks were good too.

name: Monica Smith
text: Sigh...  I hate to be this person 🙄 but wow overpriced for the quality and quantity. I paid $23 for an ox tail meal. I only received 3 oxtails in a small cup, NO RICE ,NO BEAN , just 3 oxtail. The jersey chicken nachos were bland and dry. No cheese at all. The chicken bowl was also dry didn't have the sauce as described and was made up of 3/4 bland beans. The only thing that was enjoyable was the salt fish fritters. Reached out to restaurant directly, no response. Won't give another try

name: Curtis Blazek
text: Got sat quickly, we had a reservation.  Got some water in about 10 minutes. It was almost an hour exactly before anyone acknowledged us. She was quick to get our order in. She understood. Food was a little bit of a wait but drinks came and just waited. Food was good. Enjoyed it and it was hot. Ups and downs on this visit. Could tell they were feeling the staff shortage, but just communicate better.

resp.text: Curtis, our sincere apology for the wait.  Please come back to see us and we will ensure that you have a much better experience.

name: Steph R
text: This place is awesome! Everyone's nice, the place is spotless, and the restaurant itself is very spacious inside and out. I love the outdoor setup! The drinks are really good and the wings were fabulous and huge. Can't wait to go back to try the ox tail.

name: Jarrod Humphrey
text: I ate here for the first time Friday after living here in Charlotte for 2 years. Sat on the back patio. All of tje staff were super welcoming and friendly.  The rum drinks were very good. You just can't beat the atmosphere and vibe of this place it's awesome. I tried the curry goat and ox tail. They were 10/10 and could tell they were made with passion. Absolutely phenomenal.  I will be back soon!

resp.text: Thank you Jarrod.  Hope to see you again soon!

name: Tonya Cooper
text: The food was really good.  We ate inside, not on the patio out back..service appeared to be more attentive to patrons on the patio. Service was not good inside.

name: Bridget Buback
text: Stumbled upon this restaurant tonight with a friend and certainly happy we did! We had curry chicken, ox tail and collard greens. Food was flavorful and plenty. Served hot and fast. Fun, friendly, accommodating staff rounded out a wholly enjoyable dining experience! I am looking forward to the warm months and the live music on the patio!

name: Kay Salaam
text: Excellent customer Thank you Roy for the red snapper it was wonderful. Hadir it was a pleasure meeting you, and the service you provided enjoyed our conversation while you was able to attend to other customers hopefully oneday you can take me to Egypt🤭. Preston thank you for diligently checking in for anything needed. Guy excellent customer service I wish everyone the best keep pushing.

resp.text: Thank you Kay!

name: Marjanna Anderson
text: Roy's kitchen was our choice from the spin the wheel & we were so satisfied.  We enjoyed the environment & the food. We had date night there & just adored our experience from beginning to end. We ordered sorrel, jerk chicken nachos, tostones & red snapper. Proportion sizes were great, just enough to feel complete & not too much to take away. The server & the owner were way cool & fun. We definitely going back. Not to mention great location!

name: Sanjay Patel
text: Amazing food and service. Been craving some really good Caribbean food. Best in town hands down!!

resp.text: It was a pleasure hosting you Sanjay.  Please come back and see us!

name: Jameela Nurullah
text: The service and the food was fine but nothing special that left last a lasting impression. The food was a bit bland for island style, the bread and empanadas just slightly over cooked, and the chicken alittle undercooked so we had to place it back in the oven. I got the family meal. I thought the sizes would be a bit more because it really wasn’t wasn’t what I would consider a “family meal” but for the price it’s not bad.

name: Marjanna Anderson
text: Roy's kitchen was our choice from the spin the wheel & we were so satisfied.  We enjoyed the environment & the food. We had date night there & just adored our experience from beginning to end. We ordered sorrel, jerk chicken nachos, tostones & red snapper. Proportion sizes were great, just enough to feel complete & not too much to take away. The server & the owner were way cool & fun. We definitely going back. Not to mention great location!

name: Jason Baker
text: Great job on reopening this restaurant space in NoDa. The food and service was excellent. Lots of menu choices to include some vegan dishes. Caribbean Island flavors that measure up to any of my visits there. The fried snapper was so good that I almost ordered two! Plantain chips made fresh and a unique tomatillo like salsa that had great tang and a bit of island heat. A perfect amount. Highly recommend!

name: Sanjay Patel
text: Amazing food and service. Been craving some really good Caribbean food. Best in town hands down!!

resp.text: It was a pleasure hosting you Sanjay.  Please come back and see us!

name: Walker Clark
text: 1hr+ wait for food - true island time. Appetizers came out with main course....Food was pretty bland and underwhelming. Pass.

resp.text: Walker, We apologize for the wait time.  We strive to do our very best to please every customer.  Hope you give us another try!

name: C. Maddox
text: Love The Empanadas. Lovely vibes on the inside & overall great service. 10/10 recommend

name: Belinda Brown
text: Oh my God the food is awesome 👌.  The atmosphere grown and sexy! Great date night spot!!!

resp.text: Thank you Belinda!

name: Nigel Vaughan
text: Had a wonderful meal here. The rib sauce was spectacular, sweet, spicy, what more could you want. The service was excellent and so friendly. We will certainly be back again to see their live bands on Saturday and Sunday.

name: Liz Vermoesen
text:
We went to the revamped Roy’s and love it so much more than the old Mangos. The food is amazing and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We ordered the curry and empanadas. For the quality the taste the food gets a 5/5. The only reason I dropped a star is the horrible smell on the back patio.
They have such a large and great back area but it needs a little bit of TLC. It’s got one of the largest back patios of NoDa but the design of the area is severely lacking. With a little bit of extra work this place would be a new hot spot of NoDa. I know the smell is mainly due to the dumpster, which isn’t really their fault, but I believe in them to find a creative and effective solution :). We will definitely be back but won’t be sitting in the back again.

name: Yolanda Terry
text: Excellent experience..amazing taste to the rotisserie chicken, empanodas, jerk shrimp, collards,red snapper, tea so sweet and fresh. Can't wait to get back. Thanks Dabari our awsome waiter and great dinning experience!!

name: Candace Hill
text: A real gem. Great place to vibe when the live band is there. The red snapper is seasoned to perfection!!

name: Leslie B
text: Most of the food was bland - we decided to call it the senior citizen's menu! There were several servers who called out on the day we went. Many of our guests who joined us never got any food or drinks. This made for a very unpleasant experience!

name: Dwayne Hopkins
text: Truly enjoyed the curry chicken and empenadas...first time here, but will definitely be back.

name: Ms Kat
text: Nice vibe Brunch was good with great food and music.

name: Nathan Cox
text: Great service! They ran out of curry goat so next time I'll go earlier

name: Reginald Landrum
text: I loved the Veggie wrap and salad as well.

name: Jason Baker
text: Great job on reopening this restaurant space in NoDa. The food and service was excellent. Lots of menu choices to include some vegan dishes. Caribbean Island flavors that measure up to any of my visits there. The fried snapper was so good that I almost ordered two! Plantain chips made fresh and a unique tomatillo like salsa that had great tang and a bit of island heat. A perfect amount. Highly recommend!

name: Courtney Barnertt
text: It was a very clean, spacious, and friendly atmosphere. I love the food but dont recommend the cabbage... Beside that jabari the bartender was very awesome and yet friendly. I will definitely go back.

name: Robin Dixon
text: Great drinks. Didn't eat there so not sure about food.

name: Karlynne Sampson
text: Great atmosphere, portions were slightly smaller than expected for the price point. Same can be said for the drinks. But then again, you're paying to be off the main drag in Noda. However, everything was delicious. We got 1 of each empanada and all three flavors were great. My husband got the ox tail which is wonderful, and definitely recommend getting. I got the rotisserie chicken, which was a little dry but it was the end of the night. So to be expected. We got a few drink as well. The roys revenge is AMAZING. Get that! We also got the Pool party which is their sharable drink and was not disappointed. I would most certainly come back and plan to.

name: Kathryn Maxwell
text: Excellent spot for tiki drinks! Love this new patio spot in Charlotte. We also ordered their jerk chicken and it was simply delicious! The outdoor patio in the back has a full bar and shaded seating. Recommend trying their Firedancer cocktail.

name: S O
text:
Delicious oxtails and cocktails. The empanadas are beautifully done as they are not just dry meat inside but almost a stew consistency. It goes great with the crisp shell.

Excellently thought out venue and execution with room for growth. Service was primo and the crowd was new Charlotte which is refreshing. Couldn’t have had a better experience.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Sheldon!  We are glad to be open and we hope you come back and see us again.

name: Elizabeth Kowalski
text: Cool back patio and a Saturday evening live music series. Good food and drink specials!

text: I go there specifically to buy candles. Be on the alert because, despite all the benign but beautiful candles they sell,  pagan and sacrilegious items are mixed in amongst the shelves. They sell an eclectic variety of specialized, Hispanic targeted, grocery items and miscellaneous merchandise. The young cashiers are friendly, but typically speak no English. I have been coming here for years. One of the better Mexican groceries in Charlotte.

text: Service was good, there is a wait because food is made to order. Staff was friendly. Location does get a little crowded, so place order in advance if possible. I enjoyed the food, just the batter used to fry the chicken seemed a tad salty to me. But, otherwise enjoyed the meal.

text: This appears to be under going an interior renovation while still serving to go orders   There was no outdoor seating and no curbside delivery.  The service inside was fast and efficient.  It's fast food cooked to order.  For the price it was a good size serving, more than I could eat in a single sitting.  The seasoning was well balanced and bountiful.  For fried food it's not bad on the wallet nor will it offend your taste buds.  I suggest you give it a try.

text: I haven't eaten here in a good while since changing jobs four years ago. But this place was a favorite when I worked closer to this side of town. I was near here and stopped in. I am happy to see that they're still going strong despite the pandemic. The service and food are as good as I recall. It's a must have for anyone in Charlotte. Great food, no fuss. Five stars; def recommend.

text:
The best fried chicken in Charlotte, if not the world.

Place is wonderful. All of the staffs are really friendly. The place have long lines and sometimes the wait times is so long (especially on Sunday after church) but the taste is worth it.

The chicken is absolutely delicious. It is really good! The taste is perfect, the crispiness is perfect, all of the spices really seep into the chicken meat.

If you like fried chicken, don’t go to fast food, go here.

text: I was incredibly saddened and disappointed with the food that I ordered. For the last couple of days, I had been wanting some good chicken livers and some gizzards. Remembered how good the last one's that I had ordered from their old location. Double order of livers and an order of gizzards. Got them to go. Smelled so good in the car. Got home and tried one out before settling in for a good lunch. The livers were not even cleaned and were not even seasoned. Just dropped in flour and fried. Gizzards were so rubbery and bland tasting also. The few that I had made me sick for 2 days. Had to throw $25 worth of food away. Couldn't salvage them at all. Will never be back again.  Such a waste of time and money.

Walking in I see a place that reminded me of a night club back in the day. White table clothes they even have servers!!. There was black athletes  and statesmen in History.. Nice touch!!
So of course they have Fried chicken and those parts and sides to water your  your lips!!!
The fried chicken was perfect!!  The Collard greens were perfect!! The Mac and cheese was Perfect The mashed potatoes were good but they seemed to be fake mashed potatoes mixed with real ones.Still tasty. Menu shows fried seafood I bet it is as tasty as the chicken!!!

text: Best dang southern food in Charlotte.    If you want really good fried chicken, hush puppies, broccoli casserole or whatever else, this is THE PLACE to go.  Staff is friendly, attentive and happy to pleas .   There was a lone but the wait was minimal considering how crowded it was on a Sunday.   This is a great place to take visitors if you think they'll enjoy good old fashioned soul food and home cooking.

name: Laconya Bradshaw-Gamble
text: Prices are misleading on the menu board. Beware the prices are different once rung in. When asked about the prices, the answer is oh the prices went up. Then update your menu board. On to the food. The chicken is salty and the Mac n cheese tastes like water. The fried okra is very tasty.

name: Chris VanDercook
text:
This is arguably Charlotte’s best fried chicken, and more. For sure, in north Charlotte, this place is legendary. I visit the Chicken Box frequently, both while working for a popular delivery app and to satisfy my own cravings.

If you’re ordering takeout, expect a 15-20 minute wait; it takes time for this deliciousness. I generally call ahead and it’s ready when I get there or shortly after arriving. The same goes for the times when I’m picking up for a customer; although it may be busy(it usually is) the promised pickup times are pretty accurate.

If you do have to wait a few minutes, don’t fret. The lobby has TVs and comfortable blue bench seats hugging the wall. The TVs play football if possible, otherwise.. news maybe? Honestly I don’t remember, but always football if it’s on.

For all the years that I’ve been coming here regularly, around five, I’ve never had a bad experience. The staff is friendly and helpful. The food is great(please try the broccoli casserole) and always delivered in a timely fashion.

The Chicken Box Café is a can’t miss Charlotte institution.

name: Jacquie Tooles Ward
text: Great service  food  prepared fresh and tasty if your looking for soul food chicken Box is your place

I feel sorry for the owners because the food is so good. But I give an all around review. Food, service, atmosphere and cleanliness, with emphasis on restrooms.

name: Phylesha Edmond
text: One of the best places I've been too on years hands down. There truly is soul in the food here. The people are very friendly and make you feel like you're just going to a family Dinner! I am traveling from Winston but I am definitely done back!! With more people this time!! Thanks for this soul experience.

name: Melissa Watson
text: Great food, okay decor! This place is obviously very popular which means patrons should expect a fairly long wait for take out. Visit for the food, not for a quick bite.

name: Jocelyn Gray
text: Ordered through DoorDash last night which I regret because of the time it took. Overall, I was satisfied. This wasn’t my first time eating from here but it was the first time in a long time. I ordered 3 piece dark with Mac and cheese and steamed cabbage with a side order of candies yams and tried the sweet potato pie. Of course at any soul food restaurant you’d expect great Mac and cheese...my serving was bland. Not sure if this was just a bad batch or what. My cabbage was the best part of my meal I would say! I could eat it everyday. Yams, chicken were also good. Sweet potato pie...ehh it tasted just ok.

name: Ravenous Ike
text: Food was good. Had to wait a awhile for service but other than that the waitress was nice.

name: Heatradio One

name: Tracie Bost
text: Certain items are better than the others. Staff can be very rude. Food mediocre.

name: Prince Woodberry
text:
Without question the food here is very good. The service is somewhat decent. HoHowever, I saw something that caught my attention and even bothered me the more I think about it. I could be wrong, for sharing this.

I got here today and there was a party of three Caucasian gentlemen in front of me. They placed their orders and sat down. Just as I did. Now, here if you done in they bring your food to you. I ordered a sweet tea and the gentleman behind the register graves a to go cup filled it and handed it to me. This is what they do here at this establishment.

So the three afore mentioned gentlemen came and sat down at the table conjunction to me. The server on duty came with three GLASSES, for the gentlemen!

I stopped and looked around at everyone else who was dining in to see there drinking apparatus looked like. And to my dismay everyone else had paper cups to drink out of and not real GLASS!

IM REALLY TRYING TO UNDERSTAND WHY!

name: Brian Wilson
text: Staff was very friendly. Food is amazing!! Best sweet tea I've had in years. A true southern soul food restaurant that I'd recommend to anyone who LOVES great food!

text: I love the vibe and the service but the greens taste like they put sugar in them. I ordered turkey wings and the flavor was a bit underwhelming. I know people like this place and maybe it's just my tastebuds... I'll try them again but, I'll have to get something else next time. The place is clean, and they make you feel at home. It has just been hard for me to eat out lately.

name: Furman Williams
text: Decent food quality, price too high for the average working class person. Prices are way out of line with the average resturants in Charlotte. The meat service quantity - portions are fine, but there is no need for the vegetables to put in small containers in a go box. Vegetables servings sizes are way out line with other compatible Soul food restaurants vin Charlotte. This is what kills any resturants,  you gotta have great tastng food, heaping portions of your vegetables, & a price that meets & suits your target audience & patrons. Changes needvto be made here or graveyards of fail resturants awaits??? These prices are out of line & out of order when related taste.

I had the fried chicken one week and the perch the next.  Both were the best I've ever had from a restaurant.  The chicken is NOT greasy, amazing!  For sides, I have tried the broccoli casserole, mac & cheese, and mashed potatoes with gravy.  All excellent.

The dining room is clean and comfortable, employees were friendly and attentive.

You won't go away hungry, plus it's really good.

name: Marlon Morris
text: I had the most horrible experience with a "manager" named Sharon. Ordered food to pick up through Door Dash. Get to the restaurant and she says I have to wait for a DoorDash driver to give me the food I paid for. Even after I showed her the confirmation email its my order!! She is in the restaurant yelling at me about how she can't give me my food because of her contract with DoorDash. Then why is DoorDash letting me order it pick it up?? Then she is yelling at her employees in front of customers, yelling at other customers, and being completely unprofessional. What is sad is this lady is old enough to be someone's grandmother, so you would think the time on this earth spent she would have learned something about being professional or how to conduct herself as a manager. Food is decent. But my last time spending money at this place. I usually only post good reviews and keep the bad to myself. But as someone in Sales, I couldn't let anyone else bear the same experience as I did.

name: Suzette Dajah
text:
My first and last time..
I requested the price over the phone since I'd never been here. He told me the price when I got there the price was different. I explained I was quoted another price she didnt seem to care. I just paid then asked for hot sauce she replied I put some in the bag I said yes like TWO packs she said we normally give 3 packs, I said for a family piece. She gave me 2 more saying this time I will but we dont normally.  I said thanks it's my first time and I want be back.
Packs of hot sauce cost a company around 5€. At the price of the chicken it should be factored in. Nevertheless I thought it was very cheap not to want to give hot sauce packs and the change your quoted price.

name: John L. Walton II
text:
When I was a kid, my mom suffered from depression. I never knew how horrible it was for her but I recall her burning my dinner every night and then forcing myself to eat the blackened food to make her happy. I had a similar experience eating the "food" from here. Scraping out chunk of meatloaf from a charred skin, eating only the top of the stuffing and gravy because the bottom was caked in a black crust, having to stab only a few macaroni noodles at a time to ensure I didn't eat a clump of burnt cheese....The slogan under this company's sign was "Miss ya mama's cookin?" and I can say, honestly, that I do not. Fortunately for me, I no longer have to pretend like I do.

Oh, and their health score is an 85. Watch out.

name: Khandi Miami
text: This place has the best soul food that I've eaten  since being in Charlotte thus far... Nostalgic... Puts me back in the kitchen with Moms and Gran...OMG

I've gotten triplicate orders of 1 veggie when only one was ordered.  I don't like thighs and never order them... guess what's on the box??! Yep.  So long chicken box. You're outta here!!!

name: John L. Walton II
text:
When I was a kid, my mom suffered from depression. I never knew how horrible it was for her but I recall her burning my dinner every night and then forcing myself to eat the blackened food to make her happy. I had a similar experience eating the "food" from here. Scraping out chunk of meatloaf from a charred skin, eating only the top of the stuffing and gravy because the bottom was caked in a black crust, having to stab only a few macaroni noodles at a time to ensure I didn't eat a clump of burnt cheese....The slogan under this company's sign was "Miss ya mama's cookin?" and I can say, honestly, that I do not. Fortunately for me, I no longer have to pretend like I do.

Oh, and their health score is an 85. Watch out.

Thanks,
Management

name: Marc Roberts
text: Recently remodeled. Good food and fair prices

name: Traci Loudin
text: Appetizers were amazing, though Sullivan's steak is better. Unfortunately, their clientele makes this place unbearable to eat at. We had to suffer through dinner while an old white man complained to his table about how ridiculous people were to suggest blacks were underrepresented in the Oscars, then he went on to discuss "women's place," and proceeded down a laundry list of bigotry at full volume. The servers chuckled along with him, as he often stopped to engage them in the conversation. I don't think he missed an opportunity to slight anyone's gender, sexual orientation, or race. If you're a self-respecting black, female, or homosexual person, I wouldn't recommend eating here, or you may get an earful of bigotry.

name: Steven West
text: Been going there for years. Always outstanding.

name: Jackie Mcwilliams
text: Great sea bass, romantic ambiance, excellent service.

name: Josep Cortez
text: 2nd time I came here to order 7 layer burrito to be served mainly lettuce no meat a teaspoon of beans and rice as well as it being cold horrible service in the kitchen.

name: Ashley Black
text: The employees were great, the food was great and we didn't have to wait long at all! And most important our order was correct when we got home... 😁 YAY!!

name: John White
text:
They don’t respond to curbside pickup and when you place an online order they won’t start it until you get there even if you set a pickup time. I’ve experienced this dozens of times at this location but I wanted to wait to see if I was correct in assuming that they NEVER start it until you get there. Most recently I set my order to be picked up at 11:00 and it has been over 20 minutes past that time and I still haven’t gotten it. It’s not even that busy right now.

Other than that the service is a hit or miss. Sometimes they’re very rude and sometimes they are not rude. Never really polite unless you tell them to have a good day at which point their tone changes.

My only reason for reviewing this time is due to the fact that I was charged for an added item that I didn’t receive. I will inevitably be back and my rating will change as I receive better service.

———

I’m updating my review from a scathing one star to four stars because the service is getting better. I experience the best service in the evening. Admittedly, I eat Taco Bell wayyyy too much.

resp.text: That's not okay, John. You should never have to wait that long. We'll share this with our Charlotte Team. Thanks for letting us know & hope to see you again soon.

name: JJ CBOSS84
text: Food was hot and done right not some sloppy nasty looking tacos!

name: Drixem “Lady Gunnz 848” Gunna
text: Love it....traveled from nations ford to south Blvd to there...more training... exquisite food!!!

name: Crystalle Williams
text: They never get my order right. And when I call to complain, they don't answer the phone.

name: Meredith Moore
text: This TB can't get it together to save their life. Always slow, orders wrong, rude employees, etc. Only one car in front of me in the drive through and they asked them to pull around and wait in the parking lot. I only ordered 4 small, single items, nothing special, and sat at the drive through window for a good 5min before they also asked me to pull around to the parking lot to wait. Sat there for another 5min before anyone came out with my food. 2 stars because the new guy working the drive through is extremely nice and friendly (sure he won't want to stay long at this location, unfortunately).

resp.text: That's not right, Meredith. Please DM us on Twitter @TacoBellCare so we can share your feedback with our Charlotte team and fix this. We hope you visit us again for a better experience.

text: Don't go there at least via drive through. Your credit card info will be stolen. The chic at drive through took her time charging it and kept running in it for next few days on food, rides, cash outs. Watch your bank accounts.

ALWAYS an awesome visit. The staff here are fast and accurate. Even if they miss something they take no time to correct it.

Fantastic experience...EVERY time!!!

name: Sean Goolsby
text: Ordered simple nacho combo, added jalapenos. Cashier repeated order correctly, was charged for jalapenos, received plain nachos. Never sacrifice accuracy for speed, especially when there's a line. People can wait even if they're impatient.

name: Blake Page
text: Bit into my taco expecting escargot since it took so long. Nope! Just a cow who must have had an excruciatingly slow death. Guess if the employee has enough time to talk to her boyfriend whilst simultaneously taking my order, it should have been clear to me that efficiency was not a value of this business.

name: Mark Mauberry
text: They put sour cream on my tacos and I’m allergic. And they left a taco off my order. I called in to rectify the situation, talk to management. He refused to help, nasty negative demeanor. So I asked for his name, He said Tee, I asked for his full name, he said no and hung up in my face. This is so ridiculous and irresponsible for management, if he acts like this I can just imagine how the store is ran. Terrible. Unacceptable. No respect to PAYING CUSTOMERS. So now I have to go elsewhere to eat because that manager is confrontational. No paying customer should feel that way.

name: Lil lester Roster
text: Fast friendly low price

name: Jon Serkspawn777
text:
The staff here is great, very friendly and accommodating when ordering items not on the menu. In fact, it was one of the managers that showed me how to order a burrito they no longer make. I probably come here about 3 times a month, they have never messed up an order of mine. That's a big deal to me.
Location is in a high traffic and not best of area, but they do absolutely their best to keep it clean.
The burritos are hearty, not skinny and food always fresh.
At this moment they sport a 99% sanitation rating
That too is a big deal.
Whoever owns this franchise, you should be proud of the staff you have here on weekdays around 4 PM

Although I endured this encounter, I'll still return to this location in hopes that things have improved.

Line was forever long, took forever, and the woman at the window was ruder that belligerent drunk man in Sunday church service. Got my crunch wrap though so we good. Until next time Taco Bell...

name: Six “BLACKMQQN” Million
text: Placed an online order at this location. Went to pick up soon thereafter and found a line of vehicles out in the street waiting to be served. I would have simply left had I not already paid for my food.  Finally after 20 minutes I got to the intercom and announced that I was there for an online pickup. After waiting additional time I get up to the window and was told my order contained a lot of beef items and i needed to go around to park. I waited nearly 20 minutes and had to bang on the door and told the employee I would like a refund. He gave some vague info and was ignorant to what the procedure was. He left and I stood outside with know resolution. I had to walk around to the drive thru where the employees found humor and addressed me with a derogatory racial name.  I then called the police. Four police vehicles arrived and there still was know resolution. I am out of $18 and time. If these individuals are representative of Taco Bell what does that say about Taco Bell. Over and hour to order online and to be insulted.  UPDATE: I ORIGINALLY GAVE THIS RESTAURANT A 1 STAR BUT AFTER SPEAKING WITH THE MANAGER THE NEXT DAY I GOT A RESOLUTION TO THE SITUATION. I APPRECIATED THE COURTESY AND PROFESSIONALISM DISPLAYED BY THE MORNING MANAGER. NIGHTSHIFT MANAGER NEEDS TO BE EITHER REPLACED OR RETRAINED. NO MATURE ENOUGH TO LEAD.

Food is hot and my uncle usually gets what he asked for about 60% of the time.

name: Robin Ann
text: The food certainly is Fresh in that all of the food is made to order, even the fries are hand cut! Their guacamole is wonderful and they seem agreeable to changing things up by allowing you to substitute celery or cucumber slices for tortilla chips. The salmon is fresh, perfectly cooked at Medium, portions are generous and prices are extremely reasonable for the quality and quantity. The Matthews location has started a brunch menu on Sundays (not been to other locations). Service is attentive, food delivered to tabletop quickly. Really happy they are in our area!

name: Cindye Hauck
text: The food was Awesome! Our server very nice. Their food presentation beautiful. Very affordable. We need one of these restaurant's in the Concord area!

resp.text: You never know lol. We are currently opening our 6th location in the greater Charlotte area.

name: H. Drayton
text: Absolutely the best place!! From the waitress, bartender, to manager. Can’t go wrong!! They were able to accommodate our party of 25 on a Sunday and every family raved about the food and service!! We try new places often but this is definitely a staple place we come back to often!

name: Laci Cheney-Baddouh
text: Incredible shrimp and grits! Best I have ever heard. There is also an extensive gluten free menu on their website. So yummy!!!!

resp.text: Thank you. I'm glad you enjoyed your meal.

name: Colby Bell
text: Fresh Chef is one of the best restaurants I’ve ever been to and I’ll tell you why! The customer service is outstanding, no where in Charlotte beats it. The food is so fresh, hence the name, and never disappoints. The quality of the food and the prices are also great. The kale salad is by far the best kale salad I’ve ever had! Also, I’ve been to all of the locations and the food/service is the same across the board...awesome!

name: Brenda Dixon
text: I am so thrilled with this place. The menu is extensive, the portions are incredible, and the food is wonderful. The service is top notch. Thankful for a new go to spot for lunch Or dinner. Thanks for a great experience.

name: Kyle Winters
text: The menu has an excellent variety, especially the children's menu. They will accommodate variations to their menu. The portions are large and prices are reasonable. The owner and staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

name: Elyse Miller
text: Another favorite go to in Charlotte. The food is so light and fresh. This is a great option when you are looking for something healthy. The kale salad is next level! We have been known to get a half pan of it to eat during the week or for parties.

name: Marc Anderson
text: We took the family for my wife's birthday and were really impressed. All of the food was really good (the shrimp and grits were out of this world), and the waitress was super pleasant and engaging. Looking forward to going back.

name: Brian Capron
text: Great find! Eclectic food and bar menus. Well prepared food and drinks. Large portions. Attentive service. Wonderful key lime pie!

name: Brandon Ferguson
text:
Great food and a great environment. The only reason I gave four stars is because I was told there was a special on Margarita's for $6. I asked if they had additional flavors, so that's what I got. I was never told that the additional flavor was $12. When I told the waitress about this, she apologized but did not adjust my bill. I usually always give a 20% tip, so I just deducted the additional amount of the drink off of my bill.

I would recommend this place and I will more than likely be going back.

name: Susan Weisbrich
text: Food was good.  Service was not good tonight. The waitress was disorganized - probably new.  Meals weren't as ordered.  They did comp 1 in our party.  We've been there several times before & not had this experience.   Will try again.

name: Christopher Hart
text: Fantastic selection of cheeses, charcuterie and wines combined with a fun place to hang out with friends make for a great experience. Mere also has beer for that person in your group that isn't in to wine. The cheese boards are immaculately arranged and the wine selection is broad, approachable and has something for most everyone's palette and price point.

name: Aaron Perkins
text: Esthetically pleasing Charcuterie arrangement accompanied by good wines. Nestled in a cozy spot on Park Rd. Bubbly store owner will make sure you leave satisfied with the highest quality of eats.

name: Tom Lane-Brady
text: Mere's is by far my favorite place in Charlotte for the most amazing selection of cheeses, meats, bread, and the most delicious homemade Pimento cheese.  The Quality is the best.  You are not going to find any of Mere's selection of fine cheeses anywhere else in Charlotte. Mere's also has a wide selection of wonderful wine to please every palette.  They service and atmosphere makes me feel like I'm at home with family. :)

resp.text: Thank you, Tom!!! Appreciate you and Justin.

name: Chris Guella
text: Great wine and Charcuterie. What's not to look. Very nice evening at Meres. We would also go back.

name: Laura Skillington
text: We went on a Wednesday night at 7 and the place was packed. 90% of the seating is at one communal table and the seats are packed in like sardines. I could barely squeeze in between two people already sitting and couldn't even hear my husband sitting directly across from me because it was so loud. I went up to the counter to try and order and by coincidence was helped by Meredith, the owner. I had to ask her three times whether it was order at the counter or table service before getting a clear answer and I could barely read the menu while standing right in front of it because it is written in white on an antiqued mirror. Meredith told us that you can only order by picking the number of cheeses you want on the board and adding meats but nowhere were any selections visible so I guess they just pick whatever they want to give you and no customization is available. For a shop that only serves cheese and wine this puzzled me. Not to mention the fact that they only serve one red and one white by the glass. If you don't go with one of those options you have to squeeze behind everyone at the communal table to try and pick out a bottle. I could not see any organizational system of grouping the wines, labeling or prices whatsoever. Clearly this place is very popular and people must be loving something about it but I have no idea what that is. We left without ordering because the whole system frankly didn't work for me at all.

resp.text:
You are right, we were busy.  I am still learning. So much of this is about exposing new cheeses, charcuteries, wines and brews  to the palettes of Charlotte.  I will hope that the both of you will come back and let me reverse your thoughts.
Best,
Meredith

text: Such a unique experience in Charlotte! Tried orange wine and it was awesome!

name: Chad Mcgee
text: Perfect people, wine, food and place.  Take a chance and let them match the wine and food.

name: Lesley DeSessa
text: My fiance and I went to Mere's last week for opening night and it was absolutely fantastic. I have been waiting for a place like this to open in the Charlotte metropolitan area. The staff was friendly, the environment was clean and the storefront screamed good food and wine. We will absolute be back.

text: wow wow wow!!! The cheese and charcuterie are so freaking good! You will just want to eat everything. The best part is the beer and the wine bottles are priced so great! I live 25min from here but will be coming here all the time. Great job, hope you keep up the excellent work! CLT has been waiting for you!!!

text:
As far as Taco Bells go, this is pretty standard. I recommend sticking to the 'Mexican' entrees, and not going too far into dessert or loco anything.

With that said, my standard order includes a bean burrito, a nacho cheese chicken chalupa, and - if I'm still hungry - a regular taco supreme. Can't go wrong with this place!

name: Yvette Spivock
text: Clever modernization of the pub feel- still cozy and inviting.  Multiple levels of seating and great bar area.  Even bar seating open to the sidewalk.  Four TVs but they somehow weren’t obnoxious .The frozen Irish coffee packs some punch - great for a hot day.  Good choices on the menu.  The pot pie, the Irish onion soup, the chicken sandwich were all excellent!  Jackie the owner is personable and delightful.  A place we’ll return to often!

name: Christopher Murray
text: Spot on! Food had a nice twist of flavors. If you're looking for something different then this is a great spot. Staff is friendly and you feel welcomed there. They will accommodate any requests you might have. Prices are good too. Have been and few times and will definitely be going back. Gotta say give the nachos a try and some of the Irish dishes. Tip: there is a parking deck right next to the entrance of the restaurant.

name: J.R. Denney
text:
Exquisite Irish pub!!!  If I lived in Charlotte, this would be one of my regular stops. I ordered the Boxty & the John Dillinger.

The Boxty is an Irish cheddar potato cake topped with bacon; on the side was two containers: one with tomato jam and the other had goat cheese cream.  It was as good as it was unique.

My drink, the John Dillinger, was bourbon mixed with vermouth & Guinness...topped with a brandied cherry.

Wonderful local spot.

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
This place has been on my radar since it opened and I finally got around to trying it.

We went on a weeknight for dinner and it was pretty empty. We were seated right away when we got there.

The appetizers looked so good that I ended getting a couple as my meal. I went with the lamb sliders and the Irish nachos. Both were delicious. My husband got the Irish breakfast which he loved.

Unfortunately our service wasn't very good. Even though the restaurant was empty, our server took forever to come back so we could ask for our checks. We also couldn't get our water refilled.

All in all, the food was really good, so I would come again. Hopefully the service was just a one off issue.

name: A. Emy Diop
text: Watched the English v Panama match here! Amazing staff

name: Cynthia Stockwell
text: This is an Irish Pub on East Blvd, the service is excellent!  The food is definitely better than bar food!  The PEI mussels are amazing! The stew was a soup special and was delicious.  The sliders were a good flavor, but were a little soggy.

name: Pat Lausier
text: Wow! What a great bar/restaurant! Service (Sierra and owner Sam) was great! The Mussels were the best I've had in years.. fish and chips were fabulous (so light) Irish coffee and bread pudding were fantastic! Great atmosphere! This is our new go-to spot!

name: Laila LaTisha Bradford
text: I was really eager to try this burger. I enjoyed it but I will say my patty was super thin. I was bummed because I was really looking forward to the boss sauce,  but I could I barely taste it. I am a big fan of the impossible burger at Burger King, and I was hoping to have a similar experience. I am giving you a four, as my burger was cold, but I drove 25 minutes to get it, and didn't eat it until I got home. I will definitely try it again. I will do the one bite challenge as soon as I get it.  The hawaiian bun was a nice touch.  This chips were yummy, and the lemonade had a unique spice to it.

name: Anita C
text: The food was absolutely amazing. I will definitely make another and be a life long customer. I have only 2 suggestions. They may want to consider changing their rewards program if they want the frequent repeat customers. And add parchment paper to their cookies to keep them separated. Everything was great but only in a splurge. Kind of pricey for my wallet to go on a regular basis to receive only 1 point in rewards per visit after paying almost what I could have bought a weeks worth a groceries with. The food tastes great but make it worth our value in rewards as well.

name: James Green
text: The food was delicious! Had the Chili burger and BLT. Both hit the spot. Curly fries and lemonade were A1!

name: Whitney Knight
text: We had the BLT and it was soooo good! We’ve eaten vegan for a couple of years now, and this was the first time I’ve had bacon that tasted like bacon! With the waffle fries and delicious drink, I couldn’t have been happier! I literally did a happy dance eating in my car! Thanks and we’ll definitely be back!

name: Brittany Huntley
text: The food and customer service was worth hour drive. The Boss chips was amazing, the cookies to drool over. The burger! Didn't make it to my house. My new favorite vegan restaurant!

name: Joli Moffitt
text: Today was my first experience with BOV ...I am sure it won't be my last!!! We tried the burgers, " chicken" salad, chips, fries, cc cookies and the Lemonade.... WOW!!! All so good!! The staff is so friendly and awesome, like they made the food with love!! Very recommended!! Thanks for feeding us such good food and vibes!

name: Denise McKoy
text: The fact that everything is plant base is baffling! The grilled onions, on Hawaiian buns with the vegan patties. The patties tasted just like beef hamburger patties. The topper was their specialty sauce. Then their chips was sweet and salty. This place was a great experience. The next time I will take a picture. I demolished my food.

name: Ronald Hannah
text: I'm just getting into vegan food. I get the 2 for 10 BLTs on the Hawaii bread w/ their chips. They are great and gotta get the boss sauce. Im sold and might try their burger next time.  That Lemonade though. I'll be back

name: Justice 7
text: Three words... "Best vegan burgers" in the city. Ok that's 6 words but the food is delicious. The boss dipping sauce will have you taste buds dancing. I have a co-worker who is not vegan or vegetarian ordering food from there twice a week. Also Boss Vegan is very inexpensive compared to others vegan places in my opinion. You will not be disappointed.

name: Charnel Mobley
text: I had the Boss burger deluxe! SOOO GOOD! First time ordering and the food was great! Didn't know vegan burgers could taste this good! And to top it off he gave me complimentary lemonade!! DELICIOUS!! Will definitely be back..you have a repeat customer! Thank you!!

name: Matthew Schwiebert
text: Best plant based burgers we've ever had. We went for the first time yesterday and immediately came back the next day. Nice big satisfying juicy sloppy burgers. Some people in the reviews complaining how it's not healthy. It's not supposed to be healthy, it's plant based junk food at its finest!

text: I have tried to go to this store 2 times over the last 2 months. I typically go around my lunch time at work. Between 12- 2. For some reason, every time I go the person in the store is away. Probably at lunch. The always leave the same sign 'be back in so many minutes'. The problem with the sign, you never know if they just left or is almost ready to return? Time is based on when they left which I have no clue about. So frustrating!

name: Dominique Dunn
text: An owner response on a 3 star rating.....ok. I see worse with no owner replies. Not sure of why my shipping dates and shipper information is pertinent to be published. Regardless of taking 11 days to send a parcel that was suppose to take 3 like I said over the phone I am glad it finally reached its destination.

resp.text:
Dominique Dunn shipped her package on January 3rd and it was delivered on January 14th. Dominique selected to ship her package via USPS (not UPS). Her shipment did not show any movement until 7 days later. Unfortunately this happens with some USPS shipments. USPS customer service always tell customers they did not pick up their package, making customers feel we are responsible. I'm happy that Dominique's shipment did get to its destination.

Sincerely,

The UPS Store Management

text: Consistently great service.  Very patient and accommodating.  Been going for years. Love them.

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback and being a great customer.

name: Tracie “that VanB girl” VanBuren
text:
I called to learn more about the USPS versus UPS services.  As I business owner, I use mail services several times a week and wanted to patron businesses in my local area (I even communicated that to Lilly).  Lilly was extremely impatient, unprofessional.  In speaking she would repeatedly cut me off, asking if what she said "was clear" sighing loudly with apparent disinterest in providing service.

With so many businesses competing for loyal customers, business providers would do well to remember that your customers are your business.

Everyone there has made me a satisfied customer since 2007. I have not been disappointed at all.
Thank you.

text: I use this store all the time for my business and personal shipping needs. The customer service people there are always friendly and courteous. I have never had a bad experience while shipping something as they always get it right the first time.

text: Couldn't ask for a better store. Had to ship an exchange of an item back with a preprinted shipping label. Didn't have tape at home, she asked if i had fifty cents, their fee, and I asked "could I debit it"? She said dont worry about it, and packed my box up with a nice sticky label bag to protect my preprinted. Ending up buying a 2 pack of bright pink sharpies so I could pay for the taping up :) Great store will go back

text: What a great find!! Wasn't sure what I was wanting for lunch, but ended up having the banana acai bowl and it was fantastic! The owner was so great. Definitely will be going back soon😁😁😁

text: Love it! Amazing smoothies and you can get Painted Skull Edibles there! Delta 8 rules!

name: Andy Thuan
text: Went here with my fiancée during the midwood market event last weekend. I got the simple strawberry banana smoothie and one of the employees suggested honey in it as a sweetener and that was a great decision. The staff was very kind and knowledgeable to us since it was our first time. You definitely get great, healthy smoothies here compared to Smoothie King which can be loaded with sugar. I would definitely recommend Smooth Monkey to anybody. Location is also very convenient to the city so you have great options after you leave here.

name: Monique Hearne
text: Absolutely love this place. They have so many smoothie options, it's unbelievable. They also have acai bowls along with other fruit bowls.  They also use fresh everything. There's no ice or syrup which i love. They also have ice cream and cbd products. And get this, they even have cbd treats and regular tests for your dog. I will be going back and making this s regular thing.

name: Lawanda Chestnut
text: My Acai bowl was really good along with the great customer service. I went to another spot the next day uptown for a bowl and was sooooo disappointed. Should have just taken the drive back to smooth monkey

text: Amazing service, delicious smoothies, fresh products pet friendly, all around great place!!! Would definitely visit again when in the area.

name: Andrea Singer
text: I thought leaving CA I would never find another place to get an Acai Bowl where the acai mix didnt contain banana.  Well Smooth Monkey is my new favorite place.  They do other things like smoothies and ice cream but my favorite is the acai bowl and they have just about every fruit and topping you can imagine.

text: Funky vibes in this cool smoothie shop in the heart of Midwood. Large variety in the menu. Friendly staff. Parking available in a small lot. Smoothie was pretty good, but a bit expensive based on sizes provided in ounces. Other than that, neat spot.

text: Delicious smoothies.  The girl working was super nice and very informative on the different  add ins smooth monkey had to offer.  Will definitely be back.

text: Deliciously yummy! I inhaled my strawberry banana shake! The place has a super funky vibe and decor. Parking was a pain when I got there, but there are plenty of spots it just seemed like there was a lot of businesses in the area. The guy that worked behind the counter seemed knowledgeable about the ingredients, their products and recommendations. I’ve only been once, but definitely will be going back. Its a perfect snack or make a meal out of it. Love the name too!

text: INCREDIBLE smoothies! They Blend Fresh Fruit on the spot! They offer Punch Cards for frequent customers!

text: My açaí bowl was pretty good and the fruit was very fresh. The store itself is cluttered and junky looking and the employee wasn’t very friendly.

text: First time here, great friendly service. And the smoothie (called youthful glow), really good. Will definitely come back soon.

text: This place is great!!! The fruit is fresh and what you order is made right in front of you.  I ordered a small acai berry bowl. It was big enough for breakfast and a snack later.  I took a power pack to go it was chia, flax and hemp seeds only $1 for the boost to any smoothie.   Best thing ever they have a reward system and it only takes 7 visits.

text: After driving by Spoons and finding they weren’t there we were excited to finally try Smooth Monkey. Not the best idea probably should have looked up there hours first because our first experience was very rushed and quality was not the best. We walked in 10mins til close and wish we would have just been told to come back another time. I’m used to getting more açaí, the granola was soft and we watched as our mangos didn’t get the skin cut off of them. The skin made it tough to enjoy and already disappointing bowl. $20 wasted. Not sure if we’ll be back after that.

name: M B
text:
6/11/2018
I had the small bowl, white rice, salmon, spicy tuna, edamame, corn, seaweed salad, avocado,imitation crab, and their light sesame oil.  The fish is raw for anyone that doesn’t realize that.  I was hesitant to try this place but was in the area.

The seaweed salad tasted strange so I did not finish eating it.  The salmon and tuna tasted fine.  The only thing that worries me is how long that fish has been sitting out.  I probably wouldn’t go back despite the good ratings this place has.  The inside of the place wasn’t clean.

I paid $12 and it included a soft drink.  They charge an extra $1 for avocado which was four thin pieces.

resp.text:
MB,

Sorry your meal was anything less than perfect. Poke is served as raw fish all over the world but we do offer a few cooked items such as octopus, tofu and shrimp. We have fresh fish delivered 6 days a week so the fish you are consuming is as fresh as it gets. We hope you will reconsider and give us another chance.

name: Casey Conner
text: Excellent 👍 the staff was awesome and the food was wonderful!

name: gayle valentine
text: I ordered via Uber Eats today, and as an avid lover of sushi I wanted to try some poke. I got the Hawaiian sushi burrito and I wish I took a picture of it it was a thing of beauty! Tasted so good with fresh ingredients and a side of sweet tasty seaweed salad! So good I'm gonna get one again really soon. Thanks!

name: Kisha Bibb
text: My first experience with a poke bowl was in LA.  I loved it.  The Poke Bar does a good job of the proteins.  I will admit there are several differences in my first introduction and NC.  The first difference is the size of the bowl. The second is the proteins.  The third is there are no noodles.  The fourth being the temperature.  Finally, the mix ins and sauce.  I look forward to them taking this concept and researching the real Poke experience.  Once they do this I could give it a 5 star rating.

name: MaLinda Balcom
text: I was excited to try something with new.  The food was tasty and of good quality.  But the Customer service wasn't the best for our first visit.  My husband and I stated this was our first visit, and the staff didn't offer any recommendations except to look at a sign for recommended sauce combinations.

name: Josh Madsen
text: Staff has always been very friendly and the food has always been cold and fresh - which is what I look for in this kind of food. Every time I have eaten there I have had the protein served on salad/spring mix and it really makes for a nice light meal - even when 4 proteins.  Like the house sauce and the spicy mayo mixed.  Seaweed salad was yummy and I love the crispy onions.  My office is near by and I love being able to walk to grab some lunch - which means I also hope that this restaurant has the staying power... May not be a bad idea to have a more aggressive rewards program or a lunch special.  Unfortunately not everyone will be up for a 13.00 poke plate --- just something to think about.  Wish you guys the best as you continue to serve the neighborhood very fresh and tasty food.

name: Kenzi Aurora
text: One of my favorite places to eat. Very fresh

name: Melanie E
text: The food is fresh and tasty.  The staff is helpful and professional.  I like the music they play.

name: Keydra 1979
text: 1st time there and bowl was awesome. Marquis was a great help as well with walking me through process!! Nice, clean restaurant!! Will go visit again!!! 😊😊😊

name: Kirill Zemlyanskiy
text: Super fast, and delicious. Got the medium bowl and it was more than enough. I wish there were more of these around.

name: Aka Alias
text: The cashier Daniel is so rude. He has no patience for new customers. There was no one in line so I’m confused as to why he was rushing the order like there was a dinner rush. He didn’t ask me if I wanted a drink he just swiped the car and got away from the register as soon as possible. Of course he didn’t say have a great evening. I’ll definitely just go to a different poke restaurant there’s plenty in Charlotte.

resp.text: Hi Alicia! We want to apologize for your most recent experience and we would love to speak with you directly. Please give us a call at 803-981-2245.

name: Whitney J
text:
Poke Bar vs Seoul Poke
If Seoul Poke were 2 Miles closer, I’d visit more often due to the fact they offer fruit toppings (i.e. mango) and Poke Bar does not. So please, Poke Bar, start offering mango as a topping 🙏🏽 Portion sizes are good, 3 toppings for $10.95 is a bargain. I’ll be going back soon, hopefully to find mango as an additional offering 🙂

resp.text: Hi Whitney! We will be offering Mango as a seasonal summertime topping. We are going to do our best to swap it up as often as possible! Thanks for the rating and comment! :)
