A good poke bowl is about more than just fresh fish, the sides in the bowl should be good as well. I'll probably stick with the other Poke place near Uptown for my next Poke experience.

text: Fouad and his stay are wonderful.  They treated me like family and I know where I will continue to come for hookah and tea from now on.

name: Anthony Kiev
text:
We came to Babylon from 3 hrs away, looking for a chill hookah lounge. When we arrived it was the absolute complete opposite. This place was basically a hood club in downtown Charlotte. This is nothing against the owner because these trying times make that money. But a $30 entry fee per person is extremely steep. However, the place was packed so obviously the demand was there.

The owner stopped us as we walked away and offered for us a discounted price which was appreciated. The owners son allowed us to view the lounge prior to paying, which we appreciated.

My only complaint is the misleading name of the place. It should be called Babylon Night Club offering hookah. Even nightclub is a stretch because it is so packed that nobody is dancing.

Lastly these are COVID times and the place was beyond over packed for Occupancy Space according to the city, COVID restrictions, and no face masks.

text: I came to Babylon Hookah Lounge upon reading the reviews. Totally disappointed, I was the only person there and the young guy brought the hookah and didn’t bother coming after! I had to go to the DJ Booth every time I needed something👎🏻👎🏻 hopefully they improve their customer service.

text: Anytime I’m there it could be a zoo in there-but they have an approach that gets you in and out quickly! Love it!

resp.text: Hi Danielle, thank you for your feedback and for choosing Circle K!

name: Lane Chrismon
text:
I won't go here any more. This station is near my office and it used to be good. Ever since the old manager left things have gone to s***. Most of the employees have turned over as well, and the only good one left is Juanita.

I won't complain about the customers or the area because that's not in their control (my coworker had his car stolen in the parking lot). The employees are subpar even for gas station standards. Some are rude and some just clearly don't care.

One or more of the gas pumps is always broken. There is rarely receipt paper in the pumps outside, which means you have to go in if you need it. If you're lucky, there won't be a 10-person line at the time (but there usually is, meanwhile there will be an employee outside smoking a cigarette). Today, they didn't even have the proper receipt paper so the whole right side was cut off. The most important part, total paid, was cut off so what's the use?

I'm very disappointed in this store. I used to come here every morning for coffee and gas but now I avoid it as much as possible.

resp.text: Hi there, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience. We have passed on your message to our local management team.

name: Mitch Promin
text: Unprofessionalism on display, I only stop here to get Gas because you can get right on 485 easily. Ghetto music.  People too busy to ring you up correctly.  I'm stopping somewhere else in the morning.  They need to change the "hood" atmosphere.

resp.text: Hi Mitch, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience. We have passed on your message to our local management team.

text: Worst experience ever at Jimmy John's.  Place an online order for delivery and order was 20 minutes late.  Okay no worry I know that happens at restaurants all the time,  but the worst part was when the delivery person called me and said he could not locate me and I explained to him where the building was which was right across the hall.  He decided to leave my food in the wrong building.  Somebody walk my food over to find out who the person was.  Never allow me to sign my receipt didn't care if I receive my food. Call the store that complain about what happened was put on hold when I ask for manager by employee, which sounded like the same person who delivered the order.  No one came to the phone.  Call back 20 minutes later actually talk to a manager who handled the situation, by refunding ny money.  Never Again!!

text: Fantastic bottle shop!!! The owner Doug is a frickin great guy who can also put together a beautiful flower arrangement for you while you drink your brews!!! Highly recommend this spot for all your beer and flower needs!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your experience! We truly do aim to please! Be well and hope to see you back soon! -Doug & Ben

name: Stephen Valder
text:
This was my first visit to this relatively new place in my neighborhood.  I had seen inside the building before it was renovated.
They did a great job. It is very comfortable, the music playing added to the experience without being intrusive. Conversations were easy to have.
I look forward to coming back many times.
My only hesitation is that the price point is a bit high for this frugal old guy. But for the times I want a variety of quality beers this will be a good spot.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Stephen! We hear you on the price point, and we'll continue to work on our offerings to have something for everybody (also, we've got a special going on right now with select craft beer cans for $3!) Look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Ryan Mcclinton
text: Cool little bottle shop.. staff was friendly but prices were too high compared to other places. Hope it works out for them though

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback, Ryan! We have only been open a couple of months so pricing is still a work in progress. Our draft list rotates frequently so it's harder to maintain a consistent price range, but our can options go as low as $3.50! Hope you'll come by to try us again soon.

name: Ryan Mcclinton

name: Bobby Arkus
text: Make sure you keep track of what you're drinking and the price per. We've been in twice and the final tab has had extra charges

resp.text: Hey Bobby, sorry about that. We looked in our system by last name and it appears your last visit was actually 2/20/2021, unless you visited with a friend recently under a different tab name. Let us know which items were added in error and we'd be happy to refund you. Text or call us at 704-966-7297, or email us at bloomandbottle@gmail.com. If you are looking for alternative experiences... Bart's Mart kills it, Tip Top is great, and of course Hop Shop, Pop the Top and the infamous Salud! I'm sure you'll find a favorite. Much love bro!

text: in the parking lot of a gas station. the food was quick within 10 minutes and tastes AMAZING. definitely highly recommend this and you should check out the gas station too. tons of variety of drinks from Asian to Hispanici items.

name: Kevin Garcia
text: I like the Alambre with green and red sauce but the other meals I've ordered from here are pretty bland. I got a steak burrito and there were no flavors that stood out to me. It is very conviently placed in front of a tire shop. Unless I'm getting the Alambre (pork, steak, and chorizo topped with mozzarella cheese, cilantro, and onion) I would go somewhere else, and there are many options within a one mile radius.

name: Meya P
text:
I'd had really high hopes in checking this place out, based on the previous high ratings and reviews. I got the Nachos Surpreme and a steak burrito. The nachos (looks amazing in the pic, don't they???) were decent -- nothing to really write home about -- and I wasn't too much feeling the burrito. Tasted surprisingly bland. Also, customer service was meh -- the folks there don't seem to be the friendliest bunch! I even had to ask what my total was when he took my card for the payment, and then he gave it back without any sort of official conclusion to the transaction (no "thank you," "please sign here," "here's your receipt," "would you like a receipt," etc.). I had to ask him a few times to confirm what the amount had been, making a mental note to confirm it on my bank statement later. Not ideal. Granted, I normally don't necessarily "need" a receipt, but some sort of visual indication and confirmation of the price -- or at the very least, his voluntary verbal confirmation, to where I wouldn't have to ask -- would've been nice!!

Overall, not the greatest experience or journey worth driving cross-town for (I'd searched for "the best Mexican food in Charlotte", and this was one with seemingly the highest ratings that came up, so I took a chance). Next time, I'll just stick to somewhere closer to home or go to Taco Bell.

name: Michael Germanovich
text: Don’t know if they’re THE best tacos in Charlotte, but they definitely come pretty dang close! Delicious, and the chicken/pollo is always juicy

name: Scott Berenyi
text:
Oh brother the negative reviews kill me. Customer service?  What do you expect?
It’s a trailer at a gas station that makes pretty amazing tacos. I have never had a bad meal or bad service. They are nice folks that welcome your business.

I am from Arizona and fly to Mexico and South America a lot.  I eat plenty of this type food and this is authentic. They do a really good job.

If you think it’s bland then maybe you should check out how much salt Chipotle and Taco Bell put in their food.  They puts tons of salt in their food.

Que Bueno Locos Tacos!

Tacos de camarones es mí favorito.

¡MUY DELICIOSO!

text: Food was absolutely excellent! We took a bite of our party tacos in the car before we pulled from the lot & got back it to get a few more additional items because it was just that good! We got the shrimp, carne asada and chicken tacos, the burrito and fajitas! The sauces were delicate and EVERYTHING was FRESH! Next time I'm in Charlotte, we'll be back!

UPDATE: NO MI GUSTA LA COMIDA HOY. NO BUENA! QUIENE COCINA HOY!???? MUCHO SALT!!!!!!!!!!!

They have the best asada in north carolina. I always order 3 steak asada tacos and churros. Lol i have eaten at a lot of mexican places in my life. Trust me. Its good! Its addictive. I didn't like their nachos one time. Their tacos are the real deal-

*****the steak gordita is good as well

name: Malave Co
text: This street tacos stand is one of the best I've had. I've had their lengua, asada, al pastor, and shrimp. All very good and tasty. Double tortilla with plenty of meat, dressed with onions and cilantro. They do not put salt package on your bag, so make sure that you grab it off of the counter. It comes with some radishes, a slice of cucumber, lime,  and some salsa. They do not have beverages as the patron gas station wants to sell their products.

name: Mark Thornton
text: Grabbed lunch here and the room was excellent.  Authentic Thai food, and absolutely delicious —nice and spicy.  Efficient service and polite staff.  Easy parking right outside.

name: Yu-Hsien Ho
text: Had been meaning to hit up monsoon for a while now. I love Thai food and had more than 3 people recommend this place to me. Came here for lunch. Their lunch prices arent that bad varying from 9 to 13 bucks and you get your main dish, rice, soup, spring roll, and ice tea. I ordered the #8 with a seafood mixture. The food was flavorful and not suoer spicy even though i pucked 3 hot. Service was a bit on the slowside and they forgot my spring roll as you can see in the pic. Would recommend.

name: Michelle W.
text: We are new to Southend. We really like Thai food and thought we would try Monsoon. I was not expecting the intricate wood work or decorations inside this restaurant. They had a few beer specials while we were there. The food is a was good but we have found another Thai place in the general area that we prefer.

name: PrettynPearls and RJ
text:
I loved the food. I have been there twice in one week and got take out. Even though the food is really good, I will not go back because they give you these Styrofoam take our containers with dividers in it. I can understand if you had several different items, but when you get a noodle dish it is very aggravating. When you eat it your utinsil hits the divider in the plate. Why would they use such containers ?
I was told about this place by one of my riders. I am an Uber driver. I hope they change the type of container so I can keep getting take out. I am also good advertisement, or bad advertisement.
I hope I get a response from the owner.

name: Nicholas Becker
text:
Three words for you-  Pla Chu Chee!   It is a fish dish with rice and vegetables.  The fish is tempura fried and the vegetables come in Thai coconut curry, seasoned with lime leaf and lemongrass.  Amazing!  The Pad Thai is decent, but not what I come here for.  The owner is wonderful and outgoing.  A great place to come for a fun atmosphere.  Ingredients are impeccably fresh, always!

Warning-  Thai spicy here really means Thai spicy.  If you like spicy food considered ordering it for 2 stars.  5 stars will put you in the hospital here. LOL.  4 stars is enough to burn your taste buds but release more endorphin than your brain currently has on reserve.  3 stars is adequate enough for serious spice junkies.  Fresh thai chilis

name: Anastasia Prapas
text: I went in to get some snacks for my furry friends. I was greeted by a lovely staff member. She helped me get 1 lb bags of various dog foods so we could see which my dogs preferred. She explained that the dry food is made about 2-3 hours away and is about 1 month old vs much of the dog food that is bought commercially is about 1 year old. The shop has great specially leashes and snacks. My pups loved their treats.

text: Really high quality foods/treats. Super friendly staff too

resp.text: Dylan, we appreciate the positive feedback!

name: Kyle Ray
text: Our favorite store for pet supplies. We’ve been buying food for our two miniature schnauzers here since they opened. Betty and Chloe are picky, but they love the taste and always get excited at dinner time. Last week, we accidentally purchased cat food instead of dog food. I reached out to Pet Wants to make sure it would be okay for my dogs to eat, and - that same day - they delivered some dog food to replace what we purchased. Amazing! We were already loyal customers but this just sealed the deal.

name: Jess Wilson
text:
Although this place does definitely have a limited selection for cats, the things that they do carry seem to be relatively high quality, especially if you have a dog. Unfortunately I don't, but that doesn't mean they deserve any less stars as a result.
I asked the person behind the register If they carried cat litter boxes, and was a little surprised to find that they don't. However, she mentioned that she will bring this up with the person responsible for inventory.

text: This cute little place feels like a welcoming place. Staff is friendly and caring as well as their fresh food and treats. Only thing I could say treats can be expensive depending on the one you are getting. It could be nicer if it would be more affordable so I could purchase more often. Other than that nice place.

text: Awesome staff and great quality products! Our dog loves the food. He also enjoys the little treat we get with each order. The free local delivery is awesome and very quick. Most of the time we get our orders next day.

text: Awesome wholesome dog food store with FREE DELIVERY!! Plus a fairly wide selection of gourmet and organic dog treats and bones. They have a super cute dog play area outside of the store as well. Will definitely be back!

text: My pups were having all kinds of allergies and weight issues until we put them on pet wants food. We are very pleased with how well our dogs have thrived. Highly recommend!!!

name: Sarah Anderson
text: Pet parents, have you considered trading your name brand pet food for a local alternative? I have been using Pet Wants for about 6 months now and will never go back to store bought food for my pup. It's more dense than store-bought so your pet doesn't need as large of a portion they would normally eat. [A 5 pound bag literally lasted me 90 days at 2 meals per day.] It's an honest product and best of all, is not tied to a corporation! Pet Wants is healthy and affordable option for you and your four-legged family member!  They ship all over and if you live in Charlotte, they HAND DELIVER the product to your work, home or doggy daycare! <3 #supportlocalbusiness

name: Lindsey Carrick
text:
Great food.  The Mac n cheese was delicious the only thing was that the cheese was runny so it could get messy to eat.

Had the fried chicken sandwich and really enjoyed it with the toppings it came with.

Also had the apple pudding cobbler which was my favorite part of the meal so good!

Came on a Sunday night and the place wasn’t too busy around 6 for dinner.  Had a few flat screens all around the location with the NFL games on.  It’s not very big inside but had booths, spots at the bar and tall tables.

text: First visit. Over to see our son, so thought we would try as menu looked good. We were not  let down. Staff really helpful, 3 of us had the pork and it was delicious. Tuesday night half price wine, so great night . Next time we are over from the UK we will be visiting again. Cheers.

name: Shelby Dupree
text: My first time at Turnhouse Grille was great! Its located on the first floor of the shopping center. I could smell the food walking down the stairs before even reaching the door. I was highly satisfied from the service, to the drinks,  to the food. Their instagram page gives a great insight to the items on their menu (I loved the shrimp burger). I will definitely be back.

name: David Knott
text: While the price is about right for the food, I just expected a little more attention to detail given this isn't a chain. The interior we fine but the tables were a little crowded and definitely has a bit of a sports bar atmosphere due to the plethora of TVs. Outdoor seating is outstanding. The hand-pattied burger was tasty but not cooked to my ordered temp of med rare. The lobster and shrimp with asparagus pasta special had overcooked, slightly chewy lobster and only had a single stalk of asparagus at most. Wine menu was more than adequate at reasonable prices, and while service was attentive, a part of our order was missed entirely. Overall, we had a good experience but left wanting more.

name: Constance Haske
text: Great food. Straight up delicious. The menu isn't very big, but that's OK. Scallops we're on point. Only thing I wouldn't do - the kids pizza is really more of a tiny flat bread. If your kid has any appetite at all, it won't be enough. Otherwise, great atmosphere, excellent drinks and food.

name: Saige Irlacher
text: Wonderful all around.  Great service and food is even better.  Eat here every chance you get.

name: Shane Pierson
text: The French onion soup is always delicious, but I had the fried chicken sandwich today and it was AMAZING. I love this place.

name: Kristin Buhlert
text: Katie is your bartenders favorite bartender- fantastic handcrafted cocktails that have innovative ingredients but are fast enough to make that you aren't sitting, waiting. The food tastes great and is priced even better... but Katie is the real star. Awesome service and even better fare.

name: david turner
text:
I came here for brunch with a friend on Sunday afternoon. It was fairly dark inside, and not crowded so we picked our own table. We ordered mimosas and a mango drink then ordered. It took a long time to get our food, but our waiter apologized and then bought our drinks for us, which was real nice.

I had the banana bread French toast and highly recommend it. The bread was sweet, with bananas on top and maple syrup. For my side I had the sweet potato hash. So. Yummy.  They had a great flavor, not sweet, but more of a spice and it was delicious. My friend had the monte cristo with cheese grits and I tried her grits. Creamy and delicious.

I saw the chicken biscuit go to a table near by as well as the burger and they both looked delicious, so I will definitely be back!

name: susan powell
text: Wonderful food, service and people. A gem tucked away. Had French onion soup today and the duck flatbread, layered w arugula and finished with a balsamic glaze. Going back for more French onion, the burger and brunch. Love Andy and John. It's the perfect spot for the neighborhood!

name: Ethan McConnell
text: This is at least a monthly spot for my wife and I. Great food and drinks. Outside dining in the summer is nice too. Burger, Pork chop, wings and beef short ribs are my favorite!

name: J C
text: Pricey, but great drinks and very good food.  Staff are friendly.  Ordered the burger on special for $5 which was a great deal for an awesome sandwich, but the $6 fries were disappointing.  Would still go again... just hold the soggy tater sticks:)

name: Chris Schenker
text: Great quality food! Bit pricey, but worth it if you're looking for quality.

name: Amy Everett
text: Great place! Amazing food! Best hidden gem in Charlotte!!!

name: Rod Smith
text: Amazing chicken sandwich special... Crazy Good.

name: Sean Brown
text: This food is definitely quality, the atmosphere is pretty chill, however we visited this place mid day,  and it was relatively slow.

name: R2O %
text: Nice place but it's super small inside

text: The food is out of this world. And your made to like your part of the family even first time customers

name: Richard Sterling
text: Good cocktails and tasty food. Relaxed atmosphere.

name: Jake
text: Cool spot. My burger was tasty.

name: Judd Pellow
text: Quaint ambience, cool atmosphere, good food.

name: Gwendione
text: I had the seared scallops... Amazing!

name: Bubholla Hollabub
text: Top 5 burgers I've had in Charlotte!

name: Andy West
text: Fried chicken sandwich was fantastic!

name: James Swanson
text: Great food.

name: Alex Allen
text: Amanda helped me get an old receipt with the most positive, professional attitude! I was expecting some delay or reason why the receipt couldn't be found, but she looked it up on the spot and was so kind and refreshing. Great great experience with this restaurant. Not to mention... DELICIOUS FOOD! My company orders lunch from Gusto's on occasion and I have never been unhappy with anything I've tried! Highly recommend this restaurant!

name: Barbi Gearhart
text: Best cauliflower crust pizza I ever had. It tasted just like regular only better! Seriously good food!

name: Tonya Cruz
text: First off, I have to say I was surprised to drive up and realize this was in the food court of Southpark Mall. I got the impression from the website that it was a sit down restaurant. Despite that, I was pleased with the healthy options they offered. I had the whole grain pizza crust, as well as the daiya vegan cheese. So happy they have vegan options since I am allergic to dairy. They had some great veggie choices for the pizza, my favorite being the roasted Butternut squash. So good. They also have tofu as a protein option, although I found it to be a little salty. Overall, the pizza was fairly good, but if you're looking for a romantic dinner, get take out and find a park to eat at!

name: Kay Jay
text: Service could be a little better but that wild shrooms pizza is the truth!!!! 😋 I didn't catch names but the guy working this afternoon was cool, but the females seemed like they didn't  want to be there. I won't let them stop me from enjoying good  food, so I'd definitely return.

name: Tracy Landrum
text: Good eats. Fresh ingredients and they have a cauliflower crust pizza option. Have used their catering services and their boxed lunches with the chicken and focaccia bread sandwiches are a big hit.

name: Adam Forrester
text: We weren't expecting good quality food at the mall but this place left us wishing there was a Gusto in South Carolina!  We took a simple salad and a pizza of which there are three bases to choose including a vegtable based gluten free one.  They were excellent. Truly excellent fresh food.  If you visit South Park around lunch be sure to try this place next time.

name: Saravanan Ram
text: Not a typical pizza place. They serve your pizza on cauliflower crust. It was awesome and tasted great. We also ordered a guacamole salad, which was kind of okay. The ingredients used were not so fresh in the salad. Would definitely revisit the place for the pizza though.

name: Veronica Hall-Lake
text: This was my first time and it is now my new favorite place! I wish I had taken a picture of my Devil's Wing pizza made with a cauliflower crust before I devoured it! Delicious !!!!

name: Timothy Gosey
text: Awesome food and nonalcoholic beverages.  Super healthy.

name: Jody Stamper
text: We eat here as it was part of the food court at South Park Mall. My wife got the devils wings pizza. It was absolutely fantastic. You should definitely try this place. It really surprised us.

name: Diwakar Viswanathan
text: #pizzaplace with a different, you can choose cauliflower crust in addition to the regular flour crust. Fresh ingredients to choose from. Tastes good and healthy too. They got a variety of salads too. Must try their cauliflower crust !

name: Lindsey Herr-Borkowski
text: Love the salads and the employees are always quick and nice.

name: Hillary Williams
text: Love the food! Only place we the cauliflower crust and Dayia. Wish it was outside the mall! Attitudes could be better but at least the food is good 😁

name: Jessica Tugman
text: This was a very fun and earthy place to go to. I love the concept and the quality and freshness of the food. I opted for the lunch special which consisted of half a pizza, salad, and a drink🥤 for only $8.95! I chose to get the Local farmers salad 🥗 (spring mix, strawberries,roasted corn, spiced pecans, avocado & feta cheese- tossed in a house made lemon basil dressing) and the Farmers Wife pizza 🍕  (house pizza sauce, cherry tomatoes, basil leaves, fontina, mozzarella cheese with baby arugula and a basil pesto drizzle)! The food was amazingly delicious🤤, fresh, cooked to perfection and clearly made with love. The pizza was really good, nice consistency and crunch, good balance of flavors with the ingredients (especially for wood fire style), light yet filling. The salad was delish, simple but with a bang! I would definitely recommend this place to others and I will gladly be back😋!!

name: madhumitha sundar
text: Horrible service. Waiter was impatient to close up and didn't take out orders properly. Wouldnt go again.

And the shrimp egg fo young was so flat I could almost see through it. I moved to another part of town and use to frequent this location when I lived in the area. Needless to say when I got home I was stuck with 27.00 worth of disappointment

text: This place was excellent.  I wish I would’ve taken a picture of the shrimp la mien I ordered for about $10.  It was cooked perfect and they have a heavy proportion. I ordered it in 10 min advanced and they had it ready in 7 minutes.

name: LaQuinta Taylor
text: The cleanliness of this take out place is amazing!! The food is very good. My vegetables are always very fresh and not soft or over cooked like some of Chinese  resturants. The prices are very affordable, which is always a plus  The staff are not super nice, but I believe it's more of a cultural difference than a disrespect thing. My food is always hot, delicious, affordable and prompt; so it doesn't bother me too much.

text: First time there,food was pretty good and price was fine.didn'thave the wings but theywere big and looked very tasty

text: Food was good, but could have been a little better. Also, there could of been more sugar on my donuts, but I guess that's on me for not checking my food. This place is alright overall, not bad.

text: Clean oil!! Yup fresh clean oil in the fryer. After 3 visits we have concluded that they have the best and cleanest fried food around.  NYer here, they have awesome eggrolls! Red pork and tons of cabbage!!! They deliver too!!

text: I'm from N.Y. 1960s Chinatowns food. Nowadays the food is prepared for Americans' bland tastebuds.  In those days the yellow hot mustard burned our tongues and sinuses.   Now the mustard is far from hot and spicy. Chin Chin food is ok.  I just hate the loss of nicely spiced Chinese food.

text: This is a great Subway location. They have a nice and friendly staff who are always glad to help their customers. If you are a frequent customer they always know exactly what you want, but will check with you just to be sure. You can always count on their tea to be fresh and the restaurant to be clean. If you want service with a smile and to know that you are getting fresh food then you can't go wrong with this Subway.

Have had absolutely no serving size issues with any of the other area locations who are always more than willing to accommodate customers. We will take our business elsewhere to where the management is less rude.

text: This is an ok place if you are bored of our very limited options here in Whitehall. The food is mediocre at best. The noodles-all noodles-are always mushy. The penne, spaghetti, lo mein-all are mushy. Nothing ruins a dish more than mushy noodles. I've been here 4 times since it has opened both during the day and during the evening. None of the dishes have a lot of flavor. Price and atmosphere is ok and the kids meals are pretty decent. I miss Nothing But Noodles. They are 100xs better than this place.

I was very impressed by all the flavors in each item that we tried!
The pupusas were fantastic!!
The carne guisada was spectacular un sabor tan sabroso!!
Great customer service.

name: Amber Cornell
text:
Wow wow wow 😍 So good! It was my first time trying pupusas but my boyfriend has had a bunch and we were both so impressed. We got the chicken one and the pork one. We liked the pork better, but again, both were fantastic! Will add Pupusa 503 to our favorite foods list!!
Everybody was super friendly and little Donovan was such a hard worker!

name: Jeffrey Lizama PT
text: Just amazing! Great service, Amazing food. Authentic Salvadoran food! You will find that they have food options for every diet. They have really good tamales and their Salvadoran horchata was tasty. Definitely go there and try it for yourself!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review! We are thrilled you enjoyed your experience and food. We can't wait to serve you again!

name: Jenna Kilo
text: Simply out of this world!! Pupusas are perfectly moist and flavorful while still remaining intact structurally. Many vegetarian and vegan options. My kids had the chicken and cheese, and I had the mixed vegetables and cheese, zucchini and cheese, and garlic and cheeee. Perfectly filled (just the right balance of filling and shell) and the dipping sauce is next level. Very nice restaurant. We ordered take out, and the owner was very friendly and helpful, and the place was very clean and nicely decorated. Absolutely delicious pupusas. Can't wait to try the other items on their menu!!!

resp.text: Infinite thanks! It was so nice meeting you! We can't wait to have you again!

name: Angel Valladares
text: Great food, place and experience! I made a big order and it was done quickly deliciously. The owner and everyone that work  there are great!

resp.text: Thank you Angel, we truly appreciate your support! We are glad to hear you enjoyed everything and we cannot wait to serve you again!

name: Bunny
text: Food is very delicious! Just service is very slow, so plan accordingly. 30+ wait for one order. But at least food is tasty, beats going to central Ave.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Bunny! We are so happy you enjoyed your food. The wait time is something we are definitely working on! During peak hours the wait time does fluctuate! We will definitely communicate to our customers an estimate so they can plan accordingly. Thank you, we hope to serve you again soon.

name: Tyler Goodrich
text: Outstanding new restaurant. I spent several years in El salvador so I know what good pupusas taste like and these were very good. Menus were very easy to follow and restaurant is well organized, decorated nicely and super clean. What really stood out was the service. Everyone took the time to make it a personalized experience and all the workers were super friendly. I ordered to go and everything was nicely packed and still hot and fresh to eat when I got home. If you've never tried pupusas this is the place to try!

resp.text: Tyler, thank you so much for your review! It means a lot to us and we strive everyday to be the best we can. We can't wait to have you again!

name: Roxana Artiga
text: Try the cebada its 😋 delicious also should try the horchata with coffee will not regret it.

resp.text: We agree, the cebada is so good! Thank you so much for your review Roxana! Hope to serve you soon!

name: Alfredo Perez
text: Best Pupusas un Charlotte by far! This amazing business represents the all salvadorean values and food!

resp.text: Thank you so much Alfredo! We hope to see and your family again!

resp.text: Thank you so much Bryon! It was our pleasure and are beyond happy it reminded you of home. We hope to serve you again!

name: Tashelle Monae
text: This is a small establishment where you order and take home. I love trying food around Charlotte and decided to try this place after the hubby drove by and seen the sign. The Louisiana aspect of it got his attention. We ordered 8 piece fried chicken combo box that came with 2 sides in which we chose red beans and rice as well as the corn fritters. It also came with 6 rolls. Okay I hate to say it but I have to be honest, the sides were not to my liking at all. As as someone who loves the red beans and rice from Popeye's as well as the homemade red beans and rice that my husband makes, this did not compare at all. They were very bland and dry. The corn fritters had potential but they didn't hit the spot either. Oh yeah the rolls tasted stale and we didn't even bother with those. Now on to the chicken. If you don't like spicy food it won't be for you. You can actually see the spices under the skin. I will admit the chicken was very flavorful and tasty. The skin was crispy and the meat itself was moist. Next time I visit I will be sure to only order a box of chicken without sides. I almost forgot, I ordered a Thai tea as well. You're probably thinking, what does Thai tea have to do with Louisiana Fried Chicken....absolutely nothing...but they have it and it was entirely too sweet.

name: Indigo Elo
text: My Husband enjoyed here.

name: Killa Thraxx
text:
I won't go back to this location but had a much better experience at the E. WT Harris location.

The chicken was ok (I ordered it to be fresh though) but the macaroni & cheese in ordered was horrible. no actual cheese. Pale elbow noodles with some funky white sauce. The other location has authentic mac.

Super cool staff.

Wouldn't go back to this location.

name: Davio Kanuri
text: This location is ultra convenient. The food is flavorful. My favorite has always been 3pcs of fried fish, fries and an eggroll. You can't go wrong. The rice however is a different story, because everyone makes rice different. I'm not here for that....cancel it! The chicken is decent, the fried okra is also decent, according to my friend.  I told the lady that they should start selling sandwiches, instead of just loose pieces of food. If they did  that,  their foot traffic would increase.

name: Ms KJ
text: It's pretty good 👍 I was actually surprised. After reading prior reviews, i went in and ordered only 1 leg and corn fritters, lol. Got in my car and planned to take a bite while driving off... But I had to sit still... That chicken was good. I'm not really a big fan of sweet stuff but the fritters were ok too. I went right back in and ordered 3 wings and more fritters. Considering the type of place it is I can honestly imagine them having their bad days, but gladly this wasn't one of them. I was starving that day, and i drove off happy. Outside of those 2 items I can't tell you much else, but the gumbo at least looked good.

name: Shawn Anthony
text: Great fish but chicken just ok. Don't get those fries or dirty rice, you'll just throw them away. Corn fritters are everyone's favorite

name: Jay Cecil
text:
My staff and I had this chicken for the first time on Saturday. This isn't just my opinion, it's a collective review of 12 people.
The highlight was the fried corn fritters and slaw. They were very good. If that was all our order consisted of this would be a 5 star review. We also received some of the dirty rice and mashed potatoes w/gravy. It wasn't bad, just very ordinary.
The chicken? Worst on earth. What's funny is that before today I didn't know this place also sold fried fish. Our staff came up with a collective description of what this terrible mess tasted like: day old bojangles dipped in way too much zatarain's spice and then re-fried in fish grease. Yes..fish grease! Which is undeniably what they must do!
Now you can tear a way at the overly charred outside to get to the plain ole chicken underneath. There is absolutely no seasoning in the meat, it is all in the crust. It then becomes a bit more edible, but not really worth the effort.
I have read some reviews of people who actually like this chicken. I really find that hard to believe. It must be the staff or friends trying to pull the rating it up. It is bad.
So if you go there order corn fritters and slaw. You wont be disappointed. If you get the chicken..well, you cant say you weren't warned.

Mango pineapple drink we could not sit down was so good and the Owner Sok was very sweet she engaged in conversation while waiting for food and she was very funny .They do also have Chinese food I can't speak on that yet but I'm definitely going back.

name: Jeremy Murfree
text:
My fiancee and I were excited to sample the cake flavors provided by Wow cakes. However we never made it to the tasting. The sample box did not include the flavors we wanted to taste and the bakery was unwilling to compromise to provide us with the samples we wanted. We could have paid an additional fee for the flavors we wanted, but it seemed as though we were being penalized for disliking the flavors in the tasting box. Definitely not a wowing experience.

Edit: We offered to pay more per cake sample. The box contains 5 samples for $20 ($4 per sample). We offered to pay $5 per sample (for the 2 we liked) and were still turned down. No discount would needed to be given.

resp.text:
Hi Jeremy,

We are very sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your experience with us.

At this time due to the pandemic and financial restrictions we are unable to offer the discount you asked for with the tasting box.

We understand that while you may not enjoy every flavor that is included in the box it is a set menu. We have also provided several other cake flavor combinations that are able to be purchased.

In good faith we suggested other bakeries that may be a good fit, as it is difficult for us to pursue a business relationship with a client who does not see the value in the products we sell.

Again, we are sorry we did not deliver to your service expectation and invite you to experience our cake at the same price our loyal customers do.

-	The Wow Factor Cakes Team

name: Brittney Derrick
text: I’ve worked with Lei Christine and Marianne for years and they are super friendly, professional, accommodating and go above and beyond for clients! Oh - and make show stopping cakes that taste really good too! 10/10 would highly recommend! ♥️

resp.text:
Hi Brittney!

Thank you a million times over for these kind compliments! Also, for being an amazing cheerleader for us and our small business.

- The Wow Factor Cakes Team

-- The Wow Factor Cakes Team

text:
Wonderful establishment for specialty cakes
Since I live out of the area. I conducted the entire order by email. We exchanged pictures  of a groomsman cake I surprised my son with at the rehearsal dinner. It was a hit, especially the vanilla cake layer with raspberry and white chocolate. Both layers made to look like 2 tires stuck in the mud! I would trust this business with any special event cake you need. Thank you WOW.

-- The WOW Factor Cakes Team

text: Called and ordered a custom Shrek cake and cupcakes cakes. Wow doesn't even describe the quality and over all experience. Will be back in six months for my new borns first birthday cake. Great flavor, great work. Shrek neverooked so good !!

resp.text: Hi Aaron!  Thanks so much for these kind words we truly loved working on this awesome Shrek cake and cupcakes! Hope Autumn had the best birthday!

name: Kevin Dahlquist
text: We knew right away that Amy at Wow Factor was a fit for our unconventional and ambitious wedding cake design when she didn't flinch at our crazy proposal- rather, she embraced the idea with enthusiasm and excitement!  Later- when the stand I helped fabricate as part of the design failed structurally, she came through again with her own alternative design and delivered a novel masterpiece that dropped everyone's jaws at the wedding!  On top of all that it was delicious!  I'm only sad that I don't plan on getting married more often!   Otherwise, I'd be using Amy each time!   :)

text: Discovered this place by accident and my taste buds were delighted!

We know this review is several years old, and just wanted to let you know we have been under new ownership since 2016. Let us know if we can be of assitance with any future cake orders.

text: I was addicted to these bagels for a few days. I bought the brisket with egg and requested the plain cream cheese instead of the jalapeno. So so yummy. resp.text: That's fantastic to hear, Michelle! You can always count on our team for quality, fresh bagels and excellent service. We hope to see you again soon!

text: I just came in for a door dash order and everything went smooth as it could. The food smelled delicious and the staff was very friendly especially (sage) hope I spelled it right she went above and beyond to make sure customers were satisfied. Even stopping to help clean a spill after a guy spilled half his drink on the table. her energy also brightened up my day I appreciate that. I've never ate here before but I will definitely come back to try it out. Thanks for the outstanding service

text: Do you want the best bagels in Charlotte burgers bagels is the best and they're always trying new things to bring the customer back in to enjoy another social comfortable relaxing atmosphere very clean friendly friendly customer service always there to please and give you exactly what you asked for you will never be disappointed Bruegger's Bagels the best bagels in Charlotte

text: I frequent the Cotswold Bruegger's Bagel store. The food and the service are both exceptional. You will be welcomed with friendly smiles and greetings by the staff. Many tasty cream cheese spreads available to enhance those yummy bagels. What something more? They have you covered with a large selection of oh so good sandwiches. Check them out if you haven't. I bet you will like Bruegger's as much as I do.

text: These bagels really are something else. A cheap and easy breakfast. The innovative piece of Brueggers is that they make both their own bagels and their own, different cream cheeses. I love the asiago cheese bagel with a nice chives and onion cream cheese spread, but the garlic bagel pairs well with almost anything. I would recommend seeing what flavors profiles you might like and then going for it with these great products!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We realize our fans pay a premium, but we’d like to think it’s worth it. Our ice cream has less air, and more high-quality ingredients we can believe in that are Fair Trade, non-GMO, and work to make the world a better place. We do our best to balance making the best possible product at reasonable prices. We hope you’ll continue being a fan!

They gave me pecan crumbs and very little m and m's. Also a order of cookie dough and chocolate ice cream. Once again two of the wrong flavors. The shake was  also not as good as it could of been.

resp.text: Hi Crystal.  I would like to investigate what happened with your order.  Please contact me at benandjerryscaters@gmail.com and let me know which delivery service you used.  Have you contacted them directly and requested a refund for the incorrect items?

name: John Christian Abrahamson
text: The Irish equivalent of Big Ben's. Delicious food, fair beer prices, really really good. We'll absolutely come back.

name: Julie Stevens
text:
Fantastic service! Very friendly staff!
I got the lunch special which gives you one main dish and a side. They serve from 11-5pm!!! And the special is only 10.00!
I selected the shepherds pie and the butter lettuce salad. The shepherds pie was a perfect size for me. Great taste. Full of mashed potatoes. Good flavor. If I had anything negative to say it would be that it wish it had more veggies and a little less mashed potatoes but I really can't complain. It was delicious. (I'm also sure that I'm the minority in that request ha!)
The butter salad was a great compliment (recommended to me by the manager and she was right!). Compared to the pie, it was super light. The homemade lemon vinaigrette was not heavy at all and gave just a touch of taste with the beets and carrots to make this salad awesome.
I also figured I'd have a glass of wine. Why not?! I was allowed to taste it (nice sized taste even) and then when I liked it, I was given a very nice pour. They'll take care of you here for sure!
This space is very nice. Pretty bar. Great tables and lots of space for a party, so you can bring your friends and have plenty of space. They take reservations as well so call ahead!
Four TV's had ESPN on and two had Irish type photos. I'm sure the other two are switched when it is busy. I visited at 4:30 on a Wednesday. Not a lot of people around at that time.
I asked about the beer. They have rotating taps of awesome local beers while keeping a few Irish staples (like Guiness) on hand...since they are an Irish bar. And my favorite....Fever Tree tonic!! I don't see that often in bars so if you like a good gin and tonic I'm sure this is the place to get it!
I'll definitely be back. Take a moment to add this one to the list!

H Dilworth Classic is everything I want in a breakfast, eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes and toast! Their Irish coffees are crazy! They have this thick cream, I have no clue how to actually drink it correctly but it’s insanely good. This place is a secret still, but one worth sharing

text:
My goal of writing reviews is to provide the people of Charlotte, in Charlotte, around Charlotte or new to Charlotte, info about what is GREAT in town. This new spot, by owner Mark Murphy, former Connellys bartender and owner of Murphy's in uptown, is just what the Boulevard ordered!!

The atmosphere is warm, staff is great and everything is made scratch in-house. We ordered Honey baked brie, Reuben Egg Rolls, and Truffle mac and cheese to share. I had heard good things about the food, but this was better than I expected!

Food, service and ambience are wonderful. Thank you to Mark Murphy and his stafff. I look for forward to being here often. I highly recommend Inishmore! Cheers!!

name: Ayanna McNeary
text: I normally check reviews, but forgot to this time, & REGRET IT IMMENSELY. I ordered wings for national wing day with doordash, waited over 40 minutes & received 8 extra extra HARD deep fried oreos. I had to go through doordash (serious hassle, took 30 mins to resolve) to get a refund. Of course I'm still hungry, because I can't eat extra extra hard deep fried oreos for dinner. I'm surprised this place has a 2.5 rating. If I could give 0 stars I would. Its not just wings, IT'S JUST BAD SERVICE.

name: Ivana Jones
text: Wish I had read the reviews. Every short cut you can't take with wings fries and fried oreos they took. The wings and fries had no crisp, they were oily and greasy and soggy. The fries oreos were also a mess they were soggy on the inside and burnt on the outside. Literally didn't enjoy anything on my plate and now I have a tummy ache from giving it a try. Clearly Chillis should not branch out because this was a major fail.

name: Cupcake O
text: I’m beginning to think with all these reviews I just got really lucky? The wings were great, fries were great, and so were the Oreos. The only complaint I have is the sides of sauces are extremely small and they charge an extra 50 cents for it.. if you’re gonna charge 50 cents extra for ranch at-least make it enough ranch worth charging for.

name: Latesha K
text: I ordered from Door Dash today and loved it! I was hesitant because I had never heard of them before but they were running a promotion so figured I’d try them out. I ordered the honey chipotle boneless wings with the curly fries and two extra sauces. I later saw the reviews and how bad they were so I had to leave my positive experience. Thank you!

name: denise banks
text: I had placed an order at 7:30pm and was sitting waiting on my order and at 8:50pm they tell me that they had to cancel my order.  No reason why. They wait until over an hour to cancel a order. I will not order from here again terrible customer service.

name: Zack Winters
text: 1-10 I give them a strong 2!!! These wings were straight TRASH. I'm sorry.....that's a little aggressive. I did not like the chewy, rubbery, flavorless wings. Wouldn't come back.

name: Lauren Moore
text: Giving them a two only because the fried oreos were yummy. The rest of the food was no bueno. The fries were super soggy. For the wings, they threw them into the box and just sort of squirted the "sauce" on them. Just go ahead and pass this place right on by.

name: Mike Sexton
text: Haha it's chili's? I didn't know. I dig it, these are amazing. Heck, thanks.

name: Aurora Workman
text: My daughter enjoyed the boneless wings and curly fries. The fried Oreos were awful. They were very hard. I called door dash about a missing Oreo. Now I realize it may not have been the driver.

name: Derrick Brockman
text: The best wings ever

name: Graham Wienke
text: I've ordered twice now.  No complaints.  Wings are better than competitors.  Fries are meh, but most fries are meh.  My new wing place.

name: Ellen Schweitzer
text: I actually really like the wings here. I get the boneless wings in the Honey Chipotle, which is a Chili's flavor and have always loved. My issue is that the last two times I have ordered, I have received less than what I paid for. The first time I ordered the 22 ct boneless wings for $16, but only received 20. I thought it was a simple mistake, so I didn't make a big deal. The next time I ordered the 22 ct boneless wings, I only received 17, and I didn't get the extra sauce I paid for either. I had to reach out to DoorDash to get a partial refund. Someone needs to be more careful when they are packaging up the orders. I won't be ordering again as I don't want to deal with not getting what I ordered and paid for. Also, while I enjoyed the fried Oreos, $6 for 3 Oreos is a crazy price. I though it would be at least 4 because that is what is in the picture.

name: Marina M
text: The first time I ordered from here it was really good! Ordered a second time and realized I must have been lucky bc it was so gross. Over cooked, sauce just laid out on the bottom, soggy fries. Like just nasty food!

name: Rachel Lemmond
text: Absolutely disgusting food that tastes soured and weeks old. Do not waste your money.

name: Mimi Hsu
text: Great wings and fries!!! The sauces were delicious and not too spicy for me

name: trev brown
text: There is a reason this place has such low ratings. We just got $60 worth of wings and not one of them is edible. And now doordash will only refund us $7.  What a joke.

name: Joleatha Jones
text: Good wings.

name: Kyle Trayah
text: It's hard to sum up the immeasurable disappointment I feel with my order, not only did we get less than half of the total order with no way to contact the driver or restaurant to remedy the situation the food arrived cold, under-cooked and gross. We will never order from this establishment again.

name: Prissy Krissy
text: Straight TRASH NEVER AGAIN..... The curly fries hold more weight 😡

name: Kevin Boler
text:
First time order wings were really good price was great I believe  this place is new that's why there is inconsistencies in product I will definitely  order again and if it's not I will definitely  give another review but for now .
.....

name: Derrick Funderburk
text: Horrible undercooked wings wasted my money fries were disgusting also. Do not eat here i repeat DO NOT eat here

name: Sonya Boler
text: Awesome

name: W BELAIR
text: The new owners is tarnishing his name, i ordered shrimp salad on the menu 5.99x2 at the top but they tried to charge 24$ then I canceled that and ordered 2 orders of gizzards for $13 and got one plate then asked for ranch and got blue cheese. Lawd I was done, they were cool about the refund tho. I asked about Thomas and they said their under new management 😐

name: Larry Clinkscales
text: Really good food. The oxtails were seasoned well, fried okra was fresh just a little salty. And the fried chicken was very good.

name: Allen Evans
text:
First of  all I would like to apologize to all the people who have eaten at Mr,C on Tryon  and Craighead  and you were very disappointed trust  me I feel your pain . Tonight  the food  I ordered  from this place was the worst food  I have  ever had out of a restaurant. I ordered the Super C special
all the way  and what  I got was 3 small little burger patties with no condiments on the sandwich. The fries were undone still hard on the inside. My wife ordered the fish plate and her fish was really light it looked undone and had no seasoning on it. Her fries were also undone and the greens were extremely salty. I promise you I will never step foot in this restaurant (if you can even call it that) again. I am highly dissatisfied and if I could give no stars or negative stars I would.

name: M
text:
I hate when I call restaurants within business hours and get told they are closing early and won't take my order. Major pet peeve.

Called slightly before 9pm on a Friday to order one plate of food. They close at 9:30. Asked if they were still taking orders. Receptionist was quick to say "no we're closing."

If you advertise hours, stick to those hours. It's not your customer's problem that you want to cut out early on a Friday. You obviously applied for and were hired for this job. It denotes a sense of laziness that I assume runs throughout the establishment, and I can't support.

name: Tracy Herring
text: Food was very good!! Not greasy.I will return.Desserts excellent.

name: scherie Amour
text: The food is good and their cheesecake and cakes are fresh and delicious. If you want fresh soul food and dont want to spend too much money go check them out.

name: Yolanda
text: ... overall their food is GREAT..it is seasoned well and is delivered hot. The only concern is the folks that come in looking a hot mess and playing the games that are set up right in your face. If he could eliminate the view of them while you are seated  trying to enjoy your food It would help. Also the workers who cook the food look as if they work on cars .. not saying they cant cook their as** off but why do they have to look so dirty. If they could get in a uniform and the game room removed this would certainly be the best soul food restaurant in the entire Queen city. Perception is everything. Other than that the food is everything!

name: Mint Angel
text: Food good just too much going on in the inside.. I don’t gamble but that shouldn’t keep you from doing you!!

name: NY Gent
text: Had the oxtails,. With 2 sides. Very average. Mac and cheese was good though. In the middle of the restaurant are gambling machines. Not family friendly.

name: The Stank
text: I will definitely be returning to this great place. My first trip I had a simple burger and side of fried okra. The burger was incredible and the portion of the side was ridiculously fat. All for a great price also. Recommended!

name: Sarah Hall
text: I got a steak and cheese. I could have made steakums at home. No flavor. Horrible! When they bought out the previous owner, they surely didn't buy the recipes!

name: Jerrod Duggins
text: I should have taken a picture before I threw it in the trash. I ordered the meat with no loaf, mac with no cheese, and green beans that was basic. I feel bamboozled and won’t be back here.

name: Brian Royce Harmon
text: Food is always fresh and on time. The owner and his colleagues are pleasant and always have a great experience!

name: Allen Zimmerman
text: Food is not they said. I ordered beef liver and got chicken liver. My receipt said I got gizzards not good.

name: Donald Cloud

text: Great good and pops the coolest in the business lol plus some entertaining games while you wait. The seafood is wonderful

name: Nichie [nikki] Cole
text: Great place to eat. You could feed a family on two orders and split it!  I break my meal down into 3 if i dont have anyone to share it with. Try it out. Fast. Friendly. Good food!

text: This was my first visit and I'm not sure if I'll go back. The food was good, somewhat of a soul food menu The interior has very little seating. There are various gaming/gambling machines, the counters were cluttered and the lighting was poor. The parking lot is rough and awkward. I'm not sure if there was a drive thru, with all the clutter.

text: The food was really good and they give you free lemonade drinks when you go there. I couldn't close the box on the amount of food they give you....ill be back real soon
