text: Love the atmosphere.  J. Sam can usually be found running around and is welcoming to everyone.  The staff is friendly and service is very good.  The few appetizers that we had were delicious.

resp.text: Thanks Cynthia - Hope to see you soon

name: Robert Allen
text: Cool place. Enjoyed the soft-seating outside. Service was good and had some neat twist on old favorites.Quality of product was good but I thought it was a little pricey.

name: NASOS GEORGALIS
text: Awesome place! Food is AMAZING!!!

name: Phoenix Pei
text:
Love the atmosphere and wine here -- this is my go-to place for a chill night out with friends. I like owner J Sam's selection and they always try to help customers find the best wine.

Lately, they have live music by Matt and another gentleman on Thursday night and Saturday night. Listening to the music with wine is a great experience.

name: Victoria Ramos
text: Great drinks but be careful when you open a tab they charged me twice.

resp.text: Ms. Ramos - We never charge anyone twice.  Sometimes when someone uses their debit card, the credit/debit  card processor with put a hold on the money in your account twice- the first time when we get an approval for the amount, the second time when the card is closed out with the tip.  It typically takes 2 days for the credit/debit processor to process the transaction and let you bank know that there was only one transaction.  I apologize that this happened to you but it is a problem caused by my processor.

name: Kyriakos Skiouris
text: Great wine bar, new menu is amazing, and the remodel is just in time for warmer weather!

name: Candy F
text: Had a glass of wine. Beautiful evenkkng outside seating.

resp.text: thank hope to see you again soon

name: carl parziale
text: great atmosphere.  awesome staff and experience

name: Pamela Hall
text: Great atmosphere.

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
This has been on my list to try for a long time and I'm so glad I finally made it.

Covid-19: you can order and pay online. They offer curbside pickup. This was the worst part of our experience though. We got there at the time our food was supposed to be ready. We call and no one answers the phone (many times). Eventually, I decide to go inside because it seems like the only way to get my food. The food wasn't ready and she did bring it out once it was (a good 20 minutes after it was supposed to be ready).

We got the Mojo Hash, the Bird in the Hand, the Sweet Potato Waffle, a couple of wings, and Tennessee Fries.

Everything was outstanding. I made a sandwich with the sweet potato waffle and wings which was probably my favorite thing. Probably the best chicken and waffle combo I've had.

They used a chicken thigh for the Bird in the Hand which I loved because it was huge and juicy. It was a great chicken sandwich.

I loved the flavor of the hash. The only downside was that we ordered an over easy egg and we got it over hard. We ate our food within 5 minutes of getting it, so either they overcooked it or it was sitting around for a while before they gave it to us.

Whatever you do, you have to get the Tennessee Fries. The seasoning is to die for. They also put it on their wings.

There are a lot of mixed reviews on here which I don't understand. This is some of the best breakfast food I've had in Charlotte.

name: Savvy Siren
text: Ordered the chicken and waffles and eggs scrambled hard with cheddar. The chicken was overseasoned/WAY too salty. The eggs arrived underdone, and I had to send back to be cooked to order again. They could have used some of the salt from the chicken on the eggs. Waffle was perfection!

name: Katrina Tripp
text: This place is temporarily closed, wish they would update there hours so we wouldnt have wasted our time walking. But we gave other businesses our money.

name: stacy campbell
text: Delicious food, easy menu. All the comfort food you need in 1 place

name: VAN JOHNSON
text: Disappointing at best. Ordering process is overly complicated. Food was average. Service is nonexistent.

name: FLY from48
text: The Chicken and Waffles dish was very good I will be returning to try the other items on the menu

name: Janae Moore
text: Food was super salty. Service was slow.

name: David Wedlock
text: Loved it!

name: Tashelle Monae
text: I believe in being really honest and fair. With that being said the service was very friendly and that's the reason for the 3 stars.  Being polite to customers goes a long way. Now about the food. Coming from a family who really knows how to cook soul food, when I go to a restaurant to get it , I want it to taste better than mine and my families.  Unfortunately this did not hit the mark. I ordered fried pork chops smothered with collards and mac and cheese. I also had corn bread which was very dry and flavorless. My husband had fried chicken, mac and cheese and cabbage. Nothing special about it at all. The mac and cheese doesn't even compare to my family's. Everything else was just okay. Will I be back. Probably not. If you are going to have a soul food restaurant, make sure it's top notch. Otherwise, what's the point.

name: Jemoré McDowell
text: My husband and I were looking for a good soul food place. We have tried several in the area but this place by far has the most delicious food! We will definitely be back. Rob & LaLa are fantastic and they make you feel right at home, like family. If you are looking for a great meal and are in the area, stop here you will want more!

name: S. A.
text: Food tasted good. It had that fresh down home flavor. The staff was friendly. I will be back.

name: SOV/ILL James Fields
text: Food was delicious nice and hot served on time. I recommend for all took come out try the food

name: Shan E
text: Yummy home cookin when I don't want to do it myself! I usually get fish plates. Sides and dessert are food too!

name: gen mia
text: Good atmosphere for family dining and the food was awesome.

name: Magic Coleman
text: Great food. Too bad it closed permanently... 😢

name: KeiaJohn 4:15
text: The best Cabbage and Peach Cobbler in Charlotte.

name: David Norris
text: Great place going back for sure.

name: Charles Hooker
text: IFW this place and eat here like once a week.   ProTip: Get the meatloaf with the smothered chicken gravy on top...

name: Nick Tipton
text:
Great service. Great food. Quirky atmosphere. Love this place.

Please note, Siggy's seems to hold itself to very high standards for their food, so pricing reflects that by being higher than average.  Just bite the bullet and enjoy what you get. It is not disappointing.

I recommend trying the beef kabob sandwich.

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
With all of the great reviews, I can't believe it took me so long to try this place.

We came after a happy hour in the area. It's fast casual and there were tables available and no line to order.

We went with the steak sandwich and the beef kabob sandwich. Both were amazing. The bread and sauce really took the sandwich to the next level. I think I liked the beef kabob one a little more, but it's hard to pick. Definitely my favorite sandwiches in Charlotte.

We added a side of beets which were very good and all of the crostinis except the tuna one. The brie and fig was our favorite, but we liked them all. The only thing we probably wouldn't get again was the banana almond butter smoothie. It was ok, but not nearly as good as the rest.

I would highly recommend checking this place out for a quick, delicious meal!

name: R2O %
text: SIggy's good food, was located originally in brooklyn Then NYC, and now in Charlotte. food made from scratch.

name: Davede Varner
text: I usually try a place 3 times before giving a review, but the food was so awesome I'm breaking that rule. It's just straight up "real" food. Super fresh and super friendly staff. I got the apple, brie, almond and fig spread on ciabatta bread. Fantastic. The bread was super light. Don't forget to reward your taste buds with a smoothie too! I'll be back!

name: Rhonda Sherman
text: So excited to have this restaurant in my neighborhood. Staff was friendly and helpful. Food was fresh, homemade, healthy goodness. I can't wait to try the juices and smoothies. I'm lucky this opened up within walking distance because I will be back here soon!

name: Jonelle Giulianelli
text: Been there a few times now. Service is awesome! And food is fresh and distinct!

name: Greg Olson
text: Nice little sandwich and salad shop. Plenty of healthy options. Chill atmosphere.

name: Janet Jernigan
text: Salad and lentil soup were simply amazing! Love all of the healthy, organic choices. Can't wait to return and try some of the other items on the menu. So wished they were closer to my office. I would eat there every day!

name: B Boidy
text: LOVE this spot for a sandwich and beer.  I’ve had just about every sandwich and they’re all huge, and delicious.  It’s as though this fantastic market/restaurant fell from the sky in Belmont (and I’m glad it did).

name: Tony Battaglia
text: Owner chef from nyc.  Owner operated.  Fantastic food.  Scratch made.  Make the trip it won’t disappoint.  On edge of expanding part of Charlotte Not in best area right now.  I will frequent!  Thanks for bringing good food (non chain) to Charlotte.  We need more like Siggy’s.

name: Edwin Wilson Jr.
text: My favorite restaurant in Charlotte: fresh food, awesome inspired flavors, and a dope variety of options.  Siggy is nice as hell too. Love this place.

name: Alana Hennin
text: I had the pleasure of being a customer at the place in Brooklyn and I’m even happier to be a customer here in the Queen City. This place truly is Good Food & my meal today was nothing short of amazing (as always). Excited to become a regular & experience more of what Siggy’s has to offer. If you don’t check this place out you’re 110% missing out on some of the best food you’ll ever eat!

name: Charles Glass
text:
Very high quality and delicious food! A little pricey for the amount you get, but I am not taking away a star for that because of the quality alone, plus the fact that it is all locally sourced.
Staff was very pleasant and helpful as well!

name: C C
text: Popped in with my parents for brunch. I hope this restaurant gains foothold and sticks around. Wonderfully fresh- quality food. I had the garden vegetable sandwich on ciabatta and my rents both had the beet and goat cheese salad (I almost got one too, it sounded so good!) the portions were sound- lots of greens- they certainly don’t skimp. I am a fan :)

name: Jeff N
text:
Friendly service and tasty food. Everything was fresh and flavorful, and the portions are good for the price and quality. We had steak and chicken sandwiches, with slaw, zucchini and beets as sides. The sides are pretty big, so two people could share a sandwich and one side for lunch, maybe with some juice or a smoothie. We will be back!
Edit: After several visits it is all still great. The Greek salad with quinoa and avocado is really nice in particular. Great size for lunch, or for dinner with a protein added.

name: Justin Halman
text: Great fresh foods. Steak sandwich was very good. Nice ambiance and very clean.

name: Nicole Angtuaco
text: I live in the Belmont neighborhood and went with a neighbor to check out Siggy’s on opening day, and it did not disappoint!  The place has a very neighborhood-y feel - eclectic, inviting, warm, unassuming.  There’s also a great side patio.  The food was excellent!  You definitely get what you pay for...generous portions of fresh, organic, delicious, well-prepared and presented food.  There are very few restaurants in town that offer so many healthy and organic options.  It’s not cheap, per se, but it’s worth the price.  I will be back many times!

name: Sara Woodmansee
text: Love Siggy's!  Excellent food made with love and care, wonderful staff, great choices for healthy, organic food, snacks,  beverages. We need more places like this!

name: Edwina Gazaille
text:
I wish I saved the pic of my Greek quinoa salad with avocado and a lemon vinaigrette with grilled tofu!  Out of this world delicious!! 😀
We live in Statesville and anyone here knows the traffic is horrendous!  I still think it's worth the ride to eat at Siggy's.  Everyone was happy with their food.  Delicious! Organic! Nutritious! Comfortable, no fuss dining.  Quick in/out or linger... doesn't matter.  Loved Siggy's and can't wait to go back!

name: Steve Deis
text: Great service, and the foods great. Hard to find organic food at a good price. And you'll get it here!

name: Chris Hoy
text: Great food and awesome vibe. Loved the music. The steak sandwich is amazing. My wife had the tuna and loved it. Go! Say hi to Siggy, she's super nice.

name: Joel Ferris
text: This is going to become a regular spot! Shared small plates and a half price bottle of wine- everything was honestly incredible. All crustinis were outstanding and the artichokes were mind blowing (trust me). Siggy, the owner, was delightful along with all the other staff. Happy to have this vibe and venue in the neighborhood.

name: Greg Cole
text: This place Rocks! The food and coffee were excellent and it's only the first week!!! Can't wait to taste how much better they get after a couple weeks.

name: Philip Chang
text: Chic gourmet sandwiches, soup, and salad, in the heart of Belmont.  Trendy modern decor.  Owner lives right in the neighborhood!

name: Brooke Bickelhaupt
text: Delicious food and drinks in an adorable space. Great addition to the neighborhood!

name: Luke Rogers
text: Great new Belmont restaurant - try a smoothie or banana pancakes!

name: rsteve hardy
text: A good place to eat.Friendly atmosphere.Extra friendly staff.

name: Tracy Murphy
text: So glad I stopped in for some lunch, it was awesome

name: AKM Auto Key Masters
text:
Fantastic,fresh delicious food the smoothies are refreshing and yammmmy.
Beautiful place , music and staff
Total upgrade for Charlotte .

name: Campbell
text: Salads were delicious, the artichokes insanely good, and the staff was super polite and friendly, we will be back. 👽🛸

name: Stephen Valder
text:
Siggy's is a truly great addition to the Belmont neighborhood.
Also for anyone looking for an alternative to food trucks at Birdsong or Catawba.

name: Roxxi Berry
text: I'm not a organic fan but I have to say this place was really good. The grass fed steak wrap was amazing.

name: Derek fox
text: Friendly service and creative foodie dishes.

name: Brian Baird
text: Great food and an awesome experience

name: Lee Worsham
text: Great food friendly staff!

name: Auto Key Masters
text: Best food in town , clean and healthy

name: Matthew Coghill
text: Best restaraunt in Charlotte.

name: Elizabeth Larson
text: Fav little neighborhood spot 🥇

name: juan alvarado
text: No words to describe, just go!!!!

name: Phelan
text: Delicious 👌

name: Horace Bernard Horton
text: Nothing to write home about

name: juan alvarado
text: No words to describe, just go!!!!

name: Matthew Allen
text: Great cocktails and good environment.

name: Coley Lyon
text: Great signature cocktails. I like this place a little better on weeknights when the pace is a little more mellow and the crowds aren't too large. When your servers get to take the time and actually chat with you, they have great insight and suggestions. I've never had a drink I didn't like or a bartender who wasn't pleasant. They bring a good level of upscale to NODA for a reasonable price.

name: Robert Weil
text: The cocktails are pretty good and the bartenders are friendly enough. We, being 2 of 4 people in the place asked to have the Carolina duke volume turned on (both couples were asking) but the owner said it would ruin the vibe. We then got food from jack beagles and as as good as usual. As other customers arrived they asked for the channel to be changed to the duke Carolina game, hardly seemed to ruin the vibe but increase it

name: corey rippy
text: Great music, great service, great company! If you are looking for something to do on a weekend night, this is one of the best places to start out at as you explore NoDa.

name: Rayshema Parker
text: Cocktails are great, nice staff, liked the outdoor seating

name: Kent Deckerhoff
text: Great drinks, it wasnt crowded when I visited, but attentive bartenders and well mixed drinks with a great variety in the menu.

name: Jennifer Watson
text: Rich is great! He made sure my brother had a great bday celebration!

name: Frankie Bruner
text: Rich the bartender was awesome!!

name: Brittainy Harper
text: Wasn’t pleased, definitely won’t be back. Two stars because it’s close to work. It wasn’t busy but I didn’t get welcomed or serviced right away. I got a chicken bowl (with a lot of extras). I was told they weren’t accepting cash but no reasonable explanation as to why....good thing I brought my Credit card too. service wasn’t very friendly just transactional... the food wasn’t even tasty. Some pieces of chicken were over seasoned while others were dry. Just not a good overall experience.

resp.text: Hi Brittainy, thanks for the review and for sharing your CAVA experience. We apologize for the service that you received, and we will be addressing this with our team in South End.

name: Moon Flower
text:
I love visiting Cava for a nice lunch in the park. My last visit was a big disappointment. The pita was stale and had mold on it. Super gross!!!

Update:
Recently visited store and the food was exceptional and fresh. It was a huge difference. The service was also great. Thanks!!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about this, Moon Flower. Please send our team a note at hello@cava.com so we can make this right! Thanks!

name: Talib Ghafoor
text: Wow! What a fantastic place to dine. Friendly faces and healthy eating with a taste of a Mediterranean cuisine. If you want a great meal priced to make your pocket smile make sure your stop here. You won't regret it. I will definitely be returning.

resp.text: Thanks for the glowing feedback, Talib about our new South End location in Charlotte! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Tamira Johnelle
text: Six people behind the counter with two customers and it takes them almost three minutes to acknowledge me. Then another two minutes to service me. Poor customer service.

name: Chrissy Comments
text: Enjoy my first taste of Cava my daughter even liked it I will go back great location!

name: Garrett McClay
text: Always good for a fresh bite. Clean deliciousness. Harissa chicken is the go to

name: Vera Holsey
text: Great food!!! My only negative , the spinach wasn't cleaned enough.  I got too many dirt or sand in my mouth.  I hate that crunch on my teeth!!!

name: Isis Lima
text: Fun Mediterranean spin on the "chipotle-style" food. The food was flavorful and fresh. Lots of vegetarian options too. I did feel rushed when going through the line, especially for my first time there.

name: Marjorie Allen
text: It was very good for my first time. I enjoyed their Blackberry soda

name: Abra Kadabra
text: Super fresh well priced food in a convenient location.

name: Diane Shytle
text: Food is great.. fresh and generous serving. Staff is not the friendliest. Nothing major, just not particularly pleasant nor looking happy to be there.

name: Andrea Mussman
text: Fresh Mediterranean bowls with a large selection of choices.

name: Kristi Torres
text: Love the food here. Just couldn't give it a 5 as I felt the entire staff was snarky and just felt irritated by having to take my multiple orders.

name: CARLOS ARTIGAS
text: I highly recommend the food, the place and the service, I invite you to go, you will want to return

name: Joshua Aguirre
text: Always great customer service and fresh ingredients!

name: Mike Trevino
text:
Fast, convenient, cheap and delicious. Every bit as good as a burrito bowl from Chipotle or greens bowl from Flower Child.

Highly recommended.

name: Victoria Pittman
text: CAVA is one of my favorite places to get great vegetarian friendly meals. I really the selection of bowl choices. My favorite are the falafels and the pickled veggie options.  I've been to a similar spot here in Charlotte and I like CAVA so much better!

name: T G
text: Cava is awesome! Healthy choices. Good variety of toppings. This location is clean and well managed.

name: Suzie Q
text: Great food, soo good! So thrilled that you guys came to Charlotte! I missed you guys since I moved from DC!

resp.text: Thanks for the 💛 Suzie! We cannot wait to see you back in again soon.

name: Just Jenna
text:
Delicious and healthy as usual
I love that the portions are 2x the size of Chipotle. You can get 2 meals for the price of 1

name: Jency Schnettler
text: Acoustics are terrible can't hardly hear what people are saying. People not wearing masks over their nose and were super stingy with toppings.

resp.text: Hi Jency, thank you for bringing your recent experience to our attention. We are truly concerned to read this as your experience is not in line with our current practices. That said, please know that we'll be sure to pass this message along internally to be addressed with our restaurant team. We hope you'll join us again soon for a much improved experience!

name: SR BM
text: Last 2times I've been, the rice has become hard. It would be nice if they timed how long it stays fresh before going bad

name: Jessica Hill
text:
Ever since I happened upon Cava the first time wondering around Queen City one day, I cannot stop going back while in town for a quick bite.

The best way to describe it is like a Greek version of a Chipotle. You go through just like you would Chipotle and pick your base, protein etc. I like them better than like a Kairos because they have better options for their bases and proteins. Braised lamb is my favorite but all are pretty flavorful!

name: A guy
text: Poor customer service. Poorly trained staff. Great food.

name: Randy Mabry
text: The food and service are awesome!

name: Bobby Deese
text: Yafo is a local chain with the same style food. It's head and shoulders above Cava. More food for about the same price, and it tastes better.

resp.text: Hi Bobby, we are sorry you were not impressed after your last Cava visit. We hope you will give us another chance in the future!

name: Alyssa Spivey
text: Always delivers on taste and service. I've never seen the inside dirty or messy and the workers are always smiling. Very accommodating for people with celiac disease and other food restrictions.

name: Kevin Kekich
text: Eat here all the time. Great stuff

resp.text: Thanks for the 💛 Kevin! We cannot wait to see you back in again soon.

name: Luis Villavicencio
text: Fresh, healthy, and put together quickly. One of my favorite fast dining restaurants.

name: Isabell Wolsky
text: We ordered Uber Eats from Cava for the first time tonight and the food  was phenomenal! The only bummer was that they forgot two sides of pita and pita chips that we paid for. I'll probably eat here again, just wait until I can dine in.

name: Mitchell Coles
text: The food was fresh and the staff was pleasant. There were some minor issues with the food not being ready causing us to wait 10 minutes for bread bites. However, that was contributed to the dinner patron rush. In my opinion, the chicken was cut too small which made it appear like minced meat. The restaurant was clean.

resp.text: Thanks for this feedback, Mitchell and we're sorry to hear about this visit. Please know, we'll be addressing with our South End team. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Pam Shearer
text: If you haven't,  you need too! 🍲💚

resp.text: Thanks for the 💛 Pam! Looking forward to having you back in again soon.

name: Skipper Pond
text:
Been here twice now and Cava has started to become a goto location for my wife and I.  This location is great.   We have one closer to home yet if out and about, I'd recommend here.   Food fresh and priced right.  Only wish less oil added to items, or at least a few more oil free items.
I'd recommend.  Enjoy.

name: Brianna Davis
text: Awesome food, amazing service! The girl at the register, I think her name is Sham was so awesome and helpful! I'll be back

name: Tammy Ruffin
text: Love the food.

name: Alex Serrano

name: AJ Johnson
text: I've definitely had worse Chinese food, but I've also had better. They can be kinda skimpy on their rice and their online ordering can be frustrating at times. Best to just call in your order.

name: Stuart Thompson
text: Over charge and does not have a responsible person knowledgeable to handle customer ordered.  I won't go back again terrible service

name: Wayne Biggs
text: Had Shrimp fried rice. It was great. Can't wait for the inside dinning to reopen.

name: TJ Simmons
text: One of the best Chinese restaurants in Charlotte. They will accommodate any reasonable order. Sesame chicken can be ordered "diced" and taste great.

name: Steve Peet
text: Usually Shun Lee is very good, however make sure you check your order as we have had incorrect orders in the past.  It hasn't stopped  us from going back.

name: Robert Wydra
text: Love it. They only serve take out currently.  Go there when ever visiting Charlotte.

name: James Hong
text: Best Chinese in CLT.  I am Cantonese and their food is the closest to traditional Cantonese cooking I have found.  Enjoy!

name: Alexandria Green
text: Sesame chicken was old and inedible, lo mein was decent and my fiance enjoyed his egg drop soup, service was fast but I don't think I will return.

name: Nicholas Floyd
text: One of my favorite restaurants nearby.  I've been enjoying this place for over 30 years.

name: Katie Richey
text:
Delicious! I’ve been looking for a reliably good Chinese restaurant in Charlotte and am glad I finally found Shun Lee Palace. I’ve gotten burned a few times with weak Chinese food in town, but this place really hit the mark and was satisfying.

We’ve done dinner pick-up orders and each time the food was ready quickly and still hot. Entree sizes were big enough to get a second meal from leftovers. The egg foo young is just what I wanted in old school Chinese fare - hot, oily, eggy fritters with a generous amount of gravy. The gravy here is yellow and tastes like Chinese five spice with a hint of curry. We also have ordered the sa cha beef, kon bo chicken, and chicken with hot garlic sauce. All were delicious and they did not skimp on sauce in each stir-fry. Pork egg rolls were also great. The fried rice that comes with the entrees could be a bit more fried and brown, but did have veggies and egg bits in it and was not dry. I am guessing a full side of fried rice that had a meat choice would be cooked to order.

Overall, I am impressed and this is my new go-to place for Chinese!

name: James Fain
text: The best Chinese in town! I hate that they only have take out right now but the food is still great!

name: Louis Pham
text: Horrendous wait time. Never again.

name: Phyllis Chambers
text: Very good and tasty !

name: Eyvonne Simmons
text: No inside seating...

name: Jorge Guerra
text: Good food

name: The House of Mann
text: Party at Kandy Bar!

name: Tynetta Young
text: Getting inside is ridiculous $20. On top of that they stopped the very thing that made them the kandy bar. No more dessert martinis no more sweets they're just a regular overpriced bar, with a bunch of bouncers that till you can't stand here you can't sit there. so basically I was ripped off because they still say they do it on their website. so the cover charge along with false advertisement not a good combination. this is not the KANDY BAR. this is a bar. I will never go back. I will watch with great pleasure at this place slowly sinks into the red. Hope they go out of business soon.

name: Joe L
text: Went out for my Cousins Birthday on a weekend Night.  we were promised a table and bottle but when we got there got neither.  Were told that all the vip was taken up even though I could clearly see two open.  Then when I finally asked the right person, whom went to management, after a shady debate between the two, they said I could get a table for $500.  From my limited experience there I said 'HELL' no (my first night there btw).  The bar had nothing on the website, no food or special drinks.  Just had the tender make what I could describe.  Will be my only time coming to this place for sure.

name: S. A.
text: I was having a great time until the security was rude to me. I wanted to request a song from the DJ, but he wouldn't let me because he said I was in V.I.P. the area that wasn't marked. It was my first time there so I had no idea. My advice to management would be to hire security that didn't treat your patrons poorly. I complained to the manager, but he just wanted to give me a free drink so that I would be quiet. I didn't want the free drink. I wanted him to listen to my concern of the overly aggressive security.

name: L Mora
text: Check before going. Different nights have different promoters. Sometimes hip hop, sometimes EDM, but usually a nice mix. The specialty drinks and desserts don't go all night, so go early.

name: Mark Stephen Kaminski
text: A++++ Amazing service, amazing scenery, great music, classy venue. This is a private club. If you see bad reviews, it's likely these are people whining because they couldn't get in.

name: Brian Bowman
text: Went with my wife...had a great time.  All the negative publicity must be to folks that can't keep on a decent dress code.  Great vibe, staff...and the music is awesome.  Highly recommend!

name: Bee Rimi
text: Only giving it a 2 because the bartender was super nice and it wasnt his fault we had an awful experience. There was like 5 guys out front checking ids and hanging out but only 1 guy bartending and serving. I felt so bad for him that he was alone. There was 5 of us and we all were super excited to try the stuff here because we've been planning our trip to Charlotte for months and came across the delicious looking menu. The stuff on their site's menu does not match the actual menu once there. They were out of a few deserts too. I ordered an alcohol infused cupcake and 2 other people in my party ordered cupcakes not infused. One of them said it tasted like their was alcohol in theirs. Then none of our drinks had the included candy and/or fruit garnishes that were supposed to be included. Whoever owns this joint needs to make sure that they supply the items on their menu. It's a bit crazy that we all ordered different drinks and all of them had one or more missing things with it. The menu is really awesome looking but too bad they dont have half the stuff on it.

name: Wahoo Long
text: Let's dance

name: Loving Life
text: Not a place I will ever go again!..

name: Joshua Pack
text:
Don't let the reviews fool you.... Oh wait, the review are right!!! This place is the place in Charlotte for Haitian food. The other reviews are right though about  this place being on Haitian time. Lol. However, it is well worth it. It takes time to make these flavorful dishes. So don't expect to get it in 20 minutes.

Now I'm going to list my pros and cons as I usually do.

Pros:
Amazing food
Great staff
Great mixed drinks
It has Haitian food

Cons:
Takes awhile for your fresh food

I will definitely be coming back here. Need to see how their pate creole​ tastes.

name: Cheryl Samuel Jones
text: The food is authentic, flavorful, and plenty. The customer service is top-notch -- you feel like a returning friend each time you visit. This gem is definitely worth the trip.

name: Joya Joseph
text: The food was very tasty and the restaurant was very clean. There was a bit of a wait but it was well worth it. I know most people don't check this but their bathroom was also very clean.

name: James Tyson
text: Not many people in here, but the food was great. Curry chicken, legume, and stewed chicken were on point. You better bring an appetite though, because these servings are HUGE. I'd definitely come back a second time.

name: Sonya Wilson
text: Nice place, but the food was not good at all. I really wanted it to be good, because i really like to support small businesses. Unfortunately, i won't be back.

name: Sidney Robin
text: Love the patties! Especially the fish patties. Great place to come too, eat and chill!

name: patoutou j
text: Best Haitian restaurant in Charlotte if you like good food check it out

name: Mike Lowry
text:
Very friendly
Great food
Pleasant music

name: A. Emy Diop
text: Food is good here... slightly slow service..

name: LaTrina Antley
text: Nice clean setting, with great food!! I will be back !!

text: This place is closed. Great food, big portion.

name: Princess Gypsy
text: Closed down.

text: The food is nasty. The food doesn't taste like real Haitian food, That's why Haitian people do not eat there.

name: charles pierre
text: Good home cooking.

text: PERMANENTLY CLOSED. Tried to eat there tonight. They have gone out of business according to the fellow we talked to and who said he was the owner.

name: Dottie Davis
text: Good food

name: MyDOOKIE1

text:
(Translated by Google) Food is delicious

(Original)
La comida es deliciosa

name: Jennifer Montgomery
text: Amazing from start to finish, including the service! I highly recommend the duck, the shrimp with risotto, and any of the pasta dishes.

resp.text: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your experience, Jennifer! Thanks for the 5-star review. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Lindsey Carrick
text:
Nice diverse menu.  The prices are a little high but it’s good quality food for brunch.  We weren’t too blown away by anything on the brunch menu but the food was good.

Service was quick and friendly.  Place wasn’t too packed on a Sunday around 11:30.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback, Lindsey! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Marcio G.
text: Nice place for a brunch. Great selection and great flavors. Specialty drinks are also a good selection. Outside sitting area is well laid out and the place is in a great location.

resp.text: Thank you, Marcio! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Carlin Taylor
text: Great atmosphere and fresh tasty dishes

resp.text: Thank you, Carlin! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Christopher Boulton
text: Fantastic food and an absolutely amazing experience

resp.text: We love to hear it! Thank you for the great review.

name: Michael T
text: Quite possibly the most unfriendly, clinical bar experience I’ve ever had. At least the drink was good.

resp.text:
Hi Michael,

We certainly hate to hear this. Would you be willing to reach out to steve@thestanleyclt.com with more details? We'd love to try and make it right.

name: Kim Stump
text: Brunch was yummy! Nice sunny spot in the front room, great food and attentive personable service. Sunday brunch also offers a “donut of the day”, today’s choice of a vanilla glazed Captain Crunch Berry donut was a winner!

resp.text: So glad you enjoyed brunch - including the donut of the day! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Dianna Bock
text: Wonderful service and delicious, locally sourced food. Friendly atmosphere and will be back many times!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review, Dianna! We look forward to hosting you again soon.

name: Syed Ahmed
text:
I visited this place on June 4th 2020 and what I really liked is the quality and freshness of the ingredients in the food. The food and the desert was top quality not only in terms of taste but in terms of presentation too.
I had the best Fish here and the most creative and the tasty appetizer made of beets.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback, Syed. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
We had a couple of good recommendations to try the Stanley, so we used our anniversary as a good excuse to check out out.

Reservations are recommended, although if you eat early like we do, you can probably get away without one.

We started with The Cortez cocktail which we both loved. It was refreshing and not too sweet.

We always go with small plates at a restaurant like this. They change the menu almost daily, so you never know what will be on it.

We tried the Surf & Turf, Foie Gras, Steam Buns (pork belly), Braised Chicken Tostada, and Short Rib Ravioli. We loved everything with one exception — the ravioli. It wasn't bad, but it definitely didn't compare to how good everything else was. It was supposed to have goat cheese in it, but we tasted no cheese at all. The chicken tostada was our favorite followed closely by the surf and turf.

For dessert we got the Swiss Roll. I think the menu was misleading on this one. I don't like chocolate, but the menu said white chocolate, cranberry, and pistachio. I assumed it didn't have chocolate because it said white chocolate, but that was not the case (it just had a white chocolate drizzle). My husband loved it though.

It's a farm to table restaurant and you can definitely tell the ingredients are fresh. I wasn't super impressed with the service. It was good enough, but our waiter felt a little cold.

There's a lot of complaints in the reviews that I think are not the fault of the restaurant. Yes, it's fairly pricey. This should be expected at a farm to table small plates restaurant. We felt like the quality of the food lived up to the price.

I think The Stanley is definitely worth checking out. Just make sure to have the right expectations coming in.

resp.text: Thank you for the thorough review, Jacqueline! We appreciate you taking the time to give us feedback and hope to see you soon.

name: K Boyle
text: Hate to rate this low. What saved this place was incredible service and the beautiful setting. The food just wasn't that good. Concept is amazing, but execution was a bit sloppy. I found that I was often overwhelmed with one ingredient's taste, or underwhelmed generally by the taste; ingredients didn't seem happy in their marriage. It's still a lovely place with lovely staff, and I will be visiting again, to see if I might be able to change my review.

resp.text: Hi Katie, thank you for your thorough feedback. We hope you'll come back and see us!

name: Jim Aponte
text: Really awesome food and unique mixed drinks. I am so happy that they are back open and in business I really missed you guys.

resp.text: Thank you, Jim! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Tiffany Andrews
text: We are so happy to have this new restaurant in Charlotte! The food and service are outstanding. We can't wait to go back! Go with a large group so that you can order everything on the menu. Food is served in small plates for sharing and everything was fresh and delicious with many unique preparations and presentations. We loved it! Cocktails were great too!

resp.text: We are so happy to hear such wonderful feedback, thank you Tiffany! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Andreas Willis
text: We are so happy to have this new restaurant in Charlotte! The food and service are outstanding. We can't wait to go back! Go with a large group so that you can order everything on the menu. Food is served in small plates for sharing and everything was fresh and delicious with many unique preparations and presentations. We loved it! Cocktails were great too!

resp.text: Thank you for the thorough review, Andreas! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Charles G
text:
The Stanley was amazing. I am a little befuddled at some of the negative reviews on here. It is as if they have never dined before. There is one review that is upset they didn't receive the treatment they think they should get when they showed up on Valentine's day without a reservation. When in reality they should have been grateful that the team at The Stanley found a way to accommodate them

Anyways. The food is fantastic.  Chef Verica does an incredible job sourcing locally to provide amazing ingredients. There are only a half dozen or less chefs in the Charlotte are that put as much time and effort into sourcing as they do here. I strongly recommend that you try The Stanley but highly recommend you make reservations.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and support, Charles! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Sara Sheppard
text: Awful experience. I will never understand the culture where high-end restaurants hire rude and cold waitresses. If you’re overpaying for food, shouldn’t service be EXTRA stellar? On top of that, the food was just terrible - two of the four of us took one bite of our meal and our server didn’t even ask what was wrong. Also, one of the members of our party ordered a coke, which comes in a small 8oz cocktail glass (fountain soda with ice) and they charged for every refill without even mentioning it. So the one coke he ordered cost him $12. Most importantly, The food quality was surprisingly low. The chicken salad sandwich tasted like a salt-lick, actually inedible. I have absolutely no idea how this place is going to make it. They need a major attitude adjustment, above all else. There are too many good places in Charlotte for this one to last.

name: Eamonn Higgins
text: Covid preventative measures are A+. We felt comfortable, awesome food, awesome server.      I can't even come up with a negative.

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback and review, Eamonn! We hope to see you again soon.

name: MusicMan Reviewer
text: Excellent restaurant.   We arrived at 5 PM (right when they open) on a Saturday.   It was not crowded. The service was perfect.  The waitress was very nice and very helpful since this was our first time. We had the corn bread for our appetizer and it was good. But the highlight was our meal. I had the fried chicken and my wife had the pork with bacon. Both were amazing.  This is a farm fresh restaurant,  the menu changes based on what comes in that day. Prices are higher than we are used to but for the taste it was perfect. Soda is buy the glass, unsweet tea is all you can drink. We would go back for a special occasion.

resp.text: So glad to hear it! Thank you for the great feedback and review.

name: Scott Wilezol
text: I wanted to love it more than i did. We ordered a number of dishes.... most of the dishes were artfully presented, which always makes you feel special... nicely made cocktails, too... some dishes like the scallops were delicious. Other dishes were fine. I ordered the shrimp risotto and the shrimp smelled and tasted like ammonia...and not just a little...a lot.... very off putting. I should have said something to the staff, but shame on me for being too embarrassed. I might go back, i might not... really wanted to love it.

name: Rhonda Sherman
text: Service was fantastic. The 2 dishes I had were delicious and rich, definitely meant for sharing! I'm hoping the menu changes with the season. Cocktails were good and the space is really nice.

name: Chaz Hinkle
text: Really tremendous and one of the best dining experiences in Charlotte. The tempura turnip greens were fantastic as was the fried cheese. Quail, pasta, mustards and mushrooms all really good. Terrific desserts and excellent craft cocktails. Very charming and small place, and honestly the price is what you would expect for high end fare.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review, Chaz! We hope to see you again soon.

name: deshuna7
text: Excellent food and service. A night with the ladies was a blast. Thanks to the chef for allowing us to have our cheese plate with wine instead of dessert and for the waiter for asking. The NC risotto was a hit at our table.. Soo good didn't have a chance to take pictures.  That's what you call a good night. Happy Thanksgiving! 😊

resp.text: We love to hear it, thank you for the great feedback! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Brian Capron
text: Excellent meal and experience! Neal took good care of us as we sampled drinks, small plates, wine and dinner plates. Well done!

resp.text: Thank you, Brian! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Liza Barroso
text: Went with my mom for dinner. Service was great and cocktails were amazing. We did a few of the small plates and shared the steak dish. Dessert was delicious! So glad they are in the neighborhood!

resp.text: Thank you, Liza! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Christopher Ward
text:
The main courses were absolutely amazing. My wife had the pork chops, which were flavorful and tender, while I had trout on an amazing bed of beets, risotto, and spinach; delectable. Shared the scallops for an appetizer, well cooked and good but nothing overly special. Service was good, food was a little fussily prepared for my tastes but presented well. My only complaint was the back room was so loud that conversation was difficult even across a small table. I see more visits to The Stanley in my future.

As an update, my wife and I were both independently, still thinking about how good the food was a week later

name: matthew trager
text: Unbelievable food. Amazing flavors and quality. Great service as well. Brilliant night out.

resp.text: We're so glad you enjoyed everything. Thank you for the 5-star review!

name: Bryan Wright
text:
The ambience, decor and staff were lovely.  I've been wanting to try this place since they opened based on the idea of an ever changing menu and the prestige of the chefs.  The food was gorgeous, pictured are entrees because we forgot to get the 2 small plates ordered up front.

The only thing that prevents this from getting 5 stars was the timing.  Some small plates type establishments have the timing down to a science and we had a decent wait between ordering 1st course and getting the entrees in.  Minor issue but noticable.

Cocktails were noticably creative and perfect sippers, I recommend their take on an old fashioned, but skip the prince of thieves.  Conceptually a drink with black garlic sounds amazing, and to be fair, with food it works, however after dinner sipping the black garlic flavor takes over.

Unisex bathrooms are always a win in Charlotte so good on them.  All in all will be back, perhaps next time for just a few small plates and some cocktails to save a few shekels.  Use Google to secure a reservation as the seating is limited.

resp.text: Hi Bryan, thank you for the thorough review. We appreciate the feedback!

name: Rianna Schoenleber
text: We tried to book a reservation to this place and is booked for over a month. Is a new place and I totally got it. The thing is we came anyway just to feel the vibe and tried the drinks. The bar area you can just come and sit but they tried to do a rotating thing so the people who were waiting before get to sit first. Sounds fair until they move you to the “lounge “ area so the people who gets here after you can just simply sit before you. We were waiting for this couple to leave and the guy came to me and said that the couple sitting at the lounge were waiting before us. Okay, so they move to the bar area and he said to us to wait at the lounge area. This couple came in, order a drink and right after two chairs get available and guess what? They got seated before us. Drinks are good, very small and bright atmosphere. I would maybe try again in 3 months?! Not sure.

name: noneya business
text: A lively place on the corner that will charm you when you see it.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Daniel! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Jonathan Thompson
text:
Food A+++
Service 👎

resp.text:
Hi Jonathan,

We're glad you enjoyed the food but are certainly bummed to hear you didn't have a 5-star experience on the service side. Would you be willing to share more info by emailing steve@thestanleyclt.com? We are always looking to improve on our end.

Thank you for your time and insight!

name: Ashley Finney
text: I was so excited to try this new establishment I had heard so many wonderful things about! Unfortunately, when my friend & I walked in we were not greeted with the same excitement. All we received was "Do you have a reservation?" Which, no, we did not, but also we were not eating & I had just called minutes ago to ask if the bar was available just for cocktails. Which that call was also not very friendly. To make it even worse once we sat at the empty bar (this was around 5PM on Valentine's day) the female bartender was less than kind. In my excitement I gleefully asked "What's your most popular drink?!" Her response in the most unpleasant & condescending way was "it really just depends on the day hun..." Wow. Customer service seemed devastatingly nonexistent in this establishment. My guy friend & I literally were one foot out the door & dear Vinny came to the rescue. He is the best bartender I've had in a long time! Hey Vinny!!!! I wish I could give more stars but the discomfort we felt from the beginning far outweighed this incredible bartender that tried to save his fellow coworkers poor treatment of us. Vinny was a touch of pure class! Thank you!!! However, we will not be returning to the Stanley. I am a Sales & Events Manager at a hotel in Uptown Charlotte & how you treat people is always first. Always.

name: Oikos USA - CARLOS VELEZ
text: Great place and atmosphere!!!

resp.text: Thank you for coming to see us - and for the great review! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Mike olson
text: Went on a slow day for an early dinner and had a great time at the bar. Sat next to a cool couple that shared their personal bottle of wine with us ( apperently citrus rind is a wine type). Yes it was expensive but get things that actually take time and cost money for example a nice cut of beef cooked in a style that requires special equipment .  Don't get deep fried chicken priced at 50$ get that at Bojangles! If you walk in with some knowlage of how to make food and what makes it valuable you will enjoy yourself with food and drink alike. If you don't know go when it's slow and ask for some help but don't think your getting a education at 730pm on a Friday when it's as busy .

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Mike! We appreciate your feedback. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Brenden McGlinchey
text: The food was carefully crafted and exquisite in taste. The service was knowledgeable, expert, and attentive. Just a fantastic evening.

name: Alex Holets
text: Four of us had brunch this past Sunday. I was intrigued by the burger description but was disappointed. Lackluster garnishes and my burger did not come with the onions that were described. The brioche bun was dry and crumbly. The chips were ok. My wife had the chicken biscuit. The biscuit was very dry and there was not enough gravy. However the chicken was great and the grits very good. My mother in law had the french toast. The flavor was fine but is was very soft and soggy. The last entree was the shrimp and beet risotto. I was told it was good. I did not taste it. We live in Fort Mill and had been to their former place in Waxhaw at least a dozen times and always had great food so we were excited to finally try out the new place. Our server was great but that can not make up for the overall poor food. I would be remiss if I forgot to mention that the doughnut of the day was great.

resp.text:
Hi Alex,

We are incredibly bummed to hear this - would you be willing to reach out to steve@thestanleyclt.com with more details? We appreciate you taking the time to provide feedback, we hope to make it right.

name: Christina P
text: I feel like I wasted my money coming here. Food is overpriced and small portions. Parking is horrendous and staff is uptight and rude. So many better places to spend your money in Charlotte for dinner than this place.

name: B Boidy
text:
Like many are saying, it’s pretty, but over priced and not that good.

We ordered the cornbread, tostada, fried chicken bao buns, and gnudi (like gnocchi).  The cornbread was kind of dry and the honey butter was oddly salty.  The fried chicken buns were a good portion and nice.  The gnudi was okay.  But the tostada was gross.  It looked like something I’d make drunk in college except super salty.

The service was fantastic, but all in all we won’t go back.  The small plate trend needs to die soon or step up its game.

name: Audrey Cuison
text: Our meal and cocktails were excellent. Intended to be a celebratory meal (mentioned on resy) but were crammed up next to another couple and behind a loud table with children--could barely have a conversation. Our server was deafeningly loud, intrusive to our personal space, repeatedly leaned on the back of my chair, read the menu to us item by item, very loudly dictated our order for the entire room to hear, and immediately suggested gendered drinks (i.e. 'the ladies are drinking this.. the men are drinking this..'). Could definitely use some skill refinement, especially given the cost of the meal/quality of the menu.

name: aritra pal
text: Unique menu with great tasting food. The staff can be a bit more welcoming, though!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback, Aritra! We appreciate it and hope to see you again soon.

name: Adam Peter Shinn
text: Those of you looking for a review on the Stanley burger that Ted Williams ranked #1 in Charlotte Agenda look no further. My wife and I were eager to try this spot because it had dethroned my current favorite burger spot Bang Bang after many years of top spot dominance. I also agree with at least 90% of Ted’s list so we had to try it. So.... did Ted get it right this time? My answer is no. That being said, I would place their burger, definitely in my top 10 and possibly in my top 5. A good if not great burger that’s a tad overhyped. What went wrong though? Well, first of all, this burger is EXTREMELY hard to get ahold of. Maybe that’s part of the appeal... the exclusivity and scarcity. Hell, you can only get the burger two nights out of the week (Friday and Saturday), only at the bar, and from 9-10 PM during their last hour of service. On top of that, it’s coming in pricey at $18. But does all of that make it taste better? Well, after my wife and I looked like fools sitting down at a table trying to order the burger and being met with no accommodation whatsoever, we relinquished our seats and sat back in the waiting area, with no guarantee we would be seated at the bar since there were three parties ahead of us and 30 minutes before close. We decided to wait anyway to try the vaunted burger since that was our sole mission (aside from ordering cocktails that were great). Upon waiting, the manager came out and explained they offered the burger as a way to promote sitting at the bar. I mean I appreciated the explanation, and I get it, but what’s the point of not serving it at the rest of the restaurant if someone doesn’t know that? I’d rather you accommodate, spank me on the wrist, and tell me to order it at the bar next time instead of “no burger for you”. I started to notice he and the bartenders spoke of this burger as if it was somewhat of a “unhappy surprise” as the publicity was working against them and how busy they are because of it. Anyhow, we got seated with 20 min to spare. My wife and I started chatting with a couple beside us about burgers. We talked about Bang Bang and we all got enthusiastic. One of the bartenders gloated back with “yeah, but wait til you try ours guys. Whole ‘nother level.” Now the anticipation was looming. We received the burgers and they were served with a side of chips. Not a lot of food for $18 but what was on the plate looked good! The burger looked high quality, cheese running down the side, a nice soft dukes bun (like Bang Bang’s), a very fresh tomato on the side that looked fresh out the garden. A side of ketchup and Grey Poupon were also served on the side. My wife and I split it. My impression was that the burger was very high quality and largely carried the whole team. Is it the best quality burger patty in Charlotte and better than Bang Bang? Possibly! But it would be marginal and not day and night. The bun was great too. But it needed ketchup, mustard, something to give it a little something extra. Overall, it was good but I wasn’t blown away. That leaves me to believe it is overhyped to some degree. Maybe Ted and I just had different levels of expectations going in, but I wouldn’t put it over most of the Burgers I’ve tried from Bang Bang across the street. Even the Crunkleton on the other side of the building had a better burger in my opinion. So they are literally surrounded with better burger options. When people around me asked what I thought I said “it’s worth trying”. That was my cop out because I knew it was a good burger, and one people should try, if for no other reason than for the novelty of it, but it’s not the best. But give it a shot, maybe YMMV.

name: Ted Lee
text: The waitstaff here are very rude, I would never come back given the way I was treated, far many other great restaurants that want your business

resp.text: Ted we are sorry that we could not accommodate you for dinner after we had closed. We would love to have you dine with us at another time during regular business hours.

name: Jesse Hawkins
text: Best date night location in Charlotte

resp.text: Thank you, Jesse! We appreciate that - and hope to see you again soon.

name: Ryan Edge
text: Should be in your regular rotation for brunch, especially if you live in the Noda or Plaza Midwood areas since there isn't much competition. The pancakes were just right, the donuts were a delicacy, and the staff was friendly and attentive.

resp.text: Thank you, Ryan! We appreciate the kind review.

resp.text: Thank you for coming by, and thank you as well for the great review.

text:
I called market 2as closed bust says open .
Owner said they were put paying Bill's..I mean really then close your establishment. Bad business said they will call my phone back when they get back in area by then I went to Harvey's and bought what I needed meats..they kept calling my phone got an attitude  cause I wouldn't come shop..REALLY!!

name: Jay ONeal
text: Had lunch here with a potential business partner. They had club membership so I was included. Buffet was tasty, servers remembered them and their preferences, which seemed like a nice touch. Views are spectacular. You forget you’re in rural North Carolina for a few minutes. Parking was outrageous, $25 for two hours in a parking garage that is very tight.

name: Summer Brooke Photography
text: I photographed a wedding here last August. The staff was most helpful. Especially Lauren. She made sure we had everything needed for my couples wedding day...also named Lauren. Thank you.

name: Lawrence Shaheen
text: Been coming to the Charlotte City Club my whole life. One of the best kept secrets in all of Charlotte. Food is outstanding, amenities are 1st class, and the membership is a value.

name: Mark Drinkard

name: Angela Faison

Wonderful
Beautiful setting and the staff was wonderful🙂

name: Gokhan Guley
text: Love the ambiance, views and service at the club. Awesome place for business meetings and personal gatherings alike.

name: Lynn Holloway-Mylton
text: The most amazingly delicious scallops and risotto dish with asparagus ever!Cheers to the chef for a meal that I will never forget as well as the service that is always superb!

name: Karlon Young
text: Large retirement party. Filet with Grilled Halibut with mashed potatoes and asparagus was wonderful even serving a party of several hundred

name: Gary Morgan
text: Great food and better service...tks.

name: kim Carmichael
text: Well I may be a little biased as I used to work here. And it's a great place to work for! Staff is very friendly and amazing. Gorgeous on the inside! Beautiful place to have a wedding or host any event. Food is outstanding! And the head chef has been there for over 25years.  It's a hidden gem! The views are absolutely amazing, as the club sits on the 31st and 32nd floors of 121 west trade st.  You can see the ballpark, Bank of America stadium, and amazing sunsets over the mountains in the distance. I highly recommend the city club.  But pls note it is a members only club, but anyone can become a member if they apply!

name: Troy Pelshak
text: Love the view and one of the best meeting places in Charlotte!

name: Michael J Maloney Jr
text: Great staff. Wonderful views of the city, I will be back next and every trip I make to Charlotte. Food was wonderful as well and Danny is the man.

text: Great office holiday dinner held here.

text: Great food and better service...tks.

name: Ricardo Tapia
text:
(Translated by Google) It is an excellent place to eat and enjoy a good wine. In addition to what has a spectacular view of the city

(Original)
Es un exelente lugar para comer y disfrutar de un buen vino. Además de qué tiene una vista espectacular de la ciudad

name: Cathi Costa
text: An appealing location in an old fish market serving nice fresh poke dished up in interesting bowls. Their iced coffee and fruit beverage of the day are always yummy. The main reason to visit is for a delicious and refreshing salad composed of various types of seaweed. Sadly it was not available this past visit; instead was served the basic radioactive green  that you can get anywhere. Hopefully just a fluke or the ingredients were out of season.

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
We were on a poke kick after all of the new places started opening in Charlotte so we decided to stop here and give it a try.

This one was unique compared to most other poke places because you order from the menu at the counter, but you don't see the ingredients when you're ordering and you don't watch them make it. They had a large variety of ingredients, but it was hard to order because I didn't know what several of them were. The person taking my order was helpful and tried to explain them to us.

We got our food quickly and really enjoyed it. The ingredients were high quality. They had most of the sauces on the table so you could try as many as you wanted.

The restaurant is fairly small inside, but there was plenty of seating for us. We sat at a large community table in the middle. In addition to poke, they have quite a few appetizer and seafood options.

I would recommend checking this place out if you are a fan of poke/seafood.

resp.text: Jacqueline thank you so much for your amazing review.  I will most definitely pass your review on to the team.  Is there anything we could have done to get 5 stars??  We are looking forward to seeing you again soon!

name: J Z
text: Great seafood and relaxed place to get a nice lunch. The lobster rolls and lobster lollipops are must haves have. Plus a huge selection of beer, wine and free oysters.

resp.text: J Z thank you so much for the great review.  The Lobster Lollipops have been a huge hit.  We are looking forward to seeing you again soon at HI Tide Poke & Raw Bar!!

name: Drew Osborne
text: The food is absolutely delicious, the staff and the decor give off a vibe that makes you feel very welcomed, like a small diner in your hometown you've been going to for years. Would definitely recommend coming by any chance you get.

name: R C
text: Best poke I have had on the East coast.  It is an American spin on a Hawaiian favorite.

name: Adam Peter Shinn
text: These poke bowls are the real deal!! I’d recommend getting the build your own bowl. I added the soba noodle salad (Japanese favorite of mine), ahi tuna, loaded it up with tons of veggies and topped it with the sriracha ponzu sauce for a little kick. The shoyu sesame option is also good for that wonderful umami flavor! Very savory and satisfying.

name: Daniel Makogon
text: Amazing food. It was brought out quick, the wagyu beef was delicious. I got the soba noodles, fruit, and wagyu beef and it was superb. The environment was pleasing and quite enjoyable. The rustic surroundings gave it  a refreshing feeling. I will definitely come back here a lot

resp.text: Thank you so much Daniel for stoping in and enjoying HI Tide Poke & Raw Bar.  I will pass your amazing comments onto our team here!   Look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Chirag Patel
text: Really really hope they keep their Monday Lobster Roll special going.  Poke bowl is also amazing!!

resp.text: Mahalo for loving our food here at HI Tide Poke & Raw Bar! We are happy to announce that our Monday lobster roll special will be continuing for the foreseeable future! The lobster roll Monday special price is $15.95 and comes with your choice of seasoned chips or fries. Be sure to stop in and shout an aloha to the staff! They love making our guests day extra special!

name: daniel j
text: Easily the best poke bowl in the Charlotte area. Looking forward to coming back to try a lobster sandwich.  The fish tasted fresh with plenty of options to add.  The only downfall I found was we all ordered them to be on kale salad and it was a spring salad mix.  Not one of us saw any kale in the salads.

name: Kyle Winters
text: Very enjoyable experience. Oysters were excellent. Wide variety of mix and match poke bowls options with fresh ingredients. The wait staff was friendly and helpful. Cold-brewed coffee with coconut cream was delicious. We look forward to trying more options.

resp.text: Thank you Kyle so much for coming and enjoying HI Tide Poke & Raw Bar.  I will let everyone on the team know what you said!!!  Look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Trey Wright
text: Great little restaurant! I work within walking distance, so I eat here often. Lobster roll Mondays are where it's at! I also enjoy the lobster bisque and the seared ahi tuna burger. The Poke Bowls are delicious and best in the summer when you can get the ripe avocados on top. Overall I believe these folks provide great service and fresh food. #healthy

name: Davede Varner
text: I love this place, however tonight I tried the lobster roll and was very disappointed. I almost asked for a refund. Very small amount of lobster for the price and lacked flavor. So disappointing coming from a place that serves such great poke bowls. I'll be back for the fish but wont order the lobster roll again. The fries, however, were very good.

resp.text:
Hello Davede,

I am very sorry to hear our Lobster Roll wasn’t up to your standards, which mean it definitely wasn’t up to ours.  I am not sure what happened, but please come back and ask for Jeffrey.  I promise I will take care of you and make it right.  Again, I am sorry we let you down.  Your opinion matters very much to us!

name: BubonicTonic
text:
TEN STARS!! Phenomenal food and absolutely phenomenal service. They literally have the freshest seafood I’ve tasted outside of the sea shore. I’ve yet to try a dish here that I didn’t absolutely love! Photos coming soon ;)

Oh and... I consider myself a poke bowl enthusiast and I’ve been to almost every other poke spot in Charlotte and nothing compares to Hi-Tide. If you want REAL (no imitation) seafood, this is the place to go!

resp.text: Thank you so much for loving our food at HI Tide Poke & Raw Bar.  We truly appreciate you visiting us.  Next time your in be sure to say Aloha to the team.  They love to hear from guests how the food is.

name: Kyle Paulson
text: Just had my first Poke bowl and it was amazing. It was so fresh and flavorful. I loved the atmosphere of Hi Tide and the service was very friendly and fast. I was blown away by how good my dish was. My brother got a lobster roll and he said it was delicious. Also, the French fries were on point! I will definitely be bringing my wife here because she loves lobster rolls. I highly recommend this place...it is great!

resp.text: Thank you Kyle for stopping in and giving us a try.  I am glad you enjoyed yourself.  Please come back and bring your friends for a gathering!!

name: Tiffany Barnhart
text:
I came across this place after driving by and noticing the sign that said “Poke Bowls, Lobster Rolls and Oysters” and that’s all she wrote.
I insisted on my boyfriend and I coming here for our next date night and so we did!
He being the oyster lover, ordered a few different ones (I’m not into oysters personally). I really loved that they had so many different types of oysters and they had the “saltiness” rating under each of them including where they’re from.
I started out with the poke nachos and oh my goodness were they delicious! The wonton crisps were just perfect and I loved the spiral cut seaweed salad (or cucumber?? I’m not sure but either way it was great).
For my entree I had the lobster roll which I was looking forward to being the highlight of my meal.
I will say this was a bit disappointing; especially for the price. The lobster meat itself was great quality however it was slapped on bread comparable to a hot dog bun and it was served chilled which I might have looked past if presented on a better quality bread/bun.
I will definitely be returning but I’ll save my $23 on the lobster roll and get the nachos and a poke bowl next time!

resp.text: Tiffany, thank you for stopping in and giving us a try.  I am glad you enjoyed your self.  I am sad to hear you didn’t love the lobster roll. Everyone loves it, and I am amazed we can do it at $22.50 and give only claw and knuckle meat. And, not have to use cheaper tail meat.  But to each their own.  Please come back and try us again, and hopefully we can get the four star changed to a five star!!!

name: Jacob Hundl
text: Great choice for a variety of seafood options. Hawaiin poke, a selection of fresh raw oysters, lobster rolls and more are all available, and executed well. Combined with a large selection of beers, ciders, and wines, Hi Tide is an excellent raw bar.

name: Bernadette Lee
text: I am judging the place strictly on the poke bowl that I had there. Normally, my criteria for a good poke bowl consists of the taste of the fish and the variety of toppings. This is the first store that I had to worry about the texture of the fish as well. I have never had sashimi salmon with such rough texture and bland taste. Made me wonder where it came from and if I would spend the rest of my day on the toilet. Good amount of topping variety though.

name: Robert Wells
text: Really inexpensive for a raw bar/ seafood market. Very impressed. Did the poke bowl but there are quite a few appetizing things on the menu that I can't wait to come back for.

resp.text: Thank you so much for stopping in Robert.  We are very lucky to be partnered with a high end meat and fish distributor who supplies us with the freshest fish and beef everyday.  I am excited to have you and your friends back in.

name: Hayden Thrower
text: While the service was excellent, the food was just okay...I actually left hungry. The service gets 5 stars -- seriously, this dude checked on us a lot and was genuinely doing his best to make sure we had the best experience possible -- so experience wise, it was good overall, but I'd give the food 2 stars compared to other poke restaurants in the area.

name: Hayden Thrower
text: While the service was excellent, the food was just okay...I actually left hungry. The service gets 5 stars -- seriously, this dude checked on us a lot and was genuinely doing his best to make sure we had the best experience possible -- so experience wise, it was good overall, but I'd give the food 2 stars compared to other poke restaurants in the area.

name: Gary Knight
text: Best fresh seafood on Charlotte. Outstanding lobster rolls, fresh oysters, all crab crab cakes, and a wide selection of craft beers, sake, and wine. Excellent staff and impeccable service.

name: Kristin Horak
text: Loving HI Tide!! The Poke Nachos are out of this world! It starts as a base of fried wonton crisps and then is piled high with tuna, avocado, cucumber, seaweed salad, scallions and delicious sauces! A steal for the price! Poke bowls are also on point. As were the kobe sliders. The service  here is excellent!! Order at the counter and grab a number  and a seat to wait on your food. During slower  times there is table service. Also, a nice selection of local beers and craft sodas are available as well. Definitely recommend!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for trying out Poke Nachos! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Chris Hitch
text: What a treat. It is definitely a nice little gem in the midtown area. Great food from the raw bar to the poke bowl and the lobster roll. Fresh simple and popping with flavors!

resp.text:
Aloha Chris,

I am glad you enjoyed our restaurant.  Please bring your friends back and try out our “Oyster Happy Hour” 4-7pm Monday thru Friday

name: Paul Anderson
text: Fantastic and not heavy food. Service was great and everyone was friendly. I'll be back again.

resp.text: Thank You so much Paul, for coming by and eating at HI Tide Poke & Raw Bar.  I will pass your kind words on to our service staff.  They always love to hear from the guests.  Can’t wait till you stop in again!!

name: Paul Anderson
text: Fantastic and not heavy food. Service was great and everyone was friendly. I'll be back again.

resp.text: Thank You so much Paul, for coming by and eating at HI Tide Poke & Raw Bar.  I will pass your kind words on to our service staff.  They always love to hear from the guests.  Can’t wait till you stop in again!!

name: Alex Venker
text: Lobster was great! Found a little bit of shell but definitely hit the spot!

name: DJ NICK NV
text: I tried the Traditional Poke bowl and it was great. Highly recommend to anyone.

name: Chelsey Elizabeth
text: Super delicious! Poke Nachos & Rainbow Bowl were totally enjoyed. Not to mention reasonably priced under $10! AND 1/2 price bottles of wine on Wednesdays! Definite no-brainer. Shoutout to Yuwhanna for being a fantastic server and Kelly for running a great operation.

name: Peter Dixon
text: Food was fantastic! Service.... not so much.  Ordered a salad immediately after our drink order, had to ask for it again because it still didn't arrive upon receiving our entrees.

name: Chris Wolfe
text: The initial server was great. Energetic and happy to have us there. However, the simplistic food took too much time, in a very small seating, area to arrive.  My wife then went to the bathroom and there was no tp. She politely pointed this out to another server and was very rudely put in her place as being too overbearing to warrant a verbal response. Only a wait a moment finger, be with you when I feel like it, response. The obese server(never got a name) then proceded to have a confrontational argument with my wife as to how she had to go upstairs to get tp. Clearly a dangerously overexertive venture that could have ended up in her having to sweat a bit or coronary out of existence. She never apologized, but instead imparted on the rest of the staff how unjustifiable my wife was acting. Never did a manager address the confrontation, perhaps the obese server was a manager, unknown though.  The service and managers here are elementary and lackluster to the point of ambivalent disregard of paying customers. The food is unique for a second year culinary student looking for a fun night out. Avoid this place, and spend your hard earned money on an establishment that values service as much as it values it's nearly unique food.

name: Mike Schimel
text: Hot dog bun for a $23 lobster roll? Nah.

resp.text:
Hello Mike,

I truly hate that you weren’t blown away by our Lobster Roll.

So yes, our HI Tide Poke Lobster Roll is market priced right now at $22.50. And here is why:

We wanted to stay true to a New England Style Lobster Roll.  So we paired our super premium ONLY claw meat (no cheap tail, head, or body meat mixed in).  With our premium lobster claw meat, we wanted to complement it’s naturally sweet and hint of ocean salt flavor profile with a bun that was in it self slightly sweet.  Thus the King’s Hawaiian Bakery Top Sliced Bun, which originated in Hilo Hawaii was an obvious choice for us and our Pokè Concept.

We are using ultra premium Homarus americanus (American Cold Water Lobster) that is flown in from Boston several times a week.  So yes, the lobster meat is expensive, because it is very high quality and very tasty.

As far as the bun is concerned, traditionally the “Lobster Roll” is made with a “New England Hot Dog Bun”.  Yes they are called and classified as Hot Dog Buns. Prepared either hot or cold (ours is cold, but we can do hot if you would like) it is mixed with butter or Whole Egg Mayo, celery, and seasoning.  Then stuffed till over flowing with lobster.  Check out the below link from New England Network Magazine:

https://newengland.com/today/food/new-england-made/new-england-style-hot-dog-rolls/

If you happen to have a specific brand of bun you think would be a good replacement; by all means, please let me know the name.  I can source it, and start some testing (which is Restaurant talk for eating and trying).  I also would love to get you involved with the testing process for your input.

Please feel free to email me at:

Info@hitideclt.com

name: Jamie Pride
text:
I love this spot on Morehead. I think the freshest crustaceans and mollusks I've experienced in Charlotte. I can't wait to try the lobsta roll...a Monday special. Lobsta roll, DONE RIGHT!!!
Thanks, Hi Tide!

name: Brittnee Jeter
text: 1/2 off oysters between 4 and 7. Also recommend the nachos are amazing.

name: mike zizzi
