name: Scott Smith
text: The spicy tuna poke bowl was awesome

name: Ben Jones
text: Super Fresh Fish. Excellent!

name: Gilbert Williams
text: Nice lobster roll

resp.text: Thank you for the review.  Hope to see you again soon.

Thank you very much Shawn for the FIVE STARS.  And, thank you for coming and visiting and trying our Pokè.  Our team truly strives for perfection.  And that shows with our quality of food, the service our team provides, and their knowledge of the menu items.

Please come back and ask for Jeffrey, I would love to get more input on your experience!!

Aloha Lisha,  thank you so much for stopping and at trying our Poke & Raw Bar Restaurant.  I would love to have you back into the restaurant.  What can we do differently to make you think we are worthy of Five Stars??  We are always trying to improve, and welcome constructive criticism.

Thank You
Jeffrey Schreiber
Owner Operator / Executive Chef

name: Brandon Keopraseuth
text: Pretty nice for a Hibachi spot, kinda small so seating may be limited but food and staff are great. Price is spot on too

resp.text:
Hello Brandon,
We are so grateful for your kind words. Thanks for sharing your review with us and the community. Hope to see you again soon!

name: A K
text: The food here is really good! The flavor was delicious. Yeah, we have tons of hibachi spots here in Charlotte but this place does it well and fast. They have a drive thru style window where you just walk up order or pick up your food for safety and convenience! I get the filet and shrimp and that filet was tender has heck!  I heard they plan on expanding their menu to gluten free sauces and other things to satisfy everyone! Definitely call ahead and give this place a try.

name: Timothy Norcom
text:
An edit - part of why I gave it 5 stars was its value. It used to include soup or other side, that now costs separately. Prices in general have increased almost 40% since opening (according to Postmates). The "bang for the buck" advantage they had is gone. Now, I hesitate ordering from here. Now, a lunch for 2 is around $30. That's way too expensive for lunch for 2. I definitely don't go here as much, it has become too expensive.

Original post:
A huge welcome to the area! Many construction workers and BoA workers still need a place to grab a bite for lunch or after work.
Their take out-window is EXTREMELY convenient.
My girlfriend and I have been getting food here multiple times a week since they opened. Food is great and consistent.
Only downside is that vent above the window. Holy smokes that thing is deafening. I feel terrible for the people that live above the restaurant.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback. We value your business.

name: Joshua Burrell
text: The food here was fantastic!  We got teriyaki steak/chicken with noodles and hibachi vegetables with fried rice.  I've been hoping for a good Japanese shop on this side of the city and this is it! It's unfortunate the timing of their opening is during the pandemic but I really hope your team can push through this as both the food and the workers were exceptional!

text: This restaurant, located in the food court of SouthPark mall, is just as good as any standalone Showmars could be.  Good variety.  Reasonable prices.  Service is always friendly, helpful, and prompt.  Condiments, straws, etc. are conveniently placed.  Everything is usually clean.  Nothing negative comes to mind here.

name: Lorrie Young
text: Do you believe this Southpark Showmars we ordered a fish french fries coleslaw cannot believe I could not choose the fish you can tell when fish has changed and it is not Canadian flounder anymore because it is a tender delightful tasting fish we couldn't even shoot at fish I was very very disappointed because I always order that and we drove all the way up from Columbia South Carolina just to go to Southpark Showmars Freedom Drive is a lot better I don't understand what's happening with the food that we're eating when you go out these days that's why I don't eat out that much very rarely patronize these places

resp.text:
Hi Lorrie,
We apologize for your experience at our SouthPark mall location. We do offer a choice of regular flounder and our Alaskan fish at this location. Both of these fish offerings are wild-caught sustainable fish that we prepare to order.
Please feel free to reach us at feedback@showmars.com if you would like to discuss your experience in more detail. Thanks again for your comments.

text: Delicious and inexpensive?! Hot bar special today was Dijon cream pork tenderloin with carrots, potatoes, and/or green beans for $10. All seasoned and cooked to perfection! Of course, friendly and attentive staff as well!

name: Tammy grant
text: I went to this restaurant for my 1st visit to just see what type of food they have. Got a salad that was maybe 12 $13.  The salad had a tiny piece of chicken on it which was really grilled hard. The lettuce itself was saying maybe a handful of lettuce that was supposed to be a full sized salad I would have hated to see the half size. Also ordered a grill salmon sandwich which was overcooked. The food back to the restaurant to show them my dissatisfaction with what I ordered and the manager wanted to argue with me and tell me that these are the portions that they serve and it's their best food they have so with that being said if this is your best don't waste your time don't waste your money it's not worth it

resp.text: We regret your discontent. Your dissatisfaction is not typical of the experience that we have had with the public. We stand by the quality of our food and our service, and we strive for excellent customer service, therefore we happily gave you a refund.

text: Excellent food! Wonderful staff! The Cubano is unreal! 😮😮😮

name: Nathan H
text: Southern Gourmet isn't bad. But it's not exactly special. I've had their catering off-site, catered lunch on-site, and eaten take out and dine in from the cafe. I think it's worth going to and a good option for the area given most of the competition, but it's not better than New Zealand Cafe. Not by a long shot. Or the fish market. Or Ming Fu. Those places all deserve higher ratings than Southern Gourmet.

name: Izi Blumer
text: Crystal is Great! They just catered my wedding and everything was DELICIOUS! I got my linens and dishes and cutlery from them as well. The serving staff was amazing. Everything went perfectly. I would 10 out of 10 recommend for your next event.

name: Spencer Thompson
text: Great venue and an absolutely amazing meal, along with great service. Get the Firefly cupcakes.

name: Vanessa L. C.
text:
Went here to to tastings for them to be our potential wedding caterers.
First things first.... the FOOD itself was amazing. I mean hands down crazy good!!!So if all you care about is the FOOD then they are a superb company to go with.
Now, on a different side I had to give them 3 out of 5 because of a couple different thing. We were charged, per person, for the tasting. Whether we had gone with them or not we would have been charged for tasting. $10 a person. What we ate was not even a full plates worth that would cost $10. It wasn't a fair price in our opinion. I wish I had taken pictures to put here. Secondly, the lady was really nice to me (the bride) but was disrespectful to my mother. She belittled my mother, telling her she was wrong and basically saying she knew nothing about food just because my mom wanted some chicken with no sauce on it!!
My parents were going to be paying for it, and I'm sorry but you don't treat elder people that way even if they are wrong. At least use tasteful tact.
That for me ruined it all.
So food is great. Catering lady can be very much less than professional.

name: Bruce Franklin
text: We attended a catered wedding reception here. Everything from the decor, the friendly staff, the food and the wedding cake was fantastic. Nothing but good things to say about this business. Cheers!!

text: Great food. Fast service. Very friendly and nice. This will be my go to spot for seafood!

name: J Wilkins
text: Amazing amazing ! First time eating there today. The service was out of this world. And the food my God the food ! So damn good. I ordered the fried fish and red velvet Waffle. My husband ordered the shrimp and Krab platter. Everything was seasoned to perfection. My husband and I got to personally meet the owner while leaving we had to let him know how delicious everything was. We will be back.  !  Oh yeah the alcoholic drinks were also very delicious 😋I tasted all the rum lol

name: Steve Denny
text: What a hidden little gem. Have been here twice now while working on an alarm system in a local hotel. The food is AMAZING. The fish and chips lunch is a decent proportion and delicious. Whatever the secret is to the breading I want to know. It's light, crisp, flavorful, yet not overpowering or caked on. It's perfect. And the owner and staff are both friendly and engaging. They seem to be happy to be working there. Always a smile no matter if they are slammed busy or light. It's a little spendy, BUT the proportion sizes are adequate for the price and the taste is next level. You deserve to eat here. Treat yo'self.

name: K B
text:
Because the chick on the phone was rude, I did not order. I called and asked a simple question on the phone before visiting. I asked if they made special orders for those with food allergies. Some very well do and some don’t, not a problem. Her response was rudely, “We don’t take orders over the phone, you need to come in to place an order.”

I’m not placing an order, I’m simply asking a question! I live an hour and a half away.
Then, “What was your question... well this is a seafood restaurant...

How do you expect to keep your black business running if you provide poor customer services to the ones that support/pay you?!

text: Great food.  Nice atmosphere! The owner was on the premises and was eager to please.    Deep-fried lobster was unbelievable.

text: The food and the service is ALWAYS awesome. Very respectful when they address you. From the moment they welcome you upon entering, till the time you leave and they're thanking you. A must visit

text: My flight was delayed, so my husband and I stopped here for some lunch after Googling seafood near the airport.  It was delish, and the girl working at the front was polite and helpful when it came to ordering.  We will be back next time we are in the area.

text: Amazing.  The fish and chips were crispy and so tender and flaky.  The spicy homemade sauce was so good I went back and ask for extra.  The spicy shrimp platter was equally great.

text: I ordered a seafood platter, forgot the name but the one with a cluster of crab, lobster tail, and shrimp, and it was great! It was more than filling with the potatoes, corn, and sausage included! Excellent, one of the best seafood places I've had around Charlotte! I loved everything except for the cajun fries, they were crinkle cut with some sort of, almost flavorless and not very spicy, cajun seasoning. Wasn't the best but by no means was it not appetizing. They were a bit too crunchy for my liking but nevertheless, still very good. Paid a good amount but was hoping it'd be a little cheaper, but hey, seafood for the most part is pricey, regardless of where you get it from!

The flavor is great, corn was sweet and well flavored even without the sauce, potatoes were tasty and crab legs were perfectly cooked. I’ll def be back!

text: Ordered the Krab and Shrimp Platter, original, and a side of fried fish. The fish were great, not battered but dusted...crispy. The platter was awesome...crab was tasty, shrimp and potatoes perfectly cooked, and the corn soaked up flavors from everything else. text: First time trying after scrolling Instagram with a growling stomach. I saw their ad and decided to stop by. I ordered the Krab and shrimp platter (spicy) and fried shrimp and red velvet waffle.  The fried shrimp were soooo good. Seasoned and fried perfectly. The red velvet, alien, mega waffle was so BIG! It was bigger than my face! It was so fluffy and moist! I don't know what the sauce was that came with it but it was so good. I guess it was butter and sugar mixed? You don't even need the sauce because the waffle was good on it's own. The Krab and shrimp platter was ok. Loaded with potatoes,  you'll definitely get full. The only thing I didn't really like was the shrimp in that platter. They were like basic Walmart shrimp, not the big ones you get from other places that have seafood boils. The staff was friendly and attentive even though I just picked up my order and left. I would definitely go back and try other menu items! I want to to try fried fish next. And of course another giant waffle!!

I’m not sure why I had to make a reservation to sit at the bar I was hoping it was a fancier place as the pictures online showed it to be. A basic Moscow mule was $18 , which is absolutely insane. I got a cocktail on the menu which tasted fine but nothing special for $14. We ordered muscles which took about 30 minutes and there was 4 other people in the entire restaurant. They came opened which is something I’ve never heard of and they were 3x the size I’ve ever seen or eaten in my life. They were overcooked, chewy and had horrible flavor . I honestly wanted to walk out and I wish we turned around the second we walked in. The fancy plates are cute but not worth my time or money.

name: Inna Green
text: I should have left when I saw confetti bits on the floor upstairs and in the bathroom, but I stayed because of the reviews online. The DJ in the corner played a great variety of music so that helped a bit with the worst dinner I've ever had in Uptown. The kitchen service was really slow for a less than half full restaurant on a rainy night. I waited an hour and ten minutes for a main course that wasn't what I ordered, the lamb shank was bland and the rice was dry. Skip dessert because it isn't worth the time to wait for the napoleon or the honey cake. The wait staff and bartender calmed the area down with promises and begging for people to wait, but it was a bad experience. I ordered wine so at least it wasn't poorly mixed like the second long island my table ordered. I had high hopes for this restaurant because of all the reviews on yelp, google, and facebook.

name: Leslie
text: Love, love this new restaurant! Fresh ingredients brought in daily create tender, succulent, perfectly seasoned dishes. King of the Sea Octopus is a must to start! Absolutely the best I've even eaten. The lamb shank is braised in a hint of fresh Mediterranean spices mixed perfectly with jasmine rice. Food is meant to be complimented with spices and that's what Deluxe does. They do not over season or dredge the food in sauces, as so many restaurants do. Not only was the food delicious, Deluxe brought a totally new experience to dining. Dishes were presented in fun, unique displays that take food to a exciting, interactive dining experience! Patrons were roaming to one another's tables, conversating and just having fun sharing one another's artful displays. It created a warm, upbeat environment that makes me want to go back tomorrow! Owner-operator-chefs Astrik & Tatiana are passionate restaurateurs & are sure to make Deluxe a Must-Go-To restaurant! Their staff is attentive, upbeat and take pride in the experience they bring to each table &/or cocktail, also. It was such a great choice to go here! I look forward to enjoying many more delicious Deluxe food & surprises.

name: Nicholas Good
text:
Not even mad, just incredibly disappointed... (and you know that's worse).

TL;DR:
* Slow/Inattentive service
* Bad drinks
* Good, not great food
* Overpriced

With a 7pm reservation we called ahead of time to see if it was a problem to be late and we were informed it would be fine.  We arrived closer to 7:30 and were told our table wasn't ready.  All but 1 of the tables upstairs were empty and many downstairs tables were available, 1st bad sign.

After waiting a few minutes at the bar, we were escorted to the only table upstairs that had been used and hadn't yet been wiped or reset, while half a dozen other set tables were available all around us.  The hostess seating us didn't leave menus or say they would be back to wipe the table.  2nd bad sign.

After a few minutes of standing next to the table trying to flag someone down we asked the server for a table wipe, she disappeared and never came back.  Another server came by, and I asked again for the table to be wiped... nearly 10 minutes at the table and we're still not properly seated or set... a few minutes go by and the 2nd server finally comes back and wipes the table and disappears.  A 3rd person, a polite blond woman comes by to offer us water and realizes there's no glasses or settings, and finally takes some initiative to set the table properly.  This is not a good start to something that bills itself as fine dining.

Other tables around us begin to fill up and the tables are packed in tight.  Like so tight you can't get between rows of chairs to get to other tables, or out to the restroom... servers struggle to get to tables just go get orders let alone deliver drinks or food.  Speaking of delivering drinks, did I mention we've been at the restaurant nearly 25 minutes and our drink order hasn't been taken yet?  Of 4 drinks ordered only 1 seemed correct; 2 old fashioneds were room temp, no ice, missing any sugar or simple syrup, 1 was about half-portion, the other was about correct had there been any ice in the glass.  1 specialty drink had nearly no liquor.

Since we had plenty of time to look over the menu, we ordered our food with our drinks, which then took nearly an hour to deliver, with tables sat well after us receiving their food before us.  On the plus side the food was delivered hot and beautiful.  Most of it was delicious, though the chicken was overcooked and dry.  We were satisfied with the pork chop, lamb shank, and dumplings.

It wasn't until we were done eating that our server finally asked if we wanted a 2nd round of drinks, which we declined.  We were never offered dessert.  The same polite blond who we assume to be a manager did stop by the table after 2 of us departed to ask how things were, and when she was informed about the chicken she offered to take it off the bill.  This apparently wasn't communicated to the server who brought the full bill.  2+ hours in it was beyond time to go and we paid the bill in full rather than fight to flag anyone else down to get it changed.

I don't think we would have stayed for the whole meal if we hadn't been there for an event, and I doubt we'll be returning for another meal.

text: I think the people who rated 3 or less stars must have had a one off experience or just a bad day. The prices are better than most Chinese restaurants, and my fiance and I frequent Chinese food often! The food was plenty for the price and served hot and fresh-even the broccoli was fresh and crunchy-not saturated with sauce and sloppy. Overall pretty good! Pleased with the staff kindness as well-you're nice and they'll be nice. Hope this helps!

name: Alex Wolfe
text:
Been ordering from here for over 5 years ! Closest to NY style Chinese takeout I've found in Charlotte, also the cheapest.

Pay 1$ for a drink, extra sauce is only $.25, it doesn't get cheaper than that, lol ! Food is authentic and not expensive !

name: Davina Hart
text:
We wanted to try a different chinese place. I am happy with our choice. We ordered, chiken wings, egg fried rice, sweet and sour chicken, small veggie lo mein. Everything was very tasteful. Also the chicken and shrimp egg rolls are good.
We will be back!

name: OmegaRae00 Rhyne
text: The crab rangoons  are the best in charlotte. The lady at the counter is nice. Its clean and neat inside but outdated. The teriyaki chicken on a stick was delicious and i really like their sticky white rice.

name: Chay N
text: The food is really good! The lady at the register is stingy with the sauces and literally gave me two and seemed like she was mad because I wanted more. Im spending money here I should be able to eat my food the way I like. Other than that i’d go bk just bc is good food and cheap.

name: Elizabeth Lutz
text: Good food. Service, not so much 😣

name: Storm Zerith
text: Very good food very good price. Pork fried rice is the best in the area

name: Marjorie Allen
text: Pork fried rice sesame chicken what's prepared fresh and hot, really enjoyed.

name: Nicholas Floyd
text: Great food for 34+ years.!!

name: Kara Cruz
text: Called in a order and despite them telling me 10 minutes, I waited over 30. Food was decent.

name: MELBA MCGRIFF
text: The prices are the cheapest I've seen around Charlotte. The food tastes great. NY style Chinese food. I have now become a regular.

name: Catherine Brown
text: Food is good.And the food is not expensive.Good place to go for lunch and dinner.

name: Ashley Nightengale
text: Always great food great service

name: Jimmie Pearsall
text: Good NY style food. Not the most inviting decor probably best to order takeout. Woman who takes orders can have an attitude at times

name: Sam Gaddis
text: Great food CHEAP this is by far the cheapest Chinese restaurant I've been to in a very long time and the phone is still good.

name: Carlos Rushing
text: Dry rice and bland tasting food long wait times and no extra duck sauce.

name: Tabatha Pless
text: The food is amazing and they are really quick

name: Patricia Oliphant
text: Behind counter was NOT CLEAN & EMPLOYEES  didn't SMILE 😞

name: ladynatoya
text: My fav!!!

name: Rosa Munoz
text: Still the most amazing chicken wings ever, and best deals.

name: Christal Johnson
text: Ridiculously overpriced for food that taste like it was bought from the frozen foods section of the grocery store. Will never eat there again.

name: Larry Hoover
text: Good tasty food

name: Mary Simpson
text: They just need to change thier oil out the wings over heated old...

name: Mee Mee White
text: Good food!

name: Tomas F Sablon
text: Exelent portion to go

name: Shakeeka Farrell
text: Not good food

name: Dominique Chambers
text: Delicious!

name: Brock Ross
text: OMGoodness. I found my newest Chinese restaurant.

name: Martha Sheehan
text: Wonderful food, warm welcoming service, nice and clean. Loved it, can't wait to go back! really reasonable prices. All around awesome experience! Did I mention the food was so good you don't want the meal to end?

name: Vikram Chopra
text: Everything is great. The ambiance, food, service, chef, servers. Even the wall decorations are amazing. Layered and carved out of a single piece of wood. Truly artistic!

name: Robert Beurkens
text: Came here 30 minutes before they closed on a Monday night. We were served graciously. The food was absolutely delicious, we ate every drop. #41 Nam Prig Paow with crispy duck was killer, perfect tender-crisp veggies, crispy fried duck, amazing sauce. The seafood tom yum soup was great too, I could drink a whole bowl of the broth alone. Ordered a sweet tea and was pleasantly surprised that it was sweetened and iced jasmine green tea, we were given 2 teas to go as well. Overall the food and service were superb and I look forward to returning. Thank you Thai House!

name: Rebekah Reavis
text: Great addition to the Cotswold area, found it by accident today and had a delicious lunch. Pud Krapow and Pud Siew were both delicious, so much so that we ordered another Krapow to go for dinner! Great service and beautiful decor, met Sam the owner who was very personable as we talked about the restaurant. Thai food, like many regional cuisines, varies from place to place and even household to household (and street vendor to vendor) and I really enjoyed their versions. Cant wait to go back and try more, next up Pud Namaan Hoi and Mi Krop!

name: Rayshawn Harris
text: The curry was nothing to write home about. The thai tea tho was one of the better ones I've had during my travels

name: M B
text: The worst pad Thai I’ve ever had. Asked for a “2” spice and it was so spicy I couldn’t eat it and I douse my food in hot sauce. Additionally, my order was wrong. Overall it was inedible. 2 stars to give them the benefit of the doubt since this was my first time

name: Maria Moraru
text: I paid $8 for a “bowl” of Tom Yum soup - seafood combination - which had a little half pint tub filled about halfway, and the “seafood” was a shrimp and piece of imitation crab. The crispy duck was old pieces of very dry duck, re-battered and fried in some sort of tempura batter, which was never done before when I ate it off the menu years ago. The crispy duck used to always be succulent, with whole pieces of meat, not fried in some strange tempura. I think there was maybe (without the batter) 2 oz of meat in there for a $17 dish. The curry was thick and unappetizing, with a couple of pieces of broccoli in it and a couple of slices of carrot. I had them add bamboo shoots, and there were pieces of inedible, actual pieces of what tasted and chewed like wood. The quality was really bad. I was disappointed in this location. I used to go to the university location and am just judging by that standard.

name: Rayshawn Harris
text: The curry was nothing to write home about. The thai tea tho was one of the better ones I've had during my travels

name: Jessica Mullins Rhyne
text: Amazing experience here! Alicia our waitress is the best and friendly too! Very good Soup, Shrimp appetizer and Spring Rolls. You must try the hot sauce!

name: Mike A
text: We have been long time customers of the Pineville location and this new location is definitely not up to par. It’s not bad by any means, but I know they can do better. They were very disorganized and behind on all their orders, but they were very nice and got ours to us quickly. I’m very hopeful that once things level out for them they will be an amazing Thai restaurant like their other locations....which are the absolute best in Charlotte.

name: Rebekah Reavis
text: Great addition to the Cotswold area, found it by accident today and had a delicious lunch. Pud Krapow and Pud Siew were both delicious, so much so that we ordered another Krapow to go for dinner! Great service and beautiful decor, met Sam the owner who was very personable as we talked about the restaurant. Thai food, like many regional cuisines, varies from place to place and even household to household (and street vendor to vendor) and I really enjoyed their versions. Cant wait to go back and try more, next up Pud Namaan Hoi and Mi Krop!

name: Amy Stockwell
text: Great service. Great food

name: Satya Jvala
text: The Red Curry was so delicious! Also, actually spicy, which I never find in Charlotte 😁 I would highly recommend it. Super flavorful and good portion size.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Jaye Tyler
text: Slow service and waitress didn't get our order right. They weren't even that busy. Food was good once we got it fixed, though.

name: Katie Richey
text: Under seasoned and disappointing. We got takeout of pad thai and pad see ewe. Both had bland meat and altogether had nearly no flavor in the sauce. OK texture, but only tasted like salt and barely any vegetables. I have had great Thai food in other cities and decided to try this place based on positive  reviews. But it was so flavorless, I really don’t see how anyone thinks this is delicious Thai food. Charlotte isn’t a foodie city so I didn’t have high expectations. However, I have had better food from two other Thai restaurants in town, so it is not impossible to find. But this place is not even as good as other local Thai places. Also, staff were not wearing masks inside the restaurant which made me uncomfortable.

name: Jule Gooch
text: Great takeout service. They had no problem I made a special request.bthe food was delicious,  hot and the order was correct.  Great curry and Pad thai. They have brown rice too.

name: kaledev
text: I've had varied success here. Sometimes it's good, other times it's extremely bland. Seems to depend on who's cooking that day. The spring rolls were good.

name: Bill Riggs
text: Had a delicious lunch in a very pleasant outdoor dining area. The waitress was very helpful, the price was reasonable and the quantity was very large. Ordered medium spicy Pad Thai and it was just right for us.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Louis Pham
text: On average 45 mins wait time, it's amazing how they even make money really.

name: Andrew Romano
text: This thai restaurant is fantastic, we came here during lunch they instantly brought over soup, when i ordered it came out rather quickly, i love the ambiance here, not sure i understand the 1 stars with the food but every place is gonna have strenghth in certain dishes, also this is thai food most people relate it to chinese it is not, a lot of the food comes out wet or oily with sauce if you want fast food thai dont go to a sit down restaurant. Ive had a wide range of thai food and they spice it enough here flavor is good in my opinion, cant wait to come back and try other dishes

name: Misbah Abrahani
text: I ordered the Pad Thai from this place today and it was awful. Not at all seasoned with big chucks of uncooked onions. Disgusting

name: Lauren G
text: Absolutely amazing! The flavors and decor brought be back to my time in Thailand. I am so happy to have found this place. If you like  restaurant Thai Taste- you will love this place more. Very authentic food!

name: D Pearce
text: Every bit as good as the location in Pineville.  Good service and food.

name: Janine Carter
text: Very nice friendly waitress. Good service and food was hot and tasted good. Went there for lunch

name: kashi bermejo
text: Excellent food friendly service timely food prep😊💖

name: Matthew DeSantis
text: I literally can't wait for you guys to open near us!  You seriously have the best Thai curry I've ever had!  Hang in there.  Looking forward to August 1st!

name: Joy Greenwald
text: Good service, nice patio with beautiful furniture. Too expensive for Pad Thai for lunch. They need a weekday lunch special, $10 meal including a drink.

name: L McD
text: if you like eating String Spring rolls.  This is yhe place.to go.  We should have gone with our instints, they gave our food away then gave us burnt food and I got hfway thtough my spring roll and started chewing something that was not a vegetable.  It was string.  Will not visit again!!!!!

name: Corine Hoyt
text: Excellent authentic Thai food. This is one of the best spots to eat

name: Jo Covington Nencetti
text: Great lunch and our server Alisha was amazing and adorable.

name: teresa brice
text: The food was good service was exceptional

name: Camilo Salas-Bowen
text: Unprofessional, and rude staff. They took forever.

name: Thomas Driscoll
text: Great food. Better service.

name: Kris Kodad
text: Excellent food, customer service, and environment! And Alicia is the best server! :-)

name: Tina Thompson
text: Wonderful service and food

text: Me and the wife's favorite food.

name: Susan Hayes
text: Beautiful restaurant, friendly staff. Food was delicious

name: Imagination Realizereality (Beaner)
text: Absolutely delicious food and great customer service

text: Love Thai House!

resp.text: Thanks

text: Really good food and great service

name: Stuart Thompson
text: First time, excellent flavor, good service

name: Nick Frost
text: Not good

name: Saravanan Ram
text: Service is good. Food is okay. The fried chicken tastes good.

name: the joker
text: It's aight...only got a steak biscuit,looked like a country gravy steak sans gravy and deep fried...

name: Krystal Lee
text: Two weeks ago I would have given 5 stars but the last two times I ordered from here my order was incomplete and them fixing it properly wasn't an option. The first mess up came when I ordered lunch for me and two co-workers. I left my Delish card and asked the cashier to register my points using my number. Once finished paying for my order which totaled $26 I gave my number to add my points and noticed she did not put them in but continued helping the next customer. When I informed her again of my points instead of adding them to my meal she added them to her next customers meal who only paid $6 so I essentially lost points. I went in again to at 07:40am to order my usual breakfast for me and another coworker and yet again there's an issue. We ordered the Cajun Filet biscuit combos add extra crispy bacon, egg and cheese to both upsizing the meal to large. Not only is there no cheese on either sandwich the bacon is far from extra crispy.  They don't answer calls and have attitudes when you let them know they messed up something you paid for. They need to get it together.

name: margaret mckayhan
text: Great my sister-in-law birthday. Very nice. Food was on point and so was the services.

name: Claude Oreo
text: Went during a tournament at the conference center. Everything was fine, but the biscuits tasted kind-of old. It was super busy, so they were probably just trying to bake as many biscuits at the time to keep up with demand.

name: Cheryl Johnson
text: Food was hot and good! No complaints!

name: Elmar Scaife
text: Convenient for lunch and food as expected.

name: trey edgerton
text: The Bojangles in the convention center just hits different.

name: Jonathan Simpson
text:
It's franchise! There are no specials!
Pricy!!! Compared to nonfranchised bojaBojan...

name: Sifron Benjamin
text: Prices are slightly higher than most Bojangles, but good for being in Uptown. Staff is very friendly and the wait is never long.

name: August Baur
text: This place is not good. Service is slow, workers obviously hate their jobs, and you’re lucky to get a fresh biscuit. My advice...walk the few blocks to the Bojangles up the street.

name: Brett van Beynum
text: Good place to grab a quick bite while at the convention center. It's not always open if there's not anything going on.

name: Douglas Nadeau
text: Food was good but your help have attitudes.

name: Elisha Washington
text: Good food, fast service

name: Keith Patterson
text: Love this place. Overwhelmed with service during lunch, especially during a big convention. Very fast though!

name: Steven G
text:
Pros:
-Food is always fresh and piping hot
-Always a visible manager around doesn't get a  of traffic so there is rarely a line
-staff is friendly
-CLEAN!

Cons:
- if there isn't an event going on your meal lay get cooked to order and it can take forever

text: They forgot my biscuit in the 3pc dinner :(

name: Angie‘Sew Therapy
text: If you frequent this location they have a discount card that gets points + a discount.  So if you are a die-hard BoJ eater and are close by grab one!

name: Kevin Kekich
text: Bojangles is the worst. Dear god I hope they all close.

name: Andrew W
text: Love Bojangles. This location is a bit off the beaten path and a lot of people don't even know it exists. The people that work here are friendly. I eat here a lot and have never had an order messed up.

name: Larry Richardson
text: I eat at Bojangles quite often

name: Erin Blackburn

name: Farnoosh Brock
text: Wonderful West Coast chain out here in Charlotte. We got the 24-oz smoothies which I think was way way too big but delicious.they were very welcoming and happy to modify the smoothies to our liking and the quality of ingredients is top notch. As a smoothie and juice book author, they get my stamp of approval!!

name: Mitch McCarl
text: We got the mango Acai bowl and a cold brew chai latte. The bowl was delicious and fed two people well. The mango is in the Acai and not on top, which is kinda dumb, because you can’t taste it very much. The chai latte was grosssss. It says it has a lot of almonds, which makes it pretty fatty and sugary. It was really think and a waste of money. The employees were very friendly.

resp.text: Mitch thanks for the feedback!  We will be sharing this with our team and we hope you can give our other menu offerings a try during your next visit!

name: M H
text: I love this place!  I have been here at least 3 times in the past two weeks. I love their bowls and smoothies and I cant wait to try the juice cleanse. Friendly staff and great service!!

name: trey Kelly
text: Place is awesome! I came in and asked questions and left out with a 6 bottle cleanse. Pick your flavors and they have some great flavors. Serve your body a treat.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! We love to hear that you are enjoying the cleanses!

name: Soahfi Umoh
text: I was in heaven! Awesome ingredients, so fresh.A great alternative to dairy.They also offer weekly detox kits, with individual juice formulas for each day of your detox. It was amazing! I had a bowl full of nutrients and fresh fruit , it was everything!!!

name: April Moyo
text: Was really wanting to finally try a acai bowl... this was soooooo fresh and tasty.  Hit the spot! Not cheap (at least not what I was expecting to pay)  but they give you such a healthy,  huge portion.  Worth the cash to treat yourself.

name: Stephanie T
text: Nektar juice bar is one of our favorites, I especially love them when I am not feeling so well. My husband will go and grab smoothies for me, a favorite... Tumeric Sunrise. I can’t tell you what a lifesaver having Nektar close to home has been. Of course, we grab a smoothie on the weekend here and there as well. Really great selection of what we all should be putting into our body regularly!

name: Stephen Archibald
text:
Did a 5 day juice cleanse here and over half the juices were expired by a few days.  I wouldn't have worried too much about it until the protein one I had at the end of the day was sour.  I was pretty annoyed by this.  Other than that, everything has been good here and the staff is pretty nice.

Thanks for making it right guys!

resp.text: Stephen Oh no! This isn't the kind of experience we want for our beloved guests! Can you please email us at contact@nekterjuicebar.com when you get a moment? We'd like to find out more and would appreciate it!

name: Dece Tuengel
text: We LOVE Nekter!! It's one of just a few ice creams my daughter can eat and it is so yummy!! We can't wait for the Concord, NC location to open since the closest location right nowis 40 minutes away.

name: C Perry
text: First time visiting. Went with the recommended cold press juice (Toxin Flush) and was not disappointed. Tangy and sweet with a little bite from the ginger.

resp.text: C we're happy to hear you enjoyed your Toxin Flush!  We hope you can come visit us again soon :)

name: Kisha Bibb
text: Today I decided to try Nekter.  I was suppose to go on Monday to preview their Matcha Sea Salt Carmel ice cream.  I am not a fan of their watermelon drive.  However, the Slender Greens smoothie had a great taste.  I will definitely go back.

resp.text: M thank you for your review & kind words!  We can't wait to see you again soon :)

name: salmex
text: The staff here is very friendly and attentive, if you order  Online usually ready by the time you get there

resp.text: O A thank you for your review. We are always looking for ways to improve, so we'd love to hear any extra feedback you have at contact@nekterjuicebar.com. We hope to hear from you soon!

name: Ben Torres
text: A much needed addition to this side of town. From cleanses to juices, there is something to be found for everyone on their menu.

name: salmex
text: The staff here is very friendly and attentive, if you order  Online usually ready by the time you get there

resp.text: O A thank you for your review. We are always looking for ways to improve, so we'd love to hear any extra feedback you have at contact@nekterjuicebar.com. We hope to hear from you soon!

name: Elizabeth Wurtenberger
text: Fairly pricey but delicious. Join the loyalty program though it's super legit.

name: Vandana G
text:
Oohh Lala

I love fruit juices and honestly nekter doesn't taste too good!

Yes you read it right, it wasn't tasty sweetish per se, but is so real! No syrup NO BS!

It's a bit pricey but if you join the rewards program with app etc, you should get few percent off.

I tried :
1. Acai
2. Beet root
3. Green one
4. Coconut berry

Favourite goes to beet root

name: Darya Silchenko
text: Yummy açai bowls for a reasonable price

name: Bailey Brown
text: JéLyn was super kind and helped me figure out what I wanted. I love what I got!

name: Carla Clark
text: Some of the best juices in Charlotte!   Customer service is awesome!

name: Anurag Sodhi
text: gud juice choices which can be customized. A bit pricey

name: Jennifer Watson
text: Smoothies are good -- a little pricey for what you get.

resp.text: We adjusted prices in order to balance increasing business costs with our commitment to providing value to our guests with the highest-quality, clean ingredients and the best possible Nékter experience. We appreciate your understanding and hope that you enjoy your next visit with us!

name: Queen Victoria Uno
text:
Great Service. Great Food.
Would love to have more incentives to visit more often.

resp.text: Queen Victoria Uno, thanks so much for the lovely review! Have you checked out our rewards program on the Nekter Juice Bar App? In addition to our rewards program, it also includes an online ordering feature! We also have two new seasonal smoothies: The Turmeric Sunrise and Dragon Berry Bliss that are only here for a limited time! Hope to see you again soon :)

name: Irene Smith
text: Great juice and smoothies, took a really long time for a juice. Will preorder on the app next visit to save time.

resp.text: Irene Smith thank you for your review.  Freshly-made and hand-crafted juices, smoothies, and açaí bowls can take a bit longer than some anticipate, so we apologize for the longer wait time!  We will be passing your feedback along to management to review in regard to staffing up at busier times of the day.  We hope you can try our online ordering at order.nekterjuicebar.com during your next visit!

name: J Z
text: Great service and juice! Try the green apple detox and a skoop of the chocolate bliss you won't regret it.

resp.text: J Z thanks for the great review & tips!  Can't wait to see you again soon :)

name: Melinda Brock
text: Great menu and very helpful staff

name: Greg Cole
text: Great smoothies served by nice and friendly staff. I swing by about one a week.

resp.text: Greg Cole we're so happy to hear our team has been able to take such great care of you!  Can't wait to see you again soon :)

name: niki reid
text: Great place and great service

text: Taste so good

name: David C
text: Excellent! Beautiful space. Locally, independently owned shop with all coffee roasted in house. 3 cold brew coffee blends on tap. Self-serve water station with sparkling option, beautiful patio and rooftop. I drank the Costa Rican drip and can give it a near - perfect score. Sign up for loyalty and get a free drip immediately. I will return ASAP.

name: M M
text:
Had a great ice latte here, one of the best I've had in Charlotte so far! Just the right amount of bitterness, blended perfectly with the creamy milk. Really cool space with a plethora seating options, inside, outside or upstairs.

If you keep coming back, they have an app where you can build up rewards points as well. I'll definitely be back!

name: Sandy Li
text: Best coffee shop in Charlotte with a fantastic indoor/outdoor space! Great hangout spot, place to work remotely, read a book, etc. The owner’s cute dog roams around the shop and he is a sweetheart. Place is overall very cozy and welcoming. 10/10 addition to Plaza Midwood.

name: Jonathan Buechner
text: Fantastic place. Coffee is delicious and the food offerings are also great. Wonderful outdoor space to get some work done!

name: Stephen Hess
text: Really good coffee!  Breakfast burritos were awesome.  This place kind of snuck up on me when it opened, but I will definitely be going back.

name: Leslie Huezo
text: We love trying new coffee places and this is one of the places we’ll definitely be going back to. The coffee is delicious, prices are fair and the owner is super friendly. We love the atmosphere and hope everyone gets a chance to try

name: L B
text: Awesome burrito and strong coffee :D

name: Devin Hepburn
text: The coffee and breakfast burritos are amazing. I am loving them as an addition to plaza midwood.  I am excited to try more of the menu and check out the beer and wine lounge area up top.

name: Jonathan Bolenbaugh
text: One of my new favorites. Great space, great coffee, friendly baristas. Parking on site as well.

name: La Trekista
text: dropped in to pick up a gift card for someone and decided to get a latte. it was strong (I mean that in a positive way) and tho am working on reducing my caffeine intake, I can see myself heading back. I took my cup to go, but noticed there was plenty of seating & I also appreciated the vibe (there's a huge is it coffee grinder at the entrance). Enzo, the barista who made my latte has an affable demeanour.

name: Paul Cray
text: Great latte and the empanadas are fantastic. The sweet corn, breakfast, and patagonia empanadas were all delicious. The chimichurri was incredibly flavorful. Definitely look this place up if you're in the area.

name: Cody Braddock
text: The coffee is awesome. The breakfast burritos are awesome. Great place for small business meetups and laptop friendly with Wifi. Will definitely be coming back. Love the ambiance here!

name: Bryan
text: The environment is fantastic. Super welcoming, great aesthetic. The baristas are educated and skilled. Staff is very friendly. Two stories of seating and wonderful immersion between the indoors and out, will be greater in warmer months. The coffee was exceptional. Latte far exceeded expectations, phenomenal quality espresso utilized. I really enjoy this place, it's the type of place I will go for coffee, and spend a lot of time there doing productive things like checking e-mail or browsing my instagram feed. I highly recommend the Giddy Goat.

name: Brian Robinson
text: Great coffee at a fair price.  Been several times so far and everything is great.  The owner is very nice as well.

name: Ty Turner
text: Awesome place...The owner is a real cool dude..#supportsmallbusinesses

name: Jeff Hudson
text: Great Coffee and great people. Cheers.

name: John Bryan
text: Excellent score on all counts - Product, Service, and Environment.

name: Owice Aittaleb
text: Best coffee in town.  I’m originally from the Mediterranean region and a regular coffee drinker 2 espressos a day plus a cappuccino sometimes.  This place is legit. My new favorite place!

name: Jenna Daugherty
text: Such a cute coffee shop! The iced coffee was delicious!

name: Jon Silla
text: The espresso was so good that I thought I was at the source in central america.

name: James Johnston
text: Great out door seating and view, wonderful friendly staff.

name: L B
text: Awesome burrito and strong coffee :D

name: michael depalma
text: Good place for coffee and socializing. Friendly staff.

name: Hotany Alvarez
text: Great place for morning breakfast

name: Heather Hamilton
text: Most delicious matcha latte!

name: Je Man
text: I ordered the everything well done bonsai burrito. The burrito taste really good and very delicious, all the vegetables, the rice and seafood meats compliments very well with the flavor. Very flavorful in every bite.🙂😀👍👍

name: Taddes Korris
text: Best sushi in Charlotte. Really awesome people running the shop and they are incredibly friendly.  Quality is always of a high level and prices are exceptional.  We usually order vegetarian rolls and they are always artfully made with lots of ingredients. Not your typically boring cucumber and avocado veg sushi!

name: Natalya Klimova
text: Overall, I liked the spot. The sushi rolls were good. One was brought out without the sauce, but not a big deal. I did think it was a bit steep in price, and it took awhile to get my to-go order. Other than that, neat spot in 7th street market

name: Eliade Sinnett Gensler
text: Charlotte for lunch? Come here!!! We loved this local find! We had the OG and let me just say I wish I didn’t share it with my husband! Prices were just right for the phenomenal food! Keep it up!

name: Dima Kazantsev
text: Their phone number doesn’t work. It’s very hard to find them.

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
Being a sushi fan, trying a sushi burrito had been on my list for a while. This is the only place in Charlotte I know of that makes sushi burritos. This is one of many great options inside of 7th Street Public Market.

I got the Incredible Hulk burrito and boy was it good. It has a little kick to it from the jalapenos which was good. The fish was fresh tasting. It was a little messy to eat when you add soy sauce to the equation. It's a decent size, but I was still a little hungry when I got it for dinner.

You order and pay at the counter, take a number, and find a seat anywhere in the market. When your food is ready, they'll bring it out to you. I got mine pretty fast.

I've also heard really good things about their sushi and poke. I'll definitely be back here again!

name: Bobby Sexton
text:
Went for lunch on a Saturday. Said they open at 11:30am, we showed up at noon. They said they could not open until the boss showed up, who is also the only sushi chef. Was told chef would arrive in 10 more minutes, after 1.5 hours of waiting still not open. Only place closed in the 7th St. Market.

They’re still closed for all I know......not interested in your business if closed the entire Saturday lunch hour.

name: Martin Decker
text: Food here is good and convenient for a quick sushi lunch. Took away a star for a to-go order that was handed to me incorrectly. I was satisfied with the resolution when I called the location back: they offered the same order another day, on the house.

name: Julie Efremoff
text: Love this place. Too bad it's closing at end of year

name: Rob
text: Quick stop here on a date night before a show.  Great customer service, decent prices and excellent sushi.

name: Mrs Mc
text: My goodness... this food is so good that i felt conpelled to give all stars wherw they are due. I am currently chewing and doing this review as I type....

name: Joe Smith
text: Lame. Showed up at 330 Friday April 28. Stood for at least 5 minutes at the sushi bar while the chef ran his mouth to the only other customer in there (who already was eating) and did not even acknowledge me or take my order. As he continued to blab I glanced at this supermarket grade sushi and left. Avoid at all costs. Plenty of other food options in the building.

name: frederick hudson
text: Love Bonsai Fusion, great customer service and great food

name: Jeff Pete
text: Phenomenal fish! Being from Florida's coast, been spoiled, but these guys nailed it! Great food, and amazing service with an awesome and eclectic atmosphere! Thanks, guys!

name: walter atkins
text: Ok sushi place. Service could have been a bit better.

name: Toni Whitman
text:
Inconvenient parking deck, confusing, small spaces, inconsiderate drivers.  It is validated for free for 2 hours.

The sushi sounded great, but it lacked flavor and was very underwhelming for the time it took to park, wait for the order, and the price. They do have basic sushi specials for lunch.

name: Tom Brennan
text: Delicious, no fuss sushi in a great location. Only wish they had a free standing location open later.

name: Malik Elhindi
text: Nothing special. But 4 stars for the sushi burrito. Would probably try it again if I find myself in the area.

name: Dylan Hahn
text: The people who work here hate their jobs.

name: Heather Colasurdo
text:
(Translated by Google) Love yhe AND Hulk burrito! Yum!

(Original)
Love yhe OG Hulk burrito! Yum!

name: Linda Wolf
text: The food is in containers already made so the service was fast.  The staff were friendly.  The food seemed rather bland for Caribbean spice.  There was no prices on anything except one lunch special on the door.  I was there for dinner and prices were significantly more expensive.  The bakery seemed to mostly consist of white bread.

name: Frank Wakoski
text: I’m not a fan of of Caribbean food , just not my thing but my friend suggested I try it and boy was she right. The food was great but also the customer service was fantastic.. You feel welcome and they are very professional and makes you feel like your family..

resp.text: Frank, we enjoyed reading your review, many thanks! We’re happy to hear that you enjoyed the food along with your visit with us. We look forward to serving you again soon. Bless up.

name: Toya Moon Goddess
text: I was so excited to see a Golden Crust!!!! The mild Beef Patty with Cocoa bread was DELICIOUS and the the lunch specials are great!!! Lots of food and absolutely delicious. The Curry Goat had just enough spice and I really enjoyed it. The rice and peas were moist and delicious

name: Dre’ Ames
text: Well.....  So far this place has the best Jamaican cuisine in Charlotte that I've eaten here.  Portions are nice with plenty of flavor. Maybe pennies or so more expensive than local competition but well worth it. It's quiet,clean and well worth the trip.

name: CeCe
text: The food here is delicious! It's authentic and the best I've had in Charlotte. Carrot and rum cakes are on point too.

name: Suzan Chong
text: Amazing veggie patties. I gave it a 5 because it was amazing to find something in the restaurant I could eat. I dont eat meat but I miss my jamaican heritage foods. Thank you Golden Crust. I just need one made without meat broth.

name: Ossie Spaulding
text: Just reopening.  Place is clean, staff is friendly.  This  is a chain restaurant that carries most of the standard Jamaican foods.  They do have some of the best beef patties around, the crust is really good.

name: monique mcclam
text: A good stop to grab you something Caribbean/ Jamaican me 😊 food. They do have dining in which me and my husband do a lot. It’s a very friendly business and the employees tend to remember you once you become a regular. They are one of my top jerk chicken places to go to in the university area which means it’s worth trying lol. Also if you live a little farther away and aren’t feeling the drive they are connected with doordash so 👋 deliver tonight.

name: Pamela B.
text: I enjoyed each bite of my meal. The staff was very friendly, and the establishment was clean. Comparing this establishment to many of these fake food, over priced, small portion places, Golden Krust is tops. A very good portion of reall food  for a very good price

name: Marlon Mejias
text: I had the goat roti. It was amazing. I also had the jerk dinner. Its hard to believe that food came out the same kitchen. It was bad...   Their prices are somewhat expensive. Food needs to be great at that price point.

name: Marlon Mejias
text: I had the goat roti. It was amazing. I also had the jerk dinner. Its hard to believe that food came out the same kitchen. It was bad...   Their prices are somewhat expensive. Food needs to be great at that price point.

name: Robin Green
text: Very good food and portions. Please consider extending hours on Sunday.

name: Mealy 876
text: A great place for Jamaican food, the restaurant is clean and the food is great!

name: David Duncan
text:
The quantity and quality of the door is great. I had the Curry chicken during lunch on a Friday. Came with more food that I could eat in single sitting. Food has good spice flavour.

On the door there is an advertising for lunch specials $5.99. I commented that I would like the lunch special. It was fixed, and rung up as $12.07. I found out after it was fixed that lunch specials are Mon thru Thursday. The regular prices are not posted.

This place is expensive! Needs to be changed to $$ or $$$!

Also noticed on the way out that group of people, not of my race... We're paying different prices for the same food.

Originally I have it 3 stars, because the food was tasty. But upon exiting the restaurant it dropped to 1 star.

Regretfully, I will not return.

name: Calvin Henry
text: Their food is usually tasty. I think they should get rid of the mini dinner, It would give them a bad reputation,because it's too small. Not much can fit in there without over soaking the dinner with gravy,and spoiling the whole thing.

name: Buddafly AD
text: The food is very bland. NO flavor whatsoever! Ive been there a handful of times periodically in the past and the food was OK at best. Nothing special. But this time it was horrible. I ordered the curry with peas n rice. Not to mention their sanitation score went down to a 94. I dont plan on giving them my service again.

name: Lumana Rai
text:
This place is a joke.  It took TWENTY minutes from the time I got there until I left to get a to go order.  The food is precooked and right out front so come on.  There was only ONE person ahead of me.  The portions are laughable and the flavor was lacking love.  Certainly not worth the $13 for a large oxtails.
I should have followed my gut and head to the authentic spot just past CMC University.
Don't waste your time and your money going to GK...

name: Nia J
text: I will change my review once they're open for business I called like 6 times no answer. I got there about Noon on 1/2/2019 no one was there. Lights out! Door locked! What happened?

name: Sigourney Ridley
text: Closed on Sundays. Only serve breakfast on Saturday morning . food was surprisingly good. Definitely better than caribbean hut and tropical. Which are nasty! So this will do until I find some home cooking else where. Still have to give Quigley's a shot.

name: P Jewel
text: Food was great. Big portions too. The sides could have been seasoned more but overall it was amazing.

name: Keisha Murphy
text: a Waste of $10.66 for a large curry ! Portion size was so small smh ...

resp.text: Hi Keisha, Thank you for your feedback on our large curry, our goal is to make customers happy and we're sad we weren't able to do that for you.  Your feedback will help us strive to improve our cuisine.  We sincerely hope you consider giving us another try so you can enjoy the Golden Krust experience you know and love!

name: kepstein8888
text: Generous portions, but quantity is not quality.  Jerk chicken was good, but side orders were stale and unflavorful.  It all seemed authentic enough with the food choices, the employees with cool outfits, accents, and hospitality, but the food itself was substandard.

name: Byron Medina
text: Absolutely loved it!! Great food! Great service! Great price!

name: Boss Lady Natalie McKenzie Allen
text: This place is no longer Golden Crust and it's not owned by Jamaican. Bought Jerk Chicken wasnt that good but can eat customer service was ok.

name: Sassy Queen
text: I ordered some oxtail and rice and peas and it was nasty. The flavor was not there throughout the whole meal.  The bread pudding that I bought was thrown in the trash after the first bite. Idk what they put in it but it wasn't edible. After tonight's experience I will no longer be going there!

name: Narmol
text: Amazing food, and great customer service.

name: Kerwin Edwards
text: More food not enough for price.

name: Kristy Lowe
text: The food is authentic and delish

resp.text: Kristy, we enjoyed reading your review, many thanks! We’re happy to hear that you enjoyed the food. We look forward to serving you again soon. Bless up.

name: Elder Stacey Zanders
text: Compared to the two locations in Atlanta..we're a bit let down. The front staff wasn't welcoming at all. They had their heads down and acted uninterested to take our order. A guy in the back came out, but didn't greet us at all or ask how the food was. Instead he asked us to open the back door for him. We told them we were use to the Atlanta location, but that comment went unnoticed as well. The food was alright, but we probably won't be visiting the Charlotte location again.

name: Robertha Higgins
text: Awesome food and service.

name: Duane Goodman
text: Very tasty food!

resp.text: Duane, we enjoyed reading your review, many thanks! We’re happy to hear that you enjoyed the food. We look forward to serving you again soon. Bless up.

text: Love it! Drive long, very long just to come here.

text: Great curry chicken. Oxtails are not tender.

text: Not to bad

text: Delicious

text: They need a new cook.

name: carl
text: Great food

name: Bruce Butler
text: I love this restaurant

name: Terran & Kheareh Settler
text: Small establishment with good food

name: coretta livingston
text: the food was a mazing the brown stew chicken was on point

resp.text: Jasmine, thanks for the great 4-star rating. We look forward to serving you again soon and in hopes of earning your fifth-star review.
Aaron, we truly value your honest 3-star rating. We would love to hear more about your experience so we can improve in the future. We hope you'll give us another chance so we can apologize in person!

name: Heart Cali
text:
Pulled up to this location at 8:00pm, I checked the business hours and it says location closes at 9:00pm.
The lights were off and doors locked with NO explanation on door! 🤷🏻‍♀️
Only sign on door said they were hiring and business hours indeed said they close at 9:00pm but nobody in sight in this establishment.

resp.text: Heart Thank you for reaching out. Unfortunately due to a power outage from the strong storms that day we had to close early. A sign was posted and we apologize if it was not visible when you visited. We hope that you will return and enjoy a Sub Above soon!

name: Ryan McElroy
text:
I've gone to this Jersey Mike's dozens of times. In fact, it's a little embarrassing how frequent it is.

I would say the majority of the time I get a 5* Experience. Friendly and fast employees. Especially now, I've noticed that this location has an A team.

Previously I would occasionally get some employees that were slow or frankly a bit rude. Some other minor issues include 2 instances of stale bread (very rare) and not taking into account requests via online orders (sort of common, but Jersey Mike's isn't subway).

Overall the food here is consistently very high quality for fast food, and I'm going to keep coming back.

resp.text: Ryan , thank you for the great feedback! We are grateful that you chose us and our entire team looks forward to welcoming you back for another great Jersey Mike's Sub and experience.

name: Greg Smith
text: Great service!   The team at Jersey Mikes was attentive, friendly and quick!   Will be back

resp.text: Greg - Thank so much for the feedback of our team! We love our crews and are so proud of them! We appreciate you and hope to see and serve you again soon!

name: Jon Silla
text: #17 is my favorite

resp.text: Jon Thanks for telling us about your experience. Our customer's feedback is very important to us and we appreciate you!

name: Steven Lianides
text:
Friendly staff. (This review is based on 2 visits.) Bread is fresh, subs are decent, but in my opinion, a bit expensive for what you get. Enjoyed a Philly cheese steak sub, but a regular was $9.00-could have been a little larger, with more onions.
Ingredients seem to be good quality. All in all, enjoyable but not that "special" experience you're looking for.
Could have stretched it 3 1/2 stars if they offered the rating.

resp.text: Steven Have you heard about our MyMike's rewards program? It's free and easy to join and you can earn free subs fast! Ask any employee to help you sign up soon!

name: Tom Pop
text: I've never had a Philly cheese steak from here before but OMG was it a good one. I got the large and it fed my whole family and everyone loved it. Definitely found my new and only spot for those. Fresh bread, freshly cooked, friendly staff. Look forward to ordering more from here.

resp.text: Tom Thanks for reaching out to share your experience with us and the community! We are glad to see that we are making our customers happy! We hope to see you back for another amazing sub soon!

name: William Turk
text: The subs they have taste great, but they don't have the variety of some other restaurants.

resp.text: William Thanks for telling us about your experience. Our customer's feedback is very important to us and we appreciate you!

name: Dave Amati
text: My second time eating at Jersey Mike's, can't believe how good they are, can't compare Subway and Jimmy John's to them. great staff too.

resp.text: Dave Thanks for reaching out to share your experience with us and the Yelp community! We are glad to see that we are making our customers happy! We hope to see you back for another amazing sub soon!

name: Joyce Stirling
text: Most Jersey Mike's are very friendly and quick. We were the only people in line and the staff didn't acknowledge us for a few minutes even though they were right behind the counter. The vibe was not good.  Only my husband requested chips (and placed a bag on the counter), but while eating we noticed we were charged for two.  Best course of action was just to grab a bag of chips.

resp.text: Joyce We're so sorry if your experience with us was less than a sub above! We would be grateful for the opportunity to make it up to you and learn from your feedback. Please feel free to reach out to our owner anytime by emailing: rblake8506@aol.com

text:
Great Sub.  Today special deal BOGO
With coupon. The best subs around no doubt

resp.text: Donald Thanks for reaching out to share your experience with us! We love to see that we are making our customers happy! We hope to see and serve you  again soon!

name: Joleen Y.
text: My sister and I went here this evening. The service from the cashier, Ray, was phenomenal. He had us smiling and laughing the whole time. The bread was fresh and sandwiches were delicious. I don't know why they have such a low rating. I will definitely be back!

text: Very nice staff very friendly

resp.text: Bradley , thank you for the great rating! We truly appreciate you!

resp.text: Hello S D!  Thanks for letting us know! We enjoy our time with you as well! :-) See you soon!

resp.text: Melvin , thank you for the great feedback! We truly appreciate that you chose us and our entire team looks forward to welcoming you back for another great Jersey Mike's Sub and experience.

name: Johnny Torres
text: This place was recommended by a Guatemalan friend that said its the closest to what home taste like, idk if it really is, but what I can tell you is that me being from Hispanic decent this place is amazingly delicious! And cheap cheap cheap! The tamales veracruzanos(not known like this at the restaurant) took me back in time to my abuelas kitchen! Delicious.

name: Ramon Constante
text: Needed a pick me up breakfast.  Very good and coffee had a dash of cinnamon added. Muy delicioso!!!

name: Juarez Roxi
text: Even though the food is some good here I got disappointed the time that I ordered a dish of Hilachas it was so salty 😬I just had like a couple of bites because I was very hungry😖 and I didn't throw it away only because it was expensive otherwise; I'm not sure what to say about the customer service... I meant the ladies that take your food order they're not nice at all.

resp.text: Thank You for the feedback

name: Eddvin Hawkins
text: The best Guatemalan food in town by far! Very nice staff and very affordable prices...

name: gato gordo
text: Good

name: Kathryn Schenk
text: Delicious and super friendly staff.

name: Thomas Shinn
text: My wife's family has Guatemalan roots, so we cone here for a little home cooked nostalgia. The food is fresh and delicious. Try the tamales, which are wrapped and cooked in plantain leaves.

name: Black Crow
text: Great place small but the food is good great service too.....

name: Leslie Arreaza
text: The people at this restaurant are kind and the food feels homemade. The place is small but its neither pricey nor does it take long to be served.

name: Jessica Donahue
text: Need to bring a little bit of Spanish knowledge, but great service, good portions, and great food! I died over the papusas.

name: Thelma Ramirez-Andino
text: Prices are too high! The food is not as good as before, so dissapointed!

name: Vi Phung
text: Great food at decent prices. The portions were huge!

name: gustavo mejia
text: Great food.

name: Jenny S
text:
Great Guatemalan food, kid friendly. The atol de elote is a delicious hot, sweet corn drink. The hen soup is the best I've had.
We love going for breakfast, desauno de Chapin is a good basic breakfast with eggs, beans, plantains, cheese and fresh made tortillas. Good prices, too.

name: Brandon Bissoon
text:
SEE EDIT:Generous portions, price is okay, food is mediocre. Staff is okay. I would say its a pretty average indian eatery compared to others. Some work could be done to improve customer service, a more friendly atmosphere, less oily food. If you get tea from them they pour half of a cup and say its full. You can do pretty well with the food Aroma, but you can improve in all other aspects.

Edit, portions are not consistent as noted by picture. Food is still good but they really try to ration their food .

name: E Riera
text:
The food quality and taste is excellent for a buffet.  There are plentiful options/dishes served daily to sample different flavors and combinations.  I try to change up days of the week to get a good variety.
The staff there are friendly and helpful with suggesting combinations. The portions are worth the price at $8-12 per box.  Most people take food to-go since it's a business luncheon...that said, I've gotten there late (@130p) before and they were out of food, so they must be doing something right!

name: Dan Black
text:
Been enjoying Bento’s for several years.  It’s unfortunate their sushi and small hot bar buffet is no more, but at least the sushi buffet can still be had at lunchtime and again at 3pm I believe.  Food is wonderful.  Best lo mein, sesame chicken, and crab ragoon I’ve ever had, plus their sushi is fantastic too.  Never disappoints.  5 very-deserved stars.

UPDATE:  They were closed for a month not long after I'd posted the above review, stated on the door that it was closed for remodeling.  After they reopened, we returned and discovered nothing at all had been remodeled, but instead the management/ownership had been swapped out.  The food was nowhere near as good as it used to be - no resemblance whatsoever to what previously came from the kitchen.  Giving them the benefit of the doubt that it was because they'd just opened, but I'm dropping my 5 star to 3 since they were deceptive about why they were closed plus the food quality had tanked significantly.  Will try again to see if it went back to as good as it used to be.  If not, I'll let my 3 star rating ride.

name: Leeann Sullivan
text:
Ive been to this location numerous times over the last 6 months. I always enjoyed building my own bento box and the spring rolls were so good.

I just went by tonight to go to dinner with a friend and there is a sign outside that says they are closed of as today 9/26. So sad

name: Yee Lee
text: We come here for hot pot only. All you can eat for $20 a person. Honestly, it's great and they are very generous about all you can eat. Choose what you want or just get a combination of anything you want. Extremely easy and you can ask for more whenever you want. Their 2 broths are awesome and very authentic. Broth gets better and better and BETTER as you dip, cook, and simmer all your ingredients. However yes you have to cook your own food and I know some "kings and Queens" who are very against that. This is more than eating, it's an experience.

name: Justin Oxford
text:
EDIT: This place is under new owners as of summer 2018, they only run the sushi bar during lunch now, and the options are very limited. The last time I had the sushi there I didn't feel very well afterwards, and there were only 5 or 6 rolls to choose from (compared to ~20 previously). Haven't tried the hot pot, so I don't know if it has changed. [Lowered from 5 star to 2 star].

The sushi here is very good and at $8.50 with tax for the all-you-can-eat buffet it is well worth it.

They do offer a student discount (10% if I remember correctly).

The buffet is always stocked and the wait staff are always very nice and helpful.

The hot pot here is also very good, though I have only had it once. They also have menu items.

The atmosphere is very good for a date as well.

name: danii pazmiño
text: I love this place! The food it’s so good! The staff is really nice and the prices are fantastic! I highly recommend this place :)

name: Viper
text: Delicious and flavorful every time. I like to try new stuff and the fried (age) tofu was amazing. The curries are great and the sushi buffet makes for a great quick fix. Student ID gives you 10% though they don't always check it. Either way, go during lunch time (11-4) and try it out!

name: Bruze Lee
text: For the people that gave this place a low reviews is because they don't know what the h*&@#*&^ they are ordering.  They just order the same old typical dishes (egg-rolls, fry rice, won-ton soup.) just to name a few.  I was a chef myself so I know what's good and what's not. I highly recommend this place.

name: Brian Cole
text:
Just got back from taking advantage of the "$7.75 All-U-Can-Eat Sushi" deal at this brand new University City restaurant.  My Bento Asian Diner took advantage of a "turn key" location, formerly occupied by an elegant but overpriced Chinese restaurant.

Upon entering we were greeted by friendly staff, paid up front for the sushi bar, settled into a nice booth, and then took our first of three trips to the sushi bar.  We started off with a simple salad with a delicious traditional Asian ginger dressing.  In order to keep their costs down, you won't find "high end" exotic rolls, but the sushi was fresh and very tasty. I do believe the chef will fix custom rolls upon request. Several items were tempura style, so if you're not a raw fish fan, there's plenty of items that are cooked.

If sushi is not your thing, they have a nice selection of other Asian entrees to order.  I'm sure the students of UNCC will be happy to hear of a good cheap place to eat within walking distance of the University.  We'll be back!

name: Tasha
text: Showed up before dinner rush, nothing was out, took 15 minutes to replace ANYTHING and another 30 to get back up to full service. On top of which nearly everything was fried or made of cooked chicken which, no matter how much you wrap it in rice, is NOT sushi. The waitresses apparently didn't have anything better to do than chit chat and giggle with each other.  Didn't have our drinks refilled but once - at the end of our meal. That and they couldn't figure out how to apply a student discount, we're now having to wait four plus days for the first transaction to fall off our bank account.  I'm never coming back and neither will anyone else I know.

text: I enjoyed the food. What I didn't enjoy was the  NC State mask mandate was the followed. A couple came in ahead of me they were not wearing a mask. They were hanging over the glass pointing at items the wanted on their plates. No mask insight,  Even the little opening between the two glass made me feel very uncomfortable that air particles from their mouths were getting to the food. Not one worker informed them they needed to have a mask to be served. One of the workers didn't even have her nose covered. I understand no mask is needed when sitting and eating. But all this took place upon entry and ordering. I feel this should be addressed.  Thank you in advance.

resp.text: Hi Thomassina, thanks for your review and feedback. Your health, safety, and experience are our top priority, so we’re concerned to hear about this. Can you please email customercare@qdoba.com and reference Google #1116026868 so we can learn more?

name: Ericka Mitchell
text:
I've been coming to this location for 10 years. The menu has changed a few times, along with the prices however the food continues to be great. Feels like a second home to me. And they have the absolute best queso ever which is why I keep coming back. The only down side is that they have gotten rid of the tequila lime chicken, which was my favorite. However the other items on the menu make up for it.

It is also located in a convenient area where there are shops and other popular restaurants to try.

name: richard thornburg
text: Was great food sweet tea was very good.fast service.

name: pamela ray
text: I went inside this establishment to inquire about my company delivering their catered food she told me that she needed a courier service and she told me to fill out all the paperwork I did that she said she would have work for me starting that following week 2 weeks went by she never called so I went to another store and she I guess she had to be the one to do it because I had even never been in this restaurant before until I went to talk to her about delivering her food it was in their system to not use my company cuz that's what the university store said even though we need a courier service and I system it says don't use this company and I don't know why she would put that kind of word out about my company I thought that was very rude and unprofessional of her she never called me to deliver anything for her and when I tried to call her back and when I told her who I was she said ma'am I'm busy I will return your call if I get a chance later but she never called back

resp.text: Hi Pamela, thanks for your review. We can not comment on HR / supplier relations issues on social, but if you reach out to us with more details at CustomerCare@QDOBA.com and mention Google Case ID: 1050268399 we can look into this.

It was 730ish and it looked like it had been there for a couple of hours. I said something about it and the gentleman said they had just cooked it a few minutes earlier.

The free guac on St. Patrick's day plus $1.49 tacos was a great treat! My favorite menu items is always the enormous burrito though!

name: John Jones
text:
Will not be returning to Qdoba!

I've lived in the immediate area for 2 years (and surrounding much longer) and every 6 months or so I'll return to find new management. I'm not a huge fan of Mexican food so I always order the same thing. Unfortunately, every few visits or so this location will change the pricing ($5 sometimes and $9 others) and the inconsistencies seem to be due to a lack of training. I've walked out after they've prepared my order more than once.

First off, I typically only get a steak burrito with cheese, white rice and peppers.This SHOULD BE an "A La Carte" but depending on the staff they count the actual tortilla as an item but it is REQUIRED. It's almost like any restaurant charging for the bowl or Taco bell charging for the shell.

I'm done with Qdoba, I will continue to Salsaritas more for more options and Chipotle less which I consider to be better quality and value anyway.
