name: Monalisa NotDaVinci
text: Went in today to grab 2 sandwiches to go . A girl named Erika was working the front by herself. She rocked it.. after fixing the people's in front of me and then putting one of mine in the oven she had to take their money. She took her gloves off , took care of them with a smile and then washed her hands and put fresh gloves on and continued with me. She got everything right and I was so impressed by how fast and with a smile she was moving I forgot to ask for lite mayo and sweet onion.  Before she closed it she asked me. Then she continued on my second sammich and finished it. By then 3 more people walked in and I noticed she did the same thing , gloves off, money , washed hands , fresh gloves all while smiling and greeting customers. ERIKA is her name and I hope this makes it to corporate because she is indeed an asset to Subway. ( I usually go to a different one but now will be stopping here on my way home more often )

Friendly and ready to serve you ... or annoyed with your presence. The floors, tables, counters, etc. in this location are straight up filthy. We had never sat to eat at this location before and I had not previously noticed the major filth. I was slightly shocked. I am wondering what the kitchen where we cannot see looks like.

name: Leah ChapSting
text: I will definitely frequent this place I ordered an entree to-go and I was very happy with the service. The counter person answered all my questions and I was able to have gluten free  options also. I like the cauliflower mashed potatoes and gravy, really good texture. The lentil loaf was tasty but had a strong licorice taste they might have used too much fennel.

name: T.O T.O
text: Small place. I recently went vegan so I went in there and was given different options. The food was great. I had the falafel, fries and a wrap. Its best to call ahead.

name: Alicia Goldsby
text: It's been 26 days since I ate flesh and I'm proud! But around day 21 suddenly I craved chicken. Heard about Zizi's and ordered a "chicken" wrap and the falafel balls. That wrap was slap your momma good. So good I asked the manager are you SURE there's no meat here? I'm sure I sounded like an idiot but my craving was satiated and I discovered my new favorite spot. Would've gotten five stars because the falafel balls tasted AMAZING (I would've loved more for the price, they were so small) I mean soooo good but they certainly didn't look like what I thought I was getting from the menu.

name: Tammy Carter
text: The food is absolutely delicious! I had the rib tip wrap and mango tofu. LOVED IT so much I went back the next day and ordered the same thing!

name: Erica Greene
text: Love, love,  love this place! Great vegan food. Staff is friendly. Laid back environment. Mostly take out but there are a few chairs and a table if you want to eat. I'm definitely coming back here.

name: Krysta Bok
text:
I can preface this review by saying that I am not Vegan but enjoy a meatless meal every now and then. Now, the portion size for the entrees are huge! You absolutely get your money's worth.

Falafel - little dry, super crunchy, could have a bit more of an earthy flavor. The hummus was a perfect pair and the white sauce was a good alternative.

The Cauli Mash & Gravy paired very well with the balsamic portobello. My assumptions is that the mushrooms soaked in a balsamic marinade prior to cooking. The texture of the mushroom was great too, just the right amount of chewiness.

The Mac n cheese was surprisingly not bad. The corn added just the right amount of sweetness. It also had that baked cheesy feel to it.

Overall, I would order from here again and enjoy doing so.

name: John Dieu
text: I'm not vegan, but I decided to try it anyways to see how it was. Wow. I am blown away by the flavor. I had to double back to make sure it wasn't meat. The cauliflower potatoes were delicious as well as the mac and cheese. Try this place out. This is coming from a guy who eats a steak every week.

name: Jennifer LaFever
text: Some of the best food I've ever eaten, vegan or not. They develop such great flavors. We eat here every time we are anywhere near the area. Ordering ahead is recommended, as everything is made fresh when ordered, so it may take 20-30 minutes to prepare. This is a to-go joint only, although they do have a couple small tables with two chairs inside.

name: John Williams
text: Good stuff, I couldn't believe their "chicken" nuggets weren't actually meat...I thought it had to be some kind of trick. Whatever it is, it's delicious. My favorites: chicken nuggets & mac n cheese. 10/10. Note: it is pretty pricey for the portions you get, but well worth it in my opinion.

name: Phillip Fullerton
text: Very friendly staff. Food was awesome. I had the portabello sub and some fries. Everything was made to order. I'm from Winston Salem, so we don't have options like this. I was extremely impressed.

name: Sara Montague
text: BEST vegan/vegetarian restaurant! My meat-eater husband even loves it, so we grab food from here frequently. We love the falafel wrap and pizza steak the most, but haven't disliked anything we've tried. This is our go-to place for fast, yummy, and meatless food! I only wish they had a frequent shopper punch card so we could earn discounts or free food!

name: James Doster
text: I've been here quite often. I haven't had anything on the menu that I didn't love and would try again. I love the shop itself, very cozy and comfortable. You guys need an additional location! Please!

name: Hannah M.
text: I may have tried but I can't find a single restaurant to compare with Zizi's. They just get everything right! Every single person who works there is personable and lovely (ask for their suggestions and they won't fail you!), the serve time is surprisingly quick (15 minutes tops, and I've sent them decently sized orders before), and the food is so flavorful and well-prepared that you almost forget you're at a specifically-vegan restaurant. Honestly, I'm not even vegan but this is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. It's vegetarian/vegan heaven. TRY THE PEPPERCORN STEAK with seasoned black beans and brocolli and thank me later!!

name: vince feliciano
text: I LOVE the food here. It's a takeout place with very few chairs of you insist on eating in so be aware of that going in, but feel free to eat in your car. The options here are healthy and more importantly, delicious. You don't have to be vegan to find something you will like.  To test it out, order something that you would normally order in most any  restaurant (like "chicken" parm or the soul burger) and amaze yourself at how many great choices they have where you won't miss the meat (like the Philly cheese steak or the mac and cheese) . If you're thinking of trying vegan food, start with this place and you might actually stick with it. Five stars...nay, six, seven stars or however many you need to see to convince you to eat here. I was so surprised to hear this place has been here 8 years (i wrote this as of 2017) since I've driven right past this place thousands of times.

name: J. Allen Walker
text: You want some of the best vegan food in charlotte? Go to Zizi's. its AMAZING! And try the Cheesecake... Out Of This WORLD

name: Luke Rice
text: Very good food, friendly staff. I recommend the fish and chips (or just the fish dinner, anything with the "fish") and the jerk tofu. For the sides, the mashed potatoes/cauliflower and greens are very good, and the desert has always been good as well. With the fish and chips, the hotsauce and white-sauce are excellent, try to get extra if you can because you will want it.

name: Alexander Rupprecht
text: Great vegan food, even friends who eat meat like the food here. They even have frozen dinners you can take home. Zizi's has tasty options you won't find anywhere else.

name: Jennifer C
text: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! I don't have the words to describe the flavor and cleanness of the food. Just great and the staff are so friendly :)

name: serb7891
text: I ordered the Portabella mushroom sandwich on gluten free bread, cauliflower mashed potato, and fries food was delicious. Way better than the Bean. Mashed potatoes actually taste good. Everything tasted great!

name: Harris Clarkson
text: Got this place recommended by a meat eater. I'm told the smoothies are awesome. I get some thing different everytime, always good. Great place if you miss some of the meat/cheese you've stopped eating.

name: Clint Scott
text:
Had the
Southwest burger and it was very tasty. Place was hard to find if you aren't familiar with the area as it is tucked away in a little shopping area. Overall good food at a fair price

name: Marissa L
text: What a nice little place! We got an avocado sandwich, lentil burger and tried the falafel. Everything was DELICIOUS! So so good. We will definitely return whenever we visit Charlotte. Get the falafel!!!

name: Akhai Sutukh Nubi
text: HealThy Self & Enjoy Eating Good

name: Tom Tanner
text:
Great find while making a quick trip to NC. It's really hard to find good vegan food in the South. Can you say "why is everything fried in pork fat"?

Chipotle Tofu wrap is wonderful.

name: Kevin Stack
text: Nice selection of vegan food. Price is not bad. There are less than a handful of chairs in there. This place is more designed for carry-out.

name: Ashley Prato

name: K E
text:
The food at Zizi's is pretty good, when they have it. What I mean is they are constantly running out of items on the menu. I was just there on a Saturday at noon, which is a prime time for most resturaunts, and they were out of collards, black bean burgers, bananas and strawberries for smoothies, and hummus. All in one day... Its frustrating honestly. This wasnt the first time they ran out of food.

Another issue is how long it takes to actually get your food. I've waited up to 40 min to get my order. I've been in store and be quoted 25 min and waited over 40.

Like I said, the food is good so I will continue to support this resturaunt. Also, because there are so few veg restaurants to choose from.  It won't be easy though.

text: Great place. Love how they chop up whole roast pigs. Delicious. They gave me the wrong size pig. I ordered 25lb and got a 50lb pig. Even though I told them I didn't think it was mine, they sent me off with it. They called later and asked me to pay for the 50lb, but when I said that's not right, the owner did not hesitate to agree and honored the original price. We felt bad but the owner definitely did not try to harass us. We are returning customers and consistently recommend to everyone, so they didn't lose much in this case.

FYI - if you order the duck chopped, they don't give you the entire thing. Make sure to order not chopped if you go here. Go to Baoding for duck, and don't waste your time at this place

If you want authentic Chinese style duck, this is the place. There were some flies around the food sitting out, reason for the 4 stars

name: Shana Merrifield
text: Wonderful concept! The main reason I deducted a star was because people don't monitor their dogs like they should to make sure they aren't getting too aggressive. The staff tries their best to intervene but obviously they can't watch all the dogs when it gets busy. They do have different areas to sit and some areas for smaller dogs. Food trucks and beer/drink selections are great!

name: Carrera W
text: I am so happy that I found this jem for me and my pup. Colby (Care Crew Employee) has been fantastic! He knew my dog was special needs, so he tried to keep an eye on her as best as he could. I made it a point to come when he works. The care crew, in general, monitor the dogs, so you can read, work or just relax. The drinks are really good. I recommend the pear cider.

name: Tony Scotto di Carlo
text: Awesome. I went there with no clue about what it was and with no dog. It was super fun to watch the dogs got nuts and have fun playing while enjoying the good beer. great place!

name: Tyler
text: Great layout.  Man are some of these dogs horribly behaved though.  Skiptown does a decent job trying to regulate but there needs to be harsher rules in place for the ‘repeat attackers’!  People need to take ownership of where their dogs are more and this would likely be resolved.  I’ll be coming back again but I remain cautiously optimistic.

name: Nicole Angtuaco
text: This place is VERY cool.  Tons of space for both dogs and humans.  Social distancing has never been easier.  Great beverage options.  I love that the staff handles cleanup/sanitization when your dog makes a mess.  It’s a bit pricey for a one day pass for the bar access, so definitely opt for the monthly membership if you plan to go three or more times per month.

name: Dann Barrows
text: Plenty of room for dogs to run both inside and out.  Decent beer selection at the bar.  Staff were extremely friendly.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words Dann! We are so glad you have been having a great time at Skiptown!

name: kim mckoy
text: The bartender was really nice.  The staff was nice & good with the dogs. Nice, chill place to relax with your dog. Very clean. My dog had a blast. The other dogs were friendly. Good experience & would definitely go back.

resp.text: Hi Kim, thank you so much for your kind words! We are so glad you enjoyed your visit to Skiptown!!

name: Valentina Cherednichenko
text: Fun place to take your pup. Check their calendar for free Tuesdays and other specials!

name: Jeff E
text: Great place to meet friends with dogs.  Everyone very friendly.  Good beer selection.  Had a awesome food truck there.

resp.text: Thanks so much Jeff! We are so glad that you had a great time visiting Skiptown!

name: Mollie Whitacre
text: Such a fun place to bring your dog to the Bark and Bar! I've boarded my dog twice at Skiptown and he got Kennel Cough both times, so I wouldn't recommend boarding.

name: Alex Blais
text: It’s really big inside and my dog had a blast but it’s a little pricey.  Nice place to have a beer if your dog likes socializing and you live in the city.  They only have beer and wine due to Covid right now but I’ll be back when they get that straightened out.  Owner followed up on my experience and was a total professional.  That goes a long way to having a good business IMO.  Thanks for the follow up!

name: Sarah LeStrange
text: Huge, beautiful place. Almost too big and easy to lose sight of your dog. Clean facilities and super nice staff. I enjoyed the bar and food truck that was there, but honestly it’s just pricy for what it is. I didn’t feel like there was much added value in the facilities to make it worth the $15 entry fee.

name: Jennifer Chuu
text: Skiptown is the cleanest dog bar I've been to in CLT and the openness of the space is great. The bar is managed really well and the atmosphere is great for pups.

name: Courtney Van Erem
text:
The place was clean and the app worked well for me. Everyone was super friendly and helpful at the desk and at the bar. I definitely liked the off leash rule everywhere and that they keep dogs safe in the gates.

I’m rating it three stars because this place is not all inclusive. I went yesterday with my dog that’s only 6 pounds. I understand she’s a tiny dog but still likes to socialize. There were a bunch of larger dogs there that were too rough for my taste. They advertise a small dog area but when I was there the gate was wide open to the other area and the small dogs had no choice but to interact with the others. In fact the tables and big dogs spill into the area almost making it as one large area.

I think this place can be great for bigger dogs but smaller ones, not so much.

resp.text:
Hi Courtney, we're glad you found our staff friendly!

We have a dedicated small dog indoor and outdoor area that's secured by two double gates on the inside and a gate on the outside that automatically closes and secures the area from the large dog play space. We actively monitor the space to ensure our small dogs and their parents are having fun in their dedicated area, if they choose to use it!

We'd love to have you back so you and your pup can be re-introduced to our dedicated small dog area that is both safe and secured!

name: Josh C
text: Wonderful place to have a brew with your dog and friends. Has a small dog area for those with tiny pawed friends.

name: Mike Anthony
text: I've heard so much about this place but I finally had the chance to see it on person! Wow! Great staff and my pup had the time of her life! Want bad watch my pup play while having a beer

name: Taylor Armstead
text:
Skiptown is great for pups and humans!
Some things to know: your pup must be registered and have all shots up to date. Download the app to do it before you go, but it can also be done on your first visit. It's $15 for 1 human and 1 dog and $5 for each additional dog. Humans without dogs are free.

The outside is well maintained so far and they pressure wash the turf when dogs poop. Beer selection is okay and they do have a couple non alcoholic options and wine. You can order food and they have a few snack type things.

name: Mike Leiss
text: Great place to let the pup get her energy out while we chill and have a beer. Wish they had a slightly stricter mask policy with people walking around

name: Cody Millard
text: It's alright, they have so many rules it seems like you're in high school again though. No liquor license either.

name: Mike Leiss
text: Great place to let the pup get her energy out while we chill and have a beer. Wish they had a slightly stricter mask policy with people walking around

name: Zach McDonald
text: I know multiple dog owners that claim that their dog got Kennel cough after their dogs were here. This is pretty much expected from dog bars and is a common risk, but Im disappointed I have not heard an official statement on this. Also, $15 is steep for such a concept. Local media claims “whitewater center for dogs” but I don’t see sickness spreading at the whitewater center.

resp.text: Hi Zach, Skiptown ensures that all dogs who enter our facility have an up to date bordetella vaccine as well as a rigorous cleaning protocol in place to ensure that our furry and human friends are safe! You can read more about our protocols and FAQs around Kennel Cough in our published statement made earlier this season here: https://skiptown.io/safety-update/

name: Paul Vaselopulos
text: Awesome time

name: Nate L
text: Kelly & Megan are nothing short of appauling. I could not believe how I was treated and spoke to. Discrimatory, rude, and unprofessional. "Certain breeds" are certainly not welcome here. 10/10 DO NOT GO HERE!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback, Nate. We would like to extend an apology for your recent experience at Skiptown and would like the opportunity to investigate this incident further. Could you please contact us at hello@skiptown.io so that we may work with you to resolve any issues as quickly as possible?

text: Fun place with an awesome atmosphere to bring your dogs to play at!

name: d t
text: took our dog for a compatibility session and it didnt go well. we have gone to other day cares before and they said he did great. i dont prefer for him to be put into crates at day cares or groomers because dogs can hurt themselves in crates, especially if they are stressed going into them (breaking teeth etc from trying to get out). there are other day cares in charlotte that will refrain from putting your dog in the crate if you ask them not to (K9 playland is great about this and cooper loves going there!). i told skiptown this but they dont make exceptions. every dog goes in crates throughout the day. they called me after a couple of hours and said cooper really wasnt enjoying his time there and so i went and picked him up. when i picked him up he seemed traumatized and was not himself. definitely wont be returning/would not recommend to others!

resp.text:
Hi Danielle,

We understand you're disappointed that your dog is not eligible for our pet care services.

We conduct compatibility sessions to make sure all dogs we care for are a fit for the services we offer. The health and happiness of all dogs is our number one priority. Our daycare and boarding services include rest time in private kennels. We're sorry your pup did not pass this part of their compatibility session.

We are happy to provide recommendations to local trainers who can help you work with your pup!

name: Laura Walker
text: Impeccable service and trustworthy, affectionate pet-sitters.  Easy online scheduling, a high-touch approach to communication, and all the details (legal, policy, and staff screening) that make you know you've made the absolute best choice for your furry friend and your home/security.

name: Ben Hansberger
text: Great service and people

resp.text: Hi Ben, thank you for sharing your handsome boy with us!

name: Ashley Voss
text:
I loved Skipper until today, when I got my review saying my dog had been playing in a mud puddle and was "growling" at the Skipper so she couldn't get him inside. Not once have I ever had a bad report on my dogs, in fact this is her review to be exact:

What a visit😬! I was greeted by the back door bu Alzado and Dash🐶👋🏻! They both said their hellos then we headed over to fix up dinner🍽! As they are dinner I went and refreshed their water bowls👍🏻! After I was time for a quick trip outside or so we thought🙈! They both ran around the yard and found a spot to go #☝🏻 right away! As we were heading back in Alzado found a mud hole😱! As I tried to call him inside he got in the mud hole and started digging😬!! I tried treats, a walk, a ball , some sticks, and getting close to slip my leash I even tried say mommas home but he was so excited to be digging in the mud hole🤔! I even got a pretty good mud bath😂! After about a good 40 minutes of digging he finally came inside🙏🏻! I dried him off and cleaned him off as best as I could🙈! When he was done he has the biggest smile on his face😁! I made sure to dry Dash off as well! When time was up I gave them both a carrot and headed out👋🏻! Thanks for sharing them with me! I had a crazy blast! See you soon guys🐶🐾👋🏻!!

-Ashli D

I come home to find my dog covered in mud, my floors covered in mud with paw prints, my couch COVERED IN MUD. What was supposed to help me while I was at work, created a HUGE mess for me to clean up. I had even left a note for them to stay inside and play because I knew it was cold and rainy out.  Never will I use Skipper again

resp.text:
Hi Ashley,

I’m so sorry you had this experience and we’d like to see if we can make this visit up to you! I know it was an inconvenience to clean the house and wash the pups yesterday after a long day at work. We truly value you and your pups as clients and would love schedule a free 60 minute visit for you and make things right.

As specified in your client notes for the visit, our team member let the pups out for a quick potty before attempting to bring them back in for indoor play. Unfortunately, despite our best efforts (and trying the methods you mentioned via text when we reached out), we were not able to bring one of the pups back inside until the end of the visit. We have spoken to our team member to emphasize the need to reach out to our office if they're unable to get the pups sufficiently clean so we can determine a more confined place to leave them in the future.

To ensure this never happens again, I’d like to update your visit routine with very specific rain instructions that our team will follow.

Feel free to give me a call at (704) 343-6658 or respond to the email I sent and we can get this sorted out!

name: Sabrina D
text: Enjoyed it! 1st time visit, but was pleased. The cute little guy at bar helped, as he was really nice. I'm thinking that seeing a Mom and her 13 yr old on $6 wine night at 9pm, he was thinking yes she will need guidance. You order at the counter and pick your food up at the window when your buzzer goes off. Chicken tenders were plentiful & the chicken sandwich (homeboy maybe) was tasty. Place is loud, but it's to be expected as it's a younger crowd and in Southend. My Malbec was excellent though & I did not expect it to be. We were famished, so forgot pics of other food before it was mostly eaten. Good visit. Quick & simple was just what we aimed  for.

resp.text: Hi Sabrina, Thank you for the great review! Love that you enjoyed your night with us (wine wednesday is our fave). We pride ourselves on good food, drinks, and times with friends, so glad you hit all three! We hope to see you again in here soon.

name: Jessica Jones
text: Me and my friend met here on a Monday around 7pm. Nice environment. The bar guy with the medium length hair was not pleasant. However, the smoked wings and fries were good, so I (guess) that was a good trade off?

resp.text: Hi Jessica, Thank you for stopping in and checking us out! We are so happy you enjoyed the food. We love creating an atmosphere with great, drinks, food, and team members. We have spoken to the team member mentioned and thank you for bringing it to our attention. We hope to see you in here again soon!

name: Ra'Shad Brown
text: 1st time going. Went there for lunch and was absolutely amazed at the food. The chicken tenders bbq loaded fries were out of this world. Will be back for some signature drinks

resp.text: Hi Ra'Shad, Thank you for this awesome review! We are so glad you enjoyed your lunch with us. See you again soon!

name: Samantha Wagner
text: This is a cute bar/restaurant off Tremont in Charlottes South End/ Dilworth area. Close to several night activities in the area. Easy free street parking. Bartender was cool, she helped me out in ordering my drink- I’m on the Keto diet & had to make sure certain ingredients were low carb/ no sugar. She was awesome about it. We drank, ate a bit, laughed a lot. Tuesday nights the place was empty. Counting two 3 of us, 2 bartenders (&idk how many in the kitchen area) I counted 8 people total.

resp.text: Hi Samantha, Thanks for the review! Love that our team was able to take care of you and your dietary needs. Hope to see you again soon for some more good times with friends!

name: Michael Biggs
text: Some of the best bartenders in the North America work here! This space is amazing especially when they have the front windows open.

resp.text: Hi Michael, YESSS we LOVE our team! Thanks for the awesome review, see you soon!

name: Daniel Boyce
text:
Good atmosphere, great service, average food, good drink options. Overall, I really enjoyed visiting this location since the staff was very attentive, and the atmosphere was nicely laid out. Currently, it's limiting when it comes to safe distance options, so the open wall to the outside along with the spacious interior allows for easy seating without feeling any pressure from being too close to others.

The walk up bar order and then pickup options are perfect since it allows the visitor to get drinks immediately from the bar while enjoying your seat wherever you choose and then pick up your food whenever it is ready.

The food options are better than expected for a bar and the quality definitely meets the expectations for the SouthEnd area. Some items aren't superior but still meet the expectations, like the Philly cheese steak that I ordered during my first visit and the chicken strips which my friend ordered. Both met the expectations of the order but neither were surprising or unique. For the cheesesteak, the bun was good but not a standard northern hoagie bun for sure and the meat was good and decent quality, but I am also rather picky when it comes to cheesesteak hoagies so I can't say it is anything different from what I'd expect being in the south.

I later went back on the recommendation from management so I could try the hand pies. If you aren't familiar with a hand pie, they say it's like a fried calzone, which is a good description except for the exterior of the hand pie which is not made with a dough similar to a calzone, but instead is much closer to a traditional empanada if you've had one. It's thicker, crispier, and the bread has more flavor than what a calzone's thin dough layer would have. It's nicely drizzled with a Midwest ranch-like dressing and the filling varies, but was chicken, bacon, ranch when I went. Though this place is not somewhere I'd visit specifically for a cheesesteak hoagie, I would absolutely go back for their hand pies.

I was also surprised by the quality of ingredients in their "Greek" sandwich. After having ordered and shared the hand pies I didn't want anything too heavy so I ordered the Greek sandwich with a side of cucumber salad. This sandwich surprised me with the quality ingredients from a place I was not initially wowed by with their cheesesteak.

I got chicken for my protein which was nicely seasoned and grilled, the feta cheese was quality versus the often rubbery feta, it had freshly cut cucumbers and the black olives were full olives sliced in half and de-pitted, giving the opportunity for more of the "Greek" seasoning to be soaked up by the olive - increasing the flavor of each bite.

The cucumber salad was also done better than I anticipated with a nice balance of herbs and seasoning as the base layer and quality flavors that didn't make the salad too busy or overwhelming with dressing like some places do.

I initially said I would go back for the drinks and atmosphere, but after a second round based on a recommendation from the owner, I'll return here again for the food as well, especially the Greek sandwich and the hand pies.

resp.text: Hi Daniel, Thank you for coming in and giving us a try! We are happy to know that you felt safe and comfortable enjoying your time at QC Pour House during this crazy time. Can't wait to have you back enjoying one of our burgers and might we suggest trying our signature handpie as well. See you soon!

name: Rachel Harr
text: I love to go here with my partner or friends, they have really amazing food and great drink specials.

resp.text: Hi Rachel, Thank you for the awesome review! so glad you enjoy hanging with us!

name: Alexandra Seigenberg
text: This place caters to the under 30 set for sure. I enjoy their order at the bar service - you get drinks very quick! This place is always too crowded to enjoy on a football Saturday or Sunday and the food is not great.

name: Tal Kelsey
text: Barely above average bar in a pretty good location. There are a bunch of board and card games available which is pretty cool. There is minimal seating offered, which is probably the main reason I didn't rate it 5 stars.

name: Eric
text: Delicious Greek Sandwich, lots of sweet potatoe tots and a huge selection of local beers. Top it off with outdoor seating with fans and I'm a happy diner! Would definitely bring friends from out of town here!

resp.text: Hi Eric, Thank you for your positive comments and review! We love our food and are so happy your enjoyed your experience. We can't wait for you to come back in with your friends and fam.

name: Luigi Cesaratto
text: Good food, reasonable drink prices. Great for a breezy summer day when they open the windows

name: Kevin Hughes
text: Perfect sports bar in South End. Much nicer than All American and those other bars along the Bland Street stop. Spacious, lots of TVs, and open window seating available.

resp.text: Hi Kevin, We are so glad you enjoy the atmosphere we created to be able to hang out and enjoy watching a game. Can't wait to see you in there now that sports are back on!

name: Tyler
text: Not impressed with the chicken Caesar salad or the Tremont club....Would compare the quality of both of these meals to a bb&t ballpark meal and its probably the same price!  On the plus side, the ambiance is nice although it’s a little loud...lots of hard surface not absorbing the sound and the majority of the music was emo.

resp.text: Hi Ty, Thank you for stopping in and giving us a try on our opening week. We are sorry to hear about your experience with the food. We have made some adjustments to our menu and hope to see you back in here again soon for another try.

name: Jason Hymanson
text: Great new place on the corner of Hawkins street. The drinks are all quality and the atmosphere is much like a neighborhood hangout spot. This is the All American pub of the lower south end. Wouldn’t go anywhere else to watch the game or go hangout and grab a beer. The food is good and moderately priced. Overall I will always come back here for a quick bit or a beer since the staff is so nice and helpful. They had $6 tequila cocktails on Thursday and they were made extremely well. Great job, Keep it up!

resp.text: Hi Jason, So glad you enjoyed your time at QC Pour House! Thanks for stopping in and we hope to see you again soon.

name: Dylan Creech
text: Craft beers are 6.75 on draft which seems a little high. Got the philly cheese steak which was a little dry but not bad. Decent place to watch football. Best part is the big windows on a nice day and the staff. Good concept for those who like craft beer and liquor.

resp.text: Hi Dylan, Thank you for stopping in! All of our prices (including our drafts) include all taxes already. So the price may seem high at first, but it's pretty similar to what you would find anywhere else. I apologize you didn't love your philly. Next time please let a team member know so we can get you another option that you would enjoy. Thanks for the feedback. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Scott Mallonee
text:
Due to COVID-19, I haven't actually eat *at* QC Pour House yet, but it's right around the corner from my office building, so we've picked up lunch from here a few times.

The sandwiches from QCPH are awesome - I've had the "Jay's Favorite" which was blackened chicken with cheese and jalapenos and other toppings. Very good sandwich, and I would order it again, but I'm glad I expanded my horizons to try their Philly Cheesesteak, because it was better than just "good!" A nice chewy, toasted sub roll with a TON of meat and cheese - probably a ~10oz portion of meat, shredded up of course. I'm not usually one for peppers and onions, because I hate the texture when they are undercooked, but QCPH did it just right - you get all the wonderful flavors from the onions and the peppers, but it doesn't change the mouthfeel of the sandwich.

This Philly from QCPH is going to become a staple in my lunch rotation. It's not quite on par with Clover Joe's in Brevard Court, which I consider the best Philly in Charlotte. But it certainly takes my #2 spot! Great execution on the sandwich, QCPH!

resp.text: Hi Scott, Thank you for your positive review on our take out! We are so glad you are able to enjoy our menu during this time. We can't wait to see you in here when you feel comfortable venturing out again. Cheers!

name: John Ansbro
text: Wonderful food, great beer selection and great staff. Has all the great feels of an excellent neighborhood bar. Lots of TVs and space to hang out with friends. Can't wait to go back.

resp.text: Hi John, Thank you for all of the positive comments!  We can't wait to see you back in here!

name: Clayton Kendall
text: Awesome space. Great staff. We'll rounded beer selection and liquor options. Didnt try the food this time around but I certainly will next time. Absolutely worth a visit if you're in the area.

resp.text: Hi Clayton, So glad you enjoyed your time at QC Pour House! Thanks for stopping in and we hope to see you again soon.

name: Elizabeth Wurtenberger
text: This place is a great addition to the southend! We went last weekend for drinks and snacks, and we'll will be back for lunch soon! There is plenty of space and a great TV set up for sports. We tried the wings and broccoli bites and would order both again for sure!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Elizabeth! Glad you're enjoying the new spot in the neighborhood!

name: Jessica Tilley
text: I have always loved eating here.

resp.text: Hi Jessica, Thank you for your positive comment! We are so glad you enjoy the food we are putting out and hope to see you in here again soon!

name: Trey Lowe
text: Great local neighborhood place. A lot of bar options in Charlotte, this is the most unique and fun in a great place in town. Must try food and drink

resp.text: Thanks for the review Trey! Glad you're enjoying the new spot in the neighborhood!

name: Robert Garland
text: They have a good variety of local beers in a can and on tap

resp.text: Hi Robert, We love that you enjoy our draft and can selection! Make sure to stop in on a Monday! Every Monday we offer $5 local drafts.

name: Steven Schwark
text: This is a great spot if everywhere else nearby is full and you're just looking to grab a beer (and nothing else). There are plenty of board games and open windows all around, but a very average tap list and greasy, tasteless snacks makes this place ... just OK.

resp.text: Hi Steven, We are sorry your experience wasn't up to our standards. We encourage you to give our food another try and I don't think you will disappointed. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Michael McCarson
text: $12 for burnt wings and a tea. When I told the bartender the wings were WAY TOO DONE... He said sorry and brought me my check. Would not recommend this place for anything other than a tap beer, maybe.

resp.text: Hi Michael, I spoke with the bartender and apologize that it was mishandled. We would have absolutely gone and comped your bill and replaced your meal had the bartender informed us! If you come in again this weekend we would love to refund you or provide you with another meal on us. Have a great day and hope to see you again soon.

name: Chris Franche
text: Plenty of space and TV'S. Could use some more seating but it works. Bartenders are quick at service.

resp.text: Hi Chris, Thanks for your review and positive comments. We hope to see you in here again soon.

name: Nigel Vaughan
text: This is an EXCELLENT local bar. The staff are friendly, the food is good and the beer flows. What else do you want.

resp.text: Hi Nigel, Thank you so much for coming in on our opening day! we are so happy you enjoyed yourself and thank you for the feedback.

name: Andrew Goff
text: I really enjoyed my time here, very lively and good beer selection. 4 stars because it's a little expensive and some girl beefed on me and my friends while we were there.

resp.text: Hi Andrew, Thank you for stopping in! We are glad you enjoyed your time here. Our prices are set at a certain mark because we actually include the tax in all of our pricing to make it easier for our customers when they come in. See you again soon!

name: Elizabeth Coddington
text:
I’ve been there twice now and not a fan of their drinks or prices. Their Orange Crushes taste like watered down screwdrivers, their bartenders under pour liquor (multiple ppl have told me the same) and my friend had a mimosa that costs $10 which is insane to me.

Also, the bathroom line is always ridiculously long every time.

I’m not sure this place will last very long in Southend if I’m being completely honest.

resp.text: Hey Elizabeth, thank you for your feedback on your experience with us. Our prices are actually set lower than most bars and restaurants within walking distance to us for the benefit of our customers. We also include all of the taxes that you would be charged when closing out your tab in the drink price, so you don’t have any surprises there. The Orange Crush is a very similar to a screwdriver which is why you might find them the same. We think our bartenders do a great job making the drinks. Our Mega Mimosa is $9 because it is a full can of Prosecco at 8.5 ounces which is a double mimosa. The average mimosa you would buy anywhere else is 4 ounces typically. Thanks for trying us out.

name: Neal Hargis
text: Fun local hangout, aka "dive bar!"

resp.text: Thanks for stopping in! See you again soon.

text:
Wow! The QC team is second to none! We ordered food for a party of 30 (including kids) the food was prefect, on time, awesome friendly staff that got everting set up and made sure we had anything and everything we needed.
If you need catering for any event, big or small, they can handle them all!! Great job and I will defiantly be calling again!

name: Beyond The Veil
text: Amazing company! Had a food tasting with them for a clients wedding and we loved the service and food!

name: Mei Ka Fields
text: Great staff. Friendly and very accommodating. My friend's bridal shower was a hit. Their bacon for brunch was addicting!

name: Brad Ledbetter
text: Our office uses these guys for regular catering. Compared to other ratings, I'm assuming we get low end stuff because nothing that we get looks anything like the pictures or tastes better than meh. The best thing I can say about the food is that it's edible. The meals are generally boring, under seasoned and often overcooked. And if you're vegetarian or vegan, I hope you like roasted vegetables and salad because that's the best you'll get. I can't comment on the staff as I don't deal with them.

name: Neal Morgan
text: Cannot recommend them more!  We used them recently for our daughter's first birthday and everyone kept asking where the food came from and how good it was.  Taylor, was right on time and set up was fast and efficient.  The sales manager, Justin, was friendly and responsive.  I had to increase our head count the week of the event and Justin made it easy for me to adjust last minute.  Had such a good experience and will be using QC in the future.

name: Gail McGrath
text: Exceed expectations from beginning to end!   My company frequently uses QC for our small to med corporate catering needs (usually a drop and go) so I was very familiar the quality of the food.  We recently had a pop-up outdoor celebration for 200 guests and my first and last stop was QC!  Ginny and Taylor were the catering managers that I worked with.  They were very patient and resourceful when it came to meeting my budget!  They turned our location parking lot into a tented venue to include fans,  buffet stations and the BEST service staff EVER! The event went off without a hitch and I got all the praise and recognition for a job well done.  So, Thank You QC Catering!  I look forward to working with the QC team in the very near future!

name: Saichelle McNeill
text: We attended the re-branding celebration, these guys know how to celebrate. The adult beverages were great! There was a great variety of hearty creative small bites. The staff did such a great job removing used plates,  drinks and the like. The presentation was something nice as well. Would definitely recommend!

name: Ryan Seery (Hex_Manifesto)
text: All of the staff from the Event organizers to the event staff are all wonderful to work with and the chefs are amazing making ever office catering taste like it came right from the kitchen mere moments before you eat.

resp.text: Good morning Ryan! Thank you so much for the review, we are so happy that you enjoyed the food and that it was a success! Looking forward to doing more with you!

name: Cassie Salyers
text: Our experience with QC catering has always been incredible.  Their service is flawless.  They are easy to work with, have great options, are priced appropriately and just take great care of their clients.  We have been using them for catered lunches we have for business meetings and we just recently used them for 125 attendee party that we had last night.  I could not be happier with the results!  I would highly recommend them if you need a great caterer!

name: David Gilman
text:
The worst catered food imaginable. My office catered regular lunches from QC Catering over the course of a year and they were consistently bad every time. We had to schedule smaller orders because this cater was so unpopular people would rather pay for their own food over a catered, free meal.

They serve Indian food that lacks all spice or flavor.  If the chef is reading this hit me up, let me take you out to lunch at an Indian restaurant so you can learn what Tikka Masala actually tastes like.

There was also a Jambalaya meal that resembled nothing else that has ever been called jambalaya before. The sausages were less like Andouille and more like hot dog. The soup itself was a sort of gravy. It had the greasy, meaty flavor of the sausage but otherwise was lacking in any sort of spice or flavor to it. Bizarre.

name: Glenda Steel
text: Amazing workspace! Happy chefs and staff make great food! 🍴

name: April Gardner
text: We just had a business lunch for 7 delivered. It arrived on time and as expected. Delivery gentleman, Paul, was friendly, courteous, and mindful of the meeting (set up was complete very quietly). I will definitely continue to use Queen City Catering for future needs.

name: JC Morlu
text: Nothing about Queen City Catering tastes catered!  It tastes like a personal chef sat outside the meeting room preparing a meal specifically for you to savor and enjoy.  The only thing that beats their food is their staff--incredibly friendly, helpful and responsive.  Would never go anywhere else.

name: Tangie Renee
text: I'm a HUGE fan of exceptional customer service. This company excels in this area. I've worked with Queen City for several years now & they never let me down. The stafff takes pride in EVERYTHING they do...from taking orders, delivering on time, negotiable prices, diverse menu & food that is sure to please your taste buds! Keep up the Good work QCC!

name: paul wilarski
text: Arrived at 7:55pm for our 8:00 reservation. Our table wasn't ready yet and didn't end up sitting down until 830pm. Reservations at this place really don't reserve you a table for the time you would like. It basically just puts your name on the waiting list. Manger offered to buy us a round of drinks for the wait which was a nice gesture. For the food, not impressed by the burger. $15 and then add $3 if you want a slice of cheese on it. It was rather small in size compared to other well known burger places. This was our first time here and it will be our last. Strange vibe though out the place from the staff to the other guests. If you're looking for a good burger save your money and try something from the Liberty, Peculiar Rabbit, or Kickstand.

name: Eduardo Ferrari
text: Finally a place like this in Charlotte!!!!! They have combined a butcher shop and casual dining place with very upscale dishes on the same place. Their wine list is extensive and very well selected. It is your one stop shop for making a great meal at home  for a special occasion or bring the special occasion to here! The portions, quality of food, and atmosphere can't be beaten. Good place for business meetings, special occasions, casual lunch and have fun with friends.

name: GrubSnob Charlotte
text:
The service was outstanding - our waiter was well acquainted with the food and drinks, plus he was attentive.  We were here for lunch. The food looked beautiful, but it was a little heavy on the salt - not bad.   We had super high expectations.

Down the road, we plan to try dinner - steak.

name: Karen Greiner
text: This is one of our "special occasion" spots - but it's not fussy or precious - just good food, cooked really well. Staff are knowledgeable and attentive - but not overly so.  I love the brussel sprouts. And I usually ask the server what they like, or what looks good that night, and then order that. Steaks are also great there.

name: Shannon Smith
text: Love the food here.  Chef Ben does an amazing job.  The specials are always outstanding.  The pork belly is like meat candy. Service has always been great.

name: Kyle Winters
text: Love this place. It's pricey - can spend $100 for two people just ordering burgers and a couple of drinks each, after tax/tip. Servers are always friendly/helpful and bartenders will customize drinks. Now closed on Mondays.

name: B Boidy
text:
Really dug this place and the original menu offered.

If you're in the mood for a serious steak or burger this is your stop.  Bison, sirloin, and exotic (kangaroo) burger offerings nightly.

The interior is far nicer than your average burger joint as well.

name: Willliam Jones
text: It's a great place it takes them awhile to give you your check I have been there 3 times and each time it takes them 10-15 minutes to give you the check when you ask for it. Otherwise food, atmosphere, and people are great!

name: Matt H
text: Kind of pricey for burgers, but OMG are they good burgers!  I was disapointed in the lack of draft beer, only bottles!  The staff was extremely friendly and the food was delicious, I will definitely go back on special occasions.

text:
The service was awesome and the food was excellent!!!
The waiter Scott was great guy and attentive to my family's
needs.....

text: Everything on the menu reads like it's going to be amazing and then...it's just ok. But don't you worry, it won't be cheap.

text: Best burger I have had in years. Our waitor recomended the B&G burger with pomento cheese and bacon. It was absolutely amazing. Do yourself a favor and get the mac and cheese as a side it was outstanding. Service was excellent and staff was very knowlagable

name: Jack Allen
text: Great food, atmosphere and service. A little pricey but the quality is definitely worth it.

name: Princess Small
text: Went in on a lovely Saturday afternoon around 1pm and, like most, curious as to what it was and waiting for it to finally open. Ordered a rosé and the pastrami sandwich with fries. First, a bit skeptical of the simplicity of the dish, but the heaping portion of meat and savory whole grain mustard won me over. I still would have liked more flair on the part of the fries, but they were crisp and who doesn't like ketchup? I was about to leave, but discovered I still had too much of the wine left in the glass, so I figured I'd get dessert. Great idea! The seared pear in a *Cheerwine* glaze with that tantalizing cashew créme was frellin' amazin'. Only drawback to this visit? Well, due to their dedication to sanitation, there was often a faint scent of cleaning chemicals in the air (or don't sit too close to the kitchen). Also, beware if you get the pear; the spices they use are real and I got a hearty chunk of what might have been a clove or something? Not mortal, but it cleared the sinus. Thanks John and company.

name: Leonardo Biggins
text: Upscale dining centered around meats and cheeses

name: Ryan Edge
text: Amazing food, all ingredients are fresh.

name: Christopher Murray
text: Tucked away by the mall, this is a relaxing place to grab some grub. Cocktails are refreshing and food is pretty good. If the weather is nice, there's outdoor seating to relax in.

name: Lindsey Carrick
text:
All the food was really good!  Didn’t enjoy the street corn like I thought I would.  The diablo burger was my favorite.

Would come back again and try their cocktails.

name: Mary Bellard
text: The food was tasty and the drinks good. We may have arrived after the Saturday lunch rush, due to our initial greeting and the cleaning that ensued 20 minutes in. A curious loud banging from the kitchen, not thoroughly explained, was uncomfortable. I would like to go again during happy hour or at night to see if I like it better

name: McArthur Stephen
text: Had a great experience here! We were regulars of the previous restaurant "the treehouse ". Pink Cactus had some of the best wings, and nachos I've had since being in Charlotte. Franky the bar manager is the best. Quick and attentive service. Great food and drinks. Great after work spot or place to hang with family and friends. Nice large outdoor patio.

name: Alisse Grady
text:
A few things wrong with this place. Don't see it lasting a year (especially with the low visibility behind the bank).  1. We sat outside towards the back. Pro tip. Dont sit here. We had to listen to the sewer (see pic) gargle, or whatever it was doing, the entire time. It was gross.

2. Menu. Let me get this straight. If I wanted to order 2 tacos, rice and beans. That would come to a grand total of $20.00?? Tacos are a la carte with the cheapest option being $5. Rice and beans are both separate, costing $5 each...
How is this a sustainable business model??
I'm willing to pay for quality, but come on. Just no.
Pacos Tacos (which is where we originally tried to go but the wait was too long) is right next door where you can get 3 tacos, rice and beans for like $14 .. with chips and salsa.

3. We ended up just ordering an appetizer.. the Street Pan Nachos for $12. It was well.. underwhelming. Barely squirted on sour cream and guac paste with a minimal amount of meat and some jalapenos and nacho cheese.
The flavor was decent i guess.
We decided not to order anything else and got our bill. The app magically rung up as $13, instead of $12. Not sure what the deal with that is, but they fixed it after i mentioned it.

The service was fine. It was pretty dead while we were there.

Needless to say,  we will not be back. Good luck to this restaurant! You will need it.

name: Stephen Lucci
text: The food was really good but I would definitely recommend trying this place by ordering out.  The atmosphere is lacking and given there were not alot of people the service was slow.

name: Sharron Harbin
text: The burgers were awesome!!! The service was great also just one thing that was an issue. The fries were not good and soaked in grease. Sent them back 3 times. First time they were entirely to hard and next two times it was to oily. Like that had just been back there siting in the oil. The cook came out and genuinely seemed as if he wanted to make it better but since the fries didn't get better...

text: I really enjoy this place. The food is delicious, the place is clean with a cool vibe, and the staff is very friendly. Highly recommend.

text: Really enjoyed my time at the Pink Cactus! Such a neat aesthetic inside! The food was delightful, and the server was very attentive! One star off because, although I enjoyed my ceviche in a glass, it was difficult to get out, and I wish it had a little more flavor! Otherwise, I would definitely return!

text:
Rude Rude Rude Rude
It's like they don't care if or how you want your sandwich. I ask for my chicken to be warmed up in the microwave because it's kept cold.  That's fine and good but when I ask for it to be warmed up before its put in the toaster that's what I expect.  No I get told the toaster oven will warm it just like the microwave and "can I get to it".  So yes my chicken was still luke cold and not warm enough for my liking.  Then the next chick beside of her is telling people that they have to get off the phone and pay attention so she can make their sandwich.  I understand Jared went to jail for child pornography not for being rude to Subways customers.

text: Awesome new spot in the University City area! Still have kinks to work out with food service time, servers were accommodating and very nice! Hope to make this the new go-to place!

text: The grilled shrimp and grilled chicken tenders with broccoli was delicious. The waiter was excellent and the wait time was short. The restaurant was clean and the atmosphere was relaxing.

name: Alberta Partlow
text:
Excellent food and service, greeted with a smile at the door and continued happy experience.
Tasty fried ribs falling off the bones.
A wonderful place to be with family and friends.
Ready for summer, corn holes, area for live entertainment and sitting inside on the terrace much more than a sports bar and I love the atmosphere.
Not sure who owner is but if former owner of the other one CONGRATULATIONS  for upscaling it. Oh yes comfortable seating as well.

resp.text: Alberta, thanks so much!!! We are so glad you love it as much as we do! We hope to see you Gettin' Wild with us again soon!

name: Todd Sites
text: UPDATE- Whereas thus is a nice place with lots of potential, it looks like they did not know what they were getting into. Which is surprising with as many stores as they have. They are horribly understaffed and don't appear to have the kitchen resources for its size. The food is good but could take well over an hour to get. The bar as well is understaffed and I sat with an empty glass for 43 minutes before someone asked "are you doing ok?" Restraining my urge to get snippy, I ordered another drink which took 15 minutes to get. There are a few employees there that are obviously trying hard to make up for the deficit but it seems like a moot point until upper management can get  a grip on what they need to make it work. I hope they can! Lots of potential but unfortunately this won't be my go to place until it changes.

resp.text: Todd, we are so sorry to see we let you down. We would be grateful for the opportunity to make this right. Please send us your contact info to reviews@wildwingcafe.com so we can speak with you directly.

name: Latoya Brooks
text:
Not sure if because they recently opened they are still working out the kinks, but experience was the worst.  First off they give you silverware wrapped in clothe rags.  Hello, we are in the middle of a pandemic and that is super unsanitary. We sat at the bar and were offered 3 different menus. One regular,  one limited time and one bar menu. Too much going on from that respect. onion ring app was not tasty at all. Rings were greasy and doughy, the chicken sandwich was the same , greasy and not flavorful. After waiting for over 30 minutes for our food it was underwhelming to say the least
I literally watched the cook take my chicken breast out of the deep fryer and place it on the bun, no draining at all. That was left to me to do so by procuring napkins from the bar to dab ou. One of my worst dining experiences ever. the excess grease. I never leave leftovers behind,  this time around I left half my sandwich,  most of the appetizer

resp.text: Latoya, we are sorry to see we missed our mark. We would be grateful for the opportunity to try and make this right. Please send us your contact info to reviews@wildwingcafe.com so we can reach out to you directly.

text: This was my family first time here and our server told us this was there first day of reopening since the pandemic but I to say the service was awesome awesome awesome these guys were very welcoming and the food was outstanding like the service and to add it was my son 16th birthday so we really enjoyed our self we all had different dishes but let me say our server suggested the fried ribs and they were spot on so if you or your family or friends are looking to get out and enjoy and still feel safe this is the spot and I can't forget to tell yall our server name was lex and even though all the crew was awesome lex was spot on my nieces feel in love with our server she is really awesome with kids plus us the adults I can go on and on but I want check it out for yourself and see want you be telling us about your awesome experience thanks Carr,Hardy,Hanes Family

resp.text: Teresa, thanks so much for the feedback! We'll be sure Lex gets the recognition she deserves! We hope to see you Gettin' Wild with us again soon!

name: Jennifer Miller
text: 5/8/21:  We waited for an hour to get a table because they only have 3 cooks. This is absurd. What kind of a restaurant who just had a grand opening only planned to have 3 cooks on a Saturday night.  Awful planning! It was our first time to check this place out never again coming back. We decided to leave instead.  Service was just really bad.  Bar Loiue was a lot better. DO NOT eat here.  The decor was nice but service was terrible.

resp.text: Jennifer, thank you for your feedback. We're sorry that we missed our mark during your visit. Like many in the restaurant industry, we are working hard to hire more team members to improve our guest experience.  We hope you'll give us another shot and come visit us again soon.
