Joseph, we are so sorry to see you did not have a better time. We would be grateful for the opportunity to learn more about your experience and try to make it right. Please send us your contact info to reviews@wildwingcafe.com so we can speak with you directly.
Franklin, thanks for the 5 stars! We hope to see you Gettin' Wild with us again soon!
Kevin, thanks for the feedback! If there's anything we can be doing better, we want to know. Feel free to reach out to us at reviews@wldwingcafe.com so we can speak with you directly.

name: Mimi Hsu
text:
Enjoyed their dessert empanadas. They were so good!!
Love the vibe of their little store front and would be happy to go back and try other things on their menu

resp.text: We’re glad you enjoyed your experience  thank you!!

name: Yersi Fanel
text:
These empanadas are delicious. I ordered one of each (and some more) for a reunion. I called ahead and after explaining I needed them for the next day, I was offered the option of having them frozen to bake at home at my own timing, this was exactly what I needed (they also have the option of having them just half bake if you don't need to store them)

Of all the options, I recommend the sweet guava and cheese the most, excellent combination.

resp.text: Thank you!!

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
During our last trip to Optimist Hall, this was one of the new food stalls we tried.

Covid-19: you can order and pay online. You have to go inside to pick it up. Unfortunately, my order wasn't ready and I had to wait 10 minutes past when it was supposed to be ready. Usually this wouldn't bother me, but I don't like being inside longer than necessary right now.

You can get 3 empanadas for $11, so that's what I did. They charge an extra $1 for any premium options you select (I got one). I tried the Lobster/Corn/Chive, Cubana, and Bacon/Date/Goat Cheese.

I really enjoyed all of them. The lobster was probably my least favorite. The goat cheese was my favorite. I really liked the sauces they came with too.

I definitely think it's worth stopping at this food stall for some tasty empanadas.

name: Elena Aragon
text: Best empanadas I've ever had! Probably the best part was how crispy and flaky the dough was, almost like a pie crust. Then they had some incredibly savory fillings and a ton of options. My partner and I picked up our empanadas, walked to the car, and they smelled so good that we ate all of them immediately lol. Super tasty, affordable, filling, and incredibly well made. I think their sauces need some work but otherwise, absolute perfection!

name: Kimberly Morgan
text: It was very flavorful. Appetizers were perfect for the new year's eve dinner. The food was just simply amazing, Thank you ivan and staff.

resp.text: Thank you for the love Kimberly! This helps us so much :)

name: Rick Hackett
text: Very good empanadas with a wide variety of savory and sweet choices.

name: Mike Trevino
text:
Excellent! I used to live in South America and have eaten many empanadas in my life. These are exquisite.

This past weekend, I ate at 4 different restaurants/food stalls in Optimist Hall. These empanadas were a highlight of the experience. Tasty, crispy, authentic flavors, big variety, fair prices.

Next time you are at Optimist Hall, order at least one $4 empanada from here. I promise, you’ll thank yourself.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Trevino!!! Hope to see you again :)

name: Danielle Schreiber
text: I love these, soooo good

name: Alpesh Patel
text: Waiting in line 10 min, ordered cheese pizza empanadas and apple crumble empanada and they tell me they do not have cheese pizza empanadas or apple crumble empanada. Please post on the counter what you have and don't have so people don't wait in line unnecessarily.

resp.text: You’re right. We’re sorry that happened. We don’t really have a protocol with what to do when empanadas run out, as we usually don’t. We didn’t expect for optimist hall to be so full. We don’t know why there was such a turn out post Christmas. When we do run out we usually put a dot, but idk why there wasn’t. We’re sorry you had to wait in line. Please come back for a free lunch on us! Thank you

name: Aaron Hamilton
text: Got food to go......didn't make it out of the parking lot. Enough said

name: Joshua Menor
text: Comfort food!

name: Jai Stocks
text: Great experience! They refilled our coals on our hookah and were more attentive then reds at 28th. The entire place was a vibe I enjoyed!

name: Venus Love
text: Cool spot, but they seem to ALWAYS have a issue with their cash register 🙄

name: Laila LaTisha Bradford
text: This place was awesome.  Not only did I meet my cousins there after not seeing them for sometime but the staff we awesome. Would go back!

resp.text: We are so happy you had a good time! We hope to see you and the family again!

name: Victorian hillman
text: My husband and I had the most amazing time ever it was such a great experience you only live once we loved the fruit bowl orange hookah flavor enjoyed all the great drinks we had us a couple .. Nice atmosphere people was so friendly Adam and Alex the bartenders, hookah ppl they was awesome

name: Erica Tramontano
text: The DJ and music were lit. The drinks were on point. The hookah was a little weak to me. Expected the place to be bigger inside, but its cozy and inviting; made for a more intimate night.

name: dee rich
text: Great vibe and great service! Lex, Eb, Marco and Lynn are always on point!

resp.text: We appreciate you!

name: Jourdan Drew
text:
Adam is hands down the best bartender(server😂) I have ever experienced!
He was a lot of fun to be around and he kept the jokes coming! He made great suggestions and he was very knowledgeable.(which is very important)
Thank you for being AMAZING, Adam!

name: K.T Guinn
text: New owners, still a great vibe

resp.text: We cant wait to see you again ❤️

name: Katrina Ponath
text: Paul is amazing.  Best bartender and hookah tender ever.  🧡🧡🧡🧡

name: Prisca Moore
text: One of the cleanest hookah bars I have been too. They have a really nice atmosphere and they make really nice drinks and non alcoholic ones as well if you aren’t into drinking.

name: Michelle Glenn
text: Great vibes. Indoor and outdoor seating. Nice area. Good parking. Phenomenal staff!

name: maddy stagner
text: This place is amazing! Great flavors, owners are awesome and personally check on you. It's 18 to enter and not 21 like most other places in Charlotte. I definitely will be visiting here again when I'm in the area!

name: Maribeth Manalo
text: Excellent service.  Great hookah.  You create a bond with the employees when you become a regular.  Definitely check this place out it doesn't disappoint.

name: Da Infamous Blacsha
text: Nice chill relax place.... Bartender was nice (strong drink 😍) many flavor to choose from, good music.... Definitely going back #MyNewHangOutSpot

name: Reema MSD
text: I'm not sure if it was just the night I had gone there with some friends or if it's normally like this... I felt like it was overly crowded for how small the place was. You could barely walk around because people were standing with their drinks all over the place because there was nowhere for them to sit.. drinks took a while to get and the hookah took over 45 minutes to get to us after we had ordered it.. we had reservations that night so at least we got a seat. I could see it being a chill place when it isn't on a busy night..

name: Jodi Helm
text: My daughter have been here several times- drinks are amazing- bartenders are knowledgable and friendly- it's a little annoying to have to place your initial order at the bar and then go back to pay- but otherwise a great experience

name: Nakisha
text: All the staff at Barreled at Lift are very friendly.. You Must try the the fruit bowl hookahs!

name: Sol Airhart
text: Barreled at the Lift is one of the best drink establishments in the Charlotte area. The owner is amazing and you will also catch her behind the turn tables frequently as well. She knows how to create a great atmosphere.

name: Drew Osborne
text:
Went originally with a wedding party, fell in love with it. The atmosphere here is amazing and some of the best flavors of hookah I've ever tasted. I've been bringing my friends back here ever since.

11/10 would recommend an orange bowl with some flavors of choice mixed in.

name: DJ Fries
text:
Charged a cover to get in, service for hookah wasn't great. Bar service took forever to even order. Didn't have ingredients to make a featured drink. All on a Friday night.

I liked the atmosphere and the hookah flavor was great.

Edit: bartender got into loud argument with a customer over a remark about service. Downgrading to one star

name: Jess J
text: Popped in for hookah with a friend. Loved the chill vibes of this place. This was my first time here. The quality of the hookah was amazing! The staff here is awesome. Highly recommend.

name: claire mintich
text: Barreled has some of the best craft cocktails and hookahs in Charlotte. Live DJ after 10, relaxed atmosphere, and comfy chairs and couches for seating. It's a small space and can get a bit crowded on weekends, but it's a great spot to unwind or party with friends.

name: bill norton
text: This place is amazing! Great flavors, owners are awesome and personally check on you

name: Mary Lindsay
text: Paul was the life of the party , he definitely  kept the drinks coming

name: Marvelous Marvin
text: Quaint hookah bar . Friendly people . Small area .

name: Tina Brown
text: Love it

name: Kyle McClure
text: Great atmosphere. Super friendly staff. I recommend this place to people who are looking for a laid back place to have a drink and smoke some hookah.

name: Alison Hall
text: Great place to wind down the weekend on a Sunday evening. Adam was incredibly knowledgeable, accommodating, and downright cool. The hookah was smooth and drinks were on point. Will be back!

name: Jennifer Watson
text: ADAM is great! We very much enjoyed his services and shaken wine. Best in shaken wine in charlotte

name: Alex Kang
text: My friends and i come here often and its a great experience each time! The bartenders are all super cool and friendly. Music and the hookah is great as well.

resp.text: Thank you, Alex! We appreciate your patronage!

name: Matthew Kanauer
text: Paul is an amazing host and bartender.  Also has taught me a lot about hookah

name: Shelby Adams
text: Amazing place!! Love the pumpkin menu!! Great customer service and chill atmosphere.

name: Stephanie Wallace
text: Adam and Paul are true mixologists!! Check them out you will not be disappointed!!

name: Patrick George
text: It's a bar next to a ski lift. What more do I have to say?

name: linda bell
text: Intimate spot w craft cocktails and a cool atmosphere.  Impressive staff who quickly knew all of our names!

name: Yeison Osorio
text: A privately owned club. Requires you to register your driver's license... Overly priced drinks and poor music. Ambiance, well there wasn't one.

name: Adrian G.
text: Nice little place, great drinks and good hookah. Get the orange bowl and flavored it up. Delicious and great experience all around.

name: rasheeda sales
text: The atmosphere is amazing I love the hookah bar.. the prices have gone up.since I first moved to Charlotte but it's perfect for a date night or just hanging with Friends.

name: Mr. Charlotte
text:
The bar tender has a friend and is busy chatting..practcially threw  one menu at the table and walked away.No eye contact not hello...

I asked if coming at this time is inconvenient for her 540pm she said it doesn't get busy until 9 so I guess she was hoping to have time off until 9pm with her friend.

She even asked if I expected her to join us.

So deep in conversation I'm so excited that I actually met the worst waitress of all time.

Definitely does not belong in a city like this.

name: Joshua Garrison
text: Great place. Relaxing. I want to go back soon. The only thing is that they seemed short staffed because it took a little bit of time to get drinks and hookah.

name: Shraddha Sainath
text: The hookah was very pricey and not good at all. Couldn't smoke for the first 30 minutes because it was rough. They decided to change the coal and dropped it all over me. Skin is burnt and have holes in my dress. They apologized and got me an ice pack but I would have expected a better compensation or reimbursement. The place is very small and mostly only reserved for 3 large groups. Bad experience and won't go back or won't recommend.

name: tj al-shami
text: Nice place good music and friendly staff

name: Victoria Bella
text: The best hookah in town and the bartenders are always nice!

name: tj al-shami
text: Nice place good music and friendly staff

name: John Claxton
text: What are the best places to go hookah great atmosphere friendly people

name: Joseph Dalton
text: These guys are awesome, great atmosphere, great drinks, great hookas and great music!  It's a combo that simply cannot be beaten.

name: Beth Thompson
text: Cozy hooka spot with my favorite dj on deck pumping the noise! Great variety mixed drinks to choose from. Huge variety of hooka flavors too. Was already a bit crowded for our group of 8 so our visit was short. Too darn cold outside IN MAY to hang out! But that won't stop me from going back! The best spots are always crowded though so no biggie!

name: Michael Trotman
text: Way cool people, Fire DJ, Bartenders make good drinks... Tab was less than a bill for 5 of us

name: Shakir Wallace
text: My favorite getaway spot! Good hookahs and great drinks!

name: Cannon Munn
text: Fantastic music, great drinks, friendly people and good prices!

name: Terence Hoskins
text: LOVE this place. Terri and the crew have created something special here.
Hookah was great. Great ambiance will be coming back.

name: Rachel Neff
text: Best hookah and cocktails in Charlotte.  Good service.

name: patrick Reagan
text: Not my scene but staff and drinks were great

name: John Claxton
text: one of the best Hookah places service and people are great

name: nurjoohan ali
text: Nice cozy place to go with friends and have a good drink

name: Rocket Man
text: Good atmosphere.

name: Joshua Witmyer
text: Hookas and a nice atmosphere.  Will visit again.

name: Jace Zing
text: Bit expensive, must be the location.

name: Anthony Mazzone
text: Cozy, friendly, good hangout with good drinks

name: Coach Martin Wilson
text: Great vide!!!

name: Kaitlyn Mcwilliams
text: Fun music

name: Sanjay Patel
text: Great drinks, service, and hookah

name: Kemoy92
text: Great Drinks and Bartenders

name: Hannah Caggiano
text: Great chill spot

name: Wesley B
text: Adams the best hookah maker

name: Glenn Kimbrough
text: Cool

name: Karloz 32
text: Amazing place!!

name: Katie Grahl
text: Great experience

name: K Jenkins
text: Love this place

name: S Germ
text: Awesome place!

name: Carla Clark
text: Awesome vibe!  Great hookahs!

name: L Mora
text: Awesome bar

name: Paul Hamilton
text: Best hookah and craft coctail in Charlotte

name: Dennis Glukhoy
text: Nice vibe and music.

name: Rayshema Parker
text: Cool place good drinks

name: Jon Helm
text: Love the chill vibe and great drinks!

name: Tiffani Norman
text: If you are looking for a Delicious Home Cooked Italian Meal, Zio will fulfill your appetite. Piccatta with Chicken was flavorful & prepared "just right".

name: Jess D
text:
I was excited to come here, but I guess it was an off day. The pasta tasted old like it was reheated a few times and the sauce was really watery. The meatballs were decent. The customer service was great, my server was really nice and attentive.
The atmosphere is comfortable and the patio is nice.

name: Patricia
text: The restaurant is a hole in the wall. It was very hot outside on the day our party went, and the staff kept the door open. That made the inside of the restaurant even hotter than the outside because there was no air circulation. The food was just ok. Eggplant Parm did not taste good, according to two people who ordered it at the table. The pizzas were soggy. The wine was ok. Service was slow. I probably won't be back.

name: Hope
text: For such a small business, they pack a large punch with the quality of their food and service. Always a win because everything is delicious!

name: Samson Robinson
text:
I think 4 stars is the correct rating for this place.
Pros: Food is great, people are good, atmosphere is on point, herbs are grown fresh near location. I've never had a bad meal. Great quiet and hidden location and not always too busy. Got a homey feel on one side and a cheers feel on the other.
Cons: Service is inconsistent about 1 out of every 10 times. Not always the most clean space but clean enough.

Overall: I love this place and the food as an Italian food lover. Definitely a win to go here.

name: Timothy Saula
text: Zio Causal is easily one of the best Italian restaurants in Charlotte. The food is well cooked and done . To taste and the aroma is mouth watering. And for the price is insanely affordable in a nice cozy setting especially at night for a dinner . Feels like you on a date which I was . We both came here, Neither of us have been here before . Sad part she stopped talking to me after that but ayeee at least I enjoyed the food and I was happy regardless.

name: kim arney
text: Delicious food, amazing service and fun atmosphere!

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
We came here for Yelp International Supper Club and had a great meal.

We had a family style meal that started with some warm bread and olive oil. We got a cheese pizza appetizer, salad, penne ala vodka, rigatoni Maria, meatballs, chicken picotta, and canolis.

My favorite thing hands down was the pizza. So good. I usually get toppings, but plain cheese was really good. The penne ala vodka was pretty good too.

It was a ton of food for a great price. If you're looking for solid Italian at a reasonable price, this is your place.

name: Wendy Jamison
text: Susan was an amazing, conscientious server/bartender. She was able to answer all of our questions and make our experience there awesome!  She is fabulous!

name: Bryan Segers
text:
Wonderful and a hidden gym
Wednesday jazz is my favorite.

name: Sean Smith
text: My wife and I absolutely love this place. Pasta is great. Hot pies are awesome. Veggies are fresh (and grown on site). And it isn't too expensive.

name: Randy Chittenden
text: One of my favorite restaurants in town. They moved from where I grew up in Western NY. Every time I eat there I am reminded of my childhood. Great service too.

name: Desiree M
text: I am utterly baffled how this place has such high ratings on google and yelp. We sat down at approx 6:40pm and was greeted promptly and had water brought to our table. After that, no waitress to be seen for a solid 15 minutes. We ordered the lasagna and spicy chicken sausage pizza. I am not joking when I say we did not get home from dinner until 8:30 pm and we live 5 minutes from the restaurant. It was miserable. No explanation. We felt bad because we know places are struggling through covid so we gutted the wait out. We got cold lasagna served to us and only had two sheets of pasta in it. It appears they just threw ground meat and a little ricotta cheese in between two lasagna sheets of pasta. It had zero taste. The pizza was just ok, not much flavor and was a bit cold as well. I have no idea if this is the normal food people are raving about. I hate to say I completely wasted my cheat meal for the week.

name: G
text: Great food, pizzas are very different & delicious. I really like the grilled pizza. Stuffed eggplant & pasta Maria are my favorites.  Very friendly staff. I definitely reccomend Zio!

name: Lia Daniels
text: It was good.

name: Nicole Angtuaco
text: The food is absolutely phenomenal.  The toasted ravioli appetizer, the salads, the pasta, and the pizza (especially the grilled pies!) are all SO good.  I also love the unassuming and laidback atmosphere.  It reminds me of old school authentic Italian restaurants from my youth.  This is one of my favorite places in Charlotte!

name: Nick Hlavacek
text: Authentic, delicious Italian food. Get the Chicken Parmesan! You won't regret it.

name: Eric Shaw
text: The food was good but not really what I was expecting. Got chicken parmesan which was supposed to be over fettuccine but was over what looked like egg noodles, not the worst thing but yeah. I was also expecting more cheese and maybe a slice of mozzarella on top but did not have anything like that. The website says family style but it was definitely not portioned that way. All in all the food was good just not what I was expecting

name: Matthew Smith
text: Love this place.

name: Wallace Wyatt
text: Awesome grilled pizzas and delicious pastas and salads. One of our favorite places to order take out, prices aren't too bad compared to some Italian restaurant. Parking lot can be a little tight sometimes, but it's always a good sign when a restaurant stays busy!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review Wallace. The support and patronage of awesome customers, like you, is what keeps us going!

name: April Raybon
text: My favorite pizza and Italian in town. Staff is great! Thanks for everything yall!

name: T K
text: From the min I walk in I'm greeted at the door. Bartender Kristi is awesome . Jack in the back  is always making perfect sauces!! Love this place❤

name: Jayna Brunetti
text: The WORST service we’ve ever experienced. Called 2hrs in advance for a dinner party of 10. Get to the restaurant on time and the hostess gave away our table saying “oh you showed up, well mark you down but it’s going to be a little while”. Um what? We had a reservation. Then went to sit at the bar for an unknown amount of time, asked for 1 drink and some coffee from the bartender. First of all she had white powder under her nose and no makeup on..so pretty sure she’d just done cocain. Then, the 1 drink came out and immediately the bill as if she was pushing us out. Waited another hour, never got the coffee, and left. This restaurant will never get our business again.

name: Eric Sill
text: Best place to take a date and not break the bank, yet have a fantastic time! I've been coming here for years and have never had to wait too long or had bad food. They're somewhat knowledgeable on wine too.

name: Ps J
text: Very good food. Also very reasonably priced. Would have liked to see at least one sweet Italian wine. Good service. Gets very crowded on the weekend.

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review! Please, feel free to send us some suggestions on Sweet Italian Wines and we'll try to get one on the menu before your next visit.

name: Kristin Parunak
text: We love Zios. Everything is great here. Staff is patient & helpful with their menu. Pizza is to die for. Pasta is good. The meat skewer is one of my favs!

name: Brian H.
text: The food was good but the service was phenomenal.  We had a family dinner with 2 small kids and Chris played and joked with them while providing exceptional service.   The ambiance is cozy and comfortable.

name: Rachel Hull
text: The #1 best kept secret in Charlotte. What is better than homemade pasta? NOTHING Their grilled pizzas are unlike ANY other pizzas in Charlotte! I had never had anything that wasn't AMAZING

resp.text: Rachel, thank you so very much for taking the time to rate us and write a review! Amazingly awesome feedback such as yours is a real moral booster for the Zio Family and is much appreciated 😁 We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Gary Knight
text: Absolutely the best casual Italian restaurant in Charlotte. Superb pizza, with the thinnest crust in the South ("the hot pie"). Extraordinary special dishes, especially with fresh fish. House made pasta. Garden to table from their fresh garden out back. Charlotte Agenda just named Zio's the best unknown restaurant in Charlotte. It's all true. Update: now Zio us considered one of the top 5 Italian restaurants in Charlotte!

resp.text: Gary, thank you so much for being a loyal, longtime customer, supporter and member of the Zio Casual Italian family! We're incredibly lucky to have such amazing customers, and you are one of them...Cheers!

name: LAUREN GRIFFIN
text: Pizza is amazing. Marinara is great. The patio looks beautiful. The pasta is fresh but needs to be drained and tossed properly before putting in the serving bowl. Otherwise you get a puddle and your meal served on top of it. Order pizza as takeout and you will be happy! Do not go past 8pm. Go earlier in the day. Everyone is tired and complaining in front of you. They need a curtain to hide the kitchen staff and a space for waiters to release their frustrations and smoke. Please wait a few extra minutes before serving any table after you smoke. That smells gags people out. Take away the tv and put some tablecloths down. Put on some jazz music instead. People will pay some cash with a few upgrades. You rely on the people in your neighborhood to keep this place going, but new folks will be put off after a few minutes. Willing to try again, disappointed in some details.

resp.text:
Hello Lauren and thanks for your feedback.  Looks like we have some good and some bad and I apologize for some of our shortcomings.  I can assure you we take all feedback seriously and will address the items you pointed out.  I'm certainly happy you enjoyed the pizza, marinara and our patio.  However, I will push back on one item.  People enjoy that we are very casual and come as you are type of place as opposed to white tablecloth and polished.  If fact, we more often hear our customers discouraging us from changing anything.  But I understand you thinking and hope you will join us again in the future.  I do thank you again for your feedback.

Jim Consol
owner/operator

name: Nathan H
text:
Zio wasn't terrible. But it wasn't anything special either. The best thing they have going is price and atmosphere. Service was shaky. And the food was good but not outstanding. The bruschetta is awful. The bread was soaked through w the oils, vinegar, and tomato juices. It was definitely the lowlight if the night. It looked like how you would serve bruschetta if you were feeding it to barn animals - just slop on a plate. Flavors were there, but the execution was waaaayy off. However, to be fair, my chicken parm was very good and reheated nicely the next day (it's a very large portion).

I'd maybe go back, but there are other places I'd rather check out before going back to Zio.

name: CeMoore
text: Relaxing atmosphere, great bartender af food

name: Mike B
text: Great Italian restaurant! Food is awesome with very good prices, given the location. Very cozy atmosphere. Parking can be a bit of a challenge on busy nights but it's well worth the effort

name: Evan Dungan
text: Been coming here for a few years now and have always had wonderful service and even better food.  Casual atmosphere and reasonable prices abound.  Family friendly as well.

name: Richard Hamorsky
text: Somewhat cramped dining area but we were seated quickly. Service was good and the food was very good. Will go back and try something else. Prices were reasonable also.

name: Sidney the Artist
text: Absolutely delicious. A real Italian home feel...with a wonderful friendly staff. This is authentic old world Italian food at GREAT PRICES! A must visit!!!

name: Kyler Aulisi
text: Spaghetti sauce is very watery and does not stick at all to pasta. They make good pizza's though

name: Gary Knight
text: Zio is an extraordinary restaurant that serves home made pasta, grows its own seasonal vegetables,  and makes meals that move well beyond the ordinary Italian fare into something unique and scrumptious,  the kind of meals one wants to inhale and then lick the plate...but being adults, we don't....we just ask for more of their bread to remain couth. Every pizza, every pasta dish, every salad is superb. The clientele comes from the immediate neighborhood and well beyond for the terrific food, the friendly and extremely competent servers who eventually knows  your name and what you like to eat and drink, just as you know their names and something about their lives and aspirations. It's a community of good food and friendship. We feel grateful to be a part of it.

name: Stuart Hair
text: Our favorite, too small, too good neighborhood Italian joint. Looking for a unique grilled pizza pie or classic chicken Parmesan or something all new from their back yard garden, Zio is the place for dinner.

name: Taj Bozeman
text:
Had the angel hair and meatballs. Honestly probably the best meatballs I've ever had. The angel hair pasta is made the restaurant. Very good as well. Plenty of pasta sauce, really quick service (the food arrived within five minutes of ordering), server was helpful and attentive. It's a cozy restaurant. The seating the area we were in was fairly close together, but the soft lighting, and the décor made it feel kind of homey and not at all cramped.

One of the better Italian restaurants I've been to.

name: Luke Martin
text: An easy going, fine Italian restaurant. Friendly wait staff and a relaxed atmosphere.

name: Alleda Hannah
text: Great place to eat.  The food and service was outstanding

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words Alleda. We hope to make your next experience a 5-star one!

name: John Pamperin
text: Tucked away Italian place with casual food.  Great wine selection.  Gave four stars because of a bathroom issue they had on the night that I was there.

name: Paul Walenesky
text: Always a great dining experience!

name: Wen Mela
text: Great spot to grab a pizza with the family

name: stephen calder aka Bubba
text: Had really good homemade pasta

resp.text: Thanks for the review Stephen!

name: John Pettrone Jr.
text: Some of the best Italian in the city... It's casual and not stuffy

name: Anne Garrison
text: Fabulous food and service.  Will definitely be back soon!!

name: Tom Scrivener
text: Always a good experience...I specifically love the Penne Ala Vodka, and the Spaghetti Zios....my son gets three orders of the meatballs.  It has become a 2 or 3 times a month event for our family of six.

name: Michael Giudice
text: Great dates night with the wife. This is one of the hidden gems in Charlotte. Great fried calamari and an awesome selection of authentic Italian entrees.

name: Rupert Kıncaid
text: Very nice place to eat,food was actually very good...

name: Stephanie Hamrick
text: The only way into the place is via stairs, and I'm disabled. So I have no idea whether the food is any good, because stairs are too physically painful for me to get in the door. The Americans with Disabilities Act exists for a reason. Do better.

name: walter thompson
text: Its usually great. This was a poor experience.  So disappointing.

resp.text:
We always welcome customer feedback Walter, but you gave no indication of what went wrong. Please let us know so we can improve on it and make it up to you in some way.

-Jim Consol
owner/operator

name: MyMjtaylor
text: Good service like always

name: Bobby S
text: Absolute gem. Pizzas are spectacular and the specials are great. Very reasonably priced, but doesn't skimp on quality.

name: brian hedrick
text: The atmosphere and service are great.  Quaint and homey.

name: Robert Triplett

Cameron, I wanted to apologize for your disappointment with the service at Zio.  While not an excuse, it was a challenge keeping up with an unexpectedly busy Monday night.  Our manager Stephanie, and myself, were doing our best to support the staff, but the service did suffer for some people as you know.  I hope you will consider coming in again so we can offer you a better experience.  Please ask for Stephanie or myself should you choose to.  We'd love the opportunity to give you a better impression, and we thank you for your feedback.

-Jim Consol
Owner/Operator

Highly recommend!

text: A hand written sign is displayed on the front door that reads “closed 2a-5a”. I attempted to enter the store at 1:50am and the door was locked. Too bad Doug is gone. He kept the place clean. He was also more pleasant to deal with than the girl with the colorful hair and piercings. She’s friendly with her friends and associates when they are there but not so much with me and I’m ALWAYS polite to clerks. Also, the store has been closing in the middle of the night for about 2 weeks now. How is this considered 24 hours?

resp.text: Hi Terrell, thank you for letting us know and we are sorry about your experience. We have passed on your message to our local management team.

name: Zoe B.
text:
Super cute and cozy coffee spot. They offer lots of tasty options for coffee and teas, as well as a wide selection of crepes and house made pastries.

The food and drink were delicious! Wait times weren’t bad at all, and there was no shortage of socially distanced seating. Plus free WiFi. What more could you want? 😁

name: Rachel Harr
text: This place is so amazing! Just went here today and had an absolute blast. The staff here was so friendly, and helpful since it was my first time here. Their crepes were absolutely delicious (I definitely recommend The Health Nut for a lovely breakfast!), their tiramisu was phenomenal, and their honeybun coffee, which is apparently their house special here, is so good that I'm definitely coming back here often even if it is for the coffee alone. I seriously recommend this place!

name: Alexandra R
text: Best coffee in Charlotte and cozy atmosphere with beautiful wooden tables. This is probably the only place in Charlotte that knows how to make a LARGE and strong cappuccino without it being all milk. This would be my go to coffee shop if they had better breakfast pastries so that’s the only down fall! Beautiful desserts just not for breakfast/coffee dunking. Suggestion for management: make a variety of fresh/flaky croissants (plain, chocolate, twice baked almond) and a few flavors of muffins :)

name: Timothy Gosey
text: Absolutely wonderful customer service!!  First time eating there and will not be the last, great food.  Felt like family was amazing.

name: Eileen Hume
text: The coffee was good, the crepes “okay”, baristas friendly.  But it was freezing in there already when one of them came out from behind the counter and propped the door open!  The temp outside was in the 30s!  Every patron had on their full outdoor attire, hats and one even had her gloves on.  Coffee stayed hot like 2 minutes. But the workers went about their business and never noticed, it was miserable.  We gave it a shot, but won’t go back.

name: Katherine Bennett
text: My favorite cafe in Charlotte, I love this place! It's super cozy inside and a really great place to get work done, the wifi is excellent. There are also outdoor seating options, which I love. And the coffee and food are so delicious! I usually get either the regular latte or the Lavender Fields latte (the second is a treat), and they always have a nice coffee to milk ratio. I've never bought a meal here, but I love the sweet treats they have - the cookies of the day are great with the coffee, and I just had a chocolate rum ball that was divine. Everything is pretty well priced, too, which is an added bonus, and they use local NC roasters for their coffee beans! ❤️☕

name: Mary Hoy- Huffman
text: We had a great time stopping by... we needed to kill some time and wandered in. I got the hamster? Crepe. It was superb, cheesy, meaty, yummy. Made to order, fresh and very tasty. We got a "coffee" for my tween. Her first iced mocha latte, *wink* light on the coffee, heavy on the chocolate and whipped cream. *wink* She loved it, and felt so grown up. And it was so sweet how nice they were. Thanks for the lovely treat!

name: Dina B
text: Cute cafe. Great, extensive selection of unique (eastern European) pastries and cakes. The owner was very friendly and helpful in explaining all of the sweets. For once I had a hard time deciding what to get simply because I wanted several desserts! I settled on splitting the opera cake and the plum cake. The opera cake was decadent - but a tad too moist and the last few bites were too sweet. I've had plum cake many times before and this didn't quite stack up, but was still very good. What I did like about it was that it wasn't too sweet and had a nice touch of tang from the plums. The cappuccino I had was a disappointment - absolutely no foam. I'll be back to give this cafe another try.

name: Le Ho
text: Very nice staff, great food, nice decor. The whole package.

name: Sharon A
text: Great coffee and atmosphere. The desserts are to die for.

name: Becky Waggener
text: This is a great place to chill with friends, study, or just grab a top-notch cup of Joe with a mouth-watering slice of yummy goodness! Locally owned, the atmosphere is just perfect and the prices are super affordable. Most definitely recommended!

name: Daniel Wallis
text: Great food, made fresh! There were also cool drink recipes on offer. Really friendly service and it's a local independent store so I love supporting them.

name: Kenzie Jackson
text:
The first time I discovered this place I went back 3 times in one week! It has the cozy, authentic vibe of a European street cafe. Try the crepes!!

Also— staff has been very kind and attentive every visit, which I recognize is extra difficult in these stressful, socially distant times. So I really appreciate it.

name: KUKOO MEDIA
text: The crepes are the best! Also love their biscottis and affogatos. Good place to grab coffee and large selection of pastries!

name: A guy
text: Hidden gem. Great cakes and coffee! Say, Google, take me to crema espresso.

name: JOANN PORTILLA
text: VERY nice place to relax and enjoy a light breakfast and GREAT coffee. It was a bit tricky finding it, using the GPS, but ssoooo glad we did!!

name: Elizabeth Hernandez
text: First time visiting this place it's awesome 👍 great food & service.

name: Sam Perkins
text: Nice quaint coffee shop with splendid coffee and lots of treats.

name: Tony Tueni
text: Great coffee and delicious slice of cake that was not too sweet.

name: vince feliciano
text: This is now my absolute favorite bakery in all of Charlotte.  We tried six different items and all but one was a 10 out of 10, the other was a high 7.  My coffee was fantastic.  The owner, Alexa, is just a sweetheart and her husband is great.  I hope the best for them.

name: Nyne
text:
The 3 was for the detox smoothie.
the staff had to be asked for a glass three times and then turned out backs once she put the glass on the table. not a customer-friendly experience at all...

name: Kevin Haley
text: Amazing! My favorite place in Charlotte for coffee and pastries. They serve Black Powder coffee, a small craft coffee roaster based in Mooresville and the pastries they offer are among the best you’ll ever have! Cozy inviting atmosphere and a great staff. Highly recommended!

name: Tatiana Pisarski
text: Awesome selection of dessert & always excellent service!

name: Gaby Mota
text: Super cute place! The staff was super helpful and recommended some new drinks to try. The space looks like a great place to get some work done.

name: mrclayc
text: I love this place.  Friendly staff and great custom drinks and crepes.  Great low-key atmosphere for getting work done.  Never gets too crowded. Best kept secret in Dilworth!

name: Julita Barnedo
text: I had high hopes when coming in for my first visit. Unfortunately I was highly disappointed in the level of customer service I was given by 1 of the employees there. I wish I had remembered her name. There were 2 female employees at the time of my visit and only one exhibited any care or concern towards any of the customers that happen to be there. The one employee that was wearing a hat seemed completely frustrated and even seemed to take it out on her coworker while we were there. She was visibly irritated and not able to handle even the simplest of task..which is to provide even the most basic customer service and to speak to people with respect.  While waiting for my order the one with the hat showed so much disregard and it clearly showed that she had no interest of making sure she was polite to the customers and she clearly did not want to be there. My suggestion to the management is to be mindful of the people whom are chosen to represent your business. I will most likely not return to this establishment.

resp.text: Dear Julita, thank you for your comment. We will be sure to address the issue and work with our team members to assure  pleasant visits for our patrons. We hope that you give us another chance and your experience with us was otherwise a good one.

name: Andrew Bagrin
text: Great place. Very friendly staff!

name: Natalya Klimova
text: Come for the Eastern European pastries and crepes, take a pass on the espresso. Honey layered cake was on point.

name: Tatiana Murga
text:
Amazing place. Highly recommend. Better than Amelie’s. Crepes and Orange macchiato are to die for. Owner and her stuff are exceptional.
My husband has severe allergies, never has problems after the eat at Crema Espresso. They use natural ingredients and take a great pride of it. Great job!

name: Austen D.
text:
I stop here regularly when I have to head into town from Cotswold. Staff is always super friendly, very tasty cappuccinos, and delicious baked goods (including gluten-free and vegan).

Plus it’s easier to get parking than at the Starbucks down the street

name: Emory J Hobel
text:
This is my ALL time favorite place.

Update one year later. Still my favorite place!!

name: Brandon Horak
text: Great quiet spot. Food was wonderful. Coffee as well. Service was thoughtful. This place deserves noticably more recognition.

name: Scott Davis
text:
Went to get an espresso drink - left with a smile on our face!
The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable of not only the espresso which is why we came, but also the loose leave teas, baked good and crepes (baked items made in house)
The decor is nice but also unique.
We left with a smile as they were very nice and personable.
The honeybun latte and hot chocolate we left with were light and delicious
Definitely will return again.

name: Michael McCray
text: Great experience.

name: Mark Terifaj
text: Cool little spot to go and grab a coffee and pastry.  Everything is very fresh, and prices are affordable. Haven't tried one yet, but their Crepes look really good too.

name: Mike Knapp
text: Great little spot, really quaint and cozy! Good cappuccino and atmosphere

name: Jay Komthongpane
text: Nice place. Nice staff. Great coffee. Free WiFi to do some work.  Crepes I heard are good

name: Daniel Judah
text: One of my favorite places to get coffee. The coffees are fresh roasted, the baristas always make a high quality drink. Highly recommend!

name: Adam Peter Shinn
text: The Iced Macaroon Latte is next level!

name: Brian Goggin
text: Just a great place for coffee and fine desserts and lunch. The Crepes are wonderful

name: Shane Robillard
text: Delicious food. The tea and crepe made for a great afternoon snack on a Saturday. Highly recommend.

name: Susanne Robicsek
text: Crema Espresso AND Crepes AND Omelets AND Pastries! This is a hidden gem in Dilworth, at the Kennilworth Commons shopping center near the Harris Teeter.  If you love good coffee but don't like the bitterness of that chain, this is where you can find a good cup of coffee./espresso/etc. I love the cappuccino. But don't stop at the coffee. This place makes delicious European style pastries unlike any other place I have found in Charlotte, and that is because they have a Russian pastry chef on site. They also have crepes, and crepe-style omelets - trust me on this, you never knew you wanted an omelet made like this, but you do! Sandwiches and other options like their chia bowls look good too.

name: j watts
text: I've watched this location change hands several times over the last 10 yrs. By far, this is the nicest it's ever been since the original Dilworth Coffee!

name: Julianna Hawley
text: Super cute space with a cool atmosphere for hanging out or doing work. Their menu is really diverse, too, and they have plenty of choices for coffee

name: Nick Jordan
text:
I had every intention to just stop in, grab a coffee, find some locally roasted whole beans and continue on to Greensboro. I was sitting in the car for already 3.5 hours from Atlanta and was dreading getting back in for the last leg- that is until I met Alexis, Crema’s owner. Because of her gregariousness and her amazing hospitality, I am sitting here in a booth relaxing with an americano- amazed with this place and her incredible customer service. We chatted for 10-15 minutes; nerding out about different types of coffee, machines and brewing methods, and regional suggestions. This has been such an amazing experience for this tired traveler that I am definitely going to go back out of my way to stop back by the next time I’m passing through.

Well done Alexis! You’re killing it!

resp.text: Thanks Nick! It was a pleasure chatting with you. Hope to see you soon! We’ll have more amazing coffees for you to try!

name: Christopher Sottile
text: Great food, atmosphere, and attentive staff.  Will definitely be a new hangout spot in Dilworth!

name: Elena Sokolovskaya Miskevich
text: Great place!

resp.text: Thank you for your excellent review! Please come back for a 20% off your next purchase with our springtime savings promotion!

name: Igor Lapshin
text: Excellent coffee and european style desserts.

name: Zikra Faran
text: We bought donuts 🍩 from there and they were so tasty, I wanted to buy from dunkin donuts but it was closed so I went in Quiktrip and bought only for 1.5 dollars 💵 so cheap but taste was awesome 🤩 highly recommended and will try again definitely. I love to eat donuts 🍩 sometimes so I try different places but it was so good 😊

name: Scott Sizemore
text: This was a great gas station when it was first built and was the only one I would stop at on Sunset Rd  but I have quit going.  The grill is hit or miss and I got tired of all the begging and sob stories from all the folks standing outside around the building and gas pumps. People have came up to me several times while fueling wanting money. I have had several watch me get money out of the ATM and follow me outside asking form money.  They know you got it now,  they saw it and “just need a little help.”

name: M B
text: Very clean and Quick trip to the store. Everything was pleasant including the bathrooms.

name: Carlos Rushing
text: Excellent customer service, very neat and always clean. The entire staff was professional and very punctual and polite. The best gas on the market and an excellent assortment of products that are priced competitively. QT is the convenient store of the future. Today was another day that was filled with the best customer service, from a place that lives up to its fullest potential. Britney and I think his name was Dewan are two of the most respectful customer service representatives to join a long list of many that are employed at store 1029. They were both smiling and making themselves available to anyone that needed assistance.As they diligently worked within the deli.

name: Tammie Klawitter
text: For the most part it was clean. People friendly.

name: Chris B
text: This place is going down quickly. I'm a fan of QT but not this one anymore. Rarely any hot food late in the evening and I cant walk in the place anymore without constantly being hounded by aggessive beggars hanging around outside. This place was just built a few years ago and is already run down. I'm pretty much done with it.

name: Clint Garrison
text: Restroom was in a very unmaintained state. No hand soap, no hand towels, TP almost out, and one stall was unusable due to an uncleaned mess 🤮

name: Lori Reed
text: I stop by about once every other week during the day and it's always clean and the employees are polite and super fast.  Not sure I would visit at night due to the sketchiness of the area (high crime reports)... but during the day it's great.

name: Sean Reece
text: It’s an ok Quik Trip. I’ve been to better and lately it seems to have gone downhill. It has never been the best QT since none of the workers are nice but I’ll stop by still if gas is cheap enough. Coffee pots are always out or taste old now.

name: Dee
text: OK this is suppose to be Quick Trip never have I ever walked into a QT and the cashier was working slow like Shantal was tonight. If she had not been talking to the other guy in the other line who she is obviously interested in maybe she could have served the four customers that was in line and she was nonchalant about it and didn't even have the courtesy to say hi how may I help you or even say bye see you later come back again or anyting just plain out rude.

name: Brian DeCastro
text:
Ordered breakfast for the first time at a QT.. Sausage egg and cheese burrito and sausage egg and cheese biscuit with a vanilla latte . I was only one in line and it took 25 minutes to get my order because the lady was fixing orders from folks that placed their orders at the pump. I simply got gas and came inside to order.  She told me the pump had priority.. How does that make sense..?
The food is horrible  cheap microwaved run of the mill frozen stuff,  Eggs are fake..
The Latte was decent but it didn't make up for the low quality bad tasting food. I do not recommend eating here.. Period.. It is a Gas station after all

name: richard morgan
text: Don't go at night, saggy pants and attitudes for employees that are old enough to be my kid. No manners. Management allows people to hang out and get into other people's business and has an attitude himself. Won't ever go there again. Place sucks.

name: Elizabeth Carter
text: Everytime I go in this one something is out of order. This is one of the dirtiest QT I’ve been to and the staff is rude.

name: TJ Simmons
text: I go here everyday to sit and look at all the teens that go to the school up the street. Great place.

name: AFFILIATE WITHJBPTV
text: Simply the best in the industry!  Classy.

name: Omar Perez zelaya
text: Good location

name: ShotzaDemon
text: Doughnuts never fresh

name: Daniel Flores
text: Very neat and clean.

name: SERGIO C
text: Air machine is broken

name: Mya Cooper
text: The ambiance was welcoming, yet formal. The wait staff was always available to offer service, yet out of sight. The food was delectable, including the lamb, grouper, scallops, all of the appetizers, and each of the desserts (I was with family, so I tasted everything). I highly recommend this restaurant for a special dinner with loved one(s)!

name: Skotii
text: Omg it’s so expensive. Is it worth it for the pay? No not really, but if you save up a bill or two you can have an extraordinary dinner experience that’ll leave you and your SO argue on the car ride home because you expected some play time for the good date and they declined so you asked them to pay their half and now you’re the cheap one

name: Christopher De La Torre
text: Let me preface this by stating my wife and I have been to multiple fine dining establishments across the us (NYC, Denver, LA and everywhere in between). This was by far the most exceptional culinary experience we’ve ever had. Even more amazing was that the chefs were new. For such young chefs they are culinary geniuses. Flavor and combinations are far superior to almost anything I have ever experienced . We will be back for more!

name: Peeran B
text: If you are looking for a fine dining experience and elaborate ambience transporting you back in time.. McNinch House sets the benchmark. We were there to celebrate a birthday and we had the cognac room to ourselves. The meals served in finest silverware and ornate cutlery. Every dish was well presented with wines to pair and service to match. An evening could not have been spent better..

name: Brandon Camp
text: Outstanding dining experience in Charlotte. The meal was perfection from beginning to end. What far exceeded my expectations, was the exemplary service and amazing Sommelier who took great care of us the entire night. I highly suggest you opt for the wine pairing option, it really completed the experience.

name: Logan Abrams
text: Highway robbery, for what?  The food wasn't very appetizing, greasy crabcake, rubbery duck, and honestly nothing else was special.  I've had 10x meals in Charlotte for 1/4 the price.  Go anywhere else in CLT rated above a 3 star please!  Now, the wine pairings and wines selected by the Somm were quite enjoyable,  hands down the only good part of the meal.  4 people for $1,000 with sub par food, even go to a chain like Cap Grill or Ruth Chris or Fig Tree, Bardo, etc ALL blow this place away food-wise.

name: Sebastian Williams
text: Best fine dining in Charlotte. Wesley is a gem. This place is next level. Always look forward to the next time!

name: Toppy Cat
text: Me and my husband decided to go here last June for our anniversary and it was great! They treated us exceptionally well. The food was a bit pricey, but the whole experience was worth it. I would definitely recommend it.

name: Amanda Efird
text: Great food very expensive.  Beautiful house.

name: David Griffin
text: Great place for romantic dinner, food is excellent. Bring your wallet, prices reflect the atmosphere and food

name: adam pyle
text: Best restaurant I have ever been to.

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
This would typically be out of our price range, but we decided to splurge for an early anniversary celebration.

We did a 6pm reservation on a Friday night. There was only one other couple there the entire time we were there (we left shortly after 7).

There's a few different options for ordering. We went with the smallest/cheapest which was the 4 course option for $105 each (2 appetizers, 1 entree, 1 dessert).

Since we were celebrating our anniversary, they brought us a complementary glass of prosecco which was very nice.

Prior to the first appetizer, they brought us a broccolini soup shooter which was very good. For our first appetizer, we both got the She Crab Soup. We wanted to try the Artichoke Soup, but they were out. We loved the She Crab Soup though.

Prior to our second appetizer, the brought us a cheese bread with rosemary butter that was delicious. For our second appetizer we got the Jumbo Lump Crab Cake and the Pork Belly. The Crab Cake was the best I've ever had and one of the highlights of the meal. The Pork Belly was the only thing we were disappointed with. It was over cooked and not tender like pork belly should be.

Prior to our entree, they brought us a salted caramel sorbet which was very good. For our entrees, we got the Rosemary & Dijon Crusted Rack of New Zealand Lamb and the Pan Seared Scallops. Both were excellent. The lamb was tender and the scallops cut like butter. During the course, they also brought us a biscuit with rosemary butter that was very good.

For dessert, we got the Hazelnut Crème Brulee and the Caramel and Apple Cheesecake. The Crème Brulee was very good and done perfectly, but the cheesecake was the star of the show. It was light and fluffy with a caramel apple sauce. It was the best cheesecake I've ever had.

Our top four dishes of the night were the crab cake, scallops, rack of lamb, and cheesecake.

To end the evening, they brought me a rose!

They do valet parking, but we found street parking easily. They typically have a Groupon which helps with the cost a little. The service was outstanding.

I'd definitely recommend this for your next special occasion!

name: Carol Pietras
text:
Awesome food and service
Very special

resp.text: Good Evening. We are so happy that your visit with us was excellent. Thank you for leaving a review.

name: Jets Killer
text: The staff were outstanding, friendly and kind, My wife and I celebrated our 26th Anniversary here. Thank you. We will be back.

name: Lakutus
text: Well worth the money

name: Christopher Connelly
text: You don’t get any better than this for fine dining in Charlotte. Superb food. Knowledgeable staff. All in a meticulously restored 19th century mansion in the heart of Charlotte. There’s nothing else like this and well worth the splurge.

name: Jesse Hawkins
text: Food and service is fantastic if you haven't tried it on your list.

name: Macie Myers
text: Beautiful historic setting for fine dining...Charlotte at best...

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We look forward to hosting you in the future

name: Barbi Gearhart
text: Everything was wonderful. The service, the food, the atmosphere....just fantastic! Do the 6 course, it's worth it!

name: -B C-
text: Enjoyable experience, all around.  The venue is quaint, and steeped in history.  The service was very good. The food was delicious, and combined some creative and lively flavors.  All in all, we'll be back.

name: Mac McNeil
text: Excellent fine dining!  Service is impeccable.

name: Kara Berg
text:
One of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had!
Impeccable service, amazing food,  friendly and knowledgeable wait staff.
Beautiful dining room. I can't wait to go back!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are so glad that your experience with us was one of the best. We cant wait to host you in the future

name: Donna Bush
text: We attended a wedding there. The food was ok. I wish there was a better selection of entrees. It seemed liked everything took a long time for the ceremony and dinner.

name: Argiris Kanelatos
text: A classic, vintage ambiance set in a house turned historic landmark, paired with the chef's tasting menu and Bourdeaux wine complement, made for the perfect belated birthday dinner. The best way to describe a dining experience at McNinch is to feel lost in a dining whirlwind of pure

name: Y Yu
text: One of the most memorable dining experiences ever. The prix fixe menu was outstanding and the service was great! We got the 5 course and every course was delicious to the very last bite. Enjoyed every minute of our 3 hour dining experience. And MUST get the wine pairing for each course personally selected by the wine steward Wesley. The limited seating, ambiance, and decor made for a very romantic evening. It is pricey but well worth it and would love to go there again.

name: G Marshall Johnson
text: Great 6 course dinner

name: FATman Pro
text: Had a exceptionally wonderful 5 course dinner. Wine was paired & inspired with care. Ambience was excellent & cosy.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are so glad that your experience with us was exceptionally wonderful. We look forward to hosting you in the future.

name: Fabien LeRoy
text: This is an amazing place!!!! Thank you Wesley, Tracy and the chefs.

name: Ben Hsiang
text: Top notch service and incredible food. The sommelier knew exactly the wine to pair with our dishes (he even had non-alcoholic wines for my pregnant wife). You don’t feel “rushed” at  McNinch House like you will with other restaurants. A great value for an excellent fine dining experience.

name: Charles “Chip” Payet
text: Absolutely AMAZING New Year's Chef's Tasting Menu.  To celebrate the end of an amazing year with my wife, this was perfect.  The service is friendly and excellent, the food was EXQUISITE, superb wines, beautifully decorated..........really, this is one of the finest restaurants in Charlotte.  Thank you to everyone at The McNinch House Restaurant for a fabulous New Year's Eve dinner!

name: Ronald Worstell
text: Eclectic and fascinating! In an historic home near uptown. Each course is presented with a floral garnish and always on different china. The food is excellent and divinely presented.

name: Angi QUIN
text: I dont get it. The food here was not good. The wine was ok. The service was decent. The prices are ridiculous!

resp.text:
Firstly I would like to thank you for taking the time to advise us of your recent visit. It is through feedback such as yours that we are able to maintain and indeed, where necessary, improve upon the service that we provide our guest.

I was very disappointed to read of your experience during your visit with us. Whilst an apology will regrettably not alter the outcome of your experience on this occasion, I do extend it with all sincerity. I certainly empathize regarding the points you mentioned in your review, Especially that the food was not good. This was the first night of this menu and like all first nights of anything there is always room for improvement. Sadly these needed improvements were reflected in your dining experience. We have/are addressed/ing the hiccups.

I do hope you will not judge us by this one experience. We strive to do just one thing....Create a Culinary Journey in a upscale atmosphere.

Thank you again for the feedback.

name: Ronald Worstell
text: Eclectic and fascinating! In an historic home near uptown. Each course is presented with a floral garnish and always on different china. The food is excellent and divinely presented.

name: Leigh Lane
text: Fantastic place for dates, special occasions, or just a fancy meal.  The food and service are excellent, and the atmosphere is great!  Expensive, but worth it.

name: Trish Saemann
text:
I really wanted to like this place.  They couldn't find our reservation, though they confirmed by phone earlier in the day and the day before.  So we stood in the foyer awkwardly for a while.

We added the wine pairing to our meal and the wines were nice. The sommelier was nice, but very distant and it felt like he couldn't be bothered. We had a few questions about the wine, but determined pretty quickly that though he was polite, we were not the priority.
The first 2 courses and the amuse bouche were really good, but my entree and my husbands were not that great at all.  His was average, mine was not good.  I got gnocchi and they were tough. The sauce was bland and a little salty.

We spent $350 on this meal and it was really, really disappointing.  The house was very cute/vintage and shabby chic... but that isn't enough. McNinch is a Charlotte institution and we were both so excited to try it out.  There are far better places to eat/drink in Charlotte and it's a shame this place was such a let down.

name: Carey Smith
text: Very curteous staff and want to ensure the clientele are having a good time.  Awesome surrounding and history.

name: Meredith Kistner
text: Top notch food, service and atmosphere! Bring your check book!

name: Aixavelisse Soto
text: EXCELLENT, SUPERB, MAGNIFICENT

name: alex chino
text: "Great staff, good food, and good prices."

name: Kevin Daniel
text: We dined at the Mcninch House recently after hearing so many great reviews. I have to say the best part about the place is the place itself. Very quaint old Victorian home! The food was not what I expected to be, bland and just ok. After spending the amount of money that I spent, the Mcninch House definitely lacks that wow factor that I am looking for with my dining experiences! I will not return..

name: Sonia Perez
text: This is the best Caribbean restaurant that I have tried and I know good Caribbean food when I have!  It is adjacent to a Compare Foods supermarket but don't let that discourage you from coming in and enjoying excellent Puertortican pasteles, rice with pigeon peas (gandules!),  alcapurrias (cassava friiters stuffed with meat), plantains, salads, Dominican foods and much more.  Everything is prepared fresh on location and is offered cafeteria style.  So it is not a fancy sit down place, but it is a yummy family or group oriented place. 😘  You , like me, can come alone and feel right at home!  The ambiance is casual and very friendly!  The place has very high ceilings so it doesn't feel claustrophobic!  Come in and bring your colleagues!  Heck it is just 6 miles from Southpark and even closer to Downtown/Uptown Charlotte!.  😇😇

text:
Perhaps service has been improved lately? My experience was quite good. Maybe managers are reading these reviews...

Had very friendly and efficient service on the bagel side of this joint coffee bagel shop.

My everything bagel had "everything-ness" on both sides, which isn't always the case in bagel shops.

Good ambience, with awesome but not overly-loud music when I was there (awesome if you heart 80s tunes).

It seems I'm officially contradicting the one star reviews... those who had a bad experience may want to try again?

text: This Bruegger's has been my morning hangout for years.  It is a very friendly location, there is ample parking and is always full of interesting people.  This location is popular with freelancers and others that work from home.  The location is a shared space with Caribou Coffee.  Excellent neighborhood vibe...😊

name: Isabel Duncan
text: Bruegger’s has mine and my boyfriends favorite sandwich. We always get the turkey chipotle club. We have been to many other Bruegger’s locations and they are always great. This location, however, seems to mess up our food every time we go. This last time causing me to write this review is because the employee but ham instead of turkey on our sandwiches. The name of the sandwich is TURKEY CHIPOTLE. Some people don’t eat ham. I called the store to tell them and they didn’t even apologize. Do better.

And that's the place I should of went to instead of a place where the customer service is phony and the food is trash,PERIOD.

name: Ari Goldstein
text:
Bagels are still great, but the service is bad. It has to do with the encouragement of the management, the training on the job, the attitude the employees are instructed to give. It is a SHAME, since it seems the product is excellent, but the lack of time, hiring additional help and processes are failing the business. Millions spent on quality food and the experience is killed by under staffing, and under training.
This is a mini food court and because it is a SHARED location, there seems to be a lack of control for the common areas to stay clean.
Wish the property management / land lords were smarter.

text: I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!. The food was honestly not good. It literally looked like something my 11 year old sister could make at home. I ordered a chicken with rice, beans and a salad and when I say this I’m serious.... IT LOOKED LIKE THEY BOUGHT THAT SALAD FROM WALMART, TOOK IT OUT THE BAG AND SLAPPED IT ON THE PLATE AND ADDED RANCH DRESSING TO IT. The food is not restaurant quality. I’ve payed way better for much less. Now I will admit it. It is authentic as the food you would find in a regular persons home. Something I could literally make at home right now. It taste like a mediocre  home cooked meal not a restaurant cooked meal. So if you’re expecting high quality not here. If you’re okay with paying a lot for a mediocre home cooked meal with Walmart salad then this is your place.

name: Gypsum Moon Rocks
text: Fabulous food! The music was way too loud, but the food and service were excellent.

name: Rebecca Ledford
text: We arrived at 12pm on a Saturday. the restaurant was empty, except for 2 people who had finished and were leaving. The manager greeted us and was exceptionally nice. We placed our order at 12:10 which consisted of shrimp tacos and chimichangas. We noticed a few tables had come in, ordered, eaten their food, and left during our wait. Part of our order came out at 1:10pm, the shrimp tacos came out (cold) several minutes later. We finished eating in about 15 minutes and waited for our checks which  were never brought to us. When asked (politely) why it took so long, the manager stated that the "rice wasn't ready" and he had to wait for the "majority of people," implying that he didn't want to make rice for just us.  He then stated that he had "said his apologies" without actually ever apologizing for anything. We paid $39 for very little food that took an hour to arrive. the food was OK, but not nearly good enough for an experience in an empty restaurant that lasted nearly two hours (12pm to 1:49pm) in total. We will not be back.

The service here is quick and awesome, making it an easy choice to become a repeat customer.  The owner is extremely cordial and generous with food (a big plus since I'm pregnant).  I'll continue coming back.

text: I've been eating here off and on since I moved to Charlotte 7 yrs ago. I normally like most of the foods. Last night I ordered a House special lo mein without pork, an order of chicken wings, and a Large egg drop soup. I'll start off by saying the lo mein was awesome. It taste great although it lacked enough of the proteins and the wings were good. The problem was the egg drop soup that was obviously not egg drop soup. When getting home I opened the bag to a egg drop soup that wasn't yellow at all and was almost clear with eggs floating in it and very thin. Upon tasting the soup it was clear they gave me chicken noodle broth with eggs dropped in it and it was purely disgusting. I would have rathered the tell me they didn't have it then give me what they obviously threw together. My wife had told me she ordered the egg drop soup from there a few days before and her was thick, yellow, and full of eggs so I expected better.

name: Hunter Pennington
text: I was just charged over 30.00 for a delivery that never happened. No one picks up the phone to explain it all. I'm not one to complain but good God. Thank almighty for Dominos.

name: Destiny Marie
text: Food was cold, late, and incorrect. Then when I called to let them know, they kept putting me on hold and hanging up on me. I was missing the sauces. I ordered the 6 cheese Tuscan cheese sticks and was given regular cheese sticks. So I essentially paid an extra 1.75 for the same thing I could've added to my 6 dollar deal. The cinnamon pull aparts were hard as a rock and inedible. The wings were cold but at least I could reheat them.

name: Tavita Mageo
text: Trashy place! I came at 12:40. Didn’t know that carry out ended at that time till it popped up and all the people in there ignored me at the door. Clearly they don’t give care.

name: Cody Hanes
text: Awesome, friendly and chill staff :) thanks for all the great pizza and cheesey breads, my cook dudes and dudettes.

name: Rose Stella Sears
text: We ordered delivery and I got charged. Waited over an hour, tried to call no answer, no one with pizza showed up at my door. It's really frustrating when you've had a tough day at work 🤦🏼‍♀️

name: kyle thompson
text: Ordered a pizza when I got off work and they made me wait an hour and a half and then cancelled my order. If you didn't want to make the pizza just tell me so I can order from somewhere else

name: Silika Rose Mansfield
text: I love this location!! Roy was super helpful with my order when I made a mistake. He has great customer service and I will be coming back!! Thanks so much!!

resp.text: Thank you!!!

text: Rude staff and horrible service never expect to ever get your order at a reasonable time.

name: Bill Blount
text: I bought 10 pizzas for some nurses at children floor and gots nice discount and wanted at. 11:30 I got it on time and made 10 or more lady's happy

resp.text: We love to hear this! Thank you for taking the time to review us, we appreciate it! Have a great day!

name: John
text: @PapaJohns waited 1.5 hours for a delivery that never came. Called and was told they didn't have any drivers and I could come get it. Drove 20 minutes to get it and it wasn't even in the oven. Got a refund but still pretty disappointed in the communication.

name: adam pyle
text: Never bothered to deliver my order. Their app is horrible. Save your money and time and just go anywhere else. They'll be better.

resp.text: Adam, we are sorry you had a bad experience with us! Can you please email your order number/information and contact information to reviews@papajohns.com.

text: Terrible service. The cashier is really dumb in so many ways

name: Emanuel Townsend
text: Delicious pizza and they live by their motto 'better ingredients,  better pizza.'  Every topping taste fresh, nothing seems as if it was dumped out of a can.   The service was friendly and they even offered me a drink while I waited for me order.

resp.text: We are happy to hear you enjoyed the food! We hope you have a great day Jerry!

text: Just got my delivery pizza arrived late, it was cold and skimped on the cheese. I would expect better quality from Papa Johns smh!

name: Charlotte Shopper
text:
4th Street/Uptown
Roy is awesome!!!!  Great Customer Service  👍🏽

name: Joshua Reddick
text: Coming out of gastonia this is about as good as it will get.

name: Yael Yaroch
text: A-team tonight! Really great service over the phone. Pizza got here super fast. Really hot and good. Had to leave a review.

name: Kula Kemokai
text: Very poor customer service. Manager was just rude. Order here and was told it will take about 45 minutes. An hour later we call to checked the status of our orders and they told us the orders was cancelled because they attempted to delivery but no answer. Lies!!! And the manager said we will have to come and pick up  our orders. It's not that serious for a tasteless pizza!!!

name: Mariah H
text: Papa John's is one of my favorite pizza joints. Could be 5 stars is the delivery was faster. You pay so much extra for delivery fees and they drag their feet getting hot fresh pizza to my door...

name: robert crosier
text: I have ordered pizza there. It was so so. However ordered the works pizza on 10/28/2015. I loved it. What a great pizza. Who ever cooked that pizza should have a pat on their back. It was the best franchise  pizza I have ever ate. Good job Guys and Galls..

name: Deanna Ewing
text: Love papa johns!! The pizza is wonderful and they deliver to us and they are always very nice, courtesy, and professional.

name: Gloria L
text: It Okay

name: Carol Rego
text: Ordered carry out online. Order was correct. Friendly staff.

name: randall bryant
text:
Please be aware!!!
I was quoted $20.00 for a large 2 topping pizza and asked why... I paid $9.00 for the pizza.

name: April Baldwin
text: Good hot delicious pizza, good service.

name: Bob Smith
text: One of the better pizzas that delivers on time

name: Jo Strickland
text: no long wait time and the papadias are delicious

name: Juicy Jay
text: Fast friendly service

resp.text: Thank you, Jay!!

name: donnie steamboat
text: Piss poor customer service. I don't expect from much from a delivery pizza place but this was poorer then average. They kept asking the same questions over and over and had problems taking my order but worse they were unapologetic and didn't care. I finally just hung up.

name: Katherine Blackwelder
text: Terrible pizza.  Did not have sauce and tasted bad and dry.  When I called I was not offered special with large and was charged more for medium. Staff did not give correct size pizza and we had to debate with them for correct one.

name: PRECIOUZ ROBINSON
text: MY PIZZA WAS COLD NOT TO MENTIONED I PREORDERED MY PIZZA 30 MINUTES EARLIER FOR IT TO NOT EVEN BE HOT SMH VERY DISAPPOINTED 😑😑👹👹

name: Kevin D
text: Do not place an order in store, they will charge you full price for online deals

name: Drew Terry
text: Standard Papa John's.  Generally good experiences, although one time they charged my order wrong.  However, they ended up giving me the pizza for free, so great customer service to boot!

name: Derisse Perry
text: I entered and was not greeted. I stood there for more than ten minutes before anyone said anything to me. The restaurant had more than five workers and no one made an effort to speak. When I said something the elderly guy at the register appeared annoyed by my presence. So uncomfortable but I ordered and paid online so I wanted my food.

name: Darius Little
text: Rude staff. Inefficient, Moody moody and hangs the phone up on customers.  Very trashy people.

name: Cynthia F
text: Love this place,  nice friendly staff.

name: Kathy Fennell
text:
I'm a first time customer. Thought we'd give Papa John's pizza a try.

I spent quite a bit of money and discovered a few things:

The sausage on the medium pizza's tasted like breakfast sausage-not Italian sausage. Totally ruined the flavor of the pizza. I asked for light sauce on one and regular on the other. Pizza's were made to that request and I know this because (see next issue)

I asked for light sauce on the Chicken Veggie pizza, it was not light. In fact you could see it under the cheese and particularly thick at the edges of the crust.

I don't know why anyone would pay for "priority pass delivery" when it still takes 39-49 minutes for delivery. Not piping hot, but still sorta warm. I think pizza may have delivered around 30-35 minutes but still, what a mislead.

Crust on all pizzas, while tannish on the bottom, was very chewy in the center and tough as nails on the outer edges. This is signature pizza?

Delivery girl was very nice and I don't mind the 6$ tip. That is the best thing I can say about Papa John's nasty pizza.

What a huge disappointment and waste of money. My husband, myself, my grand boys (who eat just about everything and really like pizza) were all starving and this pizza was such a let down. Honestly, I don't know how this passes for pizza or why the Papa John's chain is so popular. Do we just shove food in our faces and not care how it tastes or what it costs? It all went in the garbage last night. I'm sure when the raccoons realize it's in there they'll enjoy it.

I joined the Papa Johns online club but will be cancelling that. I won't be back. I'd like to get my money back but I have a feeling Papa will be keeping that. You got me and you got me good. Caveat emptor holds true for you.

name: Stephanie Snoddy
text: Ordered pizza online. Guy lied and closed out the order as if I already had my order. I called the store and the girl found this odd. However, she still gave me no refund and backed up the rude driver to boot. Never again. I learned my lesson.

name: Nelson Contreras
text: Good service and good pizza

name: Ashley L
text: When you order a pizza for pick up and it says it will take 25 minutes at the most, but now you've been waiting for an extra 30 minutes, that's bullshit. Last time we come to this store.

name: Connie Holder
text: Pizza was fresh and hot.

name: Mary McKnight
text: greatest pizza and staff on East side. Live it

text: Great

text: To high of price $22.00+ wasn't worth $10.00 won't buy from them again, pizza sucked!!
