name: Tom Brennan
text: Racist delivery area policy in my opinion.

name: Blanche Bichette
text: Consistently mess up my order but they're always on time for delivery.

name: Troy Brown
text: Love ordering online.

resp.text: We see you didn't have a good experience, Bobby. Let us help. Can you please provide the email associated with the account, order number, and contact information at reviews@papajohns.com.
Thank you, Jasmine!

name: Mohammad Ghanem
text: This was my first time there. It’s little bit confusing but they helped me, so two stars for the customer service that they have. The bowl that I got was delicious and good, and that’s one more star, the store was clean and shining and that’s my fourth star. The only reason why it’s 4 stars not 5 is their prices. The prices are not too high but its just little bit too much for a bowl and fruta for 11$. But to be honest it was very food, I am coming back for sure. 🔥👍🏻

name: Charlotte Local Trends
text:
Quality, authentic açaí and fruit bowls! Great selection, with so many different options to fit every diet and taste...

The fruit is fresh and the location is excellent!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review.  We really glad you're enjoying our bowls!

name: Jessica Hernandez
text:
Frutta Bowls is my go-to in Chapel Hill so I was excited when they opened up a Midtown location here in Charlotte! I love being able to customize my bowl and choose delicious strawberries, mango, and banana. It is the perfect post-workout snack and surprisingly very filling! I always think that I can eat a bowl and go for a meal after, but I always feel full afterward! Their smoothies are always a wonderful treat if you don't want a full bowl.

It's a perfect study spot in a convenient area near Trader Joe's and Target to swing by after and grab a bowl!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your review! We appreciate your support and love serving you fresh Frutta bowls!

name: IG: AyoMaegan
text: I enjoyed my time here. At first with reading other reviews I was hesitant. But the only experience I can base things off of is my own. I went, I believe the owners were there and they were very pleasant. Took our pictures. Staff wasn’t horrible. They are young so there’s just a SLIGHT attitude but I get it. The only complaint I have is that the bowls are small for the price. I’ve had açaí bowls that are a lot bigger filled with more fruit for the same price. It tasted good though

name: Aicirt Ollitsac
text: No kids menu. Cashier wasn’t pleasant. They were out of hand sanitizer at the front and when I told cashier she just said “okay” I got the strawberry, mango and honey smoothie, it was nothing special.

resp.text: So because we don’t have kids menu , you give us 1 star review? Bless your heart.

name: NADYNE NELSON
text: I’ve been going to this location for over a year. Not only is the fruit getting skimpy.  They are still serving bad fruit. I just built my own bowl with strawberries that were bad. Again

resp.text: Please come back we’ll make you a new bowl! Sorry for any inconvenience

name: Aka Alias
text: If  I could give zero stars I would. I walked in today to get a smoothie on 7/22/ @ 1:45pm and I was the only customer in line. No one greeted me. The two boys working at the counter didn’t acknowledge me for at least 10 minutes. When they did take my order he didn’t apologize for the wait. I’ll be going to tropical smoothie from now on

resp.text: We're sorry for your bad experience, we had a lot of online orders that were getting prepped and we're sorry you had to wait more than usual.  Hope to see you again soon!

name: Rosa Jimenez
text: Check the prices before you go . The parking is a little confusing if its a busy day. The customer service is good . They make sure everything is how you want it , They ate really friendly and always have a smile on their face.

resp.text: Thank you for your business!

name: Yadira Barrera
text: Bad service. The hours say closed at 7 pm. But I arrived at 6 50 pm. The lady was cleaning the floors and says the store is close come back tomorrow. Please change hours or change the way to treat the customers. And lock the doors. So upset. Just take 5 minutes to make a customer happy. 😞😣

resp.text: 100% agree.  Sorry for any inconvenience, come back and get a free bowl on us!

name: Meredith Deem
text: I made an order through Uber. I paid extra for certain toppings and items that I didn’t receive and also it is not stated that every bowl has bananas which I am allergic to. When I called in the girl just kept telling me to come back in and was talking to a man over top of me talking and stated that they gave me someone else’s order. The man in the back was saying “who is that calling now complaining.” I will not give them my business again. How unorganized and rude

resp.text: I’m sorry but our menu states exactly what’s in every bowl. Please read it carefully.  And yes someone complained about not getting their extra toppings right before you when they DIDNT pay for it, So IM sorry if you your bowl was wrong. We’ll gladly fix it for you

name: Billy Howell
text: Amazing fruit bowls. I got the frutella bowl with peanut butter and Nutella on top. It was amazing. Fruit was fresh and the guy was so nice. It’s a little pricey but for what you get, worth it. Definitely going back soon!

name: Minna Townsend
text: Delicious you hear me!! 😂 lol! So healthy, and many varieties of options. I ate the power bowl there and it was really good I ordered one to go !

resp.text: Thank you so much for coming in and give us a try!! We can’t wait to see you again

name: Carol Rego
text: Wasn't feeling too hot today, so wanted something packed with vitamin C. I ordered a build your own bowl through DoorDash. The unsweetened açaí pairs nicely with the almond butter and any fruit. I wish granola wasn't a mandatory option on DoorDash. I would have rather had a different topping. The small bowl is $10, which is a bit pricey, but it's a good amount.

resp.text: Thank you Carol for your review! Just so you know it’s not mandatory to have granola, we can add any other toppings you like.

name: Cory Beck
text: Quality food with service to match. Everything was tasty and the people were amazing. I highly recommend them!

name: Darrius McClure
text: Awesome place! The Bermuda Bowl is my favorite.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your business!! You should give Jamaica bowl a try ;)

name: Dilora Obi
text: I love going to this place every time! But the last time, I got the Valentine bowl, it was very watery, and it was rushed, so I didn't enjoy it.  The chocolate was all over the fruits and it ruined to look, and didn't look too appetizing. :(

resp.text: Sorry to hear that, come inand let us know next time so we'll remake you one! 😀

name: Christy Price
text: My experience at Frutta bowl wasn't to great, one of the employees was preparing bowls, answering the phone, and taking money and not one time did he stop to change his gloves. That was very unsanitary. I dont think I'm going back because if you doing that in front of customers just imagine what's going on in the back.

resp.text: We’re sorry this even happened, we’ll talk about this more with our employee.  Please come in again and have a free bowl on us!

name: Derek B
text: Great food and service

name: Emily Sorokes
text: I had an amazing experience at Artisan's Palate on a Saturday evening. The food was perfect. Everything was plated beautifully, cocktails were very tasty, and the menu had lots of great options. The indoor and outdoor areas were both really nice. I sat outside to be extra covid safe and each table had a fire pit next to it. There was also a basket of blankets for guests to use as well. Just very thought-out details that made for a great evening.

resp.text: We try our hardest to make everyone feel safe in our space, so thank you for this thoughtful review! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Angelica Srivoraphan
text: Love this place so much! Enjoyed a great dinner outside, they had plenty of heaters for the winter weather. Amazing cocktails - especially if you enjoy whisk(e)y but have a wide variety. Loved the empanadas and highly recommend. Great place to share a lot of different plates and try different foods.

resp.text: Thanks! We always recommend to try out our sharable plates with friends. Glad you liked it!

name: Courtney Varnum
text: Great for a date night! We love their small plates and wide tequila selection!

name: Joe Milito
text: Great place, throughly enjoyable time and well worth the detour

name: Irena Eats
text: Finally got around to checking this place out and I loved it! I got to sit outside on a really nice night while live music was playing!

resp.text: We are glad that you enjoyed your time here!

name: Sarah Watson
text: Love this place. Beautiful ambiance and amazing staff. Forward-thinking structure and casually breath-taking presentation make this place a go-to spot for brunch, cocktails, a relaxing glass of wine on either patio, or morning coffee. Definitely will be coming back!

resp.text: Thank you so much.  We can't wait to see you again!

name: Sarah Morton
text: Great spot for any time of day and any day of the week!  The service, atmosphere, food and drinks all get 5 stars from me.  Love the featured art and live music on the weekends.  A new favorite spot of mine.

resp.text: Thanks Sarah!  We are so glad you enjoy the art part of our place.  We love it too!

name: Chris Guella
text: Such a nice place. With the garage door up.... Safe. Great food. Today I had a breakfast sandwich. Chai tea was good.

resp.text: Thank you Chris.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Amanda Lee
text: This place is awesome and unique for a date night. The drinks are interesting, and there is a lot to do and see even in the intimate space. The small art gallery is lovely to walk through, and the porch is cozy and well shaded for even a comfortable summer night. There is also a fun game to play behind the bar. The TV displays famous pieces of art and then displays the name. It's a good bit of competition to see who can identify the most pieces.

resp.text: Yes.  We feel an art trivia night in the future....??

name: Stephen Hess
text: Really good addition to the area.  I've only tried them for breakfast / brunch.  Bacon wrapped figs were really good.

resp.text: Thanks for coming by! The Bacon Wrapped Dates are our favorite, too.

name: Craig Richards
text:
This restaurant is a must!  Don’t think about it - just Van Gogh.

All kidding aside, this is one of our favorites in all of Charlotte. The food is fabulous, the people fantastic.  Outdoor dining that will allow you to enjoy the food and the people while giving Covid the finger.

resp.text: Thanks, Craig! We are happy that you got to enjoy our outside seating. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Dilora Obi
text: Very delicious food!!! I love the beautiful scenery inside the restaurant so relaxing and calm!!!

resp.text: Thanks for coming by!

name: Devon Choltus
text: New favorite cafe. Barista is the sweetest ever and the oat milk latte was to absolutely die for! Great study spot but only if you have earphones. Indoor music is a tad loud for deep focused studying. Aesthetic is on point too.

resp.text: We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us.  Thank you for the great review.  And for the feedback on the music.  We are working on our acoustics in our space because we have such high ceilings.  It helps to know what people think.  Thanks again.  Come back and see us soon!

name: Shawn Woods
text: Food is creative and delicious! Underrated cocktail spot

resp.text: Thanks, Shawn!

name: Celeste De La Rosa
text: Love all the art.  Food was delicious. Staff is super friendly. Will definitely be back!

resp.text: We love having the art in our space. We get to look at beautiful creations every day!  Thank you for coming by and appreciating it too.

name: Alex Klaus
text: Enjoyed this place. Nice industrial / modern look, big open space that can be opened up to parking lot with nice weather, nice (tapas style) menu selection, and friendly staff.

resp.text: Thank you so much.  We look forward to seeing you again.

name: Jason Baker
text: Walked in before dinner service and what did they do? Shared their staff “family meal” with me. I also had coffee and later a couple glasses of wine that were well prepared and perfectly paired perspectively. Great service! The small plate menu and cheese menu looks incredible. Can’t wait to go back!

resp.text: We were happy to share our family meal with you! See you soon!

name: Jeff Pete
text: Such an amazing space and concept. Awesome coffee and pastries to start the morning! Recently visited for dinner with some friends, and Christa (the owner) did not disappoint! She has put together a fantastic craft cocktail program and dinner was fabulous! They also have an art gallery featuring local artists. We will definitely be returning, time and time again.

resp.text: We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us.  And we know we're lucky to have customers like you. We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Cheers!

name: Alex Williams
text: Been here several times now and it's easily my new favorite coffee shop in and around CLT. They also serve small plates and a handful of beers and whiskey. All of this is reasonably priced in comparison to other places in Charlotte. I've seen a very good mix of people come through here: old, young, rich, poor, and all races and ethnic groups. The staff has always been friendly and approachable.

resp.text: Thanks, Alex! Next time you come by, be sure to try our house-made Fig Infused Bourbon! We think you'd like it.

name: Michael
text: Better than average coffees, in house baked goods, and drinks galore. The decor is open and fresh, and quite artsy.  They have a gallery in the back corner for artists and to show their goods and it changes frequently.  The art is for sale as well as prints of the same.  My favorite part was at the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.  Also, there is an indoor and outdoor section and they have small plates available.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great review.  We strive to help local artists in Charlotte, so thank you for making that part of your review.  We are so grateful for customers like you.  Come back and see us soon!

name: Travis Browning
text: Coffee spot with some baked good items. Kitchen is open for brunch and weekend small plates. Service was great. The last star was not awarded because I felt they were still trying to determine how they fit in the community. Currently, the approach feels like it is trying to over appeal to the counter culture taking away from it's authenticity.

resp.text: We do appreciate feedback and hope that we can always make things better.  Thank you for taking the time to write this review.  We hope to see you again soon.

name: mark dixon
text: Such a marvelous experience with great wines for the evening and awesome coffees for the next morning to wake me up! Oh, and the pastries and small plates oh my God…

resp.text: Thank you, Mark!

name: Anthony Combs
text: Enjoyed vegan empanadas! They have great small & shared plates.

resp.text: We are glad you enjoyed the empanadas! Hope to see you again soon, thanks!

name: kristian s
text: Cant wait for this place to open back up. Personally I feel that everything from the coffee to the food is superior to what the other coffee shops in Noda have to offer.

resp.text: We are happy to be back open and ready to serve NoDa. Thanks for the review, see you soon!

name: Inna K
text: Amazing service!! Very nice and friendly environment.

resp.text: We are happy that you enjoyed your visit! Thanks so much Elena.

name: Rodney B.
text: Very cool place! Cant wait to visit there again!

resp.text: Thanks, Rodney! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Patrick Argast
text: Not enforcing masks + one person taking orders when they are busy means waiting 20 minutes. Not the best system.

resp.text:
We're sorry about your experience.  We have signs everywhere asking people to wear masks.  And we certainly do our best to make sure everyone is wearing a mask as well as providing sanitizer and signs about mask wearing at every single table.  Post-covid comes with a lot of challenges including figuring out our busier times, in this case we were short-staffed, so we ask for patience as we did hurry to get everyone's order in and served.
That is no excuse of course, and we certainly will strive to do better.

name: Joseph Byrum
text: Love the owner and employees, thanks for letting us have DragQueen Bingo there. You rock !!!

resp.text: We love you too, and Drag Bingo! Hopefully we can do it again soon.

name: Alayna Bolyard
text: Great matcha! 🍵

resp.text: Glad you like it, thanks for the review!

name: Diana Posillico
text: What a unique place...I absolutely love it here❣ If u r looking for a great place to get a coffee and chill this is it. The price was super reasonable too!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback!

name: Saveh Ghazal
text: Awsome place as usual everything in the noda area is top notch

resp.text: We're thankful to be a part of the NoDa neighborhood. Thanks for taking the time to review!

name: Charlie Britger
text: I heard this establishment recently opened and thought to check it . It has everything I expected and then some. I decided to have a Matcha Green Tea Latte.It was very tasty ! After I had my tea, I had an opportunity to meet the a friend employed there and met the owner. They were very pleasent and cheerful. text:
I order from this location at least once a week. consistently fast, accurate and friendly. I once placed an order one the app, not realizing it was about 8 minutes before they closed.. they tried to contact me by calling a few times (which I didn't see bc my phone was on silent as usual, in another room) so I had no idea.. I only notice the missed calls as I'm trying to check in via the app once I get there .. at this point it's 45 minutes past closing, all the lights are off except the fridge light inside... The guy working came and unlocked the door and said" kindof figured it was you"  as he walked back to retrieve my order. They had still  made it,  kept it warm while closing down the store and then waited on me to get there to grab it. I apologized , paid cash and included a sizeable tip..

Above and beyond. Amazing service and pizza.

THE SINGLE BEST DOMINOS THAT EXISTS.  Not only in Charlotte, but in all of the UNITED STATES. (Ive ordered from my fair share of dominos all across the US)

name: Ryan Blalock
text:
When ordering online there are no prices until the item is in the cart.  That is frustrating.

I had a $5 off a large pizza at regular price coupon, that we got from a Boy Scout fundraiser.  I purchased an XL pizza, not realizing that the coupon said "large."   The guy at the check out said that since I purchased an XL I couldn't use the coupon.  Basically, I purchased too much pizza to use the coupon.  If I had purchased a small or medium, I would understand.  However, I find it extremely poor customer services to not honor the discount for purchasing too much pizza.

The pizza was decent.

name: The Woods Online
text:
Placed an order to my work location for a future time to be delivered (over an hour in the future) at 6:15pm. Order was delivered at 7pm, end of my lunch break. No fork to east the salad with. Delivery guy said he was late because he had to deliver on the other end of the road (less than mile down the road). I asked why he passed my location to go make that delivery first when mine was scheduled for a delivery. He didn't have an answer. Called store to complain. Manager said he didn't know why the delivery person did that. He offered to give a credit of most of what it cost me, but I had to order from the phone I was calling from, my cell phone.

Fast forward over a month. It's Sunday afternoon. Calling to place an order and no one is picking up the phone. Have called 3 separate times and sat for 10 minutes each time. I know its sunday and football is on tv, but you can at least answer the phone with a human being asking to hold. I've been listening to nothing but the same annoying ad over and over.

name: Antoinette
text: This is a great place to have karaoke and have a great time with your friends and family. The staff is friendly and the guests here have such a positive outlook. This is one of the few places I've visited where everyone is having a great time. I recommend this place if you want to do karaoke with your friend, family, or a place to gather to host a party. You will not be disappointed.

name: Steph R
text: Hole in the wall place but totally worth it! Pricing was good. The hot pot was awesome plenty of greens and seafood could've had a lil bit more meat tho...we tried all sorts of stuff off the menu and it was all really good except for the clam/oyster salad?(I don't remember). Even the owners checked on us. They have private karaoke rooms too. Everyone was super nice

name: W. Daniel Lee
text: I used to go to this location when it was called Amber's. It closed for a while and I'm glad to see it back. They have some nice food options to go with the good ol karaoke and a common area in the front where you can also come up and sing. I had a great time and I'll be back.

name: John Harvey
text: Awesome food. Good grilled clams.

name: Ric Ya
text: Food is great. Price is nice.

name: Jonathan Borkowski
text: This place does not exist.

text: Love this place.. Good service even better food!! Great drinks too!!

text: Not the Best Service. I order a cocktel shrimp and popusas. Popusas were good my cocktel never came until I brought it up to the server who was not very attentive to begin with and when it came I should have taken it as sign not to order the shrimp cocktel because the shrimp were chewy, tasteless and the sauce not what I expected. Music and chips was the best !!!

name: fletcher jones
text: Very fresh menu. Authentic healthy fresh Mexican food. Highly recommended.

name: AISS LLC
text: Came at 22:30 staff refused to serve food because their kitchen closed 5 min ago. Ridiculous, especially that I always left good tips and left a lot of money here on their food and drinks as well. Very disappointed with service.

name: Amy Vinson
text: This restaurant was pretty good. The interior has been remodeled extensively as this location used to be a different restaurant. Very clean and festive. The wait staff are friendly and helpful. The food was great and the prices affordable. Wide variety of beers to choose from, small wine list, and a good selection of cocktails to choose from. They do offer dessert also.

name: Chris Vejar
text: The cake was past due that they served my brother for his birthday. They were put of ketchup and we kept having to have them give us the ketchup packets. Seemed a little disorganized.

name: Jesus Salazar
text: Delicious Seafood

name: Robert Tanner
text: Great food.. I had shrimp and it was delicious.. My server was gorgeous and polite..

name: salmex
text: I was told the wrong price for the wrong menu item, since it was lobster tail it was at market price. When my food arrived it was way more then what was described to me, no salad like what I was told either, the waiter appeared to be trying his best but didn't quite know the menu. No compensation was offered other than bringing me a side salad. The rice was not what I expected. Will be trying again because maybe it was because they were in grand opening mode. My son liked the caldo de res though.

name: Viviana Sanchez
text: The service is great and super nice! I also enjoy going on fridays so see a amazing singer!!

name: ocean valdez
text: amazing people. great food. and live music. ita an amazing envirement.

name: Kiron Johnson
text:
The service was terrible. After our order was taken, no one came to check on us-- do we need more chips and salsa, do we need more drinks?!?! Nope-- they didnt care! When our order finally arrived, it wasnt even what  we ordered!  We never received our appetizers. When I asked for a manager it took over 10 minutes for him to arrive-- why you ask?! He was sitting at the table beside us talking to two ladies!!

He offered my husband and I beer for the terrible service,  we declined, asking for the check instead.

Suffice it to say we will NEVER eat here again.

text: The staff was great and the food was amazing!

name: Gean C
text: Willis was amazing! The guy was taking care of 8 customers all by himself! Store was neat and tidy, social distancing was on point. Best UPS I've been to!

name: Lee Jock
text:
I never thought I would live to see the day when UPS has better customer service than Amazon.  That day has finally arrived thanks to Willis!

On several occasions, Willis has gone above and beyond when Amazon has sent me the wrong return label.  Today, they sent me a label requiring me to bring my own box.  Willis was kind enough to explain this to me and saved me money by allowing me box this item myself.

When shipping my personal items, I have consistently chosen this location over thePost Office because Willis is friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable.  He goes the extra mile for anyone who walks through the front door.

name: Jacob Beeson
text: Come on UPS, staff appropriately! The man behind the counter was extremely nice and helpful, but there was one of him and like 15 customers. He was very quick and diligent but one man can only do so much.

name: Janna Stokes
text: Let me tell you about this location and their wonderful employee!! I have been here twice this week and each time is just a breath of fresh air. On Monday when I arrived there were several people ahead of me and a few people walked in behind me. Willis spoke to each of us and helped us ALL out in about 10 mins if not less. I have never had such a positive experience in ANY other UPS. Willis you are a great employee and a gift from God.

name: Samantha Gampel
text: I go to this UPS store just for Willis. There was a long line, but Willis kept it moving. He was efficient and more important he was friendly and provided excellent customer service throughout. Multi-tasking at it's absolute finest. If you ever need to go to the UPS store, go to the one on University just for Willis, as he always has the customers' best interests at heart and always has a smile on his face. Give Willis a raise!

name: Sherer
text: Had an online print order to pick up super fast service done before the time even stated. Willis the associate behind the desk though alone was superman. Phone ringing off the hook, line in front of him but he was the nicest most calm and collected guy ever taking care of business multitasking. Super polite and making sure to wish everyone a great day.

name: Tisha Pink
text: Horrible & they charge $4 to print ur label. Taking advantage of A difficult situation because the libraries are closed and they know alot of us don't have printers. This location is also, always packed & unorganized. It takes 45 mins to get in & out because only 1 employee is working. I sense alot of greed from the Indian guy who seems to be the manager 👎🏾👎🏾👎🏾👎🏾👎🏾

name: Megan Amberly
text: Horrible management! Willis refused service to paying customers because of nationality and then proceeded to get louder and ruder with me when I asked for a customer service number. He just kept saying "I am the manager" he obviously is on some type of power Trip and should not be in a management position. No wonder he is always working alone as all these other reviews commend him for. He's clearly difficult to work with and doesn't want fellow employees to see his racist behavior and how he truly acts in "HIS" store

name: Robbie Akhere
text: The Manager Ankur Patel is a caring manager. I saw how he treated everyone, even as it was very busy. My best choice.

name: Chris Martin
text: I came at a very busy time. The line was out the door and Willis was the only one behind the counter. I want to commend him for how hard he worked to get everyone taken care of. This guy is a master of multitasking while maintaining a great attitude. I will definitely come back to this UPS because of Willis's professionalism.

name: Benjamin Reyes
text: I asked for printing with card stock and was quoted a price, less than 10 minutes later they wanted to charge me 25% more than the quoted price. Management solution? Sorry the employee was incorrect. Sounds like bait and switch to me. Folks, just be careful and get it in writing.

name: Bunny
text:
The manager Ankur Patel is terrible at customer service and rude! Don’t expect to be treated fairly here and they don’t help you with your incorrectly printed order either (even though it was their fault!!) complete waste of time and money. You’re better off going somewhere else to get your prints done.

Only one cashier was nice (he was an older African American man). Now that guy is helpful (he helped me the first time)! It’s sad because my second visit was terrible.

name: Angela Greene Parks
text: The place closed at 2.17 the owner said he reviewed the tape. Here are photos and the door was locked.

name: T Sal
text: We paid over 100s of dollars for a 3 month personal mailbox here since Jan. It is now march, I have yet to see my wife's mail. The worker claims his supervisor is the one assigning mail. I don't know if a refund will be issued but I will not use personal mailbox here again. Area looks too small and cramp that our gov mail, checks or anything that's priority would probably get lost.

name: Shante Phillips
text: I use this site quite often, when I learned that both Ashley's were leaving I wondered how service would turn out. There have been a couple of customer service personnel sense then maybe 6 months ago that were frustrated with the work load one of them seem to only want as much business pass through as quick as possible not concerned with slip ups. I came in today, 6/1/19, there was a new manager in place by the name of Willis, as I stood in line I watched his job performance, just as the Ashley's when they were here. This fellow took command and in the process had a conversation with a customer who was apparently trying to transfer a title but needed all parties present as well. Willis politely stood his ground and explained I cannot compromise my seal both parties need to be here. The atmosphere was pleasant Willis was in control and getting things done in a timely manner. Yes the lines can be long but it is to be expected, we can all make room for improvement. Most of the time there is only 1 person in the store and I must admitt we all at some point or another are going to have to wait on something, the things that we don't mind waiting on we never have a complaint. When your in a business doing business it's important that you make sure you set aside the time to get your business taken care of properly, sometimes you have start earlier when you know that your time is short. Thank you Willis!

name: Rick Herring
text: Willis is absolutely Spectacular !!! I've been in customer service for over 30 years and was extremely impressed by the way that Willis was able to handle a very difficult customers multiple changes with his order as well as engage with the customers that were waiting in line and answer the phone all while maintaining a calm professional demenuor.           Nice job Willis!!!!

name: Fred Anderson
text: Not the worst UPS Store but far from the best. Prices are higher than some of the others. Manager not very friendly

name: Summer Knight
text: Owner is very Rude. Mr. Willis offered to help and the owner told him to make me wait. If it wasn’t for finger printing for a job I would not give this place any business.

name: Grace Trimble
text: I went there to get paperwork notarized and scanned and emailed. The woman working at the time was all alone. The line was long but she multitasked really well and I was in and out of there faster than I imagined. Not to mention the notarizing and extra stuff was free. I had a great experience.

name: Tonya Belger
text: Willis is amazing. Knowledgeable, professional, caring.

name: Tyler Harris
text: Very helpful staff! I went first thing in the morning and the girl up front was nice, understanding and efficient. Thank you for helping me out of my bind.

name: Joseph
text: Great service. This is one of the better UPS stores in the area especially from the one up on WT Harris. The employees make it super easy to drop off packages and are very nice.

name: Raymone Byrd
text: Every time I am here. The young clerk is way too slow. He’s too timid and afraid to tactfully tell people things they don’t want to hear.

name: Lawrence Callis
text: Can be pricey but dependable.

name: kepstein8888
text:
We went to this UPS store the morning of August 20 to have some basic mortgage documents notarized.  The girl at the counter, who claimed to be a long-time notary, said she had never seen such documents before, and could not notarize them because she could not confirm the dollar amount of the sale.

Speaking to our lawyer and some qualified notaries (one of which processed our paperwork at a major bank that day with no problem), we confirmed that validating the content of a document is not within a notary's responsibilities.

Furthermore, her behavior was dismissive and rather odd.  For example, when she first looked at the documents, she insisted quite bluntly and impatiently that we point her directly to the notary signature section, showing absolutely no interest in the rest of the document.  Yet a few seconds later, she had refused to help us due to the content of the document that she had previously shown no interest in.  Based on this, we suspect that she was not a very good notary, or worse, not a notary at all.

Buyer please beware, especially if you are dealing with sensitive documents.

name: Suchi Narla
text: Best UPS store I have been to. Everyone is very friendly and so helpful.

name: Can Yapan
text: Mails are returning or getting lost, it is not as good as I expected. They give you a 3 digit number that you must add to your mailbox address like #XYZ but most providers do not accept things like these. Not a good mailbox option.

name: zixuan
text:
just the UNC charlotte's store is open
This store is weird
Why Sunday and Saturday is permantley closed?

resp.text:
Hello Zixuan,

Our Advertised Business Hours are...

Mon	8:30 AM	to	7:00 PM
Tue	8:30 AM	to	7:00 PM
Wed	8:30 AM	to	7:00 PM
Thu	8:30 AM	to	7:00 PM
Fri	8:30 AM	to	7:00 PM
Sat	9:00 AM	to	2:30 PM
Sun	Closed

We were open Saturday as usual till 2.30, in fact we were there till 3.00 pm. If you came after hours or on a Sunday we would be closed per our published business hours. Hopefully we can help you during our normal business hours!

name: Andrew W
text: Rude, won't let us choose anything. I've shipped plenty of things before and they talked to us like were stupid. I understand its the holidays, but if your customer knows what they want, give it to them.

name: Corey Bates
text: The owner is great and works hard for every customer. A true example of customer service.

name: Josie Peplinski
text: Amazing and quick

name: Girish PS
text: Friendly staff. I was in and out in under a minute

resp.text: Hello Girish, Thanks so much for your consideration, it means a lot to us, we will continue to provide our world class customer service!

name: Tony Sumabat
text: Do not use this store. They make up reasons not to assist you.
Wait time SUCKS!!!!!! Overpriced, and long circuitous lines.

name: flamingosrule
text: Great food great service  ... I was very impressed

name: Javon Barbour
text:
Food was hot, and ready. Location is within walking distance to my home. When I got home, the food was still hot. The quality of food was real good. The General with regualr lo mein was delicioso. Nice kick to the General. Excelente!! The chicken and rice, nice crisp breading and juicy chicken, slight spice to the rice. Well done!!! Price was well expected for two meals.
Thank you!!!

name: Ra Santiago
text: Great selection of dishes.  Able to call in order and it's alwats ready promptly even with specific preferences and instructions.  Not a very large dining area.  Condiments are self s serve. Ideal for pick up orders if you live nearby.

name: David Palmer
text: Best general tsos chicken hands down. Always busy! It's a shame the construction site is right out front, I always look forward to eating here!

name: Nichie [nikki] Cole
text: The food is great and service is okay. Not five star okay but good enough.

name: Natori Lawas
text: I've never had a more unpleasant experience with a restaurant than I've had with this one. I ordered food for delivery to my job and their delivery driver took an hour and a half to get me my food (They're a 5 min drive away from my workplace). Once he finally delivered my food he was extremely disrespectful and he tried to steal my change for his tip! And when I called and spoke with them about it they told me they were going to give me a credit for my food. The next day when I called they said they had no recollection of ever saying that and dismissed my issue completely. When I called again and spoke with the manager she said I couldn't even get a refund and that it "wasn't their fault." They don't need to be in the food industry if that's the kind of customer service they're going to be giving. Never ordering from this place again.

name: Mary Perry
text: Ordered from there and the food was good. Greasy, but good. One day between classes I went there with a friend and the inside of the restaurant and absolutely unappealing.  I couldn't stand to look around without being grossed out. I HAD to take the food back to school and still did not want to eat it,  but we already paid for it

name: Stephanie Hamrick
text: Meh, mediocre at best. The egg drop soup was goopy, and the egg rolls were greasy. The boyfriend was happy that his chicken and rice soup had such large pieces of chicken in it, and the wait wasn't long for takeout, but if I'd seen the health rating on the wall when I called in the order (90.5%--only half a percent away from a B is not good!), I'd have gone elsewhere.

name: Anthony Ford
text: Just had to oldest crunchiest shrimp fried rice I ever tasted. Food is overpriced and sanitation score is a 84, which you would not know because they hide it behind the iced tea can. Was very disturbed to see a sick kid running in and outta kitchen coughing playing with a garbage bag. I will never eat here again food was terrible and someone please question the sanitation score behind the tea can!

name: Philip McKenzie
text: The food was ok but the rice was not good.  The worst part was my friend found plastic in his!  The service was good except they still made him pay.

name: Cliftoné Hagler
text: I've eaten here plenty and many times over the past year and NEVER had an experience less than amazing and the food has ALWAYS been on point. Best Chinese place I've ever been to. Now, to find out where the moved to. Hmm🤔🤔

name: Lindsey Faraj
text: When we first moved to Charlotte in 2007, we couldn't get enough of this place, but the food has seemed to really go downhill lately. The sanitation rating is in the low 90's, which is quite low. Plus, 1 of the 2 owners is extremely unpleasant and should NOT be interacting with costumers, while the other owner is great!

name: Elmer Lee
text:
Food quality and service is average.

In honor of Zhang Weili's sad lost in her prized grand UFC fight, I hope you have good business in the future. Hope you have lots of good luck.

name: B B
text: Thumbs up on delivery! Thank you Emperor:)

name: X Los
text: Wonderful

name: James Dickinson
text: Not the best but it is ok

name: Sayta Martin
text: Birth hung up on me

name: robert crosier
text: It is closed

name: Cami Castillo
text: Horrible they don't even deserve any stars. Neverrrrrr againnnn!!!

name: Liz Kruckemeyer
text: Fresh veggies and flavorful sauces.

name: Angela Y
text: My go to Chinese place!

name: Justin Zirpoli
text: I feel like it used to be really good. I cannot say that now though as this meal was pretty disastrous. I know restraunts have bad days but some things you can tell are endemic. Waiter was extremely nice but messed up the entire time. Food was dry and bland. The "Cornish Hens" turned out to be some very skimpy back legs. I would have been better off ordering frog legs.  And my gf got her vegetarian dish. As it was restraints week I would never figured wed pay $200+ for just those meals  and a bottle of wine (served us the wrong one and then lost the cork).  It's not worth the price with so many good Italian places but admittedly, this does remind me of my grandparents.  So, any Italian heritage people should try it and give their support. Hopefully they are back to their old 5 star ways when you do.

name: Ernesto Faillace
text: Small and intimate. Good for romantic date. Went during Restaurant Week. Food was outstanding with tip notch service. Make sure you try the octopus appetizer.

name: Robert Allen
text: Really enjoyed this place. If you want traditional Italian this is the place. Better make reservations well ahead of time.

name: Adam Peter Shinn
text: The wife and I had a lovely first experience at Aqua E Vino. John and Andrew did an amazing job serving us and we absolutely enjoyed every course and the recommended wine. Will be back ASAP!

name: Shawn Woods
text: Food is delicious and service is amazing!

name: Tina Blundell
text: Great ladies night!

name: Kirsten Aymer
text:
WOW. Best Italian food I've had outside of Italy.
Authentic, satisfying, artistic, and delicious. The delicate hand of a well-trained culinary artist takes each guest on a journey. It was exceptional.
Bring friends, bring family, this is a restaurant that has heart and soul and we are lucky to have it!

name: Eleanor Riccardi
text: Impeccable service!!. It is the only Italian restaraunt in present time that I would give my money to. Gabrielle is a skilled artist in the kitchen!! The food is presented with ingredients only in season, so it is consistent in presentation but ever changing in offerings. If you want a true Italian experience, paired with a romantic atmosphere then give aqua e' vino a try. The servers wisk you away to a true embodiment of Italian culture and cuisine. I happen to have a few servers that I prefer first being Marco, John, Andrew and Diana. They all have followings and create an experience and quality that surpasses anything I've experienced in my time here.  It differs from any other culinary endeavor you will embark upon in Charlotte. For sure give Aqua e' Vino a try.

name: Tim Edwards
text: Such a sweet little restaurant with amazing food. Perfect for a date (went there for Valentine's day) and it was amazing. Cheese right in the middle of the room so you can watch them prepare a cheese board for you. I was thoroughly impressed and would love to go back.

name: Michael Freeland
text:
A small Italian restaurant with outstanding service and excellent wood. You definitely need a reservation.  Local owner with true Italian original food
Give them a try!

name: Josh Ehlers
text: Incredible service, food, and ambience. Highly recommended. We can't wait to go back

name: Shokoufeh Kamyab
text:
I don’t understand why this restaurant got 4star!!! Nothing is like Italian food here, people might have no idea about Italian food! We were there for dinner and the portion was funny! No tasty at all.
I have been to lots of Italian restaurants and this by far was the worse!!! If you like to waste your money on foods that taste awful, go here.

resp.text: Sorry you was so disappointed, I would like to know what do mean for Italian food? if you was looking for a restaurant making fettuccine with creamy tomato  sauce and grilled chicken like the dish you ask to my server... Well that is call Italian American restaurant, so you did  come to the wrong place.

name: John Ackerman
text: Upscale, Intimate, Limited, but Focused Menu.  Way above average Service People.  Apricot Pie is Simply the Best.  Spl Occasion spot.  Prices are Upscale too.

name: Aniello Salierno
text: A must try. Truly great and relaxing dining experience. We will be going back!

name: William Maxwell
text: Easily one of Charlotte's best restaurants. This is pure, chef driven, well executed Italian  food done really well. It's all about the food and focused table service. The restaurant space itself is not special but that does nothing to detract from the incredible food. Love the charcuterie,  it's a must order every time. The chef emerges from the kitchen to prepare special, high quality cheeses and meats. Menu changes often, dishes are unique and well executed and deserts are freshly made and wonderful. Small space so reservations recommended. Love this place!

name: Paula Reutlinger
text: The staff and menu are wonderful!!!

name: Andrew Ruthenbeck
text: Excellent atmosphere and staff, this is certainly an Italian experience you can find in Charlotte.  Limited seating so you receive a personal experience during your meal.  You need to get here for a meal!

name: Jane
text: Unbelievable experience..best Italian ever..better then NY or even in Italy. Chef  Gabrielle  is the coolest...Would come back here again and again and again  and again and again.  Highly highly recommended.

name: Peter Barr
text: Great little white table cloth Italian restaurant. Wonderful wait staff. Plus a lovely outdoor patio that is not right on a busy street.

name: Jeff Dixon
text:
Horrid place! Extremely small, only a few tables. Menu selection is extremely poor.  Deserts are 1/4 normal size. Is located in an apartment complex! I had 3 people to tell me to stay away from this place but I had to try it myself.... never again.

(Response after owners comments)

Evidently I had a lot less to say than you did.  After a month you decided to reply with such  detailed false information, I find this odd. Also extremely unprofessional, same as I found you in  person. In the future simply except the criticism or try to repair. Expressing your rude nature in a response does not help you. As I said I received multiple negative comments from others yet wanted to experience for myself and I found nothing positive. BTW I am currently in France and your restaurant in the apartment complex does not remind me of this area and yes they have full size deserts rather than the cookie samples you serve.  I hope that you take additional time to digest the negative comments and grow from them rather than continue to bounce back with your... my way is right and everyone is wrong attitude  which you also present so heavily in person.

resp.text:
Wow, how many comments did you have to say about the restaurant. Lets start off by saying that the only thing that you had eaten from our restaurant was the complimentary water and TWO baskets of bread. Yes, we are in one of the oldest shopping centers in charlotte, with apartment complexes close. But about our small size, our restaurant if very quaint and that is what our returning customers love. And our restaurant reminds people of being in southern France, or Italy. Yes, the menu is very small, but it is a seasonal menu, which means everything is made fresh. When it comes to the dolce, if you would like more than 4 ounces of sugary dessert, cheesecake factory is right down the road. By the way, when we offered the dessert, you had asked the price, and decided not to order anything. We are just wondering what from the menu you had tried, we’d love to hear your opinion!

Edited: A Response to A Response

So, yes it took me one month to respond to you, to take time to digest your negative review, that was written down after a review by your friend Diego Rivas. Yes, i have a lot of details about how you started your dinner on the patio but deciding to end your meal inside the restaurant. After your friend received a semifreddo for dessert, eating a spoonful, then sending it back. Only then did i come to your table to discuss with your party about his thoughts on my supposed “frozen”prosciutto. If anyone has any criticism I generally like to take care of my customers and have their meal on me. I would advise caution before speaking slanderous accusations towards a restaurant. Please ill be more than happy to compensate you for whatever you actually paid for to eat at this restaurant.

name: Alfonso Siano
text: Great atmosphere and absolutely amazing quality!! each dish was carefully crafted and prepared and the staff was very nice!! great experience definitely suggested!!

name: kiavash riahi
text: Dont waste your time and your money! Italian foods here are as bad as they can get.

resp.text: I’m sorry that after you finished your entire meal, sending the plate back completely clean that you were so both dissatisfied. I am curious why you both have seem to taken to social media for your girlfriend 10 minutes after you had left, and for you the night after l replied to your girlfriends review. Unfortunately, as a native born Italian, I never grew up eating grilled chicken with tomato and cream sauce. I suggest either olive garden or Maggiano the next time you guys would like to have Italian American food, instead of italian and Mediterranean.

name: Stacey Gregory
text: Service and food were both amazing

name: T. Allen
text:
We dined at Aqua e Vino last Friday with another couple. I'd heard good things about this restaurant from a client and have long wanted to try it out. So glad we finally made it. We shared two salads (ensalata caprese and a roasted beet salad) that were delicious and ample for four people. Two of us had the penne bolognese and two had pappardelle with a wild boar sauce. We all loved our dishes. I especially appreciated the fact that the penne was cooked just right - al dente! We also shared two desserts - a chocolate tart and a pistachio tart and they were wonderful as well.

We will definitely return and we might just have to try Butta la Pasta one week night.

name: Allyson Cochran
text: An unparalleled experience

name: David Grosso
text: Absolutely the only REAL Italian restaurant in town.

name: Robert Odom
text: Chef is a genius, you very seriously can't find a better place in town. This place is like a known secret!

name: Brett van Beynum
text: Good alternative to all the other sandwich places. Great selection of chicken salad, including healthy options. It's not too crowded and it's usually not difficult to find a place to sit at lunch (which is getting hard to find). The service is prompt and helpful. Good place to stop for a casual lunch. Since it is in the over street mall, they are only open for lunch on weekdays which is annoying.

name: David D'Amico
text: The food is fine despite the limited options now. While I appreciate trying to focus on one thing for efficiency's sake, a little variety to appeal to a wider audience wouldn't hurt.  In the same vein, please bring back the good cookies; the gluten-free frosted cookies taste like cardboard and paste. Keep them as an option, but bring back something that has some flavor to it.

name: Desirai Lynn
text: I also love this place and agree with the other five star reviewers! It's so delicious, great staff, and good music. It's always my first pick when I need to grab lunch.

name: Jack Arnold
text: Really good food served quick and polite. A good place to grab a bite to eat.

name: Drop Thrill
text: Almost like momma used to make!  Great chicken salad and good pimento cheese.  Quick service, casual.

name: Chris Guella
text: I really like the food. Service sometimes not that great but it's a busy lunch place.  They have also messed up order once or twice.

name: Neil
text: Very underrated restaurant in Charlotte. They have some of the best chicken salad I've ever had in a variety of different styles. I've been there over 10 times since I moved here.

name: Johnella Walker
text: My absolute favorite chicken salad spot!   The staff is so friendly and their service is on point!!   Chicken Salad Chick NEVER dissapoints!

text: Good experience, staff was nice. Chicken salad was good and filling

text: Small portions, overpriced, not good.

name: Sandip N
text:
Loved it

BuT Too much ginger and garlic , I would prefer no ginger, garlic or roasted like blaze pizza. If it can be bit spicy and no ginger garlic then I try imo I can give 5 star

Will order again

I think yellow color is coz of turmeric  Tastes better than the looks

name: Tracy Duncan
text: The pizzas were ok.  Nothing to really make me excited about going back there.   Of the "create my own" style of pizza places that I've been to,  Firenze world be #3. 2nd is Maddios & 1st is Blaze.  But have better toppings that have alot more flavor. And their pizzas are not as dry. Or if your looking for brick oven fire pizza go to Optimist Hall, Ava Pizzeria (soooooooo good🤤)!!!

name: Richard Rantz II
text: Great Pizza.. Hand stretched crust right in front of you and topped as you like. Fresh topping and great sauce. Well worth going to.

name: Thomas Kotlarz
text:
**revised review**
Our second visit was ruined by the in appropriate music, imagine me trying to explain to my seven year old why the singer wants to see her naked and why he leaves packs of rubbers in his night stand, and what hitting it means. Not a family friendly selection of music. Two songs played during our 30 minute lunch that definitely should not have been played, the other songs were okay. Management needs to screen music better if it's going to remain a family environment. My wife told me she would not be meeting me here for lunch again with our son.

**First visit**
Our first visit was great. First off the atmosphere upon entry is very welcoming, there are menus available outside and as plenty of menu boards inside, and there is tons of brand recognition around the restaurant.  Prices are reasonable and easy to understand, the staff was pleasant and respectful, easy to order and ask questions. The pizza is made directly in front of you, payment is made at the end, and it only took maybe 6 - 10 minutes from when we started our order to have a fresh hot pizza sitting in front of us. Now onto the pizza, it was amazingly good, the crust had just right amount of crisp to it, the cheese was perfect, and the toppings we had we're fresh. Jalapenos even had some heat to them, that's usually hit or miss at pizza establishments. To finalize this review, our 7 year old said:  "It was better than Brixx and he would definitely be coming back!" Haha, we are a pizza loving family.  I will likely make this a monthly lunch spot, hope to be back soon! Which brings up the question is there a loyalty program?

name: B S
text: Pizza is good! The Monterey and Firenza I have had during this locations grand opening week since proceeds go to charity. Quality ingredients but it comes out fast. It's like blaze where you see all the ingredients in front of you but toppings aren't unlimited. There is space to sit down and eat or team to go.

name: Michael Warstler
text: Absolutely amazing pizza in this area. Ingredients seemed really high quality. Every time I've been here, the staff has been pretty helpful and nice. Hopefully more locations open up!

name: Lisette Baumgardner
text: I come to this location every week and I ordered three pizzas every time I come. The staff has always been very helpful, very friendly. I'm in and out of there in no time. This is better then any pizza I have had including Frozen or Domino's or Pizza Hut. I would gladly wait whatever time it takes for me to get my pizza done. Thankfully I had never had to wait more than 8 minutes. That is why I find extremely odd some of the comments that have been made on this site. I am a frequent customer since they open last year. I have never had a bad experience nor have I ever been treated in any other manner but with the utmost respect. I highly recommend this location. If you want some really good pizza with some great customer service this is the place to go!

name: Cris Taylor
text: I'll start by saying pizza is my absolute FAVORITE food, so this review may be bias. I love the concept of Firenza, which is very much like Blaze in that you can choose from a standard pie or create your own, but their menu also includes pasta, wings and salads. Firenza has a much better crust in my opinion and they also serve wine by the bottle or glass...so there you go. The seating area in Firenza is also spacious and the service is wonderful.

name: Gina Garafola
text: I go here at least twice a week. They make a great antipasto salad. Their pizza is really good, just make sure you know what you are ordering otherwise you will pay $13 for a 14' pizza and $6.00 for 3 toppings. If Clyde I'll go back only wider. Lol. Service is great

name: Matt gorth
text: This place has great tomato sauce and really fresh toppings I like it better than blaze pizza and if you have time get their wings it takes like 20 minutes

name: CGNefarious
text: Decided to try it on a whim. I honestly wasn't expecting much, but the chipotle chicken pizza I had was phenomenal. Seriously impressed by it. The customer service was also quite good. I will definitely be going back.

name: Russ Reeves
text:
Very nice staff and very clean facility. The staff took time to listen to what we wanted and delivered on it perfectly.
There are so many options...wings, pizza, salads and more. All made to order and fresh.
This was our first visit but surely won't be our last.

name: James Koss
text: Arrived cold. Wings had no sauce. Generally feels poorly made. Definitely not worth the price or long waiting time. Very disappointed customer - will not order again.

name: Cyber Blu-ray Fanatic
text: First time ever coming here and great friendly knowledgeable staff and food was fresh and hot

name: Tyesha Brown
text: The pizza was excellent! I pulled up right when they were about to close and called to order. Even though they were cleaning and appearing to no longer be making food they were courteous and still make my pizza delicious and gave me some coupons!! I’ll definitely be back!

name: Steven Baker
text: The staff were  incredibly friendly during my visit, but didn't provide much guidance to a newbie like myself.  The tables were all dirty and the employees behind the counter were just standing around.  The pizza was good but tables were dirty and napkins not replenished.  It's similar to Blaze Pizza in that you can design your own, etc.  The pizza are a bit large for 1 person though (10").  Management needs to step up and train the employees better.  Lack of attention to detail is easy for us customers to see.

name: Skipper Pond
text:
The pizza price was reasonable.  Brought the pizza home and added spinach, reheated it.  Was very food.  My wife enjoyed her salad as well.
I'd recommend.

name: Decartus McFadden
text: Didn't care for the pizza. Pizza sauce needs work seasoning and the pizza dough can you some flavor. The sauce and dough is key to good pizza.

name: The Adams Family
text: I’m a very happy with the service I have received at this Firenza location. This was also my first time ever trying one but I must say that it has not been my last I have been back a few times since the pizza is good but the wings is what is the best thing to me. You must try the Caribbean jerk buffalo combo together awesome definitely a place I will always come to eat at a few times a month.

name: Sharryn Doss
text: It was my children and I first time in this restaurant and we didn't know what to expect. We were greeted by one of the employees that worked there by the name of Kayla and we expressed to her that it was our first time. She then provided us with information based on the food that they sell. After looking at the menu and placing our order, we went and found our table. Our food came out very efficiently and was amazingly delicious! We were then greeted by the store owner Emily who then took it upon herself to ask us, "how the food tasted?" and then came back to ask us "to sample their bacon mac and cheese" and we agreed. That was also very satisfying to our tastebuds. I would truly recommend this place. Sidenote: Their restroom is very clean, and you know what they say about restaurants having a clean restroom. I just want to say thanks to everyone who worked tonight, for providing excellent customer service.

I watched him touch door of the cooler, a knive, a spatula my food and other people food WITHOUT CHANGING HIS GLOVES... Then they got an attitude when I brought it to his attention so I just asked for a refund 🙄!!!

name: M. C.
text:
Pros: 1. Lemon pepper Wings and fries are good. The fries were freshly cooked and had a consistent golden color and were not over cooked. 2.Service good and quick.  3.Prices are reasonable.

Cons: 1. The fountain juices & lemonade are very sweet. Too sweet for my liking. Taste like pounds of sugar were mixed. While waiting for my food another customer asked for a bottle of water and she mixed it with the juice because it was very sweet.
2. The lamb gyro is okay (not much in a gyro to mess it up) but not worth going here for. Mine had 3 thin slices of gyro lamb meat and was mostly lettuce and the sauce was heavily applied. Became very messy to eat.

But they offer several delicious flavors for the wings. They have a good salad too!

text: The cashier said that he didn't speak English but didnt SEEM to have any difficulty understanding my order (he repeated everything back to me correctly but somehow it came to me wrong). He and the other crew members then stared uncomfortably at my friend and I (while joking around in Spanish) until we received our incorrect order and left. I'd return to the franchise but never this location again. I speak Spanish fluently and the jokes they were telling weren't even remotely funny or appropriate.
