Kenderick, thank you for the 5 star review. We are taking the new government guidelines very seriously. It is our job to keep our staff and community safe as we navigate through these uncharted waters. I am glad you enjoyed your recent experience.
Thank you for the 4 star review! Cheers.
Neeraj, thank you for the 5 star review! Hope to see you soon.
Thanks for leaving us a review, Marie! We're happy to hear you enjoyed your recent visit to el Thrifty Social. We hope to see you back again soon!
Thank you for the review please reach out to mike@elthriftysocial.com with more details and we will make this better.
Thanks for leaving us a review, Brett! We're happy to hear you enjoyed your recent visit to el Thrifty Social. We hope to see you back again soon!
Mike, we're sorry to hear you were disappointed with your recent experience. If you could let us know how we could improve, we would appreciate the opportunity to make it right. Thank you!

name: M Wageman
text: Excellent restaurant!!! Food is made to order and comes out hot and fresh!  Definitely worth the wait! Friendly service!

name: The Void Stares Back
text: Would have been five stars for the decor alone, but the food was so good I almost cried. 1000/10 it's my new favorite place

name: TOMMY Bryant
text: Nice little spot for some ramen. The service was ok ,the table that came in after we place our drink order ended up getting their drinks before us. The Ramen came out before the Korean Chicken wings. I thought my ramen was OK nothing to get excited about nor my wife's ramen was nothing to write home about. The Chicken wings were awesome they actually had some size to them and good flavor. I guess that's why they pride in them charging like $12 for 7. Considering the size of the Ramen and taste I felt it was over priced. This is my third ramen restaurant I've tried in the Charlotte area and so far my least favorite.

name: Dandy Mugen
text: Best korean fried chicken in Charlotte! Not too much sauce, but more of a nice glaze over the chicken. Really nice crunchy exterior too.

name: Mary-ann Howell
text:
Food is great! Wait time to get the food was way longer than I was told when I placed my order.
Note: I was going to dine in, and decided to get my order to go so I wouldn't take up a table for 4 just for myself during the dinner hour.
Definitely recommend calling your order in ahead of time.

name: Yesenia Rodriguez
text: I literally spent more than 30 min trying to call to order ahead. I got them to answer only to be hanged up on. I called again and the line was busy... I ended up arriving and, the line was open so no one could call. I stand in line 15 more minutes because the host would just walk by me and I was standing in the counter just being ignored. To top it all up, the food was cold and horrible. I asked for more sauce and the lady refused to give me some because I didn’t need it. Let me add, there was only one more costumer and me. Never coming back

name: Mary Lambert
text: Cozy but wonderful! Food is phenomenal 😋 and the servers are so sweet. An absolute must! Happy Lunar New Year!

name: britney pouch
text: Pork buns are so good and a must try. I enjoyed the ramen soup and wanna come back to try the Korean chicken. Service is friendly.

name: George Fuller
text: Best ramen I've had in NC.. Reminds me of living in Tokyo

name: Hugh Noell
text: Fantastic Ramen!  Great menu and the service was spectacular! Will recommend to anyone in that area!

name: Lacey Norful
text: Best ramen I’ve had since I left Japan, hands down!

name: Katie Thomas
text:
So nice..seems like..home..
Very nice sevice..always smile..

name: Vicenta Brown
text: Delicious! Friendly staff! Will be going back

name: David “Super Dave” Benge
text: It was just ok for the price it should've been better and more I was disappointed. And slightly sick afterwards I'm not sure why both adults in my party were. The prices are outrageous compared to similar restaurants in the area. The service was also not very good very slow and not attentive only one person working the register and handing out food from the kitchen during lunch time.

name: Mark Manning
text: Absolutely the best spot for ramen and authentic Korean fried chicken. It's honestly worth trying one of everything on the menu.

name: Mehul Shah
text: Great ramen in an unassuming location in near Matthews.

name: Christopher Murray
text: Nice local ramen shop with a small variety of ramen and Korean chicken. Broth was tasty and noodles were good. Shop is located in the same parking lot as the movie theater so that can be convenient. Price is good too. There were a few mix-ups with some of the dishes and the spice level was on the higher end of the spectrum. The do have takeout service which also seems popular.

name: Lauras Grigas
text: Ramen at it's best. Awesome 👌

name: Iron Man
text: Best korean chicken in Charlotte. Even reheating the sweet and spicy chicken in the microwave doesn't take away it's crispiness. Gam sa hab nida!

name: Riley
text: The family that runs it is really nice.

name: WrightWay Roadside Service
text: Good ramen at this establishment

name: Jessica Cooper
text: The food was amazing and the owner couldn't be nicer:)

name: Raquel S
text: Good Korean style wings and ramen. Spicy miso ramen was not super spicy. Great service!

name: Matt Hotelling
text: One of the hottest ramen spots in Charlotte! Very good service and small but nice decor and ambiance. Great pork bun appetizer, very fresh. The Shio and miso ramen was very good. Also Korean BBQ plates. Fairly busy lunch crowd. Fair prices. Will be back!

name: David Gren
text: This place has awesome ramen and really good crispy korean chicken wings

name: Sam Kim
text: Delicious Korean style wings

name: Alyson H
text: Great food! Very friendly service!

name: Jason Ouzts
text: Very good food,  great service.  I had the sweet and spicy fried chicken (mild).  Next time I'll try the spicy version.  Just a heads up; you might have a bit of wait time for the fried chicken, it's prepared fresh but definitely worth the wait!

name: Eric Tsui
text: Great atmosphere. Great food. Small menu but that was expected. Must try their wings & ramen!

name: Stephanie Park
text:
I’m happy that there’s a good Korean fried chicken + ramen plan in this area. I ordered Spicy Miso Ramen and it was good with a clean after taste. It’s not super oily and heavy like tonkotsu ramen (which they don’t have). The chashu was a bit dry and not as soft as I expected but overall it was good! It’s not as authentic as a Japanese Ramen restaurants in LA or NY but it’s decent.

Their Dak-gang-jung is really good as well and it’s great for late night snack (with beer please). It comes with sweet pickled raddish which is a traditional Korean way of eating fried chicken. Definitely a recommend.

name: Anthony Thereal
text: As someone who's enjoyed both ramen and Korean fried chicken in cities where they take Asian cuisine very seriously, like Los Angeles and Honolulu, I can say that Roppongi holds its own. Everything on the menu is absolutely delicious, the atmosphere is cozy and appropriate, and the service diligent and friendly. I would happily award more than 5 stars if possible.

name: simon stonge
text: Great spicy fried chicken wings. Got to go try them. Not too spicy, but awesome taste.

name: Andy W.
text: Good little ramen place.  The menu is a little limited, but what they have is good.  We’ve had most of the different ramen types and a variety of the appetizers and they have all been really tasty.  The only downside is the space is pretty small, so it fills up quickly.

name: Sussa Goins
text: The food is delicious and authentic,  the atmosphere is delightful and the service is top notch! So happy this place is so close to our home! We are regulars now❤

name: Sonnyson
text: We randomly looked up Japanese food in the area and this place came up. We were very surprised on how amazing this restaurant was. They have tsukumen ramen here, the only place I know in Charlotte that has this on their menu. It's a ramen where the broth is much more condensed and you dip the ramen noodles into the bowl. It amazing especially on warmer days when a hot bowl of ramen is a bit too much. Since the tsukumen is shio (salt) based, it's much lighter compared to it's contemporaries such as tonkotsu or miso. They also include those as well on it's menu. Their ramen toppings include ajisuke tamago, the flavored and slightly runny hard-boiled egg, for their ramen, which no other restaurant in Charlotte has. The ramen was also not the only thing they served, they had Korean fried chicken, both boneless and traditional, which were amazing, and you had options to make them spicy or mild. Soy garlic will always be my favorite. Definitely a recommend if you are in the area or craving japanese ramen or Korean fried chicken.

resp.text: Thanks for choosing Roppongi Ramen Bar! We’re glad to hear you enjoyed our Tsukemen Ramen and Korean Fried Chicken. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Jacob Friedman
text: When I hear people knock ramen for being basic or easy, I immediately know they haven't tried Roppongi. It's better than Futo Buta, and the best ramen in Charlotte that I've had to date. The broth is perfectly flavorful and noodles cooked very well. This is the real deal, highly recommended!

name: D Pearce
text: Really solid Ramen. Great texture from the noodles. The garlic spicy wings were Awsome! Very fast service.

name: Mie Greenberg
text: They have good ramen. This is a review by a Japanese person from Japan. The ingredients, flavor, portion size, and price ($15 with tax&tip for basic ramen) are all pretty equivalent to what you would get in Japan. The noodles had the right consistency and the soup was hot, and the wait time was under 10 minutes. It's a little pricey, but I'd go back when I want "real" ramen in Charlotte.

name: jon anderson
text:
Stopped in today for the first time, I just found out that they opened about 2 months ago! I was promptly greeted and seated. The menu is small, only about 10 menu items plus sides and apps. I got the pork gyoza which came with a shoyu dipping sauce. The dumpling skin was nice and thin and the filling tasted great!
I also had the shio ramen and the spicy garlic Korean fried chicken. The shio ramen  was a little small for the price, but the broth tasted amazing, the chashu pork was deliciously roasted, the noodles were not over done giving it a great texture. The soft boiled egg was perfectly cooked as well. The spicy garlic Korean fried chicken was amazing. The crispy breading tasted of tempura style, very light and crunchy. The glaze packed a lot of flavor, but personally not enough spice. On the table was dried garlic and an asian hot pepper spice blend to go on the ramen. Both were very aromatic and added a lot to the dish.
Overall, I would rate this as one of my favorite restaurants in the area. I definitely reccomend, and I will surely be back again real soon!

name: Alejandro A Lopez R
text: very good soups

name: Melissa S
text: Best ramen in the area. The broth has depth and is so good.

name: Brigitte B
text: Omg! This was my first time and it was so good I started dancing in my seat.

name: Danny Ng
text: The dipping ramen was amazing!! The dipping broth is salty but just enough that blend in great with the ramen. Deff recommended!!!

name: Gage Hale
text:
Just stumbled upon this place as I was waiting to see a movie. I’m so glad I went in, I love ramen and the Miso Ramen I got was delicious!

I also got the Korean Fried Chicken (Dakgangjung) which was phenomenal! This place most definitely hit the spot! I will be back soon and can see this becoming a regular spot for me, especially when going to see a movie at the Cinemark.

resp.text: Thanks for choosing Roppongi Ramen Bar! We’re glad to hear you enjoyed our Miso Ramen and Korean Fried Chicken. We look forward to your next visit!

name: Europa Jupiter
text: Although the name is ramen bar.  The ramen is so so.  But fried chicken is excellent.  I ordered spicy soy garlic favor.  It's very delicious and juicy.  Better than Bonchon.

name: Megan F
text: Fantastic ramen noodles! We ate dinner here and loved the miso pork ramen noodles--amazing spice and seasoning. It included hard boiled eggs and the pork were delicious and I loved it!! The ramen noodles were tender and I loved the flavors. The restaurant is tiny and has a few tables, so I suggest going early. The menu has reasonable prices--my ramen was around $13.00 and a generous portion. I would like to try apps next time. I think the ramen is as delicious as New York quality ramen!!   My friend had the vegetarian ramen and she liked the flavor also. Great service and friendly to us with a kiddo. No high chairs so keep that in mind. We parked in the adjacent lot, it's near the movie theater. I think weekends it must get crowded so definitely make the trip for tasty ramen!!

name: Melinda Hargett
text: O...M... Goodness! I was happy to find out a ramen place would be opening near my apartment complex but to have a yummy and delicious ramen place? Hooray for this quaint little place. The people were so friendly and the food PIPPING HOT AND GOOD! I got the Spicy Miso and the Pork Bun... 🤤🤤🤤 I am so happy the place is good. I can't wait to go back and try the Korean Fried Chicken.

name: Cassie Corcoran
text: I love the food, the ambiance and the service. That ramen was delicious and so were the wings.

name: Son Yun
text: Everything on the menu is good and reasonably priced!

name: Karen Critchfield
text: So good! The sweet and spicy Korean fried chicken is amazing, juicy, crispy and delicious. We will be back!

name: Kris Gaston
text: The Ramen was amazing....I would say best ramen in Charlotte possibly

name: F G
text: Delicious authentic ramen noodle shop

name: Victor Herrera
text: Dakgangjung chicken is the boom!!

name: Megan Gallagher
text: Id try it again, but only as take out, and probably only if i was crazing ramen. This is a small hole in the wall place serving ramen and korean fried chicken. They have 4 kinds of ramen, and 3 kinds of friend chicken. We tried the chicken family platter, which had original,  soy garlic and dakgangjung. the soy garlic was my favorite. The regular fried chicken was extra crunchy and really tender but bland. It just needed a little salt or flavor and it would be my go to. Overall the chicken was pretty good, the gyoza was meh (pork is the only flavor id consider ordering a second time). I didnt try the ramen but my friend said it was delicious. Will definitely try the ramen in the future. Inside is capitol T tiny. There are 3 bar sections that seat about 3 each, 2 tables that seat 4, 1 table that seats 8 and 2 tables that seat 2. We waited about 10 minutes to be seated at a table with 4 other people we didnt know, but sti felt like we had enough space. The menu is very small but quality over quantity i guess.  There pork bun isnt my speed. I like more traditional style and this was more of a gourmet take with a slice of pork, a slice of cucumber, some greens and a super sweet sauce instead of the stuffed sweet bun style i prefer. They have 3 types of gyoza, seaweed salad and i think one other appetizer (kimchi i think). All told i think they have less than 15 items on their menu. The fried sweet potato was really good with the chicken but the menu states it comes with cole slaw and it didnt. The dakgangjung chicken was clearly made with almonds and peanuts. One of my friends is mildly allergic to almonds, but i asked what the dusting on top was made of because it looked like more than just those two nuts sliced It looked like white shavings of something, with a texture i couldnt quite place. When our waiter asked the ched, as soon as he found out my friend was allergic to almonds he tried to deny there were almonds, which there clearly were. We were more curious about what the shavings were we couldnt figure out, but denying something like that could be really dangerous for someone with a more serious allergy....

name: Meng Lim
text: Best ramen and soy wings around

name: Raquel S
text:
Harriet’s makes a pretty burger! Branding and packaging are definitely on point at this burger place!

It’s a well made burger, definitely one of the top 5 burgers in Charlotte. The flavor of the simple sauce didn’t really come through on the burger the way it was intended so I recommend ordering extra sauce. If the bun was buttered and toasted I think it would knock this up a notch.

The fries were ok but nothing special. I did reheat them in my air fryer to get them hot and crispy again. Probably could benefit from a little more salt.

name: Hector Alvarez-Lopez
text: Arguably one of the best burgers in town. When you first bite into it, the aroma, texture, and flavor of the meat overpowers your tasebuds and you know you made a good choice. This is no ordinary ground beef, this is more like formed chopped steak. Fresh crunchy pickles compliment the tasty, tingly onions. The white cheese and simple sauce bring it home and its all held together by a soft bun that doesn't get soggy till the last bite. Paired with some crispy fries and your choice of sauces, I can honestly say this is what a real burger should taste like.

resp.text: Wow! Such kind words. Thank you for sharing your experience and we look forward to sharing many hamburgers with you in the future!

name: Tj Doane
text:
Solid smash style burger. Beats out a lot of the other spots in Charlotte. Staff is always friendly and helpful. Fastest service in Optimist hall. Their custom sodas are great as well.

Definitely my favorite spot in the hall.

resp.text: Thank you, TJ! We appreciate your kindness and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Alexander Hassan
text: I never normally write reviews unless they render one. But this is the best hamburger that I have ever had in Charlotte. The best touch of this is the note in the bag. That makes the food that much better. We have all been through a lot and I am more than happy to give Harriet's burger the support. I will be suggesting this place to all of my friends. This is officially my new favorite burger spot. Better than Pinkys!

resp.text: Thank you, Alexander! We really appreciate you sharing your experience and we truly appreciate everyone who gives us a try. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: M B
text: I would highly recommend Harriet’s hamburger. Authentic and made to order every time. Don’t be scared of the price it’s well worth it compared to other burgers in Charlotte.

resp.text: Thanks, M B!

name: Brooke Ballard
text: At Optimist Hall it’s easy to be overwhelmed with so many great choices. If you are on the fence, look no further than Harriet’s! Highly recommend the garlic rosemary sauce. Team is friendly and helpful!

resp.text: Thank you, Brooke! Love that you've found your favorite house made sauce in rosemary garlic aioli. See you again soon!

name: Rob Smith
text: After seeing the reviews, I gave this spot a try. What I like, being able to order it on the app, and the manager being super friendly. What was ok, was the meat of the burger and the fries were nothing special to write home about. What I did not like, was that the manager assured me everything was in the bag, but she forgot condiments that I had paid extra for. The other thing was the bun of the burger. If this bun was warm/fresh/off the grill soft the burger probably would have been spot on. However, I was given a burger that had a bun that did not seem fresh/super soft/warm. To me, this was just another average burger joint that was ok at best.

name: Destiny Marie
text: Burgers are good. Fries are subpar. But NEVER get a drink from here. They don't give you your drink and never contact you back when you try to get your drink replaced. We left multiple messages. This has been EVERY time we order a drink, this was NOT just a one time thing. They never give you the soda. They don't even act like they hear you when you ask for your drink as well.

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
There's been a lot of hype around Harriet's since it opened. We finally made it back to Optimist Hall to check them out.

Covid-19: I love that you can order and pay online. I love that they have an outdoor window to pick up your food at so you don't even have to go inside. Our order was ready right on time.

We got a hamburger + cheese with fries and all of the sauces. The burger was delicious. The simple sauce on it was my favorite. The fries were very good. Sauce wise I'd go with simple sauce or garlic rosemary aioli.

We wanted to get the classic our first time, but you better believe we'll be back to try the Juicy Lucy from their secret menu. We had one in Minneapolis and it was amazing!

resp.text: Thank you Jacqueline! We have that Jucy Lucy waiting for you. :)

name: Julie Stevens
text:
Another stop on our tour of finding the best burger in CLT. This did not disappoint. Very friendly service and a great meal.
I loved the simplicity of the menu. You go there to get a burger and fries, period. I got the cheeseburger and an order of fries.
The meal came in a bag beautifully marketed. The sandwich was wrapped nicely too. You could tell it wasn't just thrown together. It was beautifully done.
The first bite and every bite after was equally distributed with meat, cheese, pickles, sauces and bun. Not one bite was lacking.
And the cheese.....holy moly. I think this is probably the best hamburger cheese on the tour. So melty and so good.
The fries were just regular fries. Nothing to write home about but they were perfectly cooked and perfectly salted. So that's a win.
The burger and the fries were huge. If you aren't a huge eater, you can cut this and share it with a friend.
With this one being in Optimist Hall it was an even better experience. Such a cool place. I will be back. Can't go wrong with a Harriet's burger.

resp.text: Thank you Julie! We're sooo glad you enjoyed it. We'll see you very soon!

name: Andy Thuan
text: Harriet’s inside of Optimist Hall was pretty good. It was my first time going to it and it wasn’t anything crazy special but the burger and fries were good. The soft drinks are all natural so it’s not your average coke products. I had the black cherry and it was very tasty. The cashier that helped me was very kind so customer service was great here. I would come back next time. Also their dipping sauces are good. I had the garlic aioli for my fries.

name: Avy L
text: Super tasty. Always friendly staff. Quick service.

resp.text: Thanks, Avy! Hot + fast is the name of our game :)

name: Laura Rodriguez-Gomez
text: A completely worth it experience. This is my favorite burger place in the Charlotte are. Great service and excellent manager response!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Laura! We're honored to be your favorite and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Michael Biggs
text: Easily top 3 burger in Charlotte. If you like a good burger, go and check this place out.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: C Goodwin
text: The burgers are delicious. The patties are sized and pressed like Culver's, but not overcooked. This is a modern "limited menu" chain, so check and understand the limited options before you go. We really enjoyed ours.

resp.text: Awesome! We're glad you enjoyed it. See you again soon!

name: Sophie S
text: Really enjoyed the hamburger with cheese! I feel very well versed in hamburger and cheeseburger consumption, and although I wouldn’t put Harriet’s in my top 10, this little burger stall does not disappoint. The beef was really flavorful and well seasoned, the brioche bun is big but delicious. Super friendly staff, who offered great suggestions. I went on a Tuesday afternoon so it wasn’t very busy at the stalls. Had my meal in about 5 mins. Five stars well deserved. Will be back!

resp.text: Thanks, Sophie!

name: Adam Peter Shinn
text:
I’m sure many of you were awaiting the arrival of Famous Harriet’s Hamburgers like we were! Well... it’s here, and it’s delicious! First of all, someone needs to do a case study on their branding because it is AMAZING! Before you’ve even taken a bite, you know all about what they’re about, who they do it for, and why they do it. And the design of their menus, bags (even down to the green staples), drink cups, straws, and the overall customer experience has been given some major forethought! The burgers are great! The patties are seasoned extremely well although they are a little on the flat side of things. If it’s your first time, I would recommend trying the double, as this comes out to be the height of most single patty burgers elsewhere (and personally, a better patty to bun ratio if you ask me). Whatever sauce is on the burger is heavenly and I’m loving the pickles! The grilled red onions make for a nice crunchy finish. Finally, the fries are incredible on their own. No doubt, the branding on the fry sauce containers like the Dilly Ranch and Garlic Rosemary Aioli are cool... but I find the fries to be best on their own with no sauce. Your mileage may vary, however... but why mess with something that’s fairly close to perfection? You know? This place gets high marks and is a welcome addition to the already amazing food lineup at Optimist Hall!

- Adam from @appetiteandadventure

name: Dexter Holyfield
text: One of the best burger in charlotte! Very friendly staff with fast and fresh food.

resp.text: Thank you Dexter! We’re glad you enjoyed it. See you again soon :)

name: Joel Ferris
text:
Average burgers. The place begs to be compared to Ace No. 3 that is not far away, and Ace knocks Harriet's out of the water. The patty, the bun, the sauce, and the fries are all better at Ace. Brooks down the road would be better yet if you're hungry at lunch.

Hey, the concept of no frills old fashion burgers done well is a great concept. You can tell Harriet's is a lot of good intentions that just didn't come out as well as they should.

name: Zubair Khan
text: Juicy, cheesy, and delicious burgers. I get the triple burger with extra cheese. This is one hell of a burger, all though it is expensive, I got 3 triple burgers for $40, way to expensive for burgers. But taste wise this place is worth trying. One burger is like $13.

resp.text: Thank you for trying us out Zubair. We are soo glad you enjoyed it!

name: James Webb
text:
Harriet’s has great burgers, fries, and sauces! Branding and packaging are cute, too. Some friends recommended I try the double patty for a “better” burger to bun ratio...Glad I did! My wife opted for the single patty/no onion and was equally as happy.

The burger as it comes isn’t the most common combination of toppings - but it’s unique and exactly what I was hoping for. Everything balances out nicely and I’d put it in the comfort food category.

I read some reviews complaining about price or comparing Harriets to Ace #3... couple thoughts: Optimist Hall is fairly expensive for what you get, but you’re paying for the accessibility and ambience. And you should know that going in. I don’t think $9 for a quality burger is crazy - you’d pay more at a restaurant. As far as Ace, I think Ace is slightly better but I think that’s because it’s a more traditional take on a burger. Ace is definitely greasier - which I don’t always appreciate.

The fries and sauces at Harriets are definitely better than Ace. Try both, debate among friends, and keep supporting both!! Harriet’s is locally owned by the same folks that run Papi Queso - so if you love Papi Queso give Harriet’s some love too.

resp.text: Thank you, James! Glad you noticed the quality and cleanness of our hamburger (all natural beef, artisanal cheese and buns, housemade sauces). Your kind words go a long way in our book. Look forward to sharing more hamburgers and happiness with you in the future!

name: Wonkavator 33
text: Wow! Had cheeseburger and fries last nt. at Optimist Hall. Incredible all around. Expectations exceeded.

resp.text: Thanks! We love exceeding expectations :) Thanks for sharing your experience!

name: Alejandro Corredor
text: The brioche bun is too sweet for me. Ingredients seemed to be of good quality. I wish the burgers had more flavor overall. Great customer service.

name: Ethan Adams
text: Great service, really good food. The location is fantastic with the other options of venue as well with it being in Optimist Hall. Will need to check it out again to assess whether they deserve higher

resp.text: Thank you! We can't wait to hear how your next visit goes. :)

name: Summer Cook
text: There was a lot of hype surrounding the opening of Harriet’s Hamburgers at Optimist Hall so I expected to be completely wowed on my first visit. I was disappointed when the food was average at best. The burger itself was pretty bland but had decent bun. Pricing also felt too high for the patty and quality. They nailed their marketing strategy but missed on the burger.

name: Carol Rego
text: Great tasting hamburger! However, deducted a star due to issues pulling up my rewards, which could have been handled better from a customer service stand point.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting Harriet's. Everyday we aim for the best guest experience possible and we hope to see you again really soon!

name: gary adcock
text: Wheres the beef?  Yes too little grub for the money....will not take my cash...I love the old building....not many customers here tomight...hope they make it. However I'm going to Brooks down the street....2 burgers for less than one here

name: Kenneth “Rudy” Glenn
text:
Exceptionally average. Go to Ace if you want a burger, go to Papi Queso if you want a tasty sandwich in Optimist Hall. Harriet's ain't it.

Presentation: 5/5
Flavor: 1/5

Burger: Coming in at $12 for a double with cheese, Harriet's misses the mark. The bun is good, but the meat is flavorless and really overwhelmed by the cheese. The cheese is by far the best part, which isn't a good thing when talking about a burger. If I can find the brioche, I can actually make this at home; there was none of that crispy carmelization I expected. The only toppings were onions and pickles. It wasn't "bad"...but it also wasn't good.

Fries: The texture was great, but the taste was non-existent. Think Burger King style, but with a low salt Wendy's taste. The ketchup container was awkwardly tall for dipping, but also not ideal for pouring out. Also wasn't "bad", but not a flavor I would ever crave.

I guess it's cool to have a burger joint in Optimist Hall, but I expected much more from Papi Queso, as everything on their menu is full of unique, balanced flavors. Rosemary Fries > Harriet's fries. Why not do a pepper or seasoned salt fry? It seems like branding and speed were the key objectives, and the result is a fast food burger rather than a diner style. For $15 (before tax), they'll need to change some things to get me to eat there again.

name: S
text: Had their hamburger during their July 1 promo. It was extremely delicious. Idk what’s in their signature sauce but it’s tasty. Can’t wait for them to fully open.

name: Jason Gregg
text: Way too many good burgers around town that don't cost $8.  Mine from here was dry, sauce on it was ok.  Sub par for the price.

name: Kamil ruşen
text: Perfect burger and custumer service 👌👍👌👌👋

resp.text: Awesome! Thank you. We’re glad you enjoyed it. See you again soon.

name: Patrick Willock
text: Great food

resp.text: Simple, to the point. Like a good hamburger :) Thank you!

name: Jim Rasmussen
text: Perfect.

resp.text: Simple but good. Thank you

name: Bella Noir Rose (Rareblackrose)
text: Delicious

resp.text: Thank you! :)

name: Katie Baker Webb
text: Yum

resp.text: Thank you :)

name: Jeff Rickert
text: Delicious burger! I got the Royale, and it had all the best flavors of a summertime cookout, just as advertised!

resp.text: Thank you! :)

name: Raquel S
text:
Beautiful space but food lacks the flavor punch that Superica is known for. Just adding a bit more salt to everything would go a long way.

I've eaten at the South End location many times so I was expecting the same quality today.

Service was good and there is plenty of parking. This location has lunch service only on Fridays btw.

name: Rick Mclemore
text: Good food means long lines .. big suggestion get there early or make a reservation.. the shrimp  is some of the best in charlotte.. really big and lots of flavor.. the sauces are very good but could be a little hotter for my taste.. the service  is top notch  and quick to make your visit  a pleasant one.. they are on top of things like waiting for you to finish a appetizer before they bring anything else.. Savannah was our waitress  and did a outstanding job.. we will be coming back in the future ..

name: Mary Frances Parker
text: So glad to have this addition to the neighborhood. The food is really great but the service is slow and we have had some very grouchy wait staff. Drinks are good but they have been out of frozen margaritas twice. Food is worth it you just need to be willing to wait a while.

name: Stella H
text: I wish they were open for brunch! Had a great server (I think her name was Kim). Chili relleno had an excellent flavor. Loved the vibe.

name: Andy Thuan
text: I’ve been to the Southend Superica location before, but the Strawberry Hill location is my new favorite. My wife and I wanted to give it a try since we are closer to it and it did not disappoint at all. The restaurant atmosphere is great, decorated well and very spacious. The food and drinks are always good here. I always enjoy the OG margarita here. Definitely will return back here. They also offer brunch here too.

name: Logan Andres
text: After two visits Superica is officially our new favorite tex-mex place. The plates are unique; not anything you will get somewhere else. The ribs are a hidden gem you gotta try!

resp.text: Thank you so much Logan! Can’t wait to have you guys back in!

name: Catherine Holwager
text: What a great spot. Great food. Great service! Cool joint.

resp.text: Thank you Catherine! We so appreciate the compliment :)

name: Amy Everett
text: Food was delish.... the wait time was horrible.  Bar was closed. Took forever to get a drink.

name: TTwitchel Author
text:
Exceptional Food and Very Good Service!
I’ve lived in California and Arizona, two states that pride themselves on having good Mexican restaurants and Tex Mex food.
Superica, newly opened, is astonishingly excellent.
We ordered Fajitas Perillo, Catfish Tacos, Mole and Pork Belly Taco. The meats were juicy, perfectly seasoned so the Smokey flavor shone through, the guacamole-tamatillo sauce was amazing and the tacos were outstanding. We ordered one Reposado margarita which was also excellent. Service was very pleasant, sanitary and knowledgeable in an unforced natural way that demonstrated good training.
The only drawback was slightly too loud music, that didn’t match the concept (jazz and 60’s pop).
Highly Recommend!

name: Allen Britt
text: Great birthday meal at Superica Strawberry Hill last night! Attentive servers and I highly recommend the pork belly enchilada. 🤪

name: Jason Thompson
text: If you don't get the short rib when you go here, you will regret it for the rest of your life!

resp.text: What an awesome compliment Jason, thank you!!

name: Nate Dietz
text: very nice staff. dog friendly patio.

name: Victor Arzani
text: Nice spot.  Good food. Upbeat atmosphere.  Enjoyed it.

name: chris shaw
text: Excellent food, excellent service and and will definitely be coming back in the near future. This restaurant goes above and beyond! My new top favorite!

resp.text:
Thank you so much Chris! We are so happy you enjoyed your time with us, see you soon!

Brittany Mattix
General Manager

name: Ryon Hinson | Flycatcher Creations
text: We got the chicken quesadilla and it was very satisfying. The flavors were on point and perfect. Really enjoyed the green salsa as well - almost like a chimichurri salsa. Plus the patio is fantastic.

name: Telisha Coleman
text: An unforgettable experience!!! In the best way possible. Great decor, great food, excellent service!!! Our server Ginny was knowledgeable, efficient, and SUPER NICE!!! WE WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!!!

name: Amy Garnett
text: The service was great!! I did not love the food.

name: Tony Silva
text: Food is top notch but a bit pricey. Need more salsa choices.

name: Kirk MacDonald
text: Excellent food & service! Modern twist on Mexican cuisine.

name: Chaz Hinkle
text: In the midst of a global pandemic, Superica in Strawberry Hill refuses to do over-the-phone (or online) takeout orders. If you want take-out, you need to come inside and place your order at the bar. Mask or not, I am not comfortable with this, nor should anyone else be. Having been to the SouthEnd location, I had high expectations for this place. But I will never ever go back to a place that seems to be thumbing its nose at a worldwide public health crisis. Sorry.

resp.text:
Hi Chaz,

I first want to thank you for taking the time to reach out with your feedback. It is imperative to note that we absolutely take the current state of this worldwide pandemic very seriously. As you can imagine opening a new restaurant during these times has it's challenges, and we want to ensure we are able to roll out a proper take out system after we have honed our expertise and focus on the guests dining in with us. With that being said we are absolutely going to be offering take out via our website after the New Year. We hope that when we do you will give us a shot and enjoy some awesome Tex Mex cuisine. Please feel free to reach out if you have any further questions and have a happy holiday.

Best,
Brittany Mattix
General Manager

name: Matt Arends
text: Great staff, great food

resp.text: Thank you Matt! :)

name: Brian Andersen
text: Great service at the bar, come see Jake from Statefarm!

resp.text: Thanks Brian! We’ll be sure to give Jake the kudos he deserves for the excellent customer service!

name: Philip Huff
text: The pork belly fajitas were extremely good!!

name: Sue Delapena
text: Food,service and ambiance was so much better then the one uptown

name: Chevon Rush
text: The service was awesome and the food and drinks was amazing.

resp.text: Thanks so much Chevon! We look forward to seeing you again hopefully soon!

name: sam phipps
text: New favorite Tex-mex!

resp.text: Thank you Sam! Can’t wait to have you in again!

name: Tabitha Kesterson
text: Delicious Sunday Brunch

resp.text: So glad to hear Tabitha! If you haven’t tried the Hotcakes yet, they are a must!

name: Charlene Hopkins
text: Fabulous food and amazing decor!

name: John W
text: Loved it

name: Sharon Freedman
text: Good place for a sandwich. I had the chicken teriyaki sub. It was made nicely. As with so many of these places, they were a little chintzy with the vegetables. But I did enjoy the sandwich  when I got home.

name: Kasey
text:
Pretty poor customer service. Walked in at 2:30 and one lady is mopping the front area and another is behind the make line, sweeping.  The mopper did day hello and warned me to be careful with the wet floor. The lady behind the make line didn't acknowledge me at all.  I had to stand there and watch her sweep the entire floor and then disappear into the back. I turned to the mopper and ask if they were actually closed and she said, "no, we're open until 3." She looks at the lady behind the line, who is doing her own thing, and goes back to mopping. Finally the sweeper washes her hands and comes out to make my sandwich. No hello. No smile. As cold and mechanical as she can be.
It's been well over a year since I've been to Subway and this confirms I have no need to go back.

name: Lawrence Dickerson
text: Beware- they never change gloves- even after handling money.

name: Poetic Diva
text: My favorite sandwich is the spicy Italian.

name: Mich Smith
text: Wheat bread was stale. Saved the other half for later bread was still hard and I always add extra extra mayo with vinegar and oil.

name: Yash Shah
text: Didnt put any more veggies even when asked for it......

name: Leandria Berry
text: They are all over the food

name: Mike Kelleher
text:
I'm from NY.  I know my pizza.  This place is pretty damn good.  This is like just any of the various hole in the wall pizza joints you find peppered all over NYC.  No frills,  no BS,  just good pizza.  They do have pasta dishes, but I've never had them so I cant review them.

Nice, NY style slices and good prices.  Owners are nice friendly,  and definitely authentic.  If you're looking for a NY style slice,  you should definitely come by.

name: Farhiba Rodriguez
text: I love coming here for my usual two slices and a drink. My food is always served hot and tastes delicious, staff is friendly, specially the nice lady who always greets me hello and goodbye! They get busy about lunch time, but even then they don't take that long to serve your food.

name: Dustin Bizub
text: They always have the best pizza slices available! Quick, great tasting food.

name: Lewis Merit
text:
I came here on a Friday, and the pizzas looked pretty good. Unfortunately, I made a mistake and bought the Chicken Parmesan lunch special for around $10, and it was not good. It did come with a drink , and 3 garlic knots.
The chicken was OK, and the cheese was good. However the sauce was bland, and the noodles mushy. The garlic knots were also partially burnt.

I would not order the lunch special again, but I might try some of their pizza if I was really hungry. Otherwise I would probably go elsewhere.

name: Lewis Rhodes
text: I live in Indian Trail, and drive all the way across town to get this pizza! Hands down, BEST in Charlotte! The "cold pizza in the window", is fresh made and heated to order. Give 'em a try, you won't go anywhere else!

name: David Christianson
text: Good New York Style pizza by the slice, I had the GF option, enjoyed it!

name: Todd Kymer
text: Ordering was easy. The meatball sub was good, but nothing more than a good.

name: P V
text: Really good food. One of the best places for pizza in NC!

name: Michael Hamilton
text: Delicious pizza and always a variety of pizza and other things to choose from.  They seem to lose track of the order numbers they give you for the table sometimes but there usually isn't any mix ups.

name: Tim Olson
text: We enjoy all of the food we have had here.  And even though we enjoy there pizza, I think their meals are even better!

name: Anthony Thomas
text: They have a nice selection of pies compared to other pizza shops in the area.

name: Israel Moore
text: Great New York style pizza. Some of the best in town.

name: Marc Miller
text: Outstanding New York-style pizza, calzones and other Italian dishes

name: shahawna jones
text: I work across from the VA in the area, it's the only reason I come here. The service is awful, the older man at the cash register always has a terrible attitude and snaps at people. This is among multiple visits across about a year and a half he is always rude. It's unfortunate, the pizza is decent and the prices are good but we avoid this place.  Noone wants to be treated that way, and noone gets a pass to treat people this way.

name: Donna Freeman
text: I just paid $10 for a cold slice of pizza (I wanted cheese, which they didn't have), and finished it before my garlic knots made it to the table. Cashier was not friendly or helpful. People were standing and waiting for take out, clearly upset. First time customer and I likely won't be back. :(

name: Dorothy Williams
text: Best pizza great service just like going to mom's

name: Scott Edgar
text: Absolute best place to get New York style pizza in the Charlotte Metro.

name: Jeff Blackmon
text: Good pizza. Fast service

name: Josh Harris
text: Great place for lunch. Awesome NY style pizza.

name: Jonathan Moore
text: If you want $0.50 worth of lettuce for $7 and call it a salad this is the place for you. They didn't even give me the dressing. Will never order from this joke of a restaurant again. Stay away.

name: claire jones
text: Love the pizza and the pasta is amazing each time I eat there.

name: Florene S. German
text: Great pizza!! Its the closes to Philly I can get😊🤞

name: Nirm Patel
text: Love this place! Best pizza in Charlotte!

name: kaledev
text: Average - not bad, not amazing. Kind of like a higher class Sbarro's.

name: Susan Maroulis
text: By far the best real NY pizza in Charlotte. So glad we found them

name: Jason Callahan
text: Went by today, place was empty!  Where is my favorite pizza!

name: Cheri Brown
text: Being from the BRONX this is the best PIZZA in Charlotte plus they are delivering now. BOMB NY PIZZA!!!

name: Nicholas Colantonio
text: Traditional but a little pricey

name: benjamine moore
text: Great New York style

name: Lex
text: Taste just like home.

name: Tyeshia Butts
text: They stay pretty busy cheese slice was okay...nothing to brag about.

name: B. Jacob Partridge
text: Great pizza!

name: Kevin
text: I didn't think this pizza was any better than a Papa Johns and it was way more expensive, and I had to go pick it up.

name: Chris Tolleson
text: Best Pizza in town

name: Stacy Caudle
text: Went by there today and the restaurant has been closed.

name: Daniel
text: New York food with a new York attitude

name: Elizabeth Woods
text: Great pizza

name: jeff brown
text: Best Buffalo Pizza in Charlotte

name: Khalil Canady
text: Good eats

name: Larry Caulder
text: DOES NOT HONOR COUPONS OR PROMOTIONS!!! I brought my kids here for a treat after visiting the Lego shop in Southpark Mall and was a bit disappointed in how this particular Auntie Anne's is managed. They will not honor the fill up cup promotion and will not accept coupons out of the books, and manager was very rude about it. As a family of six, we like to use the buy 3, get one free coupon. I will still go to other AA, but not this one.

name: Stacey Cogburn
text: My mini pretzel dogs had 3 that were burnt and while I was standing there a lady came up and complained about her pretzels being hard. They immediately apologized and replaced them with fresh pretzels so I have no doubt they would have replaced my burnt mini dogs but I knew in my heart (and my thighs) it was best that I just throw them away. Would recommend as the ones I did eat were tasty.

name: Neil
text: 245pm on Sept 1, 2018. Very unfriendly staff. Pretzels are what you expect from Annie Ann's, they were good. We just had to stand there waiting for the workers to acknowledge us, when the definitely saw us. There was no "we will be right with you" or anything. Then they barely said a word besides "what can I get you?". Bad customer service

name: Taylor L
text: Pretzels were great. Line was pretty long with several employees just chatting though. But still an overall good experience.

name: kaledev
text: Good but very very long wait. They told me 5 min for a no salt pretzel and I waited 15+.

name: Home Xoom
text: Burnt food. Terrible service. How hard is this job that you mess up??

name: Debra Howard
text: Taste old

name: Le'Roy Bragg
text: Good  pretzel.

name: Tommy Burleson
text: Nasty food

name: Angelica Benitez
text:
(Translated by Google) I ordered some cinnamon. nuggets and the last thing I found was that xq the glass was only full of sugar and how 3 pieces of nuggets I don't go to this place again

(Original)
Pedí unos cinnamon.  nuggets y lo  último que encontré fue eso xq el vaso estaba solo lleno de azúcar y cómo 3 piezas de nuggets  no vuelvo a ir a este lugar

name: Alfonso Siano
text: Great food ans great experience!! Definitely a reccomended destination in CLT!! The staff was friendly and professional and Chef Luca's dishes were amazing!!!

name: Monique Meadows
text: What a great atmosphere.  The drinks and services we great. The food was excellent, great aroma, and taste. The service was quick. The chef greeted the customers at their table and even served the dishes. You get plenty of food, so be ready to eat. Food was at the right temperature and the plate was a great presentation . Will definitely return, thanks to all the staff, they were very friendly.

name: Ed McDonald
text:
I am a big fan of their lunch buffet.  It's better than most because the food offered is not the usual slop offered at buffets.  This is quality food that is ready to eat.  The buffet offers fresh salad a different themed meal every day.  The staff is super friendly and the service is fast and courteous.

My only criticism is that it's a little too pricey to eat at everyday.  When I worked downtown, I went about once a week.

name: Maria Mullen
text: Cute little place with a limited menu. Food and service were both great. The calamari with the jalapeño honey sauce is a must!!

name: Courtney Lee
text: Best French Toast EVER!!! We eat a lot of french toast as well, so that is worth noting! Very friendly staff as well!

name: Alex Keene
text: Food is only slightly overpriced, which is actually pretty good, given that it's a hotel restaurant in Uptown. Food is tasty. Wine is nice.

name: Kendra Arthur
text: Drinks were great! Food... wasn't all that good accept for the sea bass cakes! They were delicious! The waitress was superb! I think her name was Tameika.

name: Heidi Christina
text: The chicken entree was very good although the chicken was over cooked. I would be by willing to try it again.

name: Bojan Cukic
text: Visiting it for the first time, we were pleasantly surprised with quality of food an friendly service.  The house made pasta is truly authentic and prepared al dente.  A Google search revealed that this style of pasta may be indigenous to the Croatian island of Krk.  Scalopini with prosciutto were also full of taste.  Honestly, one of our favorite restaurants in uptown Charlotte.

name: Joe C. Constant
text: Good atmosphere and tasty food. Justin provided great service. We will come back.

name: Andrew Hunter
text: Service was wonderful! The wings were fantastic! I hope to come here again for sure.

name: Muhammad Butt
text: Had dinner here, was pretty empty but the burger i had was pretty good and juicy

name: Natalie Baggarley
text: Great daily lunch buffet.   Changes each day of the week.

name: jay
text: The food was great.. the salmon with bbq sauce and Chipotle slaw was great. The staff was great and the waiter did a great job. I will be back.

name: Quixotic Pilot
text: Very disappointing. Over cooked steaks and slow service.

name: Chris Brown
text: A pretty good restaurant for lunch. They have a good buffet and it's a good spot for a lunch with a group

name: Isaac Stone
text:
I give it 5-stars and wish I could come back. I took my ex-fiance here twice and we enjoyed our meals tremendously. This was "our" place during Queen's Feast.
We had two appetizers (her: lamb sliders, me: sea bass cake)
Main courses (her: duck noisette with apple and bacon, me: filet mignon w/ lobster mac-n-cheese, shrimp & asparagus)
Desert (her: tiramsu, me: creme brulee)

It was all amazing.

name: Walter Greer
text:
Not the same Cafe Sienna from years past.

We have been steady customers of Cafe Sienna for several years.  We bought the valentines day 4 course meal this year.  I had the foie gras for my second course which was no better than tasteless beef fat.  Next i had the lobster.  Sadly they did not provide me with all the tools usually used to eat lobster other than shell cracker.  Luckily my wife had wipes for me, since none were provided.  My plate was cool to the touch.  The accompanying sides, potatoes and asparagus were room temperature.

My wife got the filet mignon which was quite good.  However, she originally wanted the duck meal which was posted on cafe siennas website but was not included as a choice on the menu when we arrived.

Our waiter was good, despite the issues.  Cafe sienna seems to be trending down.  We wont be coming back.  We spent over $150 for a cool food and poor execution on some of the dishes.

I hope Cafe Sienna gets back to its former glory.  Until then, we will spend our money elsewhere.

resp.text: Thanks sweet heart

name: Jonathan Moore
text: Can I give less than 1 star? Ordered for lunch for our office today. 1 item missing from order. Had better burgers in a school cafeteria. The "Hulk" sausage dog was a sweet Italian sausage dog that was sweeter than the cake I had for dessert. The general consensus of everyone who ate this was "never again".

resp.text: We enjoy feeding good folks in the area that has time for a cook to order meal!! The problem comes when people in a office order large orders an don’t have someone to order or pick up!!! We have no control when you order from doordash. No control how long food sits, Waiting for a dash driver. & nothing was missing!!!!! No control who goes through your food after it leaves the restaurant. Good luck with delivery companies! Try visiting the place you plan to order from!! Mr. Jon. Thanks!!!!

name: Jacqueline Telljohann
text:
I saw this place on a couple of best wings list, so I added it to our list for team lunch. It won the vote last week, so I got to try it.

This is definitely a whole in the wall, which I love. It probably wasn't the best place for a team lunch since it's mostly take out. They have two small tables with some extra chairs, so we were able to make it work without taking it to go.

There are several things on the menu that looked good other than wings, but I had to get wings. My husband and I split 20 wings which came with fries. Typically, you can get two different sauces for 20 wings, but they let me get 4 for a couple dollars more. I got the Triple Whammy (sweet BBQ & spicy sweet and sour), All Purpose (Asian Polynesian with a kick), Crown Town (Lemon Pepper with Buffalo sauce), and Barbalo (Buffalo/BBQ).

They were all quite good, but my ranking would be: All Purpose, Triple Whammy, Barbalo, Crown Town. I probably wouldn't get Crown Town again because it just tasted like Buffalo sauce. I couldn't taste the Lemon Pepper at all. I loved the others. They were unique flavors and quite tasty. The fries were my favorite kind of fries. They were battered, crispy, and full of flavor.

We got our food pretty fast and you could get sides of ranch and blue cheese. Unfortunately, they only had bottled water, but I brought my water bottle with me.

I'd definitely recommend checking this place out for some delicious, inexpensive wings.

resp.text: Thanks to you & your work team!!!

name: Jonathan Collman
text: What a great place.  Tiny with 4 tables but great wings and fries.  Try the Crown Town sauce - it's unique.   Very friendly service, definitely a local neighborhood place!

name: Steven A
text: BEST wings in the QC. Moved here almost 5 years ago and have been a strong advocate for Wing King on S Tryon, BUT these wings put WK to shame. Only downside is they do not make in house ranch or blue cheese, but that's not a deal breaker for me .  Great flavors, great prices, great wings

name: Tiffany Andrews
text: Queen City Wings is by no means a fancy place. They have wings (and fries) and they have a couple of tables. That's it. What more do you need? My daughter wanted wings and so we headed here. It's a simple storefront. The gent behind the counter took our order and we paid (Square) then took a seat. Our wings were cooked right then and there, sauced as requested and handed over. It didn't take but five minutes.

name: Cheatcode
text: Bro.... seriously this amazing. Had the best wings ever here, awesome sauce. The wings here don't cut corners on the chicken, so you better slap yo momma before you come here, and then while you eat, and then again after you leave. Awesome spot for lunch, I would definitely suggest getting the wings, 10 wings is plenty for one person.
